name: Ground Assault Gamma Force
description:
Ground Combat in the Gamma Force Universe
An Anime Toymaster Game for use with the Anime Games System.

Published in 1990, Ground Assault Gamma Force is a stand-alone miniatures game using the Gundam anime series as its core with only a few alterations of names. Predominantly a game of giant robotic tanks (mecha) battling across the solar system - there are rules though that also cover more conventional vehicles and infantry.
Players form teams and then select mecha and other units based either on an agreed upon point system or on what miniatures are available. Small plastic model kits are used as its miniatures with each taken from the Gundam series. The game uses a d10 dice system for determining initiative, attacks, dodges, maneuvers and other actions taken.

9 plastic models were offered individually for the game as its miniatures.

name: Sino-Japanese War
description:
A three-player board wargame of the conflict in China during the Second World War. The players take on the roles of the Japanese invaders, the Nationalist Chinese, and the Communist Chinese. The game uses card play to regulate when pieces may move or attack.

Each turn is one year. The game lasts from 1939 to 1945. The player controlling the most cities at the end of the game wins.

The Game can be found on this website: http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/SJW.html

name: Qadesh
description:
"Wargame for two players. Simulation of the Battle of Qadesh in 1300 BC. Clash of the Warrior Kings."

The game is played on a chess board or other 8x8 grid. The board includes several terrain features, such as the River Orontes, Lake of Homs, settlements, mud flats, hills, and encampments.

There are rules included to represent fatigue, morale, shock battle, and missile combat.

"Victory: Destroy the enemy unit containing the opposing Leader, or occupy his camp and remove any 2 of his armies from play."

name: Swarm
description:
"2-4+ player board & card wargame. Each player controls an insect swarm."

The game is played on a hex grid. Each hex is filled with a randomly determined terrain: Dirt, Grass, Mound, Rocks, Water, Den, Mud, Slope, Roots, or Sand.

Each player begins with three Insect counters. Each Insect is rated for attack, defense, movement, and reproductive capacity. In addition, each player's Swarm is rated for Intelligence and Initiative.

There are two ways to win the game. You must either control all of the Den spaces on the map or occupy the most spaces when the card deck runs out.

name: The First Balkan War
description:
"Wargame for 4 players. Simulates the First Balkan War in 1912. One player is the Ottoman Turks. The other 3 players are the members of the Balkan League: Serbia, Bulgaria, and Greece."

The counters represent divisions of 10,000 men. The Ottomans have twenty-four divisions, Bulgaria has eleven, Greece has ten, and Serbia has eleven. In addition, the Serbian Army includes one division of Montenegro Guerrillas.

The game ends after twenty-four turns. The player with the most Victory Points wins. Victory points are awarded for spaces controlled at the end of the game, with more points being awarded for controlling cities and fortifications.

name: Solar Invasion 2100
description:
"The year is 2100. Human beings have been intensively colonizing the solar system for the last 70 years in relative peace."

"The Kathar are still a young race: aggressive, and impetuous. They have conquered numerous other less militant races. They are currently fighting wars on several fronts. Initial reconnaissance of Earth mistook us for a peaceful race. There was no reports of Nuclear Weapon stockpiles. A small task force was sent to enslave us. The Kathar ships use antimatter energy weapons."

"The Earth wins if all of the Mother Ships are destroyed. The [Alien] fighters are not jump capable, and will self destruct. The Aliens win if Earth is destroyed."

The game is played using two identical hex maps. Each turn the players first move their units and place attack markers on their own maps. Then the players look at each others' maps and attacks are resolved. Variant rules are provided for using a single hex map.

name: Men of Sumer
description:
"Players a rival kings in the land of Sumeria."

The game is played on a hex map depicting the Fertile Crescent between the Tigris and Euphrates rivers. There are ten City States on the map: Kish, Larak, Nippur, Umma, Lagash, Uruk, Ur, Eshnunna, Khafaje, and Eridu.

"Victory: The first player to control six of the ten city-states is the winner."

name: Traveler 1800
description:
A semi-historical game/simulation, in the style of En Garde!, representing the experiences a British Naval Officer might have faced in the Napoleonic era as popularly depicted in the Horatio Hornblower novels and other media.

By rolling on a series of tables, the player generates advancements, events, and achievements for his character. "Keep track of Prizes, Engagements fought, and Total Merits received as well as Rank. Be sure to name the Ships you are posted to."

name: Three Kingdoms Combined Arms
description:
"Board game for 2+ players. Chinese Three Kingdoms theme. No dice or cards. The Three Empires were the Wei, Shu, & Wu. Each unit represents several hundred soldiers."

The game is played on a 12x12 square grid with ten cities marked on it. There are also ten squares marked as forest and ten marked as mountains. Each player starts in control of a 5x5 corner of the grid.

There are seven types of fighting units in the game: General, Armored Cavalry, Infantry, Archers, Rockets, Shock Troops, and Horse Archers. Each unit is rated for movement, attack range, and defense.

"Victory: Destroy all enemy Generals or occupy all cities."

name: Wall Game
description: A variant to "dots and boxes", where each player has a stack of numbered tiles. Players take turns to mark a box side with one of their tiles. The player that completes a box must use one of their tiles to claim it. You score the total of the sides of the box. Highest score at the end of the game wins.

name: Der Dativ ist dem Genitiv sein Tod: Das große Spiel
description:
Based on the popular series of books on German grammar by Bastian Sick, "Der Dativ ist dem Genitiv sein Tod".

Playing as a group, in pairs or as individuals, players attempt to navigate the maze of German language by answering questions on grammar. Movement around the board is limited by the players' confidence in their answer (50-100%). If they answer correctly, they may move forward, but a wrong answer sees them moving back.

See also Der Dativ ist dem Genitiv sein Tod

name: Der Goldene Kompass: Das Kartenspiel zum Film
description:
Players take turns playing cards from their hand to a central pool. The player earns points by playing a card, whose value matches the value of either one or more cards already in the pool, or the sum of several cards already in the pool. In either case, the player wins all the cards in the set and places them in their score pile.

The round ends when the draw pile has been emptied: Points are awarded for the yellow 7, for the most yellow cards, and for the most total cards. In addition, you can win a point for clearing the table.

The game ends after a set number of round.

Re-implements:

Scopa
Gelb gewinnt!
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Chicago's Finest
description:
Sometimes the bad guys pull off a big heist, and sometimes the good guys can stop the crime before it happens. But in the long run, it’s all about style.

In Chicago’s Finest, you take the role of the titular boys in blue, or their nemesis, the mob. Both sides are working hard to either perpetuate or prevent crime - but their primary concern is looking sharp.

Players tactically deploy cards representing guys, weapons, tools, and even K9 units in attempt to conjure up precisely enough cool to match the crime of the day. How much style is needed is determined by the Time, Day, Neighborhood, Location, and type of Crime – which change every day. The game lasts seven days.

Chicago’s Finest is quick, free to print out, and different every time you play it. Game mechanics somewhat resemble Blackjack, but with a variable target number, as well as an arsenal of tricks and card synergies that let you manipulate your and your opponent’s card total.

Download the game in the BGG Files section.

name: ChronoCrisis
description:
Thanks to a nasty computer virus, most of the researchers from University of Chicago’s Department of Temporal Archeology are lost somewhere in time.

In ChronoCrisis, players take on the role of crafty collegiate researchers to collect clues that can lead to the whereabouts and whenabouts of their lost colleagues. The trick, of course, is to minimize interaction with the “natives” and not damage the flow of history.

Players search for clues in five different time periods – Ancient Greece, Legendary Baghdad, Feudal Japan, Elizabethan England, and the Harlem Renaissance – in attempt to deduce and pinpoint the location of the lost time travelers.

Players collect clue cards through detective work, and can also steal clue cards from their unsuspecting opponents. When a player collects a set of clues from the same time period, he or she can attempt to make contact and confirm if the individual they’ve been tracking is indeed a fellow time traveler. The player’s hunches will often be correct. But invariably these hunches are sometimes wrong, and players have to plan ahead to make sure they’re able to deal with feisty natives.

The first player to rescue five lost time travelers wins. The catch, however, is that this target number of five increases whenever a player encounters a native.

ChronoCrisis is a quick, free, print-and-play card game for 2-4 players.

Download the game in the BGG Files section.
categories: Card Game, Exploration, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Alien Skirmish
description: A game based on the Alien/Predator universe, in which the players control humans, aliens, or predators. It is played on a chess board or any similar 8x8 grid. Miniature figures or chits are used to represent the individual combatants. The object of the game is to destroy your opponent’s leader unit. Card play is central to the game. Cards drawn from a common deck are played to cause units to move and attack.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Reise nach Moskau
description:
Reise nach Moskau is the game of Misha the Bear's travels across the USSR.

Players are dealt a hand of 8 city cards, representing cities in the USSR and 4 action cards which let them take special moves.

The object of the game is to play all your cards by moving from city to city and then return to Moscow when you have no cards in hand. The player that does this first is the winner.

City cards are played just by moving to the corresponding city on the map (players familiar with Wildlife Adventure will see a similarity but this game does not use routes).

Action cards are played instead of moving and allow the player to do things such as fly to any city, force another player to draw an additional city card, or "invite" other players to join you in your city (quite annoying when you are heading to your final destination).
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Rock of Ages
description:
Rock of Ages is a comprehensive music trivia game with popular music from the early 1950s up to 2008.
Many of the questions relate to books, history and even movies through lyrical or thematic tie-ins. That, and many built-in clues, make Rock of Ages a challenging but user-friendly game.

Home Page: http://www.rockofagestrivia.com

name: Sharpe's Adventures
description:
"Each player is a British Officer in Spain circa 1809. Based on the Sharpe’s Rifle Series of Books and Films by Bernard Cornwell." The players start out as Sergeants. The object of the game is to survive to reach the rank of Major.

Played using the WarpQuest game system.

name: In the Nam
description:
"Your platoon has been de-assed in the bush. You must patrol the area and meet at a new pick-up point."

In this game set during the Vietnam War, each player starts with a platoon of forty-two men. The object of the game is to travel down the thirty space game track which abstractly represents time and distance. Along the way the platoon will face a variety of foes and booby traps. The object of the game is to amass the most Confirmed Kill points and survive with at least twenty men to be airlifted out.

Played using the WarpQuest game system.

name: Jail Break
description:
"Each player takes the role of a prisoner in Dick J. Pitt Correctional Facility Medium Security Prison looking to escape through a tunnel the prisoner is digging from his cell to freedom and then driving to Mexico."

The game is played on a track sixty spaces long. The first thirty spaces represent arranging the escape from prison. The second thirty spaces represent the journey to Mexico. Cards are drawn to provide random challenges and assistance. A player who wins a challenge keeps the Challenge Card. The player who acquires the most cards in the most challenge types wins the game.

Played using the WarpQuest game system.

name: Heritage Games Italian Edition
description:
The object of the game is for the player or team to advance around the game board by the roll of a die. While answering question pertinent to Italian-American culture, the first player or team to return to the Italy finish space wins the game. The game's 1492 questions explore the many significant contributions made by Italian and Italian-Americans in five categories: 1) History and Geography 2) Food, Music and Entertainment 3) Art, Science, and Literature 4) Sports and 5) Romans

TAG LINE ON BOX: The game that not only tests your knowledge, but gives you knowledge.

name: Guerres secrètes
description:
The goal of the game is to put all your 5 pawns onto the board, avoiding all the traps your opponents set.
Each player chooses the character of his pawns (Kang, doctor Octopus, Magneto, doc Fatalis) and get 5 identical pawns with a drawing of this character. At the beginning of the game all players must be upon the same secret base (red or blue): they choose their places upon their secret cards. Pawns are moved accordingly to the result of the two dices in any direction. Any time a pawn reaches his secret base, his owner surrounds a new square on his secret card. But if he crosses a square surrounded by one of his opponents, he falls into a trap and must go back to his base, while the trapper(s) puts one of his tokens upon this square, and chooses another trapped square.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Lepanto
description:
“Card game for 2 players. Simulation of the Naval Battle of Lepanto 1571. Ottoman Turks vs The Holy League.”

The game uses a custom deck of cards composed of Leader, Ship, Attack, Movement, and Scout cards. Each card has a Force value. Each turn the players fight a battle by revealing a set of cards which may consist of up to one Leader, four Ships, two Attack Cards, and two Movement Cards. The player with the higher total Force value wins the hand. Both players lose Strength Points equal to the total Force of the opponent’s cards. In addition, the loser of the hand also loses Strength Points equal to the difference between the two Force totals.

Each player starts with 100 Strength Points. A player wins by having twice as many Strength Points as the opposing player at the end of a turn.

name: Kings Hand
description:
A card game played with a custom deck of 52 cards divided into thirteen suits of four cards. The object of the game is to play the most different combos over the course of seven five card hands.

All of the combos consist of two pairs (which includes four of a kind, two pairs from the same suit.) Thirty-one types of combos are given names corresponding to the suits involved. For example, a pair from the Princess suit together with a pair from the Sword suit is known as a Warrior Princess combo.

name: Young Wizards Duel
description:
"Card Game for 2+ players. Fantasy Combat Theme. Educational: Basic Math Skills for Ages 6 and up"

Fight an opposing wizard with Creatures, Fireballs, and Lightning Bolts. Protect yourself with Shields and Healing spells. Each player starts with twenty-five Magic Points. The object of the game is to reduce your opponent to zero Magic Points.

name: Carousel
description: This is a VERY simplified version of a Cosmic Wimpout style of game. Each player makes up to three rolls of the six specialized dice that make up the game's components. The player rolls trying to produce a carousel, a jumping horse, and a chariot - in that order. If the player manages to get all three, the rest of the dice can then be scored. Players who don't get all three score zero, while a perfect score of three brass rings would be 15. Scores are referred to as "the length of the ride."

name: AnimOuch
description: A set of war-game skirmish rules for running anime/manga style miniatures combat games. You can run any sort of games based on your favourite anima show. It is primary a combat game, but also allows you to run games as a campaign and give you a few ideas on how to add element of role-playing.
categories: Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Battle of Greenbrier
description:
A free hex and counter board-wargame of the Battle of Greenbrier River.
An easy and quick wargame for beginning users, originally designed as part of the, 'Historical Series of Free War-games for Paperworlds.com"
categories: American Civil War, Post-Napoleonic, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Nations at War
description:
"2-5 player card game with WWII theme." The players represent the Axis (Germany, Japan) and Allied (Britain, Russia, America) forces.

Each nation has a custom deck of cards, which represent various sea, land, and air units used by the nation. The cards are divided into four categories: Action, Leader, Permanent, and Modifier.

Leader Cards and Permanent Cards represent improvements or advantages that provide various bonuses to the nation until the card is destroyed. Action Cards typically represent strategies, tactics, defenses, or events. They are played when appropriate and then discarded. Modifier Cards are bonuses that must be attached to a specific unit.

The object of the game is to reduce your opponents to zero Power Points. Each player starts with twenty-five Power Points.

name: Presidential Race
description:
“Board game for 2 players. Race for the US Presidency. One player is the Democratic Nominee. The other is the Republican Nominee.”

The game uses a square track game board (11 spaces on a side), Money Tokens, Vote Tokens, two Pawns to represent the candidates, two six-sided dice, and three decks of cards (the Candidate, Campaign, and Election Decks.)

The object of the game is to have the most votes after thirty turns.

name: Prohibition
description:
"Board and Dice Game. American Prohibition 1920’s Theme. Players are smugglers transporting Alcohol."

The games is played on a circular track containing three types of spaces - source, establishment, and culture. The players earn Bankrolls (money) by buying Cases (alcohol) from Sources and transporting it to Establishments. Each Culture space has two Bankrolls placed on it at the start of the game. One Bankroll may be taken by the first two players to land on the space.

In addition to the three player pawns, there are three law enforcement pawns: Local Police, Prohibition Agent, and FBI Agent. These pawns may be moved by the player in lieu of moving the player's pawn. The Local Police confiscate Cases from Establishment spaces. The Prohibition Agent confiscates Cases from player pawns. The FBI Agent confiscates Cases from Source spaces.

"The Game ends when there are no Bankrolls left on any Culture spaces. The player with the most Bankrolls at the end of the game wins."
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Rappa Nui
description:
“Card game for 2+ players. Easter Island Theme. Players control rival tribes trying to build the most and biggest Moai.”

The card deck contains seven suits of cards. Four suits are Resource Cards: Food, Wood, People, and Stone. Three suits are Event Cards: Raids, Huri Moai, and Disasters. The players form melds of Resource Cards to earn Moai Tokens.

The game ends when the players have gone through the deck three times. The player with the most Moai Tokens at the end of the game wins.

name: Regiments & Roundshot
description:
"Simple Napoleonic Miniatures Rules System. Uses Dry Erase Board, Markers, Dice, Risk Figures, and Regular Playing cards."

Scale: Each figure represents an infantry battalion, cavalry regiment, or artillery division. Each inch equals one half mile. One turn equals one half hour.

The game is played on a white dry-erase board. Terrain features are drawn directly on the board: "Green Patches for Woods. Blue for Water. Red Lines for Roads. Black Dots for Hamlets and Important Buildings. Irregular shaded areas for larger Urban Areas. Black Lines for Walls & Fortifications. Brown dotted lines for Hills."

"Use plastic figures from a Risk Game. This will include: Infantry, Cavalry, and Artillery. Each player also needs an HQ figure to represent the General."

name: Revolution
description:
“Card Game. Simulates a Coup in a Developing Country. One player is the Government. The other is the Rebels.”

The game uses a deck of 140 cards. There are three types of cards in the deck – Unit, Dummy, and Modifier. Each card has a Force value, from zero (Dummy) to twelve.

The players draw hands of ten cards and fight a series of battles between units. This process repeats each turn. The game ends when one player has no units remaining, in which case the other player wins.

name: Space Opera
description:
"Explore the mysteries of outer space with your trusty ship and intrepid crew."

The player is in command of a starship. The attributes of the starship and the skills of the crew are randomly determined by rolling on tables. The six member crew includes a captain, science officer, chief engineer, and three specialists (science, technical, or ship systems). The object of the game is to complete ten missions in the shortest time possible.

Missions are randomly generated by referring to tables. To complete a mission, the ship must face three random threats generated by rolling on tables. The crew and ship must have the skills and systems required by the threats and the mission to successfully complete the mission. If the player cannot complete the mission, the result is randomly determined by rolling on the failure table.

The game also includes three additional scenarios that expand on the basic game.

In the Drax Campaign scenario, the player must complete missions in order to win the war against the Drax. The player controls three starships. The attributes for these ships are generated by rolling on special wartime ship systems tables. Successfully completing missions makes a player victory more likely, while the failure to complete missions will lead to a Drax victory.

In the scenario A Long Way Home the starship must complete missions to reach a home destination. In the scenario A Campaign of Terror the starship must complete missions to defeat aliens threatening the human colonies.
categories: Adventure, Fighting, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Ski Race
description:
“Card and Board game for 2-4+ players. Alpine Ski Race theme.”

The game is played on a track 100 spaces long. The first space is the starting gate and the last space is the finish line. Each space is randomly assigned a number from 1 to 10. A standard deck of cards is used to govern movement of the ski racers.

“Victory: First player to reach the Finish line is the winner.”

name: Sorcery Chess
description:
“Welcome knave! The premise of Sorcery Chess is that the king is also a powerful wizard.”

The game is played using a standard chess set. However, the normal rules of Chess are altered by the use of spells by the Wizard Kings.

At the end of each player’s turn, the player rolls on a Spell Table and records the spell in a Spell Book. A player may only retain five spells at a time. Each turn a player may choose to move normally or to cast a spell. Most spells modify the way a piece can move. The rules also provide for Artifacts, which are like permanent spells, and Events, which occur immediately upon being rolled.

Expands:

Chess
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Spider-Man
description:
“2 player card game. One player is Spiderman (Spidey). The other player is the Bad Guys.” Each player uses a unique card deck.

The players bet Plot Tokens which go to the player having the higher ranking hand. In the case of a tie, the wagered tokens carry over to the next hand

The object of the game is to acquire all 50 Plot Tokens. Each player starts with 25 Plot Tokens.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Stakk Chess
description:
A game played on a standard chess board. Each player has one king piece and thirty-one flat, stackable pieces.

The movement of the stackable pieces varies based on how many pieces are in the stack, from one to five. Landing on a stack captures the whole stack.

The object of the game is to capture the opponent’s king.

name: Viking Raid
description:
"Card game for 2-4+ Vikings ... The most Scandinavian player goes first."

Players build a ship, give it a crew, and set out for a destination. Along the way encounters are faced. At the destination, the Vikings must battle the local inhabitants. Defeat the locals, pillage, plunder, and return home - all in a days work for Viking raiders.

The game uses two decks of cards, the Viking Deck and the Encounter Deck. The Viking Deck contains Ship, Crew, and Destination Cards. The Encounter Deck contains Sea, Defenders, and Treasure Cards.

The game ends when one player has successfully completed three raids or all other players have been sunk. The player with the most Gold wins.

name: Wreckers
description:
"Players are Maritime Salvage Companies searching the World’s waters for Treasure laden Shipwrecks. Card game for 2-4+ players."

The card deck contains seven types of cards: Search, Investor, Location, Controversy, Expenses, Wreck, and Delay. Discovery Tokens and Money Tokens are also required for play.

"At the end of 10 Rounds, the player with the most Money Wins. If tied in money, the player with the most Discovery Tokens wins."

name: Star Fiefs
description:
“Card game version of INVALID OBJECT ID=, type=thing. Opposing Noble Houses vie for domination in this quadrant of space.”

Each player starts with one Homeworld Card, one Leader Card, four Power Tokens, and a hand of eight cards drawn from the deck. The game is played in the following phases: Intrigue, Event, Duel, Attack (Military or Political), Production, and Recruit. Leaders may be targeted for assassination or duels. Power Tokens are won from other players by making successful political attacks.

The object of the game is to become Governor of the Sector. You can do so by eliminating all of your opponents, or by being the first player to accumulate eight Power Tokens.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Political, Science Fiction

name: Jumping DJ
description:
This is themed after Dishonest John and the characters from the Beany & Cecil cartoon.

This is a surprise action game for 2 to 6 players. Dishonest John is a spring loaded timer that is pressed down after all the 44 cards with the extra Dishonest john card is dealt out to all the players. Players then take turns passing one card to the opponent on their left until Dishonest John springs up which ends the round. You then score your hand based on how many cards you have of the different suits (pairs, three of a kind, four of a kind, and etc.). The person stuck holding the Dishonest John card gets minus 30 points for it. You keep playing another round until someone scores 250 points and is declared the winner.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Math War
description:
Players take turns laying down cards and giving the answer to the problem on their card. The highest correct answer always takes the trick. Play continues until one player has won all the cards.

Contains 54 playing cards plus a Parent card (the rules) and an Equation card (an answer list)

name: Wargammon
description:
"Two player abstract strategy board game. Variant of Backgammon."

The game is played on a standard checkers board and requires sixteen red checkers, sixteen black checkers, and two six-sided dice.

"Each player gets one set of 16 checkers. Each player has his own 'side of the board.' On the back row of a players side, the player places a stack of 8 checkers in each of the two corner spaces. Red moves first."

"Checkers may be moved forward, to the left sideways, and to the right sideways. Checkers may not be moved diagonally or backwards."

The first player to move all of the player's checkers off the board from the opponent's back row wins the game.

name: War Jhong
description:
A card game with an ancient Chinese warfare theme.

The deck has three suits: Infantry, Archers, and Cavalry. Each contains twenty seven cards numbered from one to nine (three cards with each number). There are also two Honor Suits which are not numbered, Junks and Forts, and two Special Suits, Generals and Tactics. General Cards may be discarded for victory points and Tactics cards are wild cards.

"Be the first player to accumulate 100 Victory Points. Points are scored for each hand when a player goes out. A player goes out by making 4 sets of 3 cards each. Only the player that went out scores points."

name: I Spy Mouse Follies
description: Players race against time to find the objects cleverly hidden in colourful illustrations that match the pictures on each card drawn. The player who collects the most cards is the winner. The game includes 6 game boards and 50 different object cards.

name: The Unnamed Game
description:
The Unnamed Game is a game with three distinct, recurring phases (resource gathering, trading, and creation) for three to five players.

During resource gathering, you play a trick-taking game against your opponents. During the trick-taking game, each of you has a unique special power you can use to bend the rules of the game, but when one special power activates, any other active one goes away.

You’ll trade the cards you accumulate during the first phase and use them to purchase special one-shot FX in the trading phase.

Any cards you have left over at the start of the creation phase turn into action tokens. You use action tokens to gather workers and to have your workers build creations. You can also use the FX you purchased in phase two to help your workers. The game ends when a player has five or more creations at the end of the third phase. If you have the most creations at the end of the game, you win.

The Unnamed Game requires a Special Powers deck, an FX deck, a Creation Tracker. You can download these from the publisher. You’ll also need to provide a Poker deck, about 5 six-sided dice per player, a unique pawn for each player, a totem, and about 30 tokens.

A three-player game takes about 40 minutes to play. The Unnamed Game’s unusual structure and strategic nature probably makes it appropriate for ages 14 and older.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Economic, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Set Collection, Trading, Trick-taking, Variable Player Powers

name: Le lapin malin
description:
Contents: a board with the drawing of a circuit with circles and rabbit holes. 8 rabbit pawns. 36 carrot pawns. 2 dices.

The goal of the game is to be the first to pass the arrival line.

Each player chooses a rabbit, and receive 5 carrots. Rabbit move accordingly to the result of the dices thrown. One can choose to throw one or two dices, in the latter case he must pay a carrot (if he makes a double with the dices, he get his carrot back). The circuit have special circles such as “carrot”, “coyote”, blue or pink circles, each with special actions to be make.

name: Snakes and Ladders of Life
description:
Snakes and Ladders variant for children with the addition of virtues and vices in each square. "A virtue at the top of a ladder is what you gain as a result of applying the virtue at the bottom of the ladder in your actions and behavior" (eg enthusiastic --> tireless; loving --> accepting). Similarly a vice at the head of a snake results in the outcome at its tail (eg argumentative --> isolated; worried --> tired).

A booklet accompanies the game that defines each virtue/vice in one sentence simply understood by a 7 year old.

Some squares allow the player to draw from the 'Virtue deck'. "These cards describe how a virtuous attitude can rescue you from the karmic payback for hurtful, negative attitudes."

The final variation on the traditional game is the last eight squares called the Safe Zone, which allow the player to draw from the 'Power Deck' of cards. "On reaching this zone of the 8 Powers you are safe under their canopy, protected from all negative influences, because an inner voice guides you away from situations which steal your energy. In this zone you enjoy strength, good fortune and happiness."

A score pad is included that encourages each player to write down each of the virtues that they accumulate during the game.

The material does not appear to be specific to any one religion.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Tales of Arabia
description:
An Arabian themed storytelling game.

"Goal of the game: Being about to tell and finish stories... The longer the story, the more victory points will be earned..."

The stories and sub-stories must be based on cards played by the players. The game ends when one of the players has been able place a final ending to the main storyline.

Victory is determined by scoring the most points. Points are awarded based on finishing story lines and on the number of story cards the player played.

name: Sahara Sandstorm
description:
"Colonial Era Combat game: 1879 - 1929. French Foreign Legion, British Colonials, Germans SWA Troops, etc. Simple, fun wargame rules for backyard, beach or living room."

"The romantic tales of the French Foreign Legion, the drama of the hundred British regulars who held off 4,000 Zulu warriors at Rourke's Drift, the harsh battle of Khartoum - these are the stuff of legend. Sahara Sands is a fast-action battle game that enables you to replicate those days of tropical heat and adventure. You bring the toy soldiers, regular dice and kite string while we show you how it's done!"

Ratings are provided for seven types of weapons common to figures of this era: rifle (rolling block or bolt action), jezail (muzzle-loading rifle), revolver, spear, cannon/mortar, Gatling gun, and machine gun. Each weapon is rated for rate of fire, range, and damage.

Basic unit speeds are provided for different types of units and vehicles (foot soldiers, camel troops horsemen, wagons, tanks, trucks, etc.) Terrain effects on movement are also specified. The rules also cover officers/leaders, prisoners, forts, and the shock value of 'modern' weapons.

name: Severiano
description:
"Super Juegos" was a pioneer Spanish magazine about both, board and computer games, which was published between 1984-1985. Every issue included a board game inside, with rules and cut-out counters. As far as I know only eight numbers were published, at least in its first epoch (another publication with the same name would appear years later, this time focusing on computer games only).

"Severiano" (named after the famous Spanish golf player Severiano Ballesteros), was included in issue 2 and was obviously a golf match simulation. Players had to provide two counters (representing balls) and two dice, plus pencils and paper to note scores. Dice rolling determine the movement of the counters, while several terrain features affect movement in different ways.

name: Canguro
description:
"Super Juegos" was a pioneer Spanish magazine about both, board and computer games, which was published between 1984-1985. Every issue included a board game inside, with rules and cut-out counters. As far as I know only eight numbers were published, at least in its first epoch (another publication with the same name would appear years later, this time focusing on computer games only).

"Canguro" (Kangaroo) was the game included in issue 1. It was a very straightforward game in which players, who had to provided the counters, tried to align these from the inside to the outside of the circle in the board.

name: La guerra Irán-Irak
description:
"Super Juegos" was a pioneer Spanish magazine about both, board and computer games, which was published between 1984-1985. Every issue included a board game inside, with rules and cut-out counters. As far as I know only eight numbers were published, at least in its first epoch (another publication with the same name would appear years later, this time focusing on computer games only).

Issue 3 included "La guerra Irán-Irak", an easy to learn wargame (two page rules) for two players about the conflict between these two Arabian countries which lasted from 1980 to 1988.

This game was originally published first inside issue 4 of NUMERO UNO magazine in 1980

name: El juego del mono de oro
description:
"Super Juegos" was a pioneer Spanish magazine about both, board and computer games, which was published between 1984-1985. Every issue included a board game inside, with rules and cut-out counters. As far as I know only eight numbers were published, at least in its first epoch (another publication with the same name would appear years later, this time focusing on computer games only).

"El juego del mono de oro" was the game included in issue 6. It was based in the pseudo-Indiana Jones 80s TV series "Tales of the Gold Monkey", set in the pre-II World War Japanese dominated Pacific Ocean´s isles . Up to 4 players could play, each one starting with and adventurer and a seaplane counters and searching for mythical treasures while eluding or confronting fighters and gunboats.

name: Jaw Breaker
description:
Jaw Breaker is a rather simple roll and move game with an interesting twist. A major component of the game is the large plastic shark into the mouth of which 4" balloons are inserted.

A plastic game mat lays out a path from the site of a shipwreck across several islands to the shore. The objective is to move your castaway towards the shore by the roll of the die.

On the board are both red and white spaces. Each time the marker stops on a red space, the player is required to rotate the dorsal fin of the shark. As the shark's mouth closes, pressure is put on the balloon, eventually causing it to burst (two small pins inside the shark's mouth insure eventual destruction of the balloon). How much pressure is required is primarily dependent on the inflation level of the balloon.

If the player causes the balloon to burst, he or she returns their castaway to the starting position and the shark is reset with a new balloon. The winner is the first player to successfully reach the shore.

name: Valor & Vengeance
description:
Valor & Vengeance simulates the dramatic pinnacle of General Wrangel’s offensive to seize the key city of Tsaritysn (Stalingrad in WW2).Armed British manned tanks and supported in the air with the 47th Squadron, the White forces struck along the Volga River.
Partly through deception and strategy that soaked off the Red’s most powerful force: Budyonny’s Cavalry Corps, which had opposed the White cavalry corps’ under the esteemed Mamontov up to the 29th. Pulling back to regroup, Budyonny’s men continued to be held in check. When Mamontov attack simultaneously on the 29th, it effectively canceled out any chance that Budyonny would be involved in the White attack from the south. Had this not happened, Tsaritsyn would have been a bloodbath.

The map scale is about 800 yards per hex. Each combat unit is one battalion for non-AFV units. For Tanks ,Armor cars Aircraft, each counter is one AFV\AC. For weapons, each counter is four weapons. A game turn represents TWO hours of time.

The game contains:

• One 11 x 17" mapsheet depicting the terrain the battle was fought over
• 2 player aids for charts and tables.
• One set of 280 ½" playing pieces
• A rulebook.

name: Azules y grises
description:
"Super Juegos" was a pioneer Spanish magazine about both, board and computer games, which was published between 1984-1985. Every issue included a board game inside (two in issues 7 and 8), with rules and cut-out counters. As far as I know only eight numbers were published, at least in its first epoch (another publication with the same name would appear years later, this time focusing on computer games only).

One of the games included in issue 8 was "Azules y grises - La batalla de Bull Run", set in the American Civil War. It was a straightforward, 3 pages rules wargame in the usual line of the magazine.

name: Flip to Win Travel Bingo
description: From the publisher "BINGO on the go! Choose an appropriate theme among the eight provided, slide a card into each game boards and pay attention to the passing scenery! Includes two game boards and four double-sided game cards. There are no loose pieces and everything stores conveniently in the board. Great for travel!"

name: In the Year of One Reed
description:
A classroom game for four groups of history students, grades 6 to 8. The game requires a print-and-play mapsheet, a standard deck of playing cards, and a six-sided die.

“Historical Background (1519 - 1521): In the great Aztec city of Tenochtitlan Emperor Montezuma had reason to worry. It was the year of One Reed, when the feathered serpent Quetzalcoatl would return to bring an end to Aztec civilization. A comet had been seen in the sky, a very bad omen."

"Messengers arrived to tell Montezuma that powerful strangers had arrived at the coast. The strangers were Spaniards under the command of Hernan Cortes. Montezuma was paralyzed by indecision. Should he fight the newcomers or welcome them?"

"He would soon learn that the Spanish conquistadors were on a mission to conquer and loot the Aztec empire. They brought with them horses, powerful weapons, and deadly germs. Many of the local tribes saw the invaders as a chance to defeat their Aztec overlords and joined their army. Cortes and his men would destroy Tenochtitlan and the Aztec empire.”

The game ends once Cortes (controlled by the teacher) has conquered the Aztecs by destroying their armies or occupying their capital. Sample questions for classroom discussion are included.

name: Battle of the Atlantic (1942)
description:
“It is summer in the North Atlantic, 1942. Admiral Dönitz’s German U-boats are prowling the east coast of North America and the mid Atlantic shipping lanes, inflicting heavy losses on the Allied merchant fleet carrying desperately need supplies to Europe.”

“Each Convoy player has at least one US or British destroyer and two merchants in their charge. On the base of the ship is space for a name, a box for a letter to further identify which destroyers/merchants are under the same player control, hit counters and relevant info about movement and attack.”

“Each German U-boat player controls at least one U-boat and three ‘Ocean cards.’ U-boats are represented by cards with a U-boat number, hit counters and other info on one side and a blank ‘empty ocean’ on the other. When submerged, the U-boat card is turned over with the blank side up. When on the surface, the card is turned with the U-boat side up. Ocean cards have a number and space for a letter on one side, and empty ocean on the other . . . They are used to introduce uncertainty as to the whereabouts of the submerged U-boats on the playing table.”

“Objective: The Allies must get their merchant ships past the waiting German U-boat wolf packs and safely deliver their cargo to England.”

“The Allies win if they are able to get 50% of the merchant ships safely through the wolf pack and on to England; otherwise the victory goes to Germany and the U-boats. A merchant is considered to have reach port once its front edge touches the far edge of the playing table or crosses a similar agreed upon line.”
categories: Card Game, Educational, Fighting, Miniatures, Nautical, World War II

name: Battle of Verdun (1916 AD)
description:
A miniatures wargame intended for classroom use with two teams of students (grades 6-8). The game is designed to be played on a 7.5x5 foot table using 1/72 scale plastic miniatures. Free print-and-play paper miniatures are also provided for use with the rules. The German forces consist of 366 figures and the French forces consist of 182 figures. Terrain features include barbed wire, trenches, and shell holes.

“During World War I both sides dug a line of trenches along the Western Front extending from the English Channel to Switzerland. Each side tried repeatedly to breakthrough their opponent's line of defenses, suffering terrible casualties."

"In 1916 the Germans planned an attack on the French fortress city of Verdun. Their aim was to ‘bleed the French army white’ by inflicting so many casualties that France would be unable to continue the fight. Vowing that ‘they shall not pass’ the French were eventually able to stop the German advance, and after ten months of bloody combat the German gains had been virtually wiped out."

"In the worst war in human history Verdun stands out as the worst battle of all. The battle caused nearly a million casualties, more than half of them French. Verdun was a ‘victory’ that would haunt French military and political leaders for a generation. This scenario is designed to give the students a taste of what it was on the first day of the battle.”
categories: Educational, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I

name: Siege of Tenochtitlan (1521 AD)
description:
“In 1519 Hernando Cortes landed in Mexico with a small army of Spanish conquistadors. They marched to Tenochtitlan, the fabulous Aztec capitol city built in the middle of a lake. Emperor Montezuma welcomed them to the city."

"Cortes promptly made the Emperor his hostage and used him as a puppet ruler to gather the Aztec's gold. The mood in the capitol quickly soured and, after Montezuma was killed, the Spanish had to fight their way out of the city, suffering heavy losses."

"When Cortes was ready he surrounded the capitol city and used ships armed with cannons to take control of the lake, cutting off the supply of food and water. The final assault on Tenochtitlan was long and difficult. The desperate Aztecs fought ferociously, street by street, until the last hold outs, starving and dying of thirst, were killed or captured. It was the end of the mighty Aztec Empire.”

A miniatures wargame intended for classroom use with two teams of students (grades 6-8). The game is designed to be played on a 7.5x5 foot table using 1/72 scale plastic miniatures mounted two per stand. Free print-and-play paper miniatures are also provided for use with the rules.

Units portrayed in the game include commanders, attack dogs, Aztec knights, arquebusiers, cannon, pike men, crossbowmen, and slingers/archers.

name: Arnold's Finest Hour
description:
“Everyone remembers that Benedict Arnold was a traitor during the Revolutionary War. What is often forgotten is that prior to his treachery he was America's finest general. Perhaps his greatest display of leadership and courage was at the second battle of Saratoga, also known as Bemis Heights. It was at this battle that Arnold led a successful American attack against a British fort. His victory eventually forced General Burgoyne to surrender his army, and gave the French the encouragement they needed to declare war on the British.”

A miniatures wargame intended for classroom use with two teams of students (grades 6-8). The game is designed to be played on a 7.5x5 foot table using 1/72 scale miniature figures. Free print-and-play paper miniatures are also provided for use with the rules. The objective for the American forces is to capture one of the two redoubts at the British end of the table.
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Educational, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Duivels Drinkspel
description:
Duivels Drinkspel is a drinking game for 2 to 8 players. Each player gets a glass that he uses as a counter to move on the board.

The player rolls the dice and puts his/her counter that much places further on the board. According to the place the counter stands an action takes place.

Possible actions:
- Drink you're glass
- Everyone has to drink their glass
- Choose one player who has to drink his glass
- Take the ladder up to an other space
- Take the ladder down to an other space
- Roll the dice again
- Skip a turn
- Truth or dare

name: El arcón del pirata
description:
"Super Juegos" was a pioneer Spanish magazine about both, board and computer games, which was published between 1984-1985. Every issue included a board game inside (two in issues 7 and 8), with rules and cut-out counters. As far as I know only eight numbers were published, at least in its first epoch (another publication with the same name would appear years later, this time focusing on computer games only).

One of the games included in issue 7 was El arcón del pirata ("The Chest of the Pirate"). Set in the Piracy age, one player with the Spaniards tried to reach the edge of the board with his galleons (full of silver), while the other with the Pirates tried to board the enemy ships.

name: Autopista loca
description:
"Super Juegos" was a pioneer Spanish magazine about both, board and computer games, which was published between 1984-1985. Every issue included a board game inside (two in issues 7 and 8), with rules and cut-out counters. As far as I know only eight numbers were published, at least in its first epoch (another publication with the same name would appear years later, this time focusing on computer games only).

One of the games included in issue 7 was Autopista loca ("Mad Highway"), where two players competed to be the first to build a highway (one from north to south, the other from west to east) by placing section counters on a simple squared board. Both could also use the opponent´s counters and of course divert the other´s road.

name: Joc-Tenis
description: Children tennis game for two players Ages 7 - 16 in which they alternate rolling the dice to hit the ball. Scoring is kept following real life rules with the 2, 4 and 6 rolls being considered successes while 1, 3 and 5 are considered fouls.

name: Managing My Allowance
description: Managing My Allowance offers valuable first money experiences. Players use coins and bills to pay for purchases, compute change, handle allowances and gifts, collect earnings, and make deposits into college savings accounts. They are rewarded for accuracy, taking advantage of sales, saving money for college, and making thoughtful decisions. Transactions mirror the real world, adding value and excitement. Game variations offer two difficulty levels. In Allowance, the winner is the player with the most money in college savings. No financial transactions are recorded. In Managing My Allowance, players keep simple financial records. The winner is the player with the most money in college savings plus what is saved because of the sales.

name: Budget
description:
“I’ll never get out of this financial mess until I follow a Budget!”
Why not learn what it means to live by a budget? Before each trip around the game board, players plan a budget and receive $2,000. They experience the realities of real-life economics as they buy a home or rent an apartment, pay insurance costs, make investments, buy groceries and clothing, repair fire damage, collect commissions, etc. If the budget projection is reasonably accurate, the player collects a bonus on payday! The winner is the player who has the greatest wealth at the end of play.

name: Sauve-qui-peut
description: Be the first player to reach the safety of your boat. To escape the centre fortress you must climb onto the shoulders of another piece.

name: Felhőfogócska
description:
The checked-eared rabbit (known from the TV show) blows soap-bubbles that show different characters and scenes from the series, also clouds that have the same shape as these characters. The game offers different rule versions in which children have to find out which cloud has the shape of which character, or which three bubbles are connected to each other; it also can be played as a memory game for children above a certain age.

Home Page: http://www.kockasfulunyuljatek.hu/rovat/3/felhofogocska.html (Hungarian)
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Puzzle
mechanics: Memory, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Medici
description: From the Author: "Medici is a set of rules for wargames in the Renaissance era. This set of rules is designed for use with 25mm Miniatures. It can be used to fight battles in the Thirty Years War, the English Civil War, and for Renaissance warfare."
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Phase Order

name: Spiel-Satz-Sieg
description: Accurately conceived according to the rules of tennis Spiel-Satz-Sieg offers; everything that is in a tennis match: hard hit balls, unreachable returns, solid hits that affect the opponents ability to return. On the board are marked the ways to acquire good position in order to make solid returns. A point scale keeps track of current points for the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: La nuit de l'Esprit
description:
This game is published by the French magazine Casus Belli (Issue 16 - Aug 1983).
Boardgame close to the role, in which players must destroy the spirit avoiding panic.
17 counters and map house in Din A4.

name: The Color of Kings
description:
The Color of Kings is a card game brought to you by Gen1400 Gaming. You can download, print, and play the game for free by visiting the website at www.gen1400.com

The Color of Kings is set in the medieval time period. You control the king and your job is to keep the king alive and try to assassinate the other kings, while trying to build and maintain your empire.

You get 201 cards in the starter deck. Included in the deck are special knights, knights, spies, infantry, and buildings to improve your empire.

There is no limitation to the amount of players that can play, but each player will need their own deck of cards.
categories: Card Game, City Building, Collectible Components, Dice, Fighting, Medieval, Print & Play

name: HoverTank 2
description:
"More Death and Destruction in the fight for Oil in 2022"

This stand-alone update of Hovertank portrays combat between futuristic military units - including Mechanized Infantry, Armored Personnel Carriers, Main Battle Tanks, and Rocket Launchers. Each player seeks to exit units off the opponent's end of the map in order to win the game.

The game includes 144 plastic playing pieces and is played on a large hex map.

name: Bye-Bye Birdie
description:
A magnetic Tic-Tac-Toe variant where players alternate rolling a pair of dice and placing "birdies" onto their side of a freestanding board with a 3x3 grid representing a birdhouse. Each "apartment" can only have one birdie and the opponent's placement of a birdie into an occupied apartment causes your birdie to "fly" away. The winner is the first player to get three in a row.

Shouting "Bye-Bye" when chasing away birdies is a must. Rolling a location where you already have a birdie allows you to choose any vacant apartment as long as you don't complete a row.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Movie Quote Craze
description:
From the Publisher:

"Recall those great films that truly invented the "one-liner" era. Play one-on-one or with a group. Test your memory as an individual or in teams. One person reads the actor's name and the movie line, and you guess the movie!
For added fun, step into each role by reciting the lines using accents and emotion.

You'll have hours of enjoyment when you play...

Movie Quote Craze
- the 80's Edition"
categories: Humor, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia
mechanics: Acting, Memory, Role Playing, Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: Golfy
description: Golfy is a marble game based on miniature golf that can be played indoors or outdoors. Each set includes 6 plastic holes, two ramps, 10 marbles, and a carrying bag.

name: Logjam
description:
Logjam is a simple and exciting race game for two to six players. Each player tries to be the first to move all of his loggers through a treacherous maze of logs. The players build a different maze for each game, and all of the logs can move during play. Every game of Logjam provides a new challenge, and the winner is never certain until the very end. While a player moves his loggers through the logjam, he can also try to confound his rivals. With certain die rolls, he can move the logs to block his opponent's path and open new paths for himself. He may be able to squeeze an opponent's logger between two logs and make it start over. Strategy-minded players will try to position their loggers to take advantage of any number that they may roll. Others will enjoy raising havoc.

Get the full game here:
http://www.rich-and-sharon.org/al/Logjam01.htm

name: NWTF Royal Slam Game
description:
The objectives of the players are to achieve a royal slam and collect 200 experience points by gaining useful knowledge in wild turkey hunting, outdoor safety and nature lore. A hunter achieves a "Royal Slam" by bagging the five subspecies of North American wild turkeys (Eastern, Rio Grande, Merriam, Osceola and Gould).

This is a roll and move game. Players move around a map of North America and hunt for wild turkeys. Strategic choices include type of weapon (shotgun or bow and arrow), money management and playing action cards at opportune moments.

name: Flying Rubberneckers
description: From creators of the popular Rubberneckers and Rubberneckers, Jr. comes a nifty new card game to beat boredom at the gate and in the air. Players score points by spotting the objects on their cards and engaging other passengers. Flying Rubberneckers will keep even the most restless traveler entertained for hours.

name: Wagon Trails
description:
"Card game for 2-4+ players. Theme: Overland Westward Migrations in the USA in the mid 1800’s."

The game is played using a custom deck consisting of four types of cards: Hazard Cards, Wagon Cards, Destination Cards, and Journey Cards. Each Destination and Wagon Card has a Migrant Point value.

The players are trying to play melds consisting of a Destination Card, Journey Card, and one or more Wagon Cards. For each meld played, a player scores Migrant Points equal to the total value of the Destination and Wagon Cards. Hazard Cards may be played on another player to reduce the player's Migrant Points.

The game ends when there are no cards left in the draw pile and none of the players can play a meld.

name: Battles with Model Tanks
description:
From Back Cover
The scope of wargaming is almost boundless. Wargamers can create simulations of the simplest encounter or the grandest strategy. Armoured warfare in miniature has a special appeal.
The model tank wargamer can take advantage of the superb range of miniature model tanks available and the many books detailing modern weaponry to recreate this style of fighting that was born on the Somme in 1916 and came of age in 1940. Perfect scale models and accurate rules combine to produce an almost faultless simulation of tank warfare - all that is missing is the clatter of tracks, the roar of engines and the crump of shellfire.
This book lays the complete groundwork on the subject. It explains how to use the many different armoured fighting vehicles, their guns, caliber, missile weight, range, angle of impact, thickness of armour; and does the same for anti-tank weapons. It provides essential information on communications, mines, infantry co-operation, aircraft and armoured operations, and battlefields; it also provides practical information on how to assemble armoured forces in miniature and table-top terrains over which they can battle.
The authors are well known veteran wargamers. Donald Featherstone served with the Royal Tank Regiment in North Africa and Italy during World War II; his associate, Keith Robinson, is an adviser to one of the main manufacturers of model fighting vehicles for wargamers.
Together they have clearly and simply brought this modern style of warfare to the table-top battlefield and provide technical and tactical advice against a fascinating background of wargaming narrative with ten historical scenarios spanning the lifetime of the tank, from an armoured car action in 1914 to the Middle East conflicts of recent history.

name: Zoo-Spiel
description:
Childrens' game of collecting animals in the form of cardboard tiles from a board representing a safari type environment.

Players roll dice and then move that many spaces exactly in an attempt to land on the correct space to collect the animal.

Person with the most animals at the end is named the Zoo Director & the winner.

(My German is not the best so if anyone cares to translate the rule manual and update this description please do.)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Star Wars Adventures
description:
Star Wars Adventures is a series of novel-driven set-piece adventure games marketed for direct to home sales by Scholastic, Inc. and Lucas Books / Lucasfilms LTD. The game is generally structured along the lines of the 1970s-1980s era "choose your own adventure" (CYOA) novels, except using pregenerated heroic characters from the Star Wars universe, more linear story lines and an "adventure points" scoring system. Players risk losing points for making poor decisions and for bad die rolls, but unlike most earlier CYOA books, seldom (if ever) risk character death. While the adventures are designed for solo play, the adventure points system allows for competitive, partnership or cooperative play by several players.

Characters have different RPG-like attributes (name, life-form, allegiance, charm, knowledge, navigation, power, skill, stealth, strength, weaponry and talents). Devices and Powers that the characters might use are rated for accuracy in different circumstances. Similarly, Vehicles are rated by type, speed, distance, stealth and weaponry. Combinations of these attributes are used along with d10 or d20 rolls to determine "adventure numbers" during decisions and confrontations that, in turn, affect both the direction of the storyline and the adventure points score.

Star Wars Adventures is packaged in a plastic carrying case shaped like a flattened Clone Trooper helmet. The base game includes a membership card, adventure poster, d10, d20, character cards, power cards, device cards, vehicle cards, an adventure guide, notebook, point pad, adventure novel and game book. Expansions include additional cards of all types, posters, novels, magazines and game books. Modules in the series are as follows:

1. Hunt the Sun Runner (Ryder Windham, 2002) -- This module is set in the period between Star Wars Episode I: The Phantom Menace and Star Wars Episode II: Attack of the Clones. A ghost ship is on a crash course with a helpless planet. First you must find it. Then you must stop it.
categories: Adventure, Book, Collectible Components, Dice, Exploration, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: SUDOKU: Ergänzungs-Set
description: This is an expansion for SUDOKU - Das Brettspiel. The box contains 100 new gameboards.

name: IGOR Brainwash Game
description:
From the back of the packaging:
Brainwash is an exciting memory game featuring characters from the hit movie Igor, and the Dreaded Brainwashed game play card!

IGOR Brainwash Game includes a total of 51 cards: 2 brainwashed cards, 1 Old Bone card and 24 pairs of cards that show characters from the movie.

3 sets of rules are included with the game. All are based on the classic Memory game but two of them offer simple twists.

Game titles are:
Classic Memory, Brainwash Memory Game and Old Bone.
categories: Card Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Luckie Strike
description: Players pass one card at a time to the player on their left, until one player completes a set of 4 matching. When the set is played on the table, all players grab for stick from the table. one player will not get a stick. The first player gets the letter of LUCKIE, the player without a stick gets the next letter of STRIKE. When the someone completes LUCKIE, you score +1 for each letter of LUCKIE, -1 for each letter of STRIKE, highest score wins.

name: The Cat in the Sack
description:
The Cat in the Sack is a very simple dexterity game. It consists of a large plastic base in the shape of a blue sack. Inside the sack is a large white cover for the sack on which is mounted a large plastic cat head. The cover is mounted to the sack with a large spring (reminiscent of a jack-in-the-box). Along the edge of the "sack" are 25 clips that hold the cover in place.

To play the game, you push the spring loaded cover down into place, securing it in place with the clips. The game begins and each player takes a turn removing one of the clips, trying not to let the cat out of the sack. The player who removes a clip and causes the cat to spring out of the sack, loses the game.

name: LOOKEE
description: Lookee is the "Search-A-Word Game", for 2 or more players, that can be played by those of all ages. The game consists of a plastic tile board and 100 various tiles each with a letter and point assigned to it on each side. The game has five different variations of play. In Game One: The grid begins empty except for the word LOOKEE spelled out in the center. Using at least one letter on the board each player must take turns making their own word (with the 7 tiles they began with) using at least one pre-existing tile.Each turn must be finished within 30 seconds. These words could be spelled forward, backward, horizontally, vertically or diagonally. Each player scores points for all the letters on their new word. After each turn, the player who went replenishes back to seven tiles. The player with the most points after the grid is filled is the winner. Game Two: First player to reach 100 points wins. In this game, the entire tile board is filled with letters at random. The first player tries to locate a word in any direction, and receives the added points for that word. The tiles used are then flipped over creating a new board every turn. The next player goes and so on. Only 30 seconds per turn. Game Three: Same as game two except additional option. Look for letter groupings that can be rearranged to form words. E.G. T,C,R,U,K can be TRUCK. First to 100 points wins. Game Four: Play solitaire by setting up the board as in Game One. Score as many points as possible in a given time period. Game Five: By using another game board, a duplicates version could be played by using identical letters and setting a time limit.

name: Wedlock
description: A game of skill, intrigue and fun(chess/draughts level). Based on 3,000 years of folklore, customs and superstitions of the spring festival of fertility. Players pit their wits against each other to move their own 15 pieces, which can be moved in varying ways, across the maroon and white board while outmaneuvering, blocking and capturing the pieces of their opponents with the aim of scoring the most points.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Square Grid, Team-Based Game

name: Nijntje aan zee
description:
Miffy (Nijntje) plays on the beach with her friends, collecting shells.

Three big Miffy "Meeples", in three different colors, are used to collect shells on the beach, using color-sided dice (D6).

a nice plus: the "meeples" can also be used to really play in the sand!

name: Letters and Numbers Game
description:
Basic childrens' game based on the Disney's Mickey Mouse Clubhouse television show.

From the box:
"Make a match with Mickey and friends. Have a blast with the cast of the Mickey Mouse Clubhouse Show. Match numbers on one side of the gameboard, then flip it over and see if you can match letters to spell the names of favorite characters. Will you be the Hot Dog in this game?

Reinforces:
Number matching
Letter Recognition
Basic words

name: Conclave
description:
Do you want to vote a Pope? Now it’s possible. Conclave recreates the event in which a new Pope is being elected. You represent one of the factions within the Vatican and your goal is to become the most powerful.
During a conclave you know each player has to vote for a cardinal, but how will they vote? And how can you convince them how to vote? Who is your friend, who is your foe? Make your own plan, see what the others are up to, but most importantly, vote tactically and become the most powerful faction within the Vatican.

Conclave recreates the event in which a new pope is being elected. The factions of cardinals use their influence to make one of them the new Pope. You represent one of those factions and it is your task to gain the most influence, and to be the Pope-maker

name: Hobbycon Minigame Flyer
description:
"Hobbycon (an animation, comic & game convention) is in town, but this time they got contest! Are you ready for it?"

A game where you compete with 1 or more players in a series of contest. Each player have 10 Effort Points which will be used differently in each contest. Each contest winner will be rewarded in Hobby Points. The highest Hobby Point by the end of the game is the winner.

download the game here
http://experimentalplayground.blogspot.com/2008/10/hobbycon-...

name: Bärlin: Das Stadtspiel
description:
The game is presented by the newspaper "Berliner Zeitung" and teaches a lot about Berlin.

Three types of cards (total 350 cards) ask for knowledge and creativity.

name: Trivia, Country Style
description: Put on your country duds, kick back, and have a ball with your friends learning about the lives, loves, and music of your favorite country stars. Spend an exciting evening seeing who knows the most about the history and legends of one of the most influential music styles of all time.

name: Barrel Bowl
description:
This game consists of ten miniature bowling pins (each about six inches in height) and a bowling barrel (about five inches in length and about 3 inches in diameter in the middle).

The barrel is hollow and can be filled with water. The manufacturers suggest that the barrel be filled approximately one-third full with water in order to play the game. The directions list distances as to how far apart each pin should be placed, and how far away the barrel should be rolled.

The game deals with manual dexterity, but also suggests humorous reactions, as the rolling barrel may not move in quite the manner that one thinks!

name: Match It
description: Regular play goes like this...each player draws two matchsticks. If a match is made, they are put aside for that players score. Player goes again till no match is made. Next player does the same. When all matchsticks are gone, the player with the most matchsticks is the winner. Variations are "Go Fishing", "Five Card Stud", "Wild Card Poker", "Rummy", "Solitaire", and "Poker".

name: Pearl Fisher
description:
As listed on FunAgain.com:

Pearl Fisher is an elegant synergy of abstract strategy and memory games. The "pearls" are glass marbles. Move pearls and cover them with shells. Can you uncover the right color of pearl?

Two game boards in one -- square grid on one side, a hex grid on the flip side. Beautifully handcrafted 11½-inch boards are laser-engraved. Three different game themes and three solitaire challenges.

Contents:
--3 sets of 9 pearls
--9 shells
--felt slipcase
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Memory, Square Grid

name: What Can You See?
description:
A collection of detective games
Through play, close observation is stimulated and vocabulary broadened.

The twins Tony and Tina have a superb idea; together with their three friends they want to found a secret society. The secret society’s goal will be to resolve exciting cases and become authentic detectives. On tender hooks the five have their first secret meeting in the tree house.

Contents
1 game board printed on both sides (farm/city)
5 magnifying glasses
19 decorations
30 search cards “farm” (green backside)
30 search cards “city” (blue backside)
1 hour-glass
1 die with symbol
1 set of game instructions

name: Prospect
description: In this Gold Rush game, your job is to make more money than the other players by prospecting new claims, mining their gold and selling it in town. You can hire gunmen to help protect your claims, or use them to jump claims belonging to other players instead. There are six different activities every turn (mine, claim jump, prospect, sell, hire, and draw), but you may only take three actions per turn. There is some strategy involved, but also a little luck because you never know how much gold you will find in the mines or whether the dice will roll in your favor.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Worker Placement

name: La Guerra de la Independencia
description:
The Peninsular War is set in Spain and Portugal during the Napoleonic wars. Years: 1808-1814

The hex map represents a map of Spain and Portugal with most of the major towns and cities represented.

Components:
• One 25 x 19" map
• 160 Counters
• One Rulebook
• Six Scenarios

Time Scale: 1 month
Map Scale: 30 km.
Unit Scale: Corp/Division/Brigade

name: Qelat
description:
A mancala game from Beni Amir & Mensa (the place in Eritrea, not the club). From http://mancala.wikia.com/wiki/Qelat_(Beni_Amir_%26_Mensa):

"Qelat is a common name for mancala variants played in western Eritrea. In Bilén it is the plural of qeltay, the name of the seeds used in the game. This particular variant is played among the Beni Amir and Mensa people, mainly by elders and young boys in their leisure time, as well as by males generally, especially during the period after marriage ceremonies. The elders often played it for large stakes, such as a hundred cows or a piece of land.

It was first described by Richard Pankhurst in 1971 as Qelat II (Game 11) who stated that "the counting of balls in the course of play is fully permissible."

Rules:

Qelat is played by two players.

The game board consists of two rows of six holes. Initially, there are 4 seeds in each hole.

Qelat is a two-directional game played on a twelve-hole board without pre-designated storehouse holes. As the game proceeds, each player creates up to six storehouse holes, called waldas.

On each turn, players sow only from one of the six holes on their own side of the board, but not from waldas. Seeds from the three holes on a player's right are sown counter-clockwise, whereas seeds from the three holes on a player's left are sown clockwise. Qelat is a single lap mancala game.

The object of the game is to capture holes, which is done, as in many games, by dropping the last ball in any hand into a hole containing three balls which are thus increased to four. Such captured holes, corresponding to the weg of other areas, are known as walda, but can be captured only in certain parts of the board.

The leftmost and rightmost holes on either player's own side of the board, as well as the outer two holes on the opponent's side of the board are eligible to become waldas for that player.

Thereafter seeds accumulate in walda(s) from the sowing of both players. Waldas are not skipped as incorrectly stated by Mohr.

The winner is the player who accumulates the largest number of balls in his walda(s).

Unlike many other mancala games, a player who is unable to move passes turns until a legal move is available. When neither player can move, the game is over. At the end of the game, the player who has captured the most seeds wins.

Pankhurst didn't say how to avoid repetition of board positions. It is suggested to use the following rule from another mancala game (Mazagebh I (Game 12)) of the same region: When a player moves a ball across the end of the board to his opponent's opposite hole the latter player is forbidden to shift the ball back in the following move."

Pankhurst, R. 1971. 'Gabata and Related Board Games of Ethiopia and the Horn of Africa', in Ethiopia Observer; 14 (3): 204.

name: Olympic Yachting
description:
Another simplistic sailing simulation, this one is based on a real event: the sailing competition of the XXI (21st) Olympic Games, Canada 1976. It comes with a huge (58x78cm) board, 6 boats, 3 buoys, 2 dice, a set of sailing cards and a set of advantage cards. Players sail one of the triangle courses as printed on the map; each course is used for a number of boat classes. Start and finish lines are also printed on the board. Wind direction is constant (South), as is the wind force, but some currents are printed on the board that influence the direction sailed. Players roll dice to move, and they need certain die rolls to start the race, change direction or gain sailing or advantage cards. Sailing cards represent difficulties the player must cope with (so they are, in effect, "disadvantage" cards). Special rules apply in the immediate areas around the turn marker buoys. Otherwise, some basic yachting rules, in particular right-of-way rules, must be observed.
The game is completely bi-lingual (English & French, as befits the location) and comes with an "Olympic Information" booklet that explains the sailing events (courses and boat classes) of the XXI Olympic Games as they took place in 1976 in Kingston Bay, Ontario, Canada. This booklet also has a glossary of sailing terms and illustrations of sailing maneuvers.

name: Siege
description:
Players lay Siege to each others cities and castle in order to be the first to recover their royal family.

Using one or more decks of normal playing cards (depending on number of players), each year of conflict is broken up into seasons where cards are used to attack, populate your castle or defend your walls.

Rules for the game are available on the author's website here-
http://www.curufea.com/games/siege.php

name: Stupidopoly
description:
From the publisher's web site:

It's silly, it's fun, it's the classic trading game... gone stupid!

Welcome to Stupidopoly, where you'll be racing your friends around the board, buying your favorite characters and watching the big bucks roll in! But look out, you might find yourself STUCK IN THE TOILET. (Phew!)

It sounds easy, but you'll be the one looking stupid if you're the first player to go broke!

It's the classic trading game...gone stupid!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Namits
description:
Each flip-card deck on a keyring has 20+ cards/tags in 4 colored sections. Each section has a lead card, and the rest of the cards have a list of five words on each side.

Name things that... (followed by lists of nouns, adjectives, verbs).
