A word is chosen to complete the Namits question, and players or teams think of other words associated with that word. If the game is played with paper and pencil, the one with the most answers wins. Play time could range from 1 minute to 1 day. If played verbally, players have 30 seconds to answer, and the last person to be able to think of a new answer wins.

Ages 4 and up. Good for home schooling. Very compact, so a good travel game.
publishers: Fundex, Great American Puzzle Factory, NAMiTS LLC

name: Kohti Jerusalemia
description: Kohti Jerusalemia (Toward Jerusalem) is a Finnish trivia game about the Bible. It contains 3150 questions categorized into 21 series and 3 difficulty levels. The board depicts the Levant (Samaria, Galilea and Judea) and three routes, each starting from and returning to Jerusalem, counting 100 steps each.

name: Beo: The Living Water Game
description:
<from the website of Living Water Charitable Trust> Beo is a Gaelic word meaning "alive" or "living". It is also a unique environmental, educational board game, an exciting and fun way to learn more about the environmental issues facing the planet.

It was created to help people understand the solutions to our planet's ecological problems, and encourage us to act for a sustainable future.

The purpose of the game is to show that cooperation and human values are essential to the solution of both local and global issues.

Playing the Game
Players are required to act together to keep the planet in a healthy state by solving environmental and social challenges, provided on game cards. Games are based on a global or regional map, and cover the full spectrum of water, air, soil, animal, human, forest and emotional issues.

Dials on the board reflect the state of health of the planet, and the aim of the game is to maintain all dials in the healthy zone.

Cooperation Not Competiton
The teams race against time, not against each other. Only creativity, fun and good communication can help players keep the earth healthy.

Beo creates opportunities for a new way of learning and interacting with each other, achieving integrated environmental education alongside group and personal development as participants discuss, co-operate and communicate in order to solve challenges.

Beo represents a realistic, positive approach to environmental issues, challenging our existing view of issues such as smog, floods, famine, and extinctions by offering solutions to the challenges that face us today.

Beo comes complete with 2 boards, one of the world (below) and the other of Scotland. (Alternative second boards for specific regions worldwide is planned for the near future.)

Also included are comprehensive instructions and a full glossary of terms.

There are a total of 1000 cards, 800 of which are for the adult version and 200 for the children's version, plus 7 wooden playing pieces.

name: Noddy's Ring Game
description: Players scored points by throwing rings over particular animal creatures which have certain point values. The player, who scores the most points in a certain number of ring throws, wins the game.

name: My First Counting Game
description:
For 1-4 players, Ages 3 - 5

(From box back)

This "make believe" shopping game for young players introduces the use of numbers in our everyday world and teaches simple counting and number identification skills.
The first payer to get every item on his or her shopping list wins!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Smithsonian: Be the Expert Game
description: Kids become a team of experts, hired to review the Smithsonian’s collections and find the items that don’t belong. Ninety double-sided cards feature hundreds of museum archive photographs, including objects, animals, people and places, plus fun facts that are only visible using the special magnifying glass. Regular and tough assignments allow kids of different abilities to play together.

name: Hot Air Ballooning Game
description:
This game was published Albuquerque International Balloon Fiesta. Players race their balloons through a series of obstacles. Each turn they can attempt to change the wind direction and also spin for their movement total. Event cards can give the player and edge or knock them out. Evidently hitting the electrical wires is BAD!

Rather than pawns players move one of the 5 colored balloons which are mounted on 1-foot plastic rods, so that they actually hang above the board. The balloons are meant to be painted so that players can personalize their balloons.

1,000 copies of the game were printed for the Balloon Fiesta. 1983 marked the 200th anniversary of ballooning.

name: Pawns Crossing
description:
Pawns Crossing is an abstract game that combines a requirement for tactical skill with a modest luck element. Players race to move tokens to their destinations over a tile and domino board. The game incorporates three separate movement mechanics which players must choose between at the beginning of each turn: a) Tokens move along the surfaces of dominoes and tiles, b) pawns move between holes that exist in the board at domino intersections, c) The rows and columns of the board shift. A complete game typically takes 20-40 minutes. The game may be enjoyed by two to four players but a 2-player game feels different from a 4-player game. As with many multi-player abstracts, the 2-player version is more strategic.

Requires a piecepack and a set of double six dominoes.

name: PackKub
description:
This game is a loose adaptation of the game Rummikub to the piecepack.

The goal of each round is to empty your hand by making melds to the table. On each player’s turn, the player must either make one or more melds to the table or draw a tile from the draw pile and add it to his hand. When one player has emptied his hand (by making melds), the round is over and is scored.

name: Multzo
description: Multzo, a game for 2-5 players, uses the 24 tiles and 24 coins from a piecepack. (The four dice and four pawns are not used.) It is in the family of Poker and other vying card games. But it doesn't require cash to be interesting. Players try to gain groups of tiles with the highest value, and there are four different ways to determine the best group (and up to four winners!) each round.

name: Rocky and His Friends Game
description: Players are school teachers attempting to stop Rocky and his friends from skipping school. They draw cards with students or force a player to discard one of their student cards. The first player fill all eight spots in their school house rings the bell and wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Educational, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation

name: C'est qui qu'a pété ?!
description:
Material:

10 Location Cards
40 Fart Card (in 5 colors)

The goal of the game is to accumulate less "Shame" possible by trying to pass onto others the farts that you make.

The game lasts 8 rounds and each player gets 8 cards. The active player turns a location card and then each player plays a fart card face down. In clockwise order, players acknowledge that they farted or not. If they do they get the location card with the side with less "shame". If everyone does not, then they reveal their cards and the highest number get the card (full "shame" side).

Every player get in his 8 cards a complicity card. If played along with another player's complicity, then they both are 0. If played alone, it's the highest number.

name: Koggen
description:
from the Warp Spawn Site:

INTRODUCTION
Board Game for 2-4+ players.
From the 12th to the 16th century trade in the Baltic Sea was controlled by an
organization of German merchants known as the Hanseatic League.
Each player takes the role of a Hansa Captain of a single Merchant ship (Cog).

VICTORY
The first player to accumulate 100 Gold wins the game.

THE BOARD
The board depicts Northern Europe including Scandinavia and parts of England and Russia.
13 Cities are marked on the map.
These are the main cities where the Hanseatic League conducted business.
The cities are connected by lines called trade routes.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Medieval, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Trading

name: Masters of India
description:
from Warp Spawn Site:

INTRODUCTION
Card game for 2-4 players.
India circa 1700's
Each player controls a European power that has
Colonial ambitions in India.

THE COLONIAL POWERS
Each player must pick as his identity one of the 4 Powers:
Portuguese, Dutch, English, French
All players must be of a different power.

VICTORY
The player with the most Raj Tokens at the end of the game wins.

END OF GAME
The game ends after 10 rounds.

name: Space Chess
description:
From the rules:

"Space Chess is a futuristic strategy game for 2 people. The download package includes a 14"x14" game board (separated into 2 files for printing), red and blue Fleet Strength sheets, red and blue Fleet Orders pads, red and blue King pads, and all pieces needed for the game.

Each player commands a fleet of 6 ships, represented by chess pieces on the game board, and by icons on Fleet Order pads (you can use either chess pieces from a small chess set for movement on the board, or ship tokens, which are included).

The game board is divided into 64 Quadrants. A Quadrant is made up of 9 Sectors, each referred to by its compass position in the Quadrant: N, NE, E, SE, S, SW, W, NW and C(enter). There are three types of Quadrants: Type I (Light Red), Type II (Light Green) and Type III (Yellow). Both Quadrant Type and Sector location affect ship movement and combat capabilities.

The object of the game is to locate and destroy your opponent’s King ship. King ships are initially placed on King pads rather than on the game board, keeping their location hidden."
mechanics: Grid Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Trivial Pursuit: Kansallispainos
description: This is expansion card set for Trivial Pursuit: Genus Edition. Kansallispainos is Finnish and it just means national edition. So here you have 250 cards with 1500 questions about Finland and matters concerning Finnish people. Of course the questions and answers are in Finnish.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia

name: Cheater's Game
description:
Cheater’s Game is a simple competitive game with a straightforward goal: End the tenth round with the highest score. Your score consists of two types of points: honest points and points you have from cheater’s alliances. Honest points are completely risk-free, but they’re harder to accumulate. Cheater’s alliance points are easy to accumulate, and accumulate faster when you have many players in your alliance. However, any member of an alliance can turn the other members of the alliance in and take the alliance's points, adding them to their honest score. So the question is, “How far you trust a group of self-admitted cheaters?”

Cheater’s Game uses about five standard six-sided dice, two point trackers, a turn tracker, player score pawns, and several sets of cheater’s alliance pawns. The trackers and pawns you need to play are all available as a 284 KB PDF.

Cheater’s Game has fairly simple rules, but complex psychosocial dynamics. You could play it with children as young as 6 or 7, and use it as a tool for teaching ethical and social lessons. Cheater’s Game is appropriate for Ages 12 and up without adult supervision. A 4-player game takes about 45 minutes to play.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Dice, Economic, Educational, Print & Play
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game

name: Rugged Adventures
description:
Frome the website:

Rugged Adventures is a unique approach to table top miniatures gaming. It is a mixture of skirmish wargaming and roleplaying. While must you command bodies of figures as in any miniature wargame you also play at least one character represented by a miniature on the playing surface (or set to use an appropriate movie term). This Player Represented Personality or PRP is required to act in accordance with a pre-determined character design, complete with special abilities, specific quirks, personal goals and a requirement for the gamer to take on all the characteristics they find attached to their particular miniature.

It is a light hearted approach to tabletop games with a strong emphasis on fun and story-telling. The Rugged Adventures player is encouraged not to win the game but play the story. Often players are required by the GM to act up their actions or give an 'in character' verbal account of themselves. We want our players to laugh, shout, speak in silly accents and generally come away from a game having enjoyed themselves whether they won or lost.

If I had to boil the design philosophy down to the essentials: Rugged Adventures is a game for those of us who love to build models, terrain and paint lots of figures-and still want to have a fast paced and fun game that doesn’t bog down with complex detail. Think of the Pulp Genre itself, action oriented story telling where glaring holes in the plot are often an advantage, and then apply this same spirit to the table-top.

name: Guelph & Ghibelline
description:
"Factional Warfare within and between the City States of Northern Italy circa 1220-1380. Each player takes the role of a Faction that can be found in any given city." The five player factions are: Papalists, Imperialists, Republicans, Signorialists, and Citizenry.

The game is played on a circular track made up of 26 spaces. Each space represents a city in Northern Italy and is marked with the name of the city. Victory Tokens are earned by establishing control over cities.

"The Player with the most Victory Tokens at the end of the game wins. The game ends after 30 Rounds."

name: Vestfirzka kvótasvindlið
description:
Vestfirzka kvótasvindlið (The Westfjord Quota-swindle) is a humorous game about the fishing industry and fishing quota. The players start the game with a small fishing boat and can buy bigger boats/ships so they can fish more. Selling the catch makes money to buy Quota. Ten Quotas are needed to win the game.

Cards with some actions are included giving bonus or costing the players something, usually money but sometimes just funny things.

name: Djavha
description:
A new millennium has begun on your planet! Order has seized control of your lives and Chaos has lost much ground, but still lingers in the shadows. In no event can the balance of your world tip wholly towards either force, as this would spell your immediate destruction. Your world is ruled by duality. Now the time has come to awaken the Warriors of Balance.

Djavha is a game with 54 cards where each player must use the powers of Ordre and Chaos as represented on each card to get rid of all of the cards in their possession. The game is one of rank and power. The first participant to get rid of all of their cards becomes the Master and the last person to get rid of their cards becomes the Damned.

name: Life-Boat Ludo
description: Players are sea rescuers saving ships' crews from sea catastrophes. Players must rescue all four of their ships crews and return to base before the other players get to their ships needing help. The first player to return with all survivors wins the game.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ortografia
description:
Ortografia is a polish board game designed for children (9-12 years old) to be useful tool in learnig the polish ortography.
Childrens have to choose witch type of cards do they want (h/ch or o/u). For playing they use two sided board where are special places for placing the cards with words.
The winner is child with the biggest numner of points (correctly written words).

name: Quiz Me: Game of Geography
description:
Perhaps one of the older trivia games published, Quiz Me: Game of Geography is simply a trivia game with trick questions. The player who answers the most questions correctly wins.

For example: Question #10 is "Singapore is an important naval base in the East Indies belonging to Great Britain. True or False?"

The answer is "True."

Game #4777 made in 1940 by Milton Bradley Co. of Springfield, Mass.

name: Berlin-Stadtspiel
description: A promotional game published by the Berlin Senate's public relations office, this is a simple game where players move around the town on a replica of a 1914 city map, collecting picture cards as they go. The most valuable set of cards wins. Movement can be along streets (slow) or using the underground/suburban railway. The game is historically interesting as it still shows the city divided by the Berlin Wall into Wast (Soviet) and West sectors, with only a few dedicated transit points between the two, a state of affairs that lasted from August 1961 to November 1989.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Presse- und Informatiosamt des Landes Berlin

name: Combat
description:
From the rules:
COMBAT, the new war card game, is inspired by the popular TV show. Players mix both skill and strategy with risk and luck to "capture" as many weapons as they are able.
In the pack of 40 cards are 32 weapon card...which show a NUMBER, INSIGNIA and a WEAPON. The NUMBER on the WEAPON card is the point VALUE of the card in scoring. The remaining 8 cards are "CAPTURE" cards. They show a NUMBER and WEAPON. There are 2 CAPTURE cards of each WEAPON. These cards are used at strategic times to "capture" as many WEAPON cards as possible."
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, World War II

name: Monopoly: Amiens
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the city of Amiens, in France.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Angers
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the city of Angers, in France.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Avignon
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the city of Avignon, in France.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Beauvais
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the city of Beauvais, in France.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Liverpool FC Edition
description: The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the Liverpool FC football team, in the United Kingdom.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Hasbro, Parker Brothers, Winning Moves UK Ltd.

name: Monopoly: Sheffield
description: The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the city of Sheffield, United Kingdom.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Parker Brothers, Winning Moves UK Ltd.

name: Mulligan
description:
From the rules:
Mulligan - the mind game to challenge your golf skills.

Mulligan is a game where you can acquire knowledge about the rules of golf, the history of golf and about golf technique. Mulligan has been designed like a proper golf course, consisting of 9 holes (alternatively 18 holes by playing 9 holes twice). The holes are of different length and difficulty. At each hole you get information of par and distance of the hole, as you find it on any real golf course. Mulligan is an entertaining knowledge game giving the players a good opportunity to learn or freshen up on the rules of golf and etiquette.

During the play the players will encounter all the elements that they find during a real round of golf, like bunkers, out of bounds and water hazards.

Quick description:
A challenging golf trivia game that comes with golf course board, score cards, golf ball die, tees, and trivia cards all in a wooden display box. The also game comes with rules to complete using the Stableford system, stroke play, and match play.

name: Beezi
description:
Beezi: The S-P-E-L-L-I-N-G Game

This spelling game uses a special six-sided die with different bees on it - Stinger, Queen Bee, Honey Bee, Bumble Bee, Digger Bee, Killer Bee. On a player's turn, the die is rolled and depending on the bee that appears, the player draws a card (different bees have different degrees of difficulty) with a word to spell on it. The card is passed to the player on the left, who acts as Beekeeper and says the word on the card. All other players try to spell the word on their writing pad. If the player whose turn it is spells it correctly the player gets the indicated number of beez which are then placed on a honeycomb board; if that player misspells the word, the other players who spelled the word correctly get a beez, Rolling the Stinger causes a missed turn, and the Queen Bee gives the opportunity to earn double the number of beez.

name: L'Anniversaire des triplés
description: In this game; you attempt to fill your birthday cake appropriately by rolling the dice and playing cards. The special dice allow you to advance by the number of faces you see with two boys and a girl showing allowing you to advance six. What is neat is you can use your own birthday month as the chance to score a candle. Great bits make this a relatively interesting game.

name: Mary
description:
Mary, a.k.a. Ladybirds, contains a wooden tray with three sets of ten squared tiles with different patterns:


10 ladybugs, with each ladybug bearing a number of dots from 1 to 10
10 puddles of paint, each of a different color
10 pictures of different colors with simple shapes (umbrella, kite, worm...)


The player needs to arrange these tiles in the tray with respect to colors and/or numbers.

name: Rallyspil
description: A rally game designed with kids in mind, as they get to know Icelandic geography while playing it. Players draw cards with maps of Iceland on them and on the maps there are rally-routes which they must drive from start to finish. The cards provide some general information on traffic as well, to improve the knowledge of the players.

name: Nichts wie raus hier
description:
Every player has 4 different pawns with values from 1 to 4. On his turn he can move one pawn so many unoccupied spaces like the value of this pawn shows. If the moved pawn is on a space with the same number as his value the player can take it from the board. The first player who gets all his pawns off the board wins.

Published in Spielbox 4/2006

name: WinniM
description:
A word card game in which you lay down and/or add to words from your hand. The unique feature of WinniM is that each card can stand for a vowel or consonant, depending on which end is up. The 105 cards have all possible combinations (5 x 21). This adds an extra dimension: in addition to rearranging letters as you add to your words, you can flip the cards to change the letters in the word. In the Wild version, you can also steal from and add to opponents' words as well.

When the deck runs out and no one can play any more, score for the number of cards you have on the table and for the length of each word, longer words giving many more points.

name: Star Wars Clone Wars: Giant Card Games
description: A deck of 32 cards, 4 sets of eight characters, featuring cartoon characters from the Star Wars Clone Wars animated film. Four games can be played: Grevious Hunt (Find the Queen); Use the Force (Pairs); Jedi Dual (Snap); and Clones (Rummy ie collect all four characters in a set).
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Invasión
description:
Basic wargame for two players, set in the Napoleonic period.
Utopian battle with board symmetrical.
The phases of a turn: Firing artillery,Movement and Combats.

name: A Forest Full of Kings
description:
The Rise and Fall of the Maya 376-910 AD.

The competitive, multi-player game of rival Maya city states. The game features numerous aspect of Maya civilization including warfare, kingship, slash-and-burn agriculture, economics, human sacrifice, building infrastructure, religion, and ritual blood sacrifices.
categories: Ancient, City Building, Economic, Political, Religious, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Chit-Pull System, Variable Phase Order
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), Platinum Dragon Productions

name: Eureka Stockade
description:
Ballarat Goldfields, colony of Victoria, Australia
Sunday, December 3, 1854

We swear by the Southern Cross to stand truly by each other, and fight to defend our rights and liberties.
- Miners' oath of allegiance to the rebel cause

From what I have seen today, I am convinced more than ever that very strong measures are necessary on this goldfield and the sedition must be put down by force. The disaffected must be coerced.
- Captain Pasley, acting Aide de Camp

The troubles on the Victorian Goldfields that culminated in the Eureka Stockade are a misunderstood event in Australian history. Reports in England, Canada and California at the time show exaggerated expectations that this was the start of a widespread revolt against British Colonial misrule. In Australia, it was usually reported as a minor aberration of no serious or immediate consequences, merely a protest against taxes that got out of hand rather than the culmination of a chain of events. So, who was correct ? The colonial Governor, Sir Charles Hotham reported to the British colonial secretary George Grey that if the battle was lost at Ballarat then the colony of Victoria was lost to British Sovereignty. The game is designed to both teach about the events at the stockade and to serve as an introduction to military and historical boardgames.

Each map hex is approximately 60 meters from side to side. Each unit represents 10 men in the historical scenario (in the Hotham's nightmare scenario, each unit represents approximately 20 men). Turns represent a few (about 5) minutes.

Contains:
11x17" map (also in two 8.5x11" parts)
108 counters (available in two different styles)
1 Players' Reference Sheet
7 Page Rules

name: Animal House Trivia Game
description:
In the Animal House Trivia Game, you're a member of the Delta pledge class. As a Pledge, you'll relive the hilarity of this classic film, scavenging your way around Faber College completing pledge tasks in order to become a full-fledged member of the Delta Tau Chi fraternity. As Otter says, "The whole point is just to enjoy yourself!"
Game comes complete with over 1,000 trivia questions, 15 Pledge Task cards, 6 Legacy cards, custom illustrated game board, deck of Animal House playing cards, dice, and rules.
categories: Humor, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Music Mayhem
description:
"The Furiously Fun Game for All Music Lovers." The object of the game is to earn points and advance game piece up the game board by correctly identifying song titles and/or artists played on your CDs, Mini Discs, cassettes or other music sources such as the radio, television or the internet.

Components consist of a hinged, black box such as old record collections used to come packaged in; a game board, half of which is the actual playing board being a facsimile of the controls and knobs of a turntable, and the other half being a facsimile of the turntable itself; six playing pieces in the form of Ernie Ball guitar picks; one 15-second sand timer; one drawstring bag to hold the timer and picks; and an actual vinyl record which, when placed on the turntable side of the board, becomes the game spinner.

The DJ plays music, spins the record and the players try to answer any questions put forth by the DJ about the music being played. Either a solo player makes the guess or all guess depending on which way the spinner points. Sometimes all can guess but for one player who has been "muted."

The winner is the player or team which reaches "11" on the playing board.

name: Don't be the Dragon
description:
From the box: In this exciting board game you will really dress up. The four sturdy costumes change the players into a Knight, Princess, Magician, or Dragon. Suddenly, when you least expect it you have to change costume and that changes the whole game. Whatever you do, Don't be the Dragon. You can't win the game. But... if you are, have fun keeping the other players from winning.

This children's game is a costume changing game. The costumes are plastic bibs. It is a simple roll and move game where the players try to move from an Inn to the Castle. Along the way there are short cuts to move ahead and pitfalls that move characters back. The Dragon moves back and forth along the trail trying to catch the players. When a player lands on a portrait of another character, they trade costumes. The winner is the first player, who is not the Dragon, to reach the castle.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Värmlandskampen
description:
Värmlandskampen is a game of tactics for 2 to 5 players. Together you will build a map and only the size of your table limits its size. You can either choose to cooperate with or fight against your opponents.

This plays almost exactly like Carcassonne (it even includes a small river), but with some more elements. Among others a game of rock-paper-scissors.

name: Wandelstern
description: Two large metal shapes are chasing each other on paths with special patterns. They are propelled by dice. After six moves, hunter and prey change their roles. When the hunter manages to climb on top of the victim, he wins.

name: Martianopoly
description:
Move around the board cutting down trees to erect buildings.
The pieces are used as both currency and buildings.
Movement and payment options add strategy.

name: Mumiya: Sokrovishcha grobnits
description:
Russian board game.

Players choose their chip archaeologist and several hexes of catacomb. Then players lay a field of hex and placed caches and mummies. Outside the tomb of the players can buy equipment: weapons, ammunition, a flashlight and other things.

The game consists of the movement of cells catacomb, battles with mummies and finding treasures. The player who rescue 2 treasures from the tomb - winning.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Tile Placement

name: Roll 'n Multiply
description:
The Game of Multiplication, Strategy and Fun!

Roll ’n Multiply, the exciting multiplication game, assists younger students in basic multiplication skills and challenges players proficient in multiplication. The game’s unique 10-sided dice enable students to multiply as high as 100. Simply roll the die, and multiply the numbers together. Corresponding game pieces are then strategically placed on the playing board.

Because Roll ’n Multiply encourages cooperative play, opponents assist each other in multiplying the numbers, and the enclosed multiplication table confirms the answer. Four in a row wins the game- but watch out! Your playing piece may be captured and then flipped to the opponent’s side! For beginning players, winning depends on luck and strategy, not on multiplication ability. Advanced students challenge their opponent’s multiplication and strategy skills or assist novice players with multiplication.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement

name: Marea
description:
The idea behind The Tide is the cooperation between two designers. An author from daVinci (Silvano Sorrentino, "Dancing Dice", "Ostrakon" among others) has written the first page of these rules, while an author from Red Omega Studio (Piero Cioni, "Crazy Rally", "Tortuga"), has completed the work. Successful experiment? You call it!

The playing area is made up of a 6 x 6 area of tiles (the extra 36 tiles are placed in 6 piles of 6 tiles each at the top of the paying area, which represent the tide.) Each player controls 4 pawns, representing friends who are collecting shells & cleaning up trash at a beach. On his turn, each player can do one of the following: move one of his friends, collect ONE seashell, or collect one OR MORE pieces of rubbish. Each time a tile is removed, it is replaced by a tile from the tide.

The game ends as soon as one of the following conditions is met: one of the players reaches 10 points: that player is the winner, OR one of the column runs out of tiles (no tiles in the column, no tiles in the relevant pile); the winner is the player with the most points. In case of a tie, the winner among tied players is the one with the most tiles

(Note: the link on the game's website to the pieces is broken. However, you can get the components from the Italian edition -- here's the link to the archive: http://www.davincigames.it/giocarea/archivio/giocarea11.zip. The components are language-independent.)

This game appeared in issue #11 of GiocAreA Online.

name: Tiny Toon Adventures
description: All people that like Siri and Sigge Spratt (Buster & Babs Bunny) have hidden at the Looniversitetet (ACME Looniversity) and your job is to find them. Your friends are on 20 tiles and the person who find the most friends of the same color wins this game. But be aware: Siris and Sigges enemies have also hid and will give you some trouble if you find them instead.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Spöken och Monster
description:
Do you dare to enter this monster castle? In the castle some terrible monsters will wait for you such as Greve Cranium, Ms bat, Frankenstein, Kryptonia and many more. The house is full with bats, spiders, craniums and chests. Can you lay the puzzle and find the creature in the castle before anyone else? Then you will escape with your life and the other are doomed for the eternity.

Contents:
The box as a boardgame
1 bat
1 spider
1 chest with 20 puzzle pieces
1 cranium
1 book storytelling of Greve Cranium
34 cards
2 dice
publishers: Damm / Egmont, Joshua Morris Publishing, Litor

name: Super Games
description:
The game with a lot of challenges. You have to prove your self worthy in 15 different challenges to get around the board. Do you have what it takes to get to the finish line?
Do you feel just lucky or are you a master of tactics in the challenges?

Will you master basket, skating, golf, throwing rings, number games, spelling games, higher or lower, quiz just to mention some of the challenges.
categories: Children's Game, Number, Sports, Word Game

name: Quatorze
description: Players try to remove groups of cards, but they can only remove a group of cards if the total adds up to 14, and if they are in the same row or the same column.

name: The Wooly Ladder
description:
Whoever, after a couple of Ups and Downs is the first to reach pink sheep Rosemary, wins the game.

A classic competition race for 2-4 players.

Travel games:
• Popular classic games in a suitcase
• Ideal for long journeys by car, train or airplane
• Magnetic game figures: nothing lost between the seats!
• Game board inside lid
• Suitcase is the packaging

name: Dino Flip 5
description:
Be the dinosaur hunter to find the most matching pairs! But be observant...the matches aren't exact. Flip the tokens as you play to make a constantly changing game.

The better you know your dinos, the faster you'll be. The game comes with a guide to the featured creatures.

Handy, portable box makes this a great game to take on trips.

3 ways to play
Develops observation, memory and matching skills

name: Majority
description:
In Majority, each player represents a political party in an unnamed parliament. There are 15 political issues represented by cards - each party has a platform of 10 that they are interested in passing bills about, with varying point values.

On each turn a player proposes a bill and attempts to get a majority for it - if this happens the parties interested in the issue score points. There are also event cards which can change the number of seats held by the parties, etc.

Contents:

60 political platform cards
50 event cards
6 pawns
1 game board
1 die
1 set of rules (in Dutch, French, and English)

name: Scrabble Valentine's Day
description:
Special Valentine's Day version of Scrabble. Comes in a box similar to a heart shaped box of chocolates. Contains smaller heart shaped board (kind of a blocky heart shape, since it is made of squares) and 100 Letter Tiles.

Play is like normal Scrabble, with the addition of a list of 12 romantic themed words, that if used, scores an additional 4 point bonus in addition to normal tile and grid space scoring.

Also included in the game are adhesive dots and a Scrabble and Valentine's Day themed greeting card, so that you could use some of the tiles to spell out a message on the greeting card for your loved one.

name: Maisy Lotto
description:
Maisy Lotto is a childrens lotto aimed at rather younger children than most lottos - with just 4 pictures per board, instead of the usual 9. This makes it an ideal starter lotto for younger children - in fact by the time they reach the 3+ range indicated on the box, they are probably too old for this and ready for regular childrens lotto games.

The pictures come from the popular Maisy stories, and the boards are brightly coloured red, blue, yellow and green.

name: Rolling Rocks
description: First published as part of the Stonehenge: Bonusspiele #1 anthology as Rollende Steine, Rolling Rocks is sort of a tabletop, Stonehenge: An Anthology Board Game golf. The players act as a team of Celtic giants, entertaining themselves by rolling rocks through the trilithons. The method by which she rolls her stone each turn is entirely up to the player, be it flicking, using a stick for leverage, or even blowing on it. In addition to the dexterity element, players are granted the opportunity to place and move sticks on the board in order to attempt to guide their wayward stones.

name: 270 to Win
description:
270 to Win is a dice game set during the last few months of an election for the office of the President of the United States of America. Candidates campaign across the country, compete for votes in each state, and face off in a debate, all in hopes of earning at least 270 of the 538 available electoral votes.

270 to Win has simple push-your-luck dice mechanics that allow two players to enjoy a quick, tense game where the outcome can change with one lucky roll. Better yet - it's completely free!

name: Noggin the Nog
description:
Devised and drawn by Oliver Postgate and Peter Firmin, creators of the TV films.

Simple roll and move game for Ages 4 - 7. Two games - Nogfruit Game and Nogbad's Castle - on a double sided board.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Plunder!
description:
From the game box:
"...the exciting board game about our basic instincts...
Appeals to the adventurer and the land hunger in all of us. Players make their fortunes in gold rushes and diamond claims, discover new territories and take part in war games - while they plunder land and money."

Players move their pawns around the game-board at the throw of dice. When you land on any one of the illustrated squares, it directs you to perform one or more of the following acts:
• Land on any territory and take it; from one of 134 Land Title Cards. Each card represents a territory in England, France, Ireland, Scotland or Wales and has a dollar value which doubles when you collect a set.
• Land on a battleground and you may win or lose the battle. Either way, you pick up a card from the top of the winner's pack or loser's pack, and learn your fate.
•If you encounter a barricade which prevents you from advancing further, you have three choices to overcome it: one is to bribe each player with $3000 to let you through.
• There are also safe-houses for refuge in bad times.
• Land on any Action square and you must pick up an Action Card from one of ten packs in a plastic tray. each has an instruction for you: you may obtain more territory, make your fortune or advance speedily across the board. Or you may be unlucky and lose land or be forced to retreat.

Each player starts with $100,000. the objective is to increase your net worth by game end.
Each tour around the board represents a hundred years in time, and you accumulate a fortune at the end of each tour, fro your sets of territories. Each of the 10 packs of ACTION CARDS represents a different century. During your first tour of the board, you may take Action Cards from the first pack which is the 11th century. For your next tour, you take from the 12th century, and so on until you reach the 20th century and end the game.

EDUCATIONAL ASPECTS
For adult history buffs who want to read them, each Action Card also describes vivid historic episodes. Students who wish to be informed on the real background to their studies may learn how the English speaking peoples, and the French, survived the ups and down of fortunes over the past 1000 years.
For players who like war games, major battles mentioned on Action Cards often have military strategy or new weapons technology described.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Wordcard
description:
A word card game that is similar to Rummy 500, with many options to its play.

The deck has 8 suits of cards 1-K, each one also having a letter and point value; there are also 4 joker/wild cards. The rules (and facecard names) are in French, English, Dutch and German.

In a turn, a player:
1. Draws the top of the draw pile, or any card of the discard pile (which is fanned). If the latter, the drawn card must be melded immediately, and all the cards above it are added to the hand.
2. Melds cards from the hand.
3. Adds to melds already on the table. This can only be done after one has melded 5 cards of his own.
4. Discards a card.
The game ends when a player clears his hand.

The multiple options include:

Hand size: 8 to 13. Larger is recommended for cardplay melding (sets and runs).

Melding: words alone, cards alone (sets and runs), various ways of doing both, dealer's choice.

Scoring: maximum (add points for each meld); minimum (add points for unused cards in the hand).

Others: bonuses, variations such as crossword arrangements.

There is also a Group Game mode where one hand (8 to 13 cards) is laid out for all to see, and write out their best scoring meld based on those cards.

name: Travel Scroll-O-Matic Boggle
description: A travel version of Boggle, that utilizes scrolling letters rather than cubes.

name: Majority Rules
description:
Majority Rules is a game of gathering votes for various factions: Governor, Congressman, Senator, and President; and collecting the money that's associated with them. Rewards of bonus states are available, but beware of the penalties, which include being exiled to D.C.

States are marked by chits as they are claimed, and the faction the are claimed for is decided by dice roll (d6, rolled 3 at a time).

Production quality is minimal. Chits are file card weight cardboard, colored blue and white with backings in dark and light gray. Card stock is similar to Parker Brothers' standards for family games. Board is eight-color on black backing. Game bills itself as "The World's Most Exciting Game", and MSRP was $19.95

name: Guacamole
description:
A print and play game, designed for the '4 cards or tiles only' contest. Designed by Peter Chilton & Lisa Orchard.

A two-four player abstract strategy, where players move on to spaces with different shapes and numbers. The number they land on is added to their score, while the shape determines how many spaces the next player can move.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Print & Play

name: The Baltic Wars
description:
This is a very small wargame covering the whole of The Baltic Wars of the early 1700s. The three players represent Poland, Sweden, and Russia, as well as a collection of lesser allied powers. Production, political influence, and status are all kept on a small score sheet. Victory is determined by victory points based on captured cities and aggregate political influence. The mechanics of this game are very similar to The Thirty Years War by the same designer and publisher.

This definitely was a "budget" wargame, retailing for $1.79 in 1980. The counters were printed on thin cardboard and had to be cut out with scissors. All other components are paper, including an 11"x17" map, the cover sheets, and 5 double-sided copies of the score sheet, all in a 4"x6" ziplock bag.

name: Dragons
description:
Dragons is a tile placement game in which two players strive to complete sinuous loops of their colour.

Two players, Green and Red, share a common pool of 50 hexagonal dragon tiles. Each tile shows shoulders on the front and tails on the back in both players' colours.

The opening player places a tile of their choice in the centre of the playing area. Players then take turns adding a tile of their choice adjacent to at least one existing tile, such that edge colours always match.

http://www.cameronius.com/games/dragons/

name: Tusenbeinet
description:
A caterpillar race.

Each player controls a caterpillar made up by six coloured cups and a head. You move your caterpillar on any flat surface by rolling a coloured dice. The the first who reach the finish line wins.

name: Edges
description:
Players take turns to place the triangular pieces onto the board. When played the piece must be laid down so that its edges match those of any piece already in position (i.e Red to Red, Green to Green).
When two or more edges are matched the player earns an extra turn. If a player cannot place a piece matching the edges then the turn is forfeited and play reverts to the opponent.
When one player has placed all the pieces on the board the game is over and opponent calculates the penalty points for the unplayed pieces. If no further play is possible then both players calculate the penalties for their unplayed pieces.

name: Kikavu
description:
Memory game.
Goal of the game: To have the most tokens by finding the animals which hide in the savanna.
Set up: place face down the 18 animals tiles and then place over each one a savanna tile. Each player take a players aid.

Buy throwing dice, the active player can look at an animal under the savanna tiles. Before he must tell which animals he wants to find.

If the answer is right, the player takes a victory token and replaces the animal.
If it's not right, he shows the animal to the other players.

The players with the most savanna tokens wins.

name: The Haunted Railway Game
description:
Second title in the Famous Five Adventure Games book series. A "make your own adventure game" based on the Famous Five children's book, "Five Go Off to Camp".

Players start at the first paragraph and roll the Famous Five die to select the first step on their adventure. In subsequent paragraphs, players receive instructions about how to proceed: they must make decisions about which way to go next, roll the die, or solve clues using the included playing cards (in the shape of various tools, such as a torch or a codebook). The more clues solved, the better chance of unraveling the final mystery. And running out of provisions (picnic cards) automatically ends the adventure!

From the back of the book:

In this original series of Adventure Game Books, YOU decide what they do and whether they solve the mystery or not.

Everything you need to play the game is contained in your own Adventure Wallet. Inside it, you will find a book and a selection of playing cards including a compass, binoculars, a map, a code book and a rucksack; and in case you need refreshment, a lunchbox and picnic cards! There is even a special Famous Five dice!

The game can be played over and over again, as many times as you like. For there are a variety of routes to the solution and each route involves different clues and adventures.

name: UTAH in a box
description:
Yet another Monopoly variant, but this is not the same as "Monopoly-Utah" by Hasbro, nor "Utah on Board" by Help on Board. Description from the back of the box:

" Utah is a land of incomparable natural beauty. It's varied terrain, from the snow capped mountains of northern Utah to the stunning red-rock country in the south, surrounds it's residents with breathtaking views on a daily basis. A place of great contrasts, the majestic Wasatch range rises dramatically behind the sparkling skyscrapers of progressive Salt Lake City. With a history forged by pioneers, Utah now embraces the future while delighting the eye and rejuvenating the soul. Yes...this is the place!

"UTAH IN-A-BOX was created with the help of Utah natives. We asked Utahns what makes this place so great. While it's impossible to include everything, UTAH-IN-A-BOX includes many of the highlights. Advertising space was not for sale on this game. The board includes authentic landmarks only.

"The game is full of mountains, parades, dinosaur footprints, salt, basketball, symphonies, ballet, a little more salt and lots of things Utahn! This is a game about a unique place, so roll the dice and take a hike! Who knows? You may win big in the Winter Games or become the proud owner of Skull Valley! Are you looking for a fun way to experience Utah? VOILA! -- behold; here it is!"

"Here's a quick idea of how to play: Buy property, build a skyline, trade the skyline for a key to the city. It sounds easy enough -- but add a traffic jam, property taxes, car fines and the IRS and it becomes a little more difficult and a lot more fun!
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Bucking Broncho
description: This is a "Gold Medal" spin the top game from Transogram which from the game cover is "full of pep and action." The game is made from wood and tin. It comes with a top, 8 pieces which are stood up outside of some blocking posts that control where the top is capable of spinning to. Knock a piece down and score the number of points listed on the bulls-eye where the piece was knocked down.

name: Animal Domino Card Game
description:
One of a series of children's card games published by International Games in 1983.

There is a deck of 34 cards, done in domino fashion with 7 animals: Bear, Camel, Fox, Mountain Goat, Leopard, Lion, Zebra. There is 1 of each pairing and 2 for each double -- except Fox, perhaps to make room for 2 rules cards out of the 36.

Deal 4 each; the player with the alphabetically lowest double plays it. In a turn a player plays a card that matches one end of the line, drawing a card if necessary. He may play cards as long as he can; when he runs out of plays, he discards to end his turn. The first player out of cards wins.

name: El Paso Scene
description:
Get ready to experience the El Paso Scene - Live and work at an exciting pace, make and break deals, buy and sell property, finance and liquidate businesses.
Be Prepared to deal with the Mayor, get connections with the County Commissioners, influence the Chamber of Commerce and stay out of trouble on the Border. (from the box.)
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Vet du var?
description: Promotional question-game from the Swedish ice-cream manufacturer Sia-Glass. Questions about the world, in categories based on the world continents.

name: Quanta
description: A two-player competitive puzzle in which the pieces have values called “quantum charges” restricting their placement. This value can make the same pieces either offensive or defensive, depending on the way the game progresses. In the end, the player with the most captured neutrons will win the game.

name: Play 4
description: A game of foresight in which each player plans four moves ahead, without knowing what the opponent is up to. There’s only one pawn on the board for each player — a very valuable pawn indeed. There are two variations: the easier allows the players to change their minds...a little.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Muskie Noqueado
description:
Game Objective:
To be the first to score 400 points. Points are obtained by having a combination of cards with value up to 10. 6 green and 4 red gives you 10 points. 3 blue and 7 blue you get 20 points. A wild card (Muskie Card) doubles your combination score. Finally, if you are the first to play all your card and use the knockout Muskie card with your last 10 combination you obtain 50 points. However, if other players plays his/hers last cards and the knockout Muskie is in your hand, you lose 10 points.

name: Scuda Checkers
description:
From the game bag: "Scuda Checkers is basically playing two games of checkers simultaneously."

The game comes in a cloth drawstring bag, with a cloth 6x6 grid checker board with circles and squares on the grid instead of red/black, and 24 wooden cubes (12 yellow and 12 orange).

One person plays orange cubes on circles and yellow on squares. The other plays yellow on circles and orange on squares. On your turn, you decide whether to make a move on either squares or circles; your cubes stay on circles/squares according to what they started on, following normal checkers rules. So you are basically playing two small games of checkers at once: orange vs. yellow on circles, and orange vs. yellow on squares.

name: Speel je mee?
description:
The parts of this lovely game combine to form a house with four rooms, walls and doors for the little figurines to walk through. In this beautiful house children have played and therefore of course it is not very tidy, the toys are strewn all over the place. And now the children have a new game: Find all the toys and thereby tidy the house.

Every player gets a cardboard card with 4 toys on it. The tiles with toys on it are placed in the rooms of the house. Every player chooses a wooden figure and places it in a room, the trail to follow through the house is made coloured mats. you throw the dice and move to the next mat in that colour, you can turn 1 of the toy tiles, is it on your list, you take it.
The first player to have all 4 toys of his list wins the game.

name: GoVenture Card Game: Entrepreneur & Monster
description:
A new business-themed game that moves fast with fun strategy. Add a fantasy sci-fi themed version called Monster — Zombies, Vampires, Orcs, Merfolk, Werewolves, and Dragons — and you have the GoVenture Card Game.

The GoVenture Card Game is fast and easy to play but deep in strategy. It is designed for novice and experienced players, kids and adults, to have fun playing together.

The depth of the gameplay is revealed as you play. Follow every turn and every decision, or just play casually.

Play with 2 players, or up to 6, in a single game. Includes over 300 cards with engaging graphics and game rules that are easy to read and follow. Each game plays for 10 to 30 minutes (or longer with 6 players). More ways to play are included on the game website at GoVentureCardGame.com

_________________________________
GAMEPLAY SUMMARY - MONSTER THEME

There are four decks of cards: MONSTERS (6 types), WEAPONS, BOUNTY, ACTION.
Earn GOLD COINS by delivering MONSTERS to claim BOUNTIES. To claim a BOUNTY, you must hold matching WEAPON, MONSTER, and BOUNTY cards.
The winner is the first player to have 20 GOLD COINS on hand or to collect all 3 unique WORLD cards. WORLD cards are earned when you claim BOUNTIES for the MONSTERS shown on the cards.

ON YOUR TURN

Pick up one MONSTER card from the deck or top discard. This is the START of your turn.
Do any of the following (no limit): Trade cards with other players; Buy or return WEAPONS cards; Buy or play ACTION cards.
Pick up one MONSTER or BOUNTY card (or the top discard of either deck). Claim the BOUNTY if you can, otherwise return the BOUNTY card to the top of the discard pile. This is the END of your turn.

_________________________________
GAMEPLAY SUMMARY - ENTREPRENEUR THEME

There are four decks of cards: PRODUCTS (6 types), BUSINESSES, CUSTOMERS, ACTION.
Earn MONEY by selling PRODUCTS to CUSTOMERS. To make a sale, you must hold matching BUSINESS, PRODUCT, and CUSTOMER cards.
The winner is the first player to have $20 (MONEY) on hand or to collect all 3 unique WORLD cards. WORLD cards are earned when you make sales of the PRODUCTS shown on the cards.

ON YOUR TURN

Pick up one PRODUCT card from the deck or top discard. This is the START of your turn.
Do any of the following (no limit): Trade cards with other players; Buy or return BUSINESS cards; Buy or play ACTION cards.
Pick up one PRODUCT or CUSTOMER card (or the top discard of either deck). Make a sale if you can, otherwise return the CUSTOMER card to the top of the discard pile. This is the END of your turn.

—description from the publisher

name: Pitch: Chicago Cubs
description:
Contents:
70 Pitch cards each with six baseball questions and answers based on Chicago Cubs history
Baseball diamond game mat
Instructions for play

Two teams of players vie to answer the most trivia questions, each question being worth a single, double, triple or home run. Miss a question - that's an out! After 5 innings, the team with the most runs wins.

name: Die Naschbären
description: There are 72 large strawberries displayed on the game board. Each player has two wooden bears and places them on one of the berries. Little wooden pieces (or, if you prefer, gummibears etc.) are placed on all other strawberries. These pieces come in three colors, worth 1, 2 and 3 points respectively (of course, if you use candy, you can choose your own preference of colors). The players roll one die and move one of their bears 1-6 berries in a straight line (the strawberries form kind of a hex grid). If you cannot move because you are blocked by other bears or by the end of the game board, you have to pay one of your pieces. Otherwise, you pick up the piece on the berry you end your move on, if there still is any. Game ends when there are no more pieces to be found (or, for a shorter game, only 10 left) or everyone has eaten enough.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Flip to Win Bear Hunt
description: Great for travel! By asking "yes" or "no" questions see if you can correctly identify your opponents bear. Includes two boards with bear selections wheels. No removable pieces!

name: Così Fan Tutti
description: Light "Adult" game for up to 4 couples. Four phases to accumulate points: seduction, strip-tease, petting, positions. Each phase a different little game using dice and cards. Published in Italy by Giochi Prezios under license by Henry Creation Paris.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Dice, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Busy Little Bees
description: Busy Little Bees game.Race your Bee around the garden to be the first to fill your hive with honey.2 to 4 players.This game has been designed to develop counting,colour matching and social skills whilst encouraging concentration and observation.A great game from the Orchard Toys range which is made in Britain.All Orchard Toys products are made in the UK from durable recycled board and have a wipe clean finish to offer years of enjoyment and great value for money.The range is rigorously tested in playgroups,schools and at home by teachers and parents to ensure that they stimulate and entertain at the right level to make learning fun.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Die Flöte mit sechs Schlümpfen
description: The destination is to reach the center of the gameboard with your smurf figure first. To move throw a spinner with numbers (like a dice) on it.

name: Dotty Dozen
description:
This is a children's card game. Each player has three cards in hand, cards can be numbered 0 to 6. On their turn, they play one of them to one of the 4 stacks. If the 4 top cards now add up to 12, they take those 4 top cards and immediately take another turn.

Note: Cards must first be played to open spaces in the tray. A sum of 12 must always be made with 4 cards. Hands must always be refilled to 3 cards.

Game ends when last card is played. Winner is the player with the most cards.

name: Dirty Money
description:
The Game of indecent Proposal$.

Players collect points by correctly predicting what their opponents will or won't do for Dirty Money

name: Knobello
description:
Two games in one box."Knobello"cards, every player gets an numeration board and 6 cards. On the cards are numbers and symbols. The highest number takes the trick, if 2 players play the same number on the trick the first played number wins. The points you get for a trick come from the symbols (stone, paper, scissor). Rules for the common game. Zero points for the same symbol, 1 point for the better symbol, -1 point for a bad symbol. The player who reaches 50 points first wins.

"Knobello" board, the player who first reaches the middle of the board wins. The player and his left neighbor play simultaneously Hands are played and then players show different number of fingers. The player goes the total numbers of fingers shown by both players on the board. On different parts of the board you cannot use all five fingers.

name: Weidespass
description: An attractive tile laying game based on raises and riding horses. The game looks somewhat like Carcassonne and is well produced, but the play is simple and based on dice rolls. Includes "horse meeples" too!

name: Mickis Lyckosnurra
description: Each player has 5 pins at start. Spin the arrow. If the field is empty, the player puts his pins in that field. If the field already has pins, the player picks them up. Last player with pins remaining wins.

name: Connect the Dots: Build and Destroy!
description:
Use custom dice to build, attack, and defend dice structures!

In the first phase, players simultaneously build one of six possible structures by connecting the dots on their dice. Each structure has its own advantages. Points are awarded based on how many dice are used, and players can earn bonus points by being the fastest builder or by building certain structures.

In the second phase, each player attempts to damage his opponent's structure using a battle die, which determines how he may attack his target. The battle die may be flicked, tossed, or dropped in an attempt to move the dice in the structure. Points are awarded to both players based on the success of the attack.

The first player to earn 100 points wins the game.

Connect the Dots: Build and Destroy! is a combination of dexterity, strategy, and puzzle-solving.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Dice, Print & Play, Puzzle, Real-time

name: Sternenschweif: Lauras Zauberritt
description:
One of a series of Kosmos games based on the My Secret Unicorn books by Linda Chapman.

In Germany, the series goes by the name, "Sternenschweif" (Star Tail) and the books are also published by Kosmos.

Lauras Zauberritt is based on the book in the series, with the same name. The game has the tag-line, "the fast-paced card game" and that is just what it is. Players race to rid their hand of seven cards (real-time) by forming matches with cards on the table.

name: PanzerKämpfe: A Scenario Book for the Clash of Armor Rules System
description: PanzerKampfe consists of eight scenarios designed for the Clash of Armor miniatures rule system. Five of the scenarios feature division level or greater combat. Chronologically they span from 1941-44. Geographically they cover the Eastern Front (2), North Africa (1), and the Western Front (2). Also included are three "mini" scenarios that simulate regimental level combat on both the Eastern and Western Fronts, ideal for tournament play. Each scenario has a detailed full page map, order of battle, and all combat charts necessary to play.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Bilderstraße
description:
Bilderstrasse (Picture Street) matching game by Selecta is similar to a cross between a jigsaw game and dominoes.
The objective of the game is for children to find a picture that matches with a picture on a tile already played. As play continues, the row of pictures grows slowly. Encourage storytelling during play. The clown needs his umbrella, the tower needs a roof and the moon needs the sun.

Bilderstrasse is one of a series of similar but not identical play games by Selecta including Picture Snake, Picture Worm, Picture Bingo, Picture Chain,and Picture Dice. All these games feature beautifully-finished large wooden tiles or wooden cubes in the case of Picture Dice.

name: The Game of Tag: You're It!
description: Spin and move game based around the classic game of tag. As simple of a game as it gets.

name: Boy Scout Skills Game
description: For Scouts of all ranks, this card game is designed for learning and practicing Scouting skills. With 64 question cards, and 8 specialty cards, mostly taken from the Boy Scout® and Field handbooks. Answers are on the reverse side of each card. Even wrong answers have benefits and can become part of training at future meets.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory

name: Arnold Palmer Golf Game
description: 18 holes from a variety of golf courses are featured. Cards and spinners are used to determine shot results.

name: Bisley
description:
A solo card game using the standard 52 card deck.

Rules

Remove the aces from the deck and place them face up in a row on the table. Deal nine cards in a row to the right of them, and the rest of the deck in three rows of 13 cards below them. When the four kings become available, place them above their aces.

The aces are built on upwards and the kings downwards in suit sequence. It does not matter where the two sequences meet.

Only the bottom card of a column is available for play. It may be built either on its ace or king foundation, packed on the bottom card of another column, or itself be packed on.Packing may be upwards or downwards in suit sequence, and the player may change this at his convenience. A space left vacant in the layout by removal of a card is not filled.

name: 8-Sided Poker Dice Game
description:
This is a simple plastic tube containing five 8-sided dice. The 40 available faces contain all the possible cards from 5 through Ace in all four suits.

Players take turns. Roll once, set aside those you want to keep, and roll the rest a second time. Best poker hand wins.

name: Sverige frågespel: Junior
description: Junior edition of the Swedish quiz game "Sverige Frågespel" (english lit.: Sweden Question Game)

name: Tennis Dice Challenge
description:
From the box: "A game of chance and skill simulating lawn tennis".

In point of fact, chance definitely takes the upper hand over skill here: players try to position serves and returns but the outcome of every shot (and the players' positions on the court as well!) is determined by a set of 5 6-sided dice. The probability of winning a rally for either player stays pretty much the same regardless of his/her choices.

The game board, representing a tennis court with scoring tables, is quite neat though.

The box contains:

1 playing board of two interlocking halves
5 dice:
- service (yellow)
- in/out (white)
- stroke (white)
- singles position (light blue)
- doubles position (green)
4 purple scoring tokens
1 purple player token (large)
4 green scoring tokens
1 green player token (large)
1 yellow ball token
1 set of rules

Year of publication is unsure (not reported on rules booklet), but box features Boris Becker and Gabriela Sabatini in their prime, so late Eighties would be a reasonable guess.

name: Ken je Dorp
description:
"Ken je Dorp" is a trivia game about three villages from the Campes (a region in Belgium) namely Kasterlee, Lichtaart and Tielen based on the all time classic 'Game of goose'.

The theme of the game is a bike ride through these villages. The road is representend by a spiral of numbered mushrooms (gnomes are a symbol of the village Kasterlee). There are three different colours for the mushrooms with every colour demanding another action: green (roll the dice again and proceed the number of eyes), orange (check for the corresponding question or action in the booklet) and red (roll the dice again and go back the number of eyes). The first one to reach square 105 wins the game.

The trivia questions deal with the history, places of interest etc.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Safari
description:
New! Fun! Trap big-game animals! Track them from room to room, out-of-doors. A new trail each time!

Cool spin and move game.

name: Puzzling Pastimes: "Bothered Butcher"
description:
A simple anagram game from the 1920s, produced by G.Delgado Ltd of London as part of the Union Jack series of "Puzzling Pastimes".

The games consists of 8 identical cards (games), each of which is printed with 20 anagrams of common cuts of meat found in a butchers shop. The purpose of the game is for each player to have a card, and identify as many of the anagrams as they can within a set time.

Good production values - cards are heavy duty and well printed - but limited replay value, as once you have worked out the anagrams on the card there is no point in playing the game again as you know all of the answers.

Part of a series of similar games which include "Half hour in a Fairy World", "A Grocer's Mistake", "Careless Chemist", "Mr & Mrs Jollyfolks Supper Party", "The Sportyboy Game" and "The Humorous Haberdasher".

Advertised as "a clever and interesting game. For afternoon and evening parties". Simple pleasures for simple folk.

name: Kleiner Rabe kann das ABC
description:
Translation: Little Raven, the ABC's

A game in the "Little Raven" game series based on the children's book series by author Nele Moost and illustrator Annet Rudolph.

Little Raven knows his ABC's ...mostly. If he gets the first letter or two he knows all the words. Players roll the die, and then try to match the letters to the photos. This is an educational game to learn the alphabet.

Game contents:

1 die
22 character cards
22 photo cards
1 rules booklet

name: Sea Law
description:
Sea Law contains a ship combat system and naval campaign guidelines. With Sea Law am GM can set up and resolve naval battles involving a wide variety of ships from early oared galleys to great sailing ships. In fact, the combat system does not require a GM - it is a fully functional boardgame.

Features:
- A complete, detailed tactical ship combat system
- Guidlines for strategic naval activity and ship construction
- Material and suggestions for running a naval campaign
- Stats and descriptions for historical and fantasy ships and sea creatures
- Hex maps and ship counters and status markers
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing

name: Somewhere far beyond: Prairie Grove 1862
description:
Somewhere far beyond: Prairie Grove 1862 is a print & play only wargame, on this battle fought in Arkansas 7th December 1862, as a sideshow to the principal theaters of war during the American Civil War.
It is the second entry in a system premiered with the succesfull and Charles Roberts Award nominated Innocence Lost: the battle of Bull Run.
It is a brigade level wargame, with a lot enphasys given to chit activation (each leader has an activation chit to activate his units each turn) and chain of command to the transmission of the order.
Medium complexity, very good for solitaire play.
It comes with a 4A4 full color map, 144 counters, 1 order track and 6 pages of rules.
Available through wargamesdownloads, arima or directly from the author (pumaye@virgilio.it).
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Play Ball The Board Game
description:
Want to teach your Little Leaguers the basics of baseball? Want to help them learn what to do in most game situations? Want to do it all from the comfort of your home? The Play Ball is the game for you.

Officially Licensed by Little League International, Play Ball is a fun, interactive board game that teaches the fundamentals of baseball to little league age youth.

name: Pirateninsel
description: The game board shows an island. On this, nine cardboard tokens are placed (face-down). One of them shows a treasure, the others nothing. When a pirate reaches a square with a token, he looks at it without showing it to the others. The winner is the pirate who gets back to the ship first and knows where the treasure is hidden.

name: Shaun das Schaf: Köttel-Alarm
description:
The pasture stinks. There are sheep droppings all over the place. But suddenly there is movement in the herd. The farmer is coming. Suddenly all sheep try to fetch the only fork to clean up the pasture of their droppings first.

The players try to throw wooden cylinders of their own color into a center hole in the board before the other players do this.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Murder and Mayhem
description: You're a movie monster lurking in the streets of late 19th century London. You're killing like it's goin gout of style. But in the wake of the Ripper murders, it's not as easy as it sounds. There are gangs of hard-nosed ruffians, and bonnies with their silly hats and batons, and the insipid reporters, all trying their best to get in your way.

name: Pfützenkönig
description:
Pfützenkönig (King of the Puddles) uses a magnetic game board as the basis for a simple game that involves a race and puzzle aspect.The colorful board shows a track around the outside, with a large body of water in the center. Various graphics on the board are missing small square-size pieces.

Each player gets a set of the puzzle pieces and reveals one at a time. They then must get to the right spot on the path, using a simple roll-and-move mechansism, to fill out the board. When they have played all of their puzzle pieces, they can race to inner tube in the center of the lake to be declared "The Puddle King".

The game can be played by younger children by ignoring the puzzle aspect, and just racing to the center. It can also be played in a cooperative way, where it does not end until each player has successfully be named the Puddle King.

name: Tirol-Jan
description: Simplified Mahjong variant played with Tirol chocolates instead of tiles. (Yes, the pieces are real Tirol chocolates that you can eat after you play... but then you won't be able to play anymore) Players blindly draw chocolates from a large box shaped like a Tirol chocolate, trying to collect sets.

name: Rainbows and Showers
description:
"The 3D game of ups and downs"

"Pop the dice and move round the board, travelling up the rainbows and down the showers."

This children's game from the U.K. features a three dimensional plastic board with a "pop-o-matic" bubble in the center. Players move from the bottom to the top of the board using an aviation theme and can take advantage of the 3D rainbow sections to move quickly into the clouds.

Includes a plastic board, 4 marbles, 3D rainbow sections that atatch to the board, sticker sheet, and rules.

name: Milyarder
description:
This is a Turkish board game that appears rather similar to Ratrace. There are 3 concentric tracks on which players roll dice and move their tokens to take on different professions (e.g. grocer, mechanic) or run different services (e.g. car service, hotel) to earn money. There are also Toto spaces where presumably one can gamble for cash (the centre of the board holds a table showing payoffs for rolls of 2 to 12. Unlike Ratrace, the game does not feature status symbols. Milyarder translates as 'Billionnaire'.
The game is made by different game companies, implying it may be considered a public domain game.

name: Down the Hatch
description: Down the Hatch is a drinking game (like many other games from this publisher) in which players move around a board with aspects of both Sorry! and Monopoly. Pieces represent ships and as the players move around the board, they draw cards relating to getting drinks on shore leave. Squares on the board and cards instruct players how many drinks to take. The first player to return all of his ships to the port is the winner.

name: Lach dich gesund
description:
The full title on the box cover is "Lach dich gesund, ein Frage- und Antwortspiel" meaning "Laugh for health, a question and answer game". A card game probably of the 1950s.
The concept is very simple. The game contains 120 cards. Every one contains a question and an answer, but these do not fit together. Player sit around a table and read a question to their neighbour who answers with an answer from a different random card. The resulting combination was obviously supposed to be funny and make people laugh.
Example question: "Do you like driving a car?", answer: "You old donkey!" or "Passionately!"

name: Schummeltier
description: Each player has a little board with 3 x 3 squares which show three roosters, three cats and three dogs. There are individual square tiles face-down on the table.
