description: The game board shows a snail on which the players place number chips. The sum of the numbers cannot exceed 88 or a player has lost. Some chips show negative numbers or 0 points, and it is possible to exchange chips for others if that helps a player survive.

name: Ice Age 2: The Meltdown
description:
Help the sub zero heroes in saving their valley.
But watch out! The ice is melting!

In this game you have to get Manny, Sid and Diego across the melting ice to safety in the green valley.

The winner is the player to get all 3 characters to safety.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: 1871: Last Stand at Surbiton
description:
"1871: Last Stand at Surbiton" is a sequel to Draken Games' "1871: The Battle of Dorking". However it is playable as a stand-alone game in its own right. Featuring a 'Dorking Lite' rule set and with a typical game lasting just half an hour or so, the intention is to give a free taster of "Dorking" and the world of the fictional German invasion of England in 1871.

Contains:

Rules and background
6.5" x 7.5" map
20 double-sided counters
9 single-sided counters

name: Valu: The Game of Survival
description:
Valu, pronounced ‘Var-lu’ is a Fijian saying ‘to make war’. Valu - The Game of Survival is a abstract 2 to 4 player Game of Strategy based on Traditional Pacific island warrior culture.

The object of Valu is to take all of your opponent’s pieces or to create situation where your opponent/s pieces are unable to move and are forced to surrender.

The board is made up of 96 light green and dark squares (= four islands), 36 light and dark blue squares (= ocean) and 28 light yellow and orange squares (= beach). Opposing pieces (= Clan), red, green, blue and/or yellow are initially lined up on the sides.

The game has similarities to checkers. All pieces only move diagonally, and only one space at a time. Players take turns moving one of their pieces in an attempt to capture or develop their positions. Capturing occurs when a piece is able to jump over of an opposing piece into an empty space. Capturing is mandatory and jumping/capturing more than one piece on turn is possible. Time between moves is limited and has to be mutually agreed before start of play (1 - 5 minutes). Player must decide the move before touching any of the piece and complete the move immediately. If piece is touched but not moved, it is then sacrificed and removed from the board. Each player has four Chiefs and eight Warrior/Elder pieces. Each type of piece has a slight variation on its form of movement:

- Chiefs are the most powerful pieces. They can move both backward and forward and move to any area on the board that is in play. Chiefs are allowed to jump over their own pieces, but only if the square adjacent to it is vacant. When jumping over your own piece the piece remains in play, however if playing in teams the team member’s piece being jumped over is sacrificed and removed from board.

- Warriors can only capture and move in a forward direction. They cannot move onto another island apart from the island it started on or the island directly opposite. Warrior reaching the opposite island is immediately made an Elder (by being turned upside down).

- Elders can move forward or backwards and can move to all board areas that are in play. They cannot jump their own pieces or, if playing in a team, they cannot jump their team mate’s piece

Valu can be played as two, three of four with only a minor variation of the rules.

name: Subbuteo Snooker
description: This was one of the big sets of the mid seventies, where the box was also the pitch with the sides making a fence surround. Snooker Express contains "player figures, 15 red balls, 6 colour balls, 2 white balls, 1 triangle, 6 pockets, scoreboard and rule book". The box states that billiards, snooker, pyramids and pool could be played. So it is basically snooker except you use a flicked player instead of a cue. The player did not stay on the pitch between flicks, and you placed him behind the cue ball before flicking.

name: Kreuz und quer durch Deutschland
description: Players are randomly assigned 5 cities to visit. They move over a map of Germany, occasionally following special instructions on event cards. The first player to reach his/her starting city after visiting all 5 assigned cities is the winner.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Zombie Rummy
description:
In Zombie Rummy, players battle for their survival using sets of weapons against hordes of zombies.
They can use brains to bait zombies out of hiding and collect plot points to help in the fight.
categories: Card Game, Horror, Print & Play, Zombies

name: Battle of Nature: at forest's edge
description: Battle Of Nature is played like the classic card game "War". The field mouse card can capture the strawberry and mushroom cards and be captured, in turn, by the fox. Watch out for the female mosquito! She can bite and capture any mammal, even the bear! Discover the battles of nature that take place at the forest's edge as you play this fun and fast paced card game.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Environmental

name: Aktenzeichen XY
description:
Aktenzeichen XY is a game based on a famous German TV series. In which real crimes were tried to be solved by asking the viewers to help the police if they had witnessed anything.
In the game each player gets two crimes he/she has to solve by finding the three evidence cards related to that crime.

name: Bibi Blocksberg: Dreimal schwarzer Kater
description: Each player has two playing pieces and tries to move them toward the finish line. Certain fields on the way are "magic fields": If a player lands on one of them, he or she can decide to either move back four fields or pick up a "magic card" and follow the instructions on it (move forward/backward, skip etc.). The first player with both pieces to reach the finish is the winner.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Gen Zeit
description: The players are a team of experts who are invited for a hearing about the risks of genetic engineering. Each player has to support certain opinions determined by cards; after the discussions, votes are cast.

name: Das U-Boot-Spiel
description:
Game probably developed during WWII.

One player takes the command of the U-Boat with a purpose to destroy the tanker. Other player takes the command of the tanker and four destroyers bound to protect the tanker that must reach the other side of the board. The convoy can move only forward when the U-Boat can also move backwards.
The rules were left somewhat foggy, leaving players plenty of room to create the course of action by themselves.

Game Components
1 U-Boat
1 Tanker
4 Destroyers
1 Gameboard
Box containing the rules
categories: Abstract Strategy, Nautical, World War II

name: Mad and Genius Trivia!
description: A "party" board game designed in co-operation with a greek music channel (MAD) in which players test their music knowledge and more, by answering many questions from cards, sketching or with the help of the game's DVD.
categories: Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Party Game, Trivia

name: Focusing
description:
A memory-clone where you have to match cards together. The difference to normal memory game is that the cards doesn´t exactly match. Instead one of the cards display a famous place, building or city from a far distance and the other card shows the exact same thing but from a closer perspective. This makes the game a little bit harder than an ordinary memory game.

All pictures are from the National Geographic archives.
publishers: Dino Toys s. r. o., National Geographic Society

name: Cocoa-Nut Pitch
description: Cocoa-Nut Pitch is a miniaturized carnival-type game where players try to knock little wooden balls, or 'cocoa-nuts', off of various tees of different heights by flicking a small wooden bottle from a pedestal. The player who hits the most 'cocoa-nuts' in 12 twelve flicks wins.

name: About Time: USA Edition
description:
First launched in the UK, About Time USA edition has all the great features of the original board game plus all new American content. It features more than 1600 original questions on American history and culture and world events up to and including 2009. The game is for 2 to 8 players or teams, aged 12 or over, and lasts between 25 and 90 minutes.

About Time USA edition is available exclusively through Barnes & Noble in store and online.

name: Lattjo på tippen
description: Here you will meet with Lens lice, monster, robot and mischievous monkey from TV4's popular children's program Lattjolajban shown in the box every day. Lattjolajban-Figures are for the dump, where lots of fun things happening. Collect the six pieces to your Lattjolajban puzzles. To address this, you need to adopt a number of challenges, such as whistling a tune without laughing, balancing a card on your forehead, be the first to come up with an animal beginning with the letter spinning top shows and lots of other "fun" find - on-things. You win cards which you buy for puzzle pieces. The first player to have collected their puzzle wins.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Spiro
description:
The Spiro box contains two dice rolling games.

The 1st game is "Spurensucher" (pathfinder):
Each field on the gameboard with 7 concentric circles has two footprints that point to different directions. The field you land on shows which direction you have to go your next turn. The player who reaches the center field first wins the game.

The 2nd game is "Würfelroulette":
Each player has 21 pawns. On your turm you roll 3 dice and have to place 3 of your pawns on the 9x13 fields board. Each field has one side of a six sided dice on it. The 3 fields you place your pawns on have to be next to each other. The player who first placed all his pawns wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Lucky Number
description: This is a dice-based Roulette game. On top of the usual features of Roulette, there are two "pig dice" which can be rolled in addition to the other two dice. The player has to guess which combination of pigs (the dice contain male and female pigs and a 0) are rolled to enhance his/her winning chances.

name: Zonesh
description:
Zonesh is played on a 6×6 square board.
Each stone moves and captures to an empty adjacent (orthogonal or diagonal) space except that a stone in its home zone (the set of spaces where its army begins) cannot move/capture diagonally.
A player wins by moving a stone to the opposite corner.

name: The Wizard of Oz: The Game
description:
Battle Winged Monkeys, escape the Wicked Witch's Castle, help Tin Man find a heart, Scarecrow a brain, Cowardly Lion courage, and show Dorothy that there is truly no place like home! Build your very own Yellow Brick Road each time and begin your journey towards the Emerald City!

Includes:

* Land of Oz Game Board
* 4 Wizard of Oz 3D Character Pieces
* 10 winged monkey tokens
* 42 yellow brick road pieces
* 4 place markers
* 20 tokens
* 40 Toto cards
* Emerald Spinner
* Dice

name: Muziris
description:
Muziris is a Pure Card game from Small Box Games.

Muziris takes place in the ancient Indian port city of the same name. Muziris was an important trade hub for all of the ancient world, where goods from Africa, Rome, Asia, and India itself were traded.

Players control three market stands in ancient Murziris, selling goods from China, Rome, Egypt, and India. Each round, the different goods are worth a different amount of sapphires. Players must manage their hands, market stands, and actions to earn the most sapphires. Blessings from some of India's most sacred animals make this easier for you, and more difficult for your competition!

Note: The 2-4 player count on the box is a typo. The designer has confirmed player count is 3-4.

name: The Art of Literary Conversation
description:
Now there's a new way for readers to discuss their passions, with the release of The Art of Conversation: Literary Edition, a new game from the makers of The Art of Conversation.

Following the success of their original games, creators Louise Howland and Keith Lamb have adapted the concept to offer new angles and avenues to think, and talk, about books.

● TAOC® comes with 300 starter questions plus a 32-page guidebook that includes informative and comprehensive endnotes.

● Carefully developed and researched by the creators, with the assistance of well-respected literature teacher Leila Bryant, there’s plenty of scope to come up with your own questions. Like all TAOC editions, it’s not a quiz – it’s not about who knows the most. It’s a communication tool that draws on your own experiences, thoughts and reactions to facilitate fascinating discussions.

● Even reluctant readers will be drawn in! Readers of all stages and ages will find themselves being educated, all in the name of fun.

● Ideal for book clubs, but can also be adapted to friends, family, workmates, students or even solitary readers.

● Covers all genres – fiction, poetry, drama, biography, autobiography, science fiction, fantasy, crime, romance, historical writing - essentially, the whole bookshop!

name: GoHoops Basketball Dice Game
description:
Experience the thrill of full-court basketball action with GoHoops! It’s a 4 quarter one-on-one basketball game where you roll the dice to score buckets, racing up and down the court trying to outscore your opponent. You will have to avoid fouls, turnovers, and steals to get to the rim. Then you can hit jumpers, rain in 3-pointers, or slam home dunks. It’s basketball action for fans of all ages!

* Slam-Dunkin' Hardwood Action! It's fast, incredibly addicting, easy to learn, and difficult to master.
* Perfect for the tailgate, the bleachers, the coffee table - play it anywhere!
* Kids love it and so do adults! The whole family can play!
* Basketball action anywhere, anytime!
* Great for kids and a great learning tool. They don't even know they are doing simple math!

name: Milliarder: Tehnology
description:
Translation from the box:
New word in the world of board games!
Offered to your attention not just another clone of "Monopoly", but rather an original project. In "Technology" players will be making money not just for the sake of capital accumulation, but in order to make new scientific discoveries and unique invention. Take in your hands the most promising technologies of the world and lead mankind through PROGRESS! Be the first to invent something new and useful in each category and win.

Content:
1. Playing Field
2. 36 maps "instantly. Transformations"
3. Bundle of banknotes of various denominations
4. 48 tokens with the emblem of the scientific community.
5. 24 Card Lab
6. 24 Card Research Center
7. 24 cards Institute
8. 2 dice
9. 4 chips
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Earl Gillespie Baseball Game
description:
This very basic baseball card game is of interest only because it may be the first whose marketing was based on the fame of a broadcaster rather than a player – in this case long-time Milwaukee Braves announcer Earl Gillespie.

The cards in the 48-card deck are simply turned over one at a time by the batting player, and each produces only the result of a play. The cards are notable, however, for including both detailed play results (Line Drive to Left, Runners Hold) and the corresponding scoring notation (L-7). The rules include a sample score sheet filled out with a full game of proper notation.

name: The Great Dinosaur Adventure
description:
The Great Dinosaur Adventure is billed as "an educational game of creation and Bible knowledge".

Player's tokens are multicolored rubber dinosaurs and, by rolling a dice, they are moved around a board decorated with locales from the prediluvian world described in Genesis. While traveling, players can land on spaces marked either "Event" or "Take a Card". When landing on an "Event" space, players take a card containing flavor text that affects their placement on the board ("Stampeding dinosaurs chase you into Babylon. Move your player piece to the Babylon space"). When landing on the "Take a Card" space, players draw a dinosaur card and have to answer trivia questions to acquire it. The first player to collect 6 different cards is able to take the nearest path into the Ark. The fate of the remaining players is not specified but probably grim.
mechanics: Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement

name: Alpaca-opoly
description:
Alpaca-opoly is a custom-crafted game that allows players to immerse themselves in the wonderful world of alpacas. As players travel around the game board, they will have the opportunity to purchase alpacas, land, farm equipment, and other necessities they might need to start their own successful alpaca operation.

In addition to being fun to play, Alpaca-opoly also includes educational information about the alpaca lifestyle. Each certificate of ownership introduces interesting tidbits including information on the alpaca’s basic needs and care, the various types of alpaca shows, and their renewable crop, the fleece.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Mr. Pizza
description: A wobbly waiter holds a tray on which the players take turns to put a pizza (chip). The player who topples the tray loses, a player who can get rid of all chips is the winner.

name: Il Girafirenze
description: Il Girafirenze is a racing game through a track depicting Florence. As in The Game of Goose, players move in the track after rolling a dice: when they stop, they must give a correct answer to a question related to Florence (Architecture, Arts, People, History, Tradition and Sports.

name: Mandate of Heaven, a Game of Chinese History 120 BC - 1954 AD
description:
As summer came on the heel of spring, a new regime was bound to replace the old one, whenever the right time arrived. Before an old regime was replaced, there were unmistakable signs indicating its coming end, such as flood, drought, famine, and epidemics, the same as twilight signified the rising sun and falling leaves marked the coming of winter. When natural calamities repeatedly occurred, it was clear that the old regime had lost the Mandate of Heaven. Then the reigning monarch, facing the inevitable, should elect the wisest and most virtuous man to replace him, so as to make the change of dynasties a peaceful transformation. Failure to do so would provoke revolt which, in this case, was clearly justified. In the end the old regime would be overthrown and replaced by a new dynasty, which in turn had to pass through the same process.

Dun J. Li, the Ageless Chinese

Mandate of Heaven is a game for four players, which should take 4-8 hours to play. It depicts the political and military history of China from the Han Dynasty to the People’s Republic of China. Each player controls eight empires which earn victory points by holding the Mandate of Heaven, controlling the Forbidden City, occupying areas, building spheres of influence and destroying enemy armies. Each empire has counters representing its leaders, armies, artillery and spheres of influence. Empires add counters through invasions and the natural increase of population, move them on the map and resolve combat using dice. At the end of the game the player with the most victory points wins.

name: Disc-Grams
description:
"Spill the letter discs into the tray - Race to spell as many words as you can!"

A word game similar to Boggle. A 4x4 grid of letters is created using 50 circular discs with letters printed on them which are sealed in a shaker. The aim is to form as many words as possible within the time limit, longer words scoring more points. A blank disc can be used as any letter.

No designer or publisher is credited. The box lists the game as being "imported by W.H.Smith."

name: Kelly Pool
description:
From the publisher...

As many as care to may play. First play is determined by each player shooting one blue ball at the target holes, and the one scoring highest plays first, etc. In case of a tie, those tied will shoot again. Each player in turn places each of the nine balls, one at a time, at the point of the yellow triangle shown on the shooting surface and propels it towards the target holes with the point of the cue, as in regular pool. All balls must remain wherever they come to rest until a player has shot the nine balls, after which the score is counted, the balls removed, and the next player starts. The object of the game is to shoot the various colored balls into the target holes that will score the most points.

Scoring values:
Blue ball in blue hole = 20
Red ball in red hole = 15
Yellow ball in yellow hole = 10
Any ball in hole of different color = 5
Any ball in black hole = -5
The first player to score 200 points is the winner.

name: Plot!
description:
A game of plots and schemes, as simple as checkers, as strategic as chess.

Advance, retreat, feint, engage and capture in an effort to be the sole survivor.

Plot area on the board is a safety zone and a vantage point, adds an extra element of suspense and strategy.

Object of the game is to capture all enemy pieces, and still have one or more of your own pieces on the board.

Pieces move based on the roll of the dice. As long as a player has one or more pieces remaining in the Starting Area, each piece is limited to either a horizontal or vertical move in one direction. Once all pieces are out of the Starting Area, a player is also allowed diagonal moves, and can now capture opponents playing pieces. Jumping is not allowed and only 1 pieces may occupy any space.

Pieces are captured by landing on its square at the end of an opponents move. Two pieces may be captured, if a move is split between two pieces. Once down to one piece, you may capture two opponents pieces, by exact count of each of the two dice, either in a straight line, or by changing directions with the second die.

This game includes two special 6 sided dice. Sides have printed numbers 1-5 and a side with a "P." If one "P" is rolled, you may move one of your own (or an opponents) piece the number rolled. You can even move the opponent back to his Starting Area. If you roll two "P's", you can move one of your pieces directly to the Plot Area, even if coming from the Starting Area.

The Plot Area is a safety zone in the center of the grid. Each player has a square of his color. Besides rolling two "P's", you may enter this area through your assigned color, and can only come to rest on your own assigned color. A player rolling one "P" may move your piece out of the Plot Area.

name: Standoff
description:
The greatest new game of wit, psychology, and bluffing since the invention of poker. Four unique playing boards. Players compete for points, while each player knows what card his opponents holds! Full of surprises, strategy, coincidences and laughs as players try to out-wit each other. Anyone can win points... but it's how you play your cards that counts.

Object of the game is to outwit opponents to win highest "point cards", thereby accumulating the highest score.

Standoff is unlike most games in that players do not take turns. To begin, any player turns over the top card from the stack of "point cards." Each player then competes for that card by selecting one of the cards in his hand, placing it face down in front of him. After each player has done this, they turn over all the cards played. The player with the highest number is awarded as many points as is indicated on the face of that point card. Point card is then placed in a discard pile and the next point card is revealed.

Play continues with each game ending after all 11 cards held by players have been played. Two of the 13 point cards will not be revealed in each game.
publishers: Berwick's Toy Co. Ltd., ED-U-Cards Mfg

name: The Poker-Reno Game
description:
A poker dice game...

This game is a variation of Yahtzee, using poker dice. Instead of 1-6 at the top of the score sheet, this game has Aces, Jacks, Queens, Kings, Nines and Tens. Scores are recorded the same way as in Yahtzee, following the 1st, 2nd or 3rd roll, in the order shown above, scoring is 1 each, 2, 3, 4, 9 & 10. A bonus of 44 is scored if the total in the section above is at least 87 (an average of 3 dice each category.)

In the bottom scoring section, Poker-Reno is similar to Yahtzee, but scores 60 points. Fortune works the same way as Chance. 2 Pair of Same Color, and 3 of a Kind score the total of all dice, Full House scores the total of all dice + 45, and Straight (5 consecutive) scores 50.

The instructions state that any amount of players may play the game, but the score sheet is designed for no more than 6.

name: Power Rangers Collectible Card Game
description:
It's time to relive all of your favorite battles from the ever popular kid's show Power Rangers!!!

Each player shuffles their Deck and cuts their opponent's Deck.

Turn Flow

STEP 1: Each player draws a card from the top of their Deck to their hand.

STEP 2: Each player can then choose to select a card from their hand, if available.

STEP 3: In order to play a card in battle, a player must fulfill the Hand Cost requirement located on that card (see Symbol ). To do this, a player removes a specified number of cards from their hand to their “Discard Pile” that is equal to the amount indicated by Symbol . If the Hand Cost requirement can’t be met, that card can’t be played.

STEP 4: Each player then puts down the card they have chosen for battle on the count of three. “1..2..3!”. (For strategic purposes, players have the option of bluffing their opponent by not putting down a card at the count of three.)

STEP 5: If a player plays a card and their opponent does not, the player inflicts “Damage” to their opponent (see Step 6C). If neither player plays a card, nothing happens and both players return to Step 1.

STEP 6: When both players have played a card, the battle begins!

A.Each player must refer to Symbol on their card which indicates the Battle Element that each player’s opponent will be using for this battle. If a player’s card has multiple Battle Elements listed here, the player has the option to choose any one of them.

B.Each player now looks at the value indicated on their chosen Battle Element (See Symbol ). The player with the higher value wins the battle! (If the values are equal, it is considered a “draw” and both players return to Step 1). The winning player now gets to inflict “Damage” to their opponent.

C.When receiving Damage, the losing player must draw a number of cards from the top of their deck equal to the amount indicated on the winning player’s card (See Symbol ). Move all used cards to their Discard Pile.
Winning the Game

Repeat Steps 1 through 6 until a player is required to draw a card and cannot due to a lack of cards in their Deck.

That player loses the game. If both players must draw a card and cannot due to a lack of cards in their Decks, the game result is a “Draw”.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Collectible Components, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Shock Hockey
description:
The two players are the coaches of the two ice-hockey teams. The players are cards on the rink and each player has his special strengths. Each coach makes one action a turn by playing an action card from his hand trying to score a goal or get the puck from the opponent.

More cards can be bought as booster packs, so this is basically a CCG, but the starter set has enough cards for two players to play the game.

name: City Lines
description:
There’s a new mayor in town! And he’s here to change things!
On the order of the day: Privatise transports.
He put together a team to redesign the city’s main lanes, and he now needs enterprising volunteers to achieve it.
And they only got 4 years to do it!

Each player will represent the CEO of a Private Mass Transport company, trying to achieve high value for their shares in the stock market, and a healthy bank account. The City needs a new transport grid, either with Bus or Metro Lines.
The players will achieve that by building segments of Transport Lines connecting the objectives as dictated by public surveys. Also, the City Hall will come up with special projects, which will be bided by the players.
The game turns are split into Quarters (3 months), in which everyone does their actions. After all players had a turn, the Quarter advances, players receive profit (or not!), and the first player of the Quarter changes (so that everyone can have a quarter in which they are the first to build).
After all Quarters are done, the Year advances and players tally up their accomplishments that year, which will directly impact their Stock Market EOY results.
By the end of the fourth year, the city should be fully networked, and we’ll have a happy Mayor, ready to win the next elections. The player that had the most impact (somehow measured by the value of the shares), will be given the key to the city!

That easy?
Not really. Not everything goes as planned, strange events occur, people lie, politicians cheat….
At the beginning of every quarter something will happen that can change a smile into a frown. Or the other way around…
And there’s also the Influence that such powerful transport tycoons (the players) will have on politics!

Who knows, sometime in four years, you might be the one smiling in front of the cameras holding a golden key to the city!
Or you could be the one already planning for revenge…

Either way, fun is coming your way!
categories: City Building, Economic, Negotiation, Print & Play, Transportation
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Tile Placement, Voting

name: Classical Conquests
description:
A game of ancient civilizations in conflict over the European continent and surrounding territories. "For 2-4+ players."

The players choose to play as one of 12 ancient civilizations of the region. Each civilization starts with two traits, such as arts, metallurgy, ship building, religion, etc. Traits provide certain resources or benefits. Traits can be developed and improved during the Research Phase.

Each territory on the map is marked with a type of resource. The distribution of the resources is randomly determined each game. Resources are used for various purposes, including supporting your civilization, building cities, and supporting research attempts.

This is a free, online rules set which describes the components that you will need to create in order to play. Components include an area movement map of Europe, a set of six tokens for each player (Armies, Fleets, Villages, Cities, Monuments, and Resources), a resource chart for each player, a common resource pool card, and six-, eight-, and twelve-sided dice. An area movement map is available for download from the Warp Spawn site.
categories: Ancient, Civilization, Fighting, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Warped Diplomacy Classic
description:
A web-published board game of European conflict between the Great Powers. Inspired by the game Diplomacy.

From the publisher's website:

"Heavily modified variant of the board game Diplomacy. Card play replaces written orders. Players should be familiar with basic concepts of the standard game such as Supply Centers, Provinces, Units, and Great Powers. Special movement rules (Kiel & Constantinople, etc.) still apply. Rules for Retreats, Building, Occupation, Civil Disorder, and Convoys still work in the spirit of the original game."

"The standard game takes place in the relatively peaceful (historically) period between the Franco Prussian War (also Russo-Turkish) and WWI. However, it will be noticed that the card flavor of the Battle Decks in this variant has a distinctly WWI flavor."
categories: Bluffing, Negotiation, Political, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Area Movement, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Patzam
description:
Patzam is a sort of moving 3D Tic Tac Toe where you remove the middle piece each time you make a row. The goal of the game is to get rid of your pieces and be the first to have only 2 left.

Rules:
Alternately, both players place one piece on one of the 18 spots of the 3D-board. When all the pieces have been played, middle pieces of any rows of the same color are removed.
Then, players successively slide one piece in order to make a row (and remove the middle piece) or block the opponent.
The first player who has only 2 of his own pieces left on the board is the winner.

name: Speculation: The Dynamic Real Estate Auction Game
description:
Speculation is an auction and strategy game for 2-6 players, built around property acquisition in a metropolitan area. The object of the game is to amass the greatest wealth through property ownership. Players first compete in an auction to purchase options on the various properties. An option gives a player the right to purchase a property, if they can mameuver the token around the board to their property. Since all players maneuver the same token, each player can try to prevent the other players from exercising their options. A player receives from the bank when he moves the token over one of their own properties, and receives from the other players when they move the token over one of his properties. At the end of the game, the player with the greatest amount of money plus property value is declared the winner.

The game ends when the last option is exercised. Any player may exercise the last option, regardless of who holds the option.

name: Uups! Sag's nicht!
description: Taboo variant with cards of different difficulty level (marked in different colors) which yield 1-4 points. Also, each team gets an individual difficulty level, determined by the number of taboo words. The cards are put into a box in which a number of openings can be cleared to display the taboo words (1-4). Thus, the game can be played by adults and kids together (giving the kids less taboo words to worry about). Game ends when a team has reached a premeditated number of points.

name: American Gladiators: The Wall
description:
American Gladiators - The Wall is a dexterity game based on the American Gladiators television series. It was produced by Taco Bell and given away in its kids meals.
Players take turns flicking gladiator discs at a wall trying to knock off contestants.

name: Alley Up
description: This is a simple bowling game from the William Bruce Company. It features wooden dice that either have a blank face or a pin on them. You roll the dice and see what you have for pins remaining and then shoot for your spare. This game has similarities to other bowling type games from different companies and different publishing years. Games like Spare Time Bowling, Bowling Dice, Bowl and Score, or Bowl - A - Strike are similar types games and their may be others already in the DB.

name: 5cross
description:
5cross is an exciting game of strategy and tactics for 2 players.
Object of the game is to get 5 of your colour chips in a row.
Each game a player wins they get 300 points auto matically. If any of your chips land on a points square in the winning row, the winning player may add the value of the squares to their total points. If the losing player has chips on a points square they must deduct their highest occupied point square from their total.If the losing player is on more than 1 point square of the same value they must add the amount to their deducting score.

name: A Frog's Banquet
description:
A Frog's Banquet is a fast, fun, frog filled game of eating dragonflies and dodging dangers. Choose a play board to jump around, choose a frog and jump to it!

2-4 frogs may compete, or go it alone with the single player variant.

Each player chooses a frog: Flecks, Springs, Grublic or Bubbly. The frogs each have a default 'jump' that they can use during their turn.

Each player has a hand of five cards from the event deck and may play any of them face down, adding to a line at the edge of the board. The majority of these cards are Dragonfly cards that dictate where the dragonflies will appear and where they will move to. Dragonflies are worth points depending on which turn they are caught by the frogs (first turn they appear, second turn they move, third turn they move and then fourth turn they are gone)

There can only ever be one dragonfly of each colour on the board at any one time, so players need to plot carefully to get their frogs in the right place at the right time.

In the deck is also a series of Dangers - Turtle, Heron, Snake, Toad and the dreaded Bunyip! These dangers are added to the board when played and will act according to their own rules (they are played by the game). Avoid them at all costs!

The game can be played to a certain number of points, depending on the length of game you are after.

Play boards depict different environments that the frogs may inhabit, for example wetlands and rainforests. Theses are presented both horizontally and vertically. They contain their own special rules - for example, don't get caught in the waterfall!

It's easy to pick up and play with people of all ages, but with careful tactics and clever use of your jumping resources, the better player gets the most dragonflies.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Dice, Environmental, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Ampparin eskari: Numerot ja laskeminen
description: A fun and simple game for children who want to learn how to add. Solving tasks, and set the tiles shuffled on the table. If we solve all the tasks correctly, you will find the fun side of the board background image! The game includes 8 playing boards and 72 different levels to do - learn the numbers 1-12 in the simplest and more difficult to solve simple addition and subtraction. The winner is the one gets right all the pictures!

name: Almirante
description: Game of naval strategy and random for 2 to 6 players. The game consists in destroying 5 ships of rivals's fleets or leading someone of the own ones to the opposite side.

name: The Jungle Grapevine: The Race to the Watering Hole
description: In the Race to the Watering Hole board game, players choose Turtle, Lion, Croc, Elephant, Bird or Hippo and race across The Savanna by drawing cards and avoiding unexpected "wild" surprises. First player to the Watering Hole wins!

name: Grips Champion
description:
Train your memory, so that you can store data, lists, numbers and names easily and permanently. You will be astonished, how fast you are able to achieve true master achievements and this easy, but effectively. Profit from a good memory at your job, at school as well as in the everyday life. The game contains different variants with different levels of difficulty. (Text from the box)

Components: 1 two sided board, 100 Memory-Cards, 4 Pawns, 4 Tokens, 1 six sided Die, Rules

name: Jungle Zombie (fan expansion for Tikal)
description:
Explorers at the Central American jungles in search of lost temples and treasures are not aware that ancient black magic awaits them. Opening an old ceramic vessel unleashes a powerful spell that transforms them in Zombies!
Jungle Zombie is a free print and play expansion for the board game Tikal.
This expansion replaces the round treasure pieces adding the new Zombie pieces. When a player gets the Zombie he is transformed into one. As a Zombie he can move just as any member of the team, but now he has the power to kill the rivals of the other expeditions. The Zombie can also be killed, of course, but this is not easy.
This expansion is easy to print (just one page) and use all the basic rules of Tikal. It transforms the peaceful exploration in a bloody B movie.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fan Expansion, Fighting, Horror, Print & Play, Zombies
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Vorsicht, kleiner Pirat
description: As the title suggests Vorsicht, kleiner Pirat deals with water, boats and pirates. The publisher calls the game "A dice-throwing game with a surprise." The goal of the game is to bring three of your pirates first onto the island. The board is a rondel of sorts, that is moved according to the die throw. The moving rondel can also push the boats into shallow water or even swallow he pirates into the depth of the sea. The players decide whether they stay in their pirate boat or prefer to move into another boat of their own color.

name: Kosmolino: Kennst Du die Uhr?
description: A game that offers several games in one but each tied together by the theme of setting the time in a clock and learning together to help children to learn about time. The gameplay evolves around the play of cards with different situations that occur during the day The figure of identification cards with Leon pretend situations. Each card has a color frame that situates the event to a certain time of the day, the players should then try to set the clock to match the correct time of the day. Th game can also be played as a memo game.

name: Table Top Bowling
description:
From the box cover: Real Bowling played at home. Authentic Plastic skill game, hardwood bowling pins, balls return automatically.

Game is played with hardwood pins using marbles as bowling balls. The pin deck is sloped so that the marbles return to you after having been rolled.

name: Pik-Paks
description: Family board game produced in Belgium. It's themed around super markets; a phenomena that was rising in Belgium in the era that this game was produced (the first Belgian super market opened in Ixelles in 1957). Players travel around the board buying goods whilst they visit small super market shops.

name: Portals
description: An abstract strategy game for two, the "Portals" board includes four "portal" spaces which allow pieces to transport between them in addition to their regular movement. Also included is a "portable portal" which can be moved (by a roll of a d4) which sometimes is to great advantage (sometimes not). Your objective: to annihilate your opponents "Guards" or capture the "Prince"... before they do the same to you.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Le Champion
description: French cycling game where players have to push a ball (Carabande style) and the position of the ball then determines the next position of the rider. The game comes with six prepainted riders and a ball for each rider in the appropriate color. This game was the inspiration for the game Bisikle that was released in 2009.

name: Roule Cocotte
description: Roule Cocotte is a game about chickens that lay eggs. First the players set up the board by putting eggs in the spaces on the board. They can put up to six eggs in one space but there are not that much eggs so some spaces will only have one or two eggs and some up to six. Then they put the wooden chicken on top of all the eggs. Now the players run a die each turn. After each die roll they can lift a chicken and take the eggs below the chicken; but they may only take it if the roll equals the amount of eggs below that chicken.

name: Word Pirates! Quick Play Edition
description:
Quick Play Edition. Half the time. All the fun.

Can you get to the treasure first? Roll the dice and spell a word to advance through the shark-infested waters. Roll a 4-letter word to earn the eyepatch. The first player to reach the treasure while wearing the eyepatch wins! Roll and spell your way to victory, matey! Arrgh!

name: The Eagle's Last Flight: Eagles & Empire I
description:
Operational and grand-tactical rules for the 100 Days Campaign in 1815, covering the famous and decisive encounters between Napoleon, Bluecher and Wellington at a high abstract level. The rules indicate use of 10mm figures but other scales are usable.

The rules emphasise command and the various ineteractions between the arms of the warring factions including light and heavy cavalry, infantry and artillery.
publishers: Real Time Wargames, Realistic Modelling Services

name: Sveriges kungahus frågespel
description: Crown Princess Victoria and Princess Madeleine married! The game with the 1250 issues of Sweden's Royal Family is overdue! Here you answer questions on everything from Jean Baptiste Bernadotte to Silvia Nobel Blisters. The questions are divided into five categories: Bernadotte's predecessor, 1800s, 1900s, New & mixed and Castles & mansions. Win a crown for the right answer in each category, go to the center and answering the final question. The game is published in a limited and numbered edition exclusive to wooden pieces in velvet bag and velvet posts and gold foil on the cover.

name: Lättlurad?
description:
From publisher:
Tell them the truth - except the gullible! Take a card that says how you are, whoever you are, what you do or where. Fool your friends into believing that you are telling the truth when you do not. Or, make them believe that you are telling the truth but actually prefer a waltz. Chance cards add an extra voltage moments and try your creativity. Buckling liars and speed up the proceedings - the first player to have won the case!

name: LogIQ: Ξ Xi
description:
From the publisher:
Challenge yourself and your friend with this fast-paced IQ duel game. Each product includes tasks divided into different task types, covering everything from number sequences to 3D problems and analogies. Put that grey matter to work and win the tasks by being the fastest one to solve the tricky problems!
Game 4 in a series of 4!

name: What Everyone Should Know About TRENDS & LIFESTYLES
description:
From the publisher:
This game covers the whole scale from haute couture to everyday trends. Do you know which international fashion house uses the initials LV, or which animal appears on the Lamborghini logo? If you don’t, find out with What everyone should know about trends and lifestyles!
On each turn players take one card and try to answer to the question on there! When getting the answer right you get 10 of the money the game uses! Then you have another change to go! Get it right again, you get 20, then 50, then 100 and then you have to give away your turn!
You win the game when collecting amount of money agreed with other players at the beginning of the game! For example you win, when you get 250 that money!

name: Toystore Chess
description: Toystore Chess begins with an empty 5x5 board and a King, Queen, Rook, Bishop, and Knight in reserve for each player. Opponents alternate placing one piece at a time on any open square until all pieces are on the board. Play proceeds as Chess.

name: Oh Magoo, You've Done it Again
description:
A roll and move game with colorful 3D board elements. Instructions are printed on the board.

Contents include: 5 Player Pieces, 17 Playing Cards, 8 Card Buildings and Die.

name: Battle with the Swedes for Charles Bridge
description:
From the rules: "In the course of the cruel Thirty Years' War, the people inhabiting the Czech Lands were subjected to many invasions by Swedish mercenaries who looted burghers' houses, aristocratic palaces, churches, libraries and monasteries. Regardless of whether they were led by Generals Baner, Torstenson or Wrangel, the Swedes always wanted to take away as much as they could . . . On the night of July 25, 1648, the Swedish cavalry tried to conquer the Stone Bridge (today's Charles Bridge) and penetrate the Old Town through the gate in the Old Town bridge tower . . .The people of Prague, and particularly students led by Father Jiri Plachy, quickly took up arms and rushed to help the tiny unit of the tower guards. A fierce hand-to-hand fight ensued, with the fighters on both sides hiding behind the the statues on the bridge. The battle took the toll of many dead and wounded on both sides. The present game is based on this particular battle with all its snares and personal fights."

The rules are in Czech, English, German and French. The board is a simple checkerboard-type surface on medium-weight cardboard. The only other components are 28 small wooden blocks, 14 dyed red, 14 in their natural light brown coloring. There is a coin on the front of the box that is tossed at the start of the game to determine how many moves the Swedish player gets.

Each player places their 14 men on the first two rows of squares on each side of the board. The men can move one square in 12 possible directions. You eliminate your opponent's men by landing on their square and can take another turn provided you can eliminate another man with that move. All men can jump over each other. The player who has more of his men on the starting line of his rival when no one can make any more moves wins.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Lexico Suomi-Saksa
description: Lexico is a game and a dictionary combined in a unique and fun way. Beside its excellent game value, it also has a huge educational value and is of interest to anyone who wants to learn languages. Lexico features altogether 9000 commonly used words from five different categories: Human, Living environment, Nature and hobbies, Science and technology and Common words. The words are divided into 3 difficulty levels and the idea is that every player plays the difficulty level best suited for his/her language skills.

name: Supremacy at Sea
description:
Originally entitled Actions Stations! (which was changed for copyright reasons), Supremacy at Sea - World War II Naval Combat is a the product of years of effort from a group of individuals known collectively as the University of British Columbia Sunday Night Crew.

Supremacy at Sea can be used for either quick scratch battles, or as part of larger campaigns. The rules are best suited to be used with 1/2400 scale models, but can be used with anything from 1/1200 to 1/4800 scale.

Game contains rules for every aspect of naval combat including: ramming, laying smoke, searchlights, night-fighting, weather, radar, and more.

One interesting feature of the game is that players on the same side must talk strategy loudly enough for everyone at the table to hear. (This simulates the ability of both sides to intercept communications). However, orders are written down secretly and executed simultaneously.

Re-implemented by:

SAS: Spee
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Tryangles
description:
Tryangles is a space-themed game having a board with a triangular grid containing a few black holes, planets, stars etc, with a Base area for each player. Each player has a set of triangle-based polyominoes containing 2, 3 or 4 spaces. A die is thrown to indicate whether a player may place a piece with 2, 3 or 4 spaces. Players place pieces over the special areas of the board with the constraints that:


the player must first play in their base and all further plays must attach by at least two sides to pieces already on the board
black holes may not be played on
planets and stars must be fully occupied with one placement. Planets score 10 points and the sun scores 30 points.


The player to score the most points wins, though the rules do not specify a game end condition.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement

name: A Drop Too Many
description:
Subtitled "WW2 Coup De Main dialogue game".

Excerpts from the rules:

"This is a form of interactive storytelling around a theme. Sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn't - it depends on whether the players have a consensus of the nature of the story being told - the results vary from the realistic, to the amusing to the downright surreal. Its entirely up to the players."

"You are members of a platoon being landed by glider onto a key target in a secret location. The target is a bridge over a fast-flowing river. Capturing this bridge intact will facilitate the rapid advance of our armies and the inevitable swift conclusion of the war before christmas (as usual)."

"All you need is a large map or terrain model, including a wide river, a bridge, and some trenches, building and bunkers. Counter or figures representing the troops involved, plus loads of spare enemy troops and vehicles to be brought in as the story develops."

name: Britons
description:
Britons: One Brain Cell Wargame Rules for Tribal Skirmishes in 1st Century Britain.

From the rules:

"These are rules for playing a wargame with toy soldiers. It is intended for several players - say 4 or more, but can be played with fewer."

"Players control heroes (and, of course, heroines), who in turn have contingents of fighters under them."

"The setting is the constant inter and intra-tribal conflict that characterised Celtic society in ancient times."

"These rules concentrate on the actions in a raid. Raids could involve anything from a few dozen to several hundred, and could involve considerable fighting."

name: Monsters
description:
Monsters: The Big City Monster Crisis Game.

An umpired convention-style miniatures game for a large group of players. The game is played on a map of Amsterdam overlaid with a hex grid. Each hex is roughly 300m across, each turn is 30 minutes, and each "crowd" unit represents many hundreds of people. The rules cover fires, police and military units, helicopters, air strikes, and naval forces.

From the rulebook:

"The game is set in the present day, and is intended to expand the basic idea of 'a monster destroying the city' a little further than just pouring lots of firepower into the monster until it, inevitably, falls over."

"There is a significant political dimension to this game (as there would be in any real-world crisis), and for this reason all the players represent the authorities. The monsters themselves (once you understand their motivations) have few real decisions to make, so they will be run by Game
Control."

"There will be no winners or losers in this game the conventional sense."

"You will all know at the end how well you did, and whether your political or operational objectives were met (or not). In the end you all want the same thing. To save Amsterdam. Can you do it?"

name: War in Hell
description:
War In Hell: The toy soldier game of Apocalyptic Conflict.

From the rulebook:

"This game is intended to be a Complete Fantasy Game, with unbelievable beings struggling for unattainable goals. The rules and structure aims only to be internally consistent, and players have to determine tactics and actions based solely on the briefings and rules presented to them - they have no ‘historical reality’ (whatever that is) to appeal to."

"The game draws heavily on Judeo-Christian source material - particularly medieval notions of hell and demonology - for its inspiration, but it is not intended to be a realistic depiction of the similar elements of that belief system, and any offence caused to Christians is entirely unintended and accidental."

"The key thing to remember in playing this game is that it takes place in an alien environment that is truly incomprehensible to mortal humans. What you see and experience is only your feeble mind attempting to make sense of the unknowable. If it seems like some sort of weird hallucinogenic dream then perhaps that is the nature of the world we are simulating."

"The game is played on a table-top using toy soldiers. Absolutely any toy soldiers can be used, from any period and any scale from ancient Egyptians to starship marines. The terrain is a representation of the landscape of hell. Hell is what you make it, so there are no guidelines - anything that fits your conception will do. Sometimes we play using multiple tables, each representing a Circle of Hell - but much depends on how much space you plan to take up and how many players are taking part."

name: STONK
description:
STONK: Brigade-Level Combat - Europe 1944.

This set of detailed miniatures rules is suitable for use with any miniatures that can accommodate a terrain scale of 1cm=40m. Each turn equals about ten minutes of real time. Units represent infantry platoons, armor troops, and artillery batteries.

From the rulebook:

"This is a set of wargame rules intended to simulate actions between about one brigade equivalent a side, supported by divisional or even corps troops where they would have been available."

"In STONK the focus is on the operations of companies - with platoons and heavy weapons as the smallest units separately represented."

"This is shown on the table top by models on a base of the appropriate size - the exact number or models per base can be varied to meet your own taste and financial resources - the game is perfectly playable without models at all, substituting counters for the models."

name: Hidden City Philadelphia
description:
Hidden City, the card game, brings the rich stories of Philadelphia's neighborhoods to life.

In this game of urban development, the winner is the first to create a community chock full of art, food, and history - the cultural life of every city. Along the way, you will discover landmarks, meet local citizens, and see Philly in a whole new way.

The object is to manage your resources in order to build up your favorite neighborhoods. Along the way meet local citizens, visit landmarks, and see Philadelphia as you never have before! Every player needs their own deck to play, and one deck per person.

name: Wu Xing
description:
Wu Xing is the doctrine of the 5 elements named fire, water, earth, metal and wood.

Each player need to get as many element chips as possible.

You get elements chips of your played card, comparing each time the cards next to eachother whether they destroy or create elements.

There are playing cards in range from 1-9 (2x) for each element.

Sets of all elements (all 5) will earn you 5 points, metal/wood/earth 2 points, fire/water/earth 2 points, fire/water 1 point and metal/wood 1 point.

You play in turns by placing a card from your hand on your own board or on a board of a fellow player on the first free card space. Each player get a board with room for 4 cards.

A round exist out of playing all cards (4 for each player). Three rounds need to decide who gain the most points for the collected element chips.

Element creation
Fire creates Earth
Earth bears Metal
Metal carries Water
Water nourishes Wood
Wood feeds Fire

Element Destruction
Fire melts Metal
Metal chops Wood
Wood parts Earth
Earth absorbs Water
Water quenches Fire
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Open Drafting, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: Battle of Britain: The Hardest Day
description:
The British aviation magazine, to celebrate the 50 years from the Battle of Britain, decided to offer to its readers a wargame.
In the introduction of the rules it is so descibed:
"BATTLE OF BRITAIN: THE HARDEST DAY recreates the events of 18 August 1940, the day during the Battle when the greatest number of aircraft were destroyed and damaged on either side.
Contestants are the senior Fighter Controller at 11 Group of Fighter Command, on the British side and the senior operational officer at Luftflotte 2 of the Lutwaffe, on the German side. For authenticity, in the game each of side uses the exact forces available to it on 18 August, bombers and fighters move across the map at the same rate as did the real aircraft during the Battle and each contestant has operational orders and directives similar to those of his real counterpart during this phase of the Battle of Britain. The players control pieces representing each British fighter squadron, and forces from each German bomber and fighter Geschwader, in their struggle for air superiority over the vitally important south eastern corner of England. The rules of the game have been carefully worked out to present a series of actions remarkably close to those actually fought during the Battle of Britain. With tactical skill and element of good fortune, either side can win. Devised by Dr. Alfred Price and Mike Spick."
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II

name: Let's Learn the Professions
description: The children are shown a card which has a profession on it. The child who can find the correct tool of that proffesion on his picture board wins the card. When the children learn to tell the professions the game can be played so that you only show the children a card and they tell you what tool it uses.

name: Spouse-ology
description:
Because you're my favorite subject!

Spouse-ology challenges husbands to think like their wives and vice versa. While competing against other couples, your spouse will guess how you would answer questions from five different categories. You'll love scoring extra credit points while you and your spouse do wacky stunts together. If you mismatch answers on certain questions, you and your spouse will have to do a fun penalty. Watch out you could be in a 30-second lip lock! Spouse-ology is an excellent ice-breaker or celebration for a couple's small group!

For 2-6 married couples.

(from the publisher's website)

name: Memo-Construction Site
description:
From Haba Website:
The fabric cards are great to hold and won't wrinkle! A picture and memory game for the smallest with 24 pieces made of cotton/polyester, washable.

Size of card approx. 8,5 x 8,5 cm, height 5 mm.

A game with powerful machines for 1 - 4 players ages 2+.

name: The Stock Car Racing Game
description:
Card driven racing simulation with 8 legends of stock car racing on the front cover.

Contents:

9 Plastic Cars
Deck of "Laps" Cards
Deck of "Trouble" Cards

name: Light Sword
description:
A science fiction themed dueling game, loosely related to Rapier & Dagger by the same designer. Published in White Dwarf issue #10.

Players create characters and have them fight. Could have been used as the basis of a simple combat system for an RPG, but never was. If players wanted to allow characters to gain experience, it was recommended that the system in Rapier & Dagger be used.

name: The Game of Marriage
description:
An after dinner game for the pleasure of 4 players, based on the world of Jane Austen.
Players spin a teetotum (top) and move their tokens around a circular track, trying to land on 4 spaces to collect the attributes needed for marriage in Austen's day: Education, Wealth, Breeding and Beauty. After collecting these, players race to land in the center where they can be declared the winner.
The spin mechanic is varied by having 1st the player & then the left-hand neighbor spin; the player has a choice of 4 different methods of calculating their move between these two spins: Adding them together, Subtracting the lower from the higher, Taking only the Lower or the Higher.
Published in the 1990's; packaged in a cylindrical box, with a small folding board, separate rules in English and French, attractive wooden tokens for the 4 attributes, 1 wooden teetotum/spinner and 4 small wooden horseshoes for player tokens, with the small pieces in a small cloth drawstring bag.
(User Summary from actual Game, no designer or year available in game.)

name: The Barbarian
description:
An introductory fantasy board game published in White Dwarf issue #15 (reprinted in The Best of White Dwarf Articles (Volume I)).

One player controls a single barbarian ("Vaarn") searching the "outlands" for the shield and sword of the "Old Fathers" while the other player controls various creatures in attempt to thwart Vaarn.

Vaarn wins as soon as he exits either side of the map with the sword and shield. Any other results is a victory for the other player.

name: Shinsengumi: Ikedaya-sodo
description:
English and Korean rules available.
https://legalalien.sakura.ne.jp/wiki/?Tabletop+Wargaming/Shi...
https://legalalien.sakura.ne.jp/wiki/?%ED%83%81%EC%83%81+%EC...

On June 8th, 1864, in Kyoto, there was a very famous sword-action between Shinsengumi and Kinnoh-rohshi. Yes, it was Ikedaya.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ikedaya_Incident

It was rumored that the most radical group of Kinnoh-rohshi had planned to kidnap Komei-emperor from Kyoto while they set up fires around Kyoto-city.
Shinsengumi, the patrol group hired by Edo-bakuhu decided to assault the Kinnoh-rohshi's meeting before the final moment. They found the meeting at Ikedaya.

This is a small postcard game. It was distributed on A-game shop's yearend-yearopening campaign between 2009 and 2010.
Basically this game uses the same game engine as 47 Ronin. Each player take action by one of his stack alternatively. Each stack can move and then fight to adjacent enemy stack. This is chess-like puzzle movement. A goes to attack B to open the path. But, the enemy moves C to defend the path just opened. And so on.
Also, if you have issue #1 of Wargame Japanese History, you can use counters from Shinsengumi Chronicle for this game.

Though this is a small game, it is filled with puzzle-like tactics and excitement of swordplay.

updated
This game is reprinted as a second game of Wargame Japanese History #27.

name: Balloons in the Wind
description:
Description from game pdf

Balloons In The Wind can be played by any number of players, but one player might not be very challenging and anything over eight might begin to get a little crowded. Grim Trojan recommends using the Ball Pawns for this game (just because they look good for it. Any pawn that fits in the grid’s squares will work).

The winner is the first player to cross the red line into the park at the North end of the board.

name: Téte de la Course
description:
Game, in which authors took a job to simulate cycling. The main game takes place in France on the Tour, on one track between Brest - Plumelec. Other side of the board is a timed circuit with completely new rules.
Each player takes care of one team (one colour) and moves his vehicles according to the dice throw. There are 3 types of terrain - down (dice throw x3), straight (dice throw x2) and hills (dice throw).
A few places behind you rides also your service vehicle, which can help in case of a defect (when you throw a six, there is a chance of defect).
Each player has also a pack of cards, which he can use in the race to speed up his cyclist for a couple of dice throws.
There are also fights for the yellow and striped dresses, which gives player advantages in next race. Weather has also influence on racer movement and is simulated randomly with a short forecast by a PC small program.

name: Conquista la Corona
description:
From box:
King Harold, had just returned to England from the Crusades, not time to declare his succession who dies suddenly.
Her 4 children are the heirs virtual, but only one can become the true king.
Each player will have to impersonate at beginning of the game the King is not entitled, to one of four colors, in defiance of all the others to become the authentic depositary of the Crown.
The achievement will not be easy!
The game features 2 decks for a total of 90 cards.
Initially will distribute 8 cards of Army to each contestant and then they draw from the deck of event cards a card which constitute the performance of the real game.
Happen so bloody battles in which you can conquer Castles, Keys or Crowns, or see your Army decimated.
The game should be played in three round. Every round ends in two ways: one player obtains a "Full Victory" (Crown, Castle, Key of his colour and the Royal Seal) or all the Event cards have been turned up without a Full Victory.
In every case every player goes to mark on a paper his or her score.
It will also depend on luck but remember that amid the storms of events is not only the fate that you should count, but especially about your strategy skills, how to field Armies and your skill in negotiation.
There will then be unexpected as considerable pestilence, tax liability and Magicians are able to perform any spells.

name: Max-It
description:
From rules page:

Max-It is a unique dice game played with a special set of five dice. Three regular d6s and two "function" dice, each of which has two Plus (positive) signs, two Minus (negative) signs and two Times (multiplication) signs. Game play involves rolling and re-rolling the dice, and grouping them in various combinations to produce the most desired results.

The game is divided into three rounds, each with a different objective. A round consists of three turns and a Max-It roll for each player. A Max-It roll uses only two dice, one regular and one function, and may cause a scoring upset. After three rounds, each player takes a final Max-It roll. The player with the highest total score wins.

Round 1 - Players try for high positive scores.
Round 2 - Players try for high negative scores.
Round 3 - Players try for the greatest difference between two dice rolls.

Components include 5 dice (3 regular and 2 function), dice cup, instructions and players' score pad.

name: F1 Wyścig
description: In these exciting races players must properly dispose of the stock tires and fuel. Accelerating quickly consumes fuel but it gives you more move dices. Cornering the car loses a tire. When the fuel level and tire is low, the player must enter the car on the pitstop. After replenishing fuel and tires can continue to move to fight for victory.

name: Imita
description:
This game calls for quick perception and some imagination. To act, imitate or describe a wide variety of illustrations is fun and encourages creativity!

The players thrown the dice and places their figures on the first space with the colour shown on the dice. Now they have various options to explain the illustration to the other players. They can mime it, imitate the sound or explain the illustration without calling it by name. The first one to reach the goal wins the game.

Contents:
• 1 wooden game board (370 x 370 x 10 mm)
• 6 playing figures
• 1 colour dice
• 1 coloured Beleduc Box

name: Dwarf Hold
description: High Fantasy Theme. Each player represents the head of a Clan of Dwarves that collectively form a single stronghold in the center of a Mountain infested with Monster Lairs. Players choose each turn the role of one of 8 leaders to give them special abilities and benefits during the turn. Players dig, fight, mine, and build rooms.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Tile Placement, Trading

name: Flip Flop
description:
The players must decide quickly. As soon as a player turns over a card (s)he calls "Flip!" which means that the picture is the same on both sides of the card. (S)he says "Flop!" if (s)he is sure that the upturned picture is different. The player with the most different cards at the end wins the game!

Contents:
• 20 wooden cards with pictures printed on both sides
• 1 coloured Beleduc Box

name: Dice Towers
description:
Dice Towers is a two player game where each player uses over 30 dice to build prestigious towers, mine for gold and battle head to head with their opponent.

The game lasts 10 rounds with scoring after round 5 and round 10. Each round, both players roll 3 or more dice and typically use their dice one at a time to increase the height of a tower, gather the next available gold, fortify their troops on the battlefield or carry over to the next round.

Dice Towers was designed and created for the Dicefest contest - a tribute to Chessex run by Kai Bettzieche.

name: Vem vill bli byråkrat?
description:
The game where you win if you tag along the longest, but do the least amount of work.

"Vem vill bli byråkrat?" (Who wants to be a bureaucrat?) is a fairly simple card game. Your goal is to get rid of cards by collecting sets. The game itself is quite humorous, since all cards are actual excuses (as to why a certain case seems to have stranded, for example) from real bureaucrats (and others) in Sweden.

Players will also coöperate slightly; a player can "join in" when someone else gets rid of a case. But the goal in the game - as well as in real life bureaucracy - is to get rid of all the cases, without actually doing any amount of work towards them.

name: De Race om de Kaap
description:
This game takes place in the 17 and 18th century. Players have to buy a ship and sail from Europe to India. They have to sail around Africa. The players roll and move their boats. Players have to buy spices in India. The spices have to brought back to Europe, where the spices can be sold.
At the end of the game, the richest player wins.

Contents:
- 1 Board
- 2 dice
- 4 ship shaped pawns
- 52 cards

name: Monsters and Magic
description: Fantasy conquest theme boardgame for 2-4 players on an 8x8 map. Traverse 4 different terrains (mountains, plains, forests, and badlands) upon which are built 8 types of structures (Villages, Towns, Cities, Mines, Castles, Towers, Temples, and Ruins). Fight using your Heroes, Mages, Armies, and Monsters, and leave garrisons in the places you have conquered. Use your 5 permanent Allies to help you as well as your hand of Temporary Ally cards. The map layout changes every game as well as your permanent Allies, so every game will have its own unique challenges and opportunities. Win by eliminating your opponents or controlling 5 Temples or over half the Map.

name: Petaouchnok
description:
A light illustrated cardgame, where the first player with only three cards in his hands (1 place, 1 dress and 1 vehicle) is the winner. Every player starts with 10 cards and on their turn play cards that matches the previous card. Special cards (ban, +3, miss your turn etc.) make it harder for your opponents.

Text on back of the box:
"By taking the cable car, reach the moon dressed in armour. It's possible! But avoid the pitfalls! You have to be sharp to arrive first."

name: abgeblitzt
description:
User Summary: A card game where players try to collect most valuable suggestions to save energy in different categories.

There are five categories: Kühlen (refrigerating), Waschen (washing), Unterhaltung/Information (entertainment/information electronics), Heizen (heating) and Beleuchtung (light). For each category there are six suggestion/hint cards ranging from 3 to 6 points representing saving suggestions.

A stack is built from these hint cards and several Kurzschluss (black out / power surge) cards. Players take turns. The active player reveals cards from the stack one by one. At any time he can stop and take the highest valued cards on his hand the rest of the cards is place face up in front of the player and it is the next player's turn. If a Kurzschluss shows up all cards of that turn are lost and placed face down under the stack together with the Kurzschluss. Instead of revealing new cards the active player may exchange a card from his hand with a higher valued cards from the open cards of the same category.

Round ends when a player collects one hint from each category. If the points add up to 27 and more round ends instantly. All other players lose a live represented by two Stecker (plug) cards.
If score is below 27 the sum is kept secret and all other players get another turn to get more points. Then all players tally their points. The player(s) with the lowest score lose a live.

All cards are shuffled and a new round begins. Game ends when only one player is left.

name: Pirates
description:
Black Jack, the pirates has been retired. He was always a lonely wolf. With his last action he tricked his fellow partners. The treasures that was robbed together, he melted in one, broke it to 3 parts and burried them separately. The pirates started to search the parts...Will they find them? Take part in this treasure hunt and find all the 3 parts to win.

From the back of the board game

In this game you are controlling one of the 4 pirates who is searching for the treasure.
You start with 9 markers and 3 mission cards. The game board has got a 7 * 10 matrix. Every row and coloumn has got a colored skull symbol (4 player colours and a black one) These skulls are important:
1. The player needs to go one of the cross point of his/her colour. In the board there is only 2 spots like that.
In this spot he/she may check one of the 3 treasure cards that was received at the start of the game..
2. The black skulls cross points. In there you have to draw a card. These could be:
a, Key card --> needed for the treasure (3 for the 3 pieces of the treasure)
b, A steeringwheel--> you will be on turn again
c, A storm-->you will miss 1 turn
d, A skull-->gather 4 and your game is over.

If you know where the part of the treasure is hidden, you need to go there and place 4 marker in the crosspoints that surronded the location. You can not place a marer if someone else has got there a marker. You need to keep in secret what is your mission!

The winner is who can collect the 3 parts of the treasure first.

This game needs strategy, luck too.

name: Roary: Silver Path
description:
It's a children racing game.
Players throw with 2 dices, one normal with numbers from 1 to 6, but the other one is for the careful ones and it contains only numbers 1 and 2, three of each. Player can throw with both dices or only one of his/her choice.
Players move around the board and in every turn they have to stop once, otherwise their car got out of control and they have to wait for one turn.
When two players end up in one spot, they battle for the leading place with dice.

name: Braille Scrabble
description: While nothing more than regular scrabble, it comes with a large board that has plastic overlay that will hold the tiles, and has a braille board. Tiles are Bakelite and have both English lettering along with the corresponding Braille lettering. Finally, includes both instructions in English and Braille.

name: Warsaw Rising
description:
This wargame depicts the struggle between the Polish patriots of the Armja Krajowa and the German garrison in 1944. The 120 units in the countermix include the Hermann Goring Division, SS Cossacks, and wire guided mini-tanks called Goliaths. The 23" x 17" map represents Warsaw and the suburbs on both sides of the Vistula River.

Combat can be affected by sewers, Stukas, and massive railway artillery pieces. The Poles must capture key locations to gather additional weapons from the Nazi occupation troops. The major Polish objective is to capture a bridge across the Vistula and link up their scattered froces.

name: Battle For Rome: Anzio-Cassino 1944
description:
This operational level WWII game shows all of the attempts to crack the German defenses in Italy from December 1943 to May 1944. The board covers the Anzio Beachead and the Gustav Line. The game includes full color maps and 420 die-cut counters. Contains several scenarios with a complete package of set-up sheets.

According to the game insert, only 100 copies of this game were made.

name: Bremen-Quiz
description:
Simple trivia game with questions related to the town of Bremen. The game consists of cards with one question and answer each. Players take turns asking the other player(s) questions. A player who can answer a question gets the card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Spellen-Meister
description:
A roll of the die determines a set of two letters. Within the allotted time, players write down words that include the two-letter combo. The combo may occur at the beginning or the end of a word or somewhere in between, with more points awarded for the latter variety.

(user summary)

name: Stalingrad Campaign
description:
Covers the Stalingrad campaign from June to December 1942.

The game uses the multi-impulses system. Operation points allows players to conduct their operation impulse.
