The turn ends when both player passes. Other mechanic are very standard.

2 map
180 counters

Issue game of old Game Journal 60.

name: Thomas and Friends All Aboard Giant Floor Game
description:
Consists of a large plastic playmat with railway tracks printed on it. A die is rolled to move a player's engine along the tracks, aiming to stop at a station to pick up passengers and transport them to the end. Short-cuts are possible and there are some spaces which lose passengers or have other effects. Passengers are picked up in the form of cards which have a variable number of points so it is not known who is winning until the end. There is a bonus for the first player to reach the final station.

(User summary)

Copyright is held by Britt Allcroft, the company with the rights to the Thomas the Tank Engine trademark.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Trains

name: Rank 'Em
description:
This is a game of sorting lists. On their turn a player or team is given a category (NBA basketballers, big cats, African countries, Tom Cruise movies etc) and five items within that category. They must then rank the 5 items in correct order (tallest to shortest, heaviest to lightest, highest to lowest populations, earliest to latest release etc).

The more items a team ranks correctly, the further ahead they move on the board. Correctly naming the 1st ranked item moves you ahead 1 space, correctly picking the 2nd ranked item moves you TWO more spaces and so on. If you correctly rank an entire card you move ahead 10 spaces but beware! Teams can stop ranking at anytime and end their turn wherever they have reached but as soon as they name an item in the wrong order they automatically go right back to where they started that turn, so the more you rank the greater the reward - and risk!

name: Last Man Standing
description: This is a game of lists. Each round a question is read out. Questions don't have a single answer, but rather a list of possible answers. Then each player places a bet on whether they think they know more answers than the other players. The round continues as each player gives one answer around and around the circle until there is only one player still able to continue answering. This player is the Last Man Standing, and earns points based on the size of their bet.

name: Chance (Шанс)
description:
Round the world travel economic entertaining game. (From Publisher)
Purpose- visit to any two cities on each continent. Every turn consist from flipping a coin to understand chance or not.

name: Long Knives
description:
Long Knives was a set of rules published by Greenfield Hobby Distributors and written by Jim Birdseye.

They were a simple but effective set of rules that depicted Indian vs Cavalry actions in the old west.

No counters came with the game as they were primarily printed with the use of miniatures in mind.

Catalogue Description.
Basic rules for skirmish warfare in the Old West, covering the period 1830-1898, with special emphasis on the post-Civil War era. Rules are based on tactical level engagement where miniatures will represent individual combatants, with a scale of 4 yards per inch and 20 seconds per turn. Historical background and designer notes round out this 28-page booklet, complete with charts and optional procedures for play. Requires a standard deck of cards, six-sided and percentile dice for play (not included).

name: Op Vakantie
description:
A trivia game with vacation and cultures themes.
The start player rolls the dice and gets a question according to color rolled on the dice. The questions are on cards and are assigned to five different colors. If answered correctly, the player gets a chip in the corresponding color and the turn goes to the next player. If answered incorrectly, the turn goes directly to the next player. Whoever gets all five colored chips wins the game.

Contents
- 56 cards with questions
- 25 colored chips
- 1 die
- rules

name: Spurt að leikslokum: HM í fótbolta
description: Expansion for the base game, with 540 new questions about the FIFA World Cup competitions.

name: Liefde Leven
description:
A romantic trivia game.
The start player rolls the dice and gets a question according to color rolled on the dice. The questions are on cards and are assigned to five different colors. If answered correctly, the player gets a chip in the corresponding color and the turn goes to the next player. If answered incorrectly, the turn goes directly to the next player. Whoever gets all five colored chips wins the game.

name: Fur-Ever Home, The Animal Rescue Game
description:
Fur-Ever Home, The Animal Rescue Game is a game of skill and chance, where you and your friends get to operate an animal rescue in Straytown where Spaghetti, Meatball and many other furry friends need you to help them get to loving "Fur-Ever Homes".

Will you hire staff? Will you manage your money to make it to the end of the game? Will you have what the customer wants when they come to adopt? What choice will you make at your annual Petsapalooza event? However you run your rescue, you will be hooked from the time you select a rescue to the time Straytown is empty and you add up your points. Are you ready to come to their rescue?

This game includes: instructions, a game board, 2 regular dice, 1 adoption spinner, and 4 player pawns. There are 20 bark and 20 meow cards, 40 dog cards, 40 cat cards, 4 rescue cards, 4 staff cards, and play money.

-- This game is made in the USA, except for one small piece bag that is made in the UK.
-- For each game sold, Petsapalooza gives back $5 to a local animal rescue who is part of our Choose Rescue donation program.
-- Buy your copy today at www.petsapalooza.com.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Heartbreak Kid: Mexican Drinking Floor Game
description:
Setting up the Game
1. Spread the mat face up on a flat surface
2. Distribute the shot glasses so each player is designated a colour for the game and fill with your alcohol of choice.

How to Play:
Each player must take it in turns to spin the spinner and call out the body part and the colour that the arrow points to. For example, the spinner at the time may call out: "Right hand, red." The red player must then drink their shot and try to follow the directions as explained below.

- Each player must try to place the called-out body part on a vacant symbol of the called-out colour. For example, if a player calls out "Right hand, red," each player must try to place right hand on any vacant red chilli.

- If your called-out body part is already on the on a symbol of the called-out colour, you must move it to another symbol of the same colour.

- There can't be more than one body part on any one symbol.

- If all 6 symbols of a colour are already covered, the designated player who is spinner at the time must spin again until a different colour can be called out.

- Each time a player drinks their shot their glass must be re-filled

- When a player falls because they can't stay in their position they must drink a shot and are then eliminated from the game.

- The last player left in the game is the winner!

name: Boston-opoly
description:
There are a few cities that grab hold of the heart almost at first sight. Boston is one of those cities. Its range and depth of history are unequaled, but Boston has a youthful spirit. Skyscrapers of tomorrow stand respectfully alongside cherished symbols of yesterday. Built by people from every corner of the world, great ethnic influence has created unique neighborhoods, and the city thrives on its diversity. This is a city with character that rivals any challenger. The sun rises on Boston - and she shines!

While it’s impossible to include everything, we jammed all the Boston we could into this box! It’s full of swans, ships, marathons, Boston Terriers, sports and of course...CHOWDER! Looking for a fun way to experience Bean Town? Here it is!

Here’s a quick idea of how to play... Buy your favorite Boston properties, increase your rent by collecting City Blocks and trading them in for Keys to the City. Sound easy? Well, throw in some traffic jams and parking fines and it gets a little more difficult and a A LOT more fun!

So choose your token and advance to Paul Revere! You may soon be the Mayor of Boston... or you may be stuck in the traffic jam of your life!

GET YOUR GAME ON! This is Boston... and it’s YOUR roll!

Publisher's Website
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Cincinnati-opoly
description:
A board game about the GREAT city of Cincinnati! We chose some favorite landmarks and traditions, mixed in some chili cheese coneys, a few flying pigs, great traditions, riverboats, and some BIG FUN... and voilà (vwä lä)-behold; CINCINNATI-OPOLY!

Grab Some Friends and Gather 'Round!

Here's a quick idea of how to play! Buy property, collect City Blocks and trade in for a Key to the City. It sounds easy enough - but add in a traffic jam, property taxes, parking tickets and the IRS and it becomes a little more difficult... and a lot more FUN!

Get YOUR Game On, Cincinnati! It's Your Roll!

Publisher's Website
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Dallas-opoly
description:
A board game about the GREAT city of Dallas! We chose some favorite landmarks and traditions, mixed in some western heritage, a huge ferris wheel, a little chili, a great big cowboy, and some BIG FUN... and voilà (vwä lä)-behold; DALLAS-OPOLY! Grab Some Friends and Gather 'Round!

Here's a quick idea of how to play! Buy property, collect City Blocks and trade in for a Key to the City. It sounds easy enough - but add in a traffic jam, property taxes, parking tickets and the IRS and it becomes a little more difficult... and a lot more FUN!

Get YOUR Game On, Dallas! It's Your Roll!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Denver-opoly
description:
A board game about the GREAT city of Denver! We chose some favorite landmarks and traditions, mixed in some Rocky Mountains, professional sports, music, a great big ampitheatre, and some BIG FUN... and voilà (vwä lä)-behold; Denver-OPOLY! Grab Some Friends and Gather 'Round!

Here's a quick idea of how to play! Buy property, collect City Blocks and trade in for a Key to the City. It sounds easy enough - but add in a traffic jam, property taxes, parking tickets and the IRS and it becomes a little more difficult... and a lot more FUN!

Get YOUR Game On, Denver! It's Your Roll!

Publisher's Website
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Kansas City-opoly
description:
A board game about the GREAT city of Kansas City! We chose some favorite landmarks and traditions, mixed in some splendid fountains, awesome parks, the arts, world-famous BBQ, and some BIG FUN... and voilà (vwä lä)-behold; Kansas city-OPOLY! Grab Some Friends and Gather 'Round!

Here's a quick idea of how to play! Buy property, collect City Blocks and trade in for a Key to the City. It sounds easy enough - but add in a traffic jam, property taxes, parking tickets and the IRS and it becomes a little more difficult... and a lot more FUN!

Get YOUR Game On, Kansas City! It's Your Roll!

Publisher's Website
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: San Francisco-opoly
description:
How do you make a game about the city by the bay?
While it’s impossible to include everything, we jammed all the San Francisco we could into this box. It’s full of the bay, cable cars, sea lions, sourdough bread and of course...fog!
Looking for a fun way to experience San Fran? Here it is!
Here’s a quick idea of how to play... Buy your favorite San Francisco properties, increase your rent by collecting city blocks and trading them in for keys to the city. Sound easy? Well, add in some traffic jams, property tax and parking fines and it gets a little more difficult and a lot more fun!
So choose your token and advance to Fog! You may soon be the mayor of San Francisco... or you may be stuck in the traffic jam of your life!
Get your game on! This is San Francisco... and it’s your roll!

Publisher's Website
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Seattle-opoly
description:
How do you make a game about the Emerald City? While it’s impossible to include everything, we jammed all the Seattle we could into this box. It’s filled with music, art, sports, a big troll, uniqueness and...lots of rain! Looking for a fun way to experience the emerald city? Here it is!
Here’s a quick idea of how to play... Buy your favorite seattle properties, increase your rent by collecting city blocks and trading them in for keys to the city. Sound easy? Well, add in some traffic jams and parking fines and it gets a little more difficult and a lot more fun!
So choose your token and advance to rain! You may soon be the mayor of Seattle... or you may be stuck in one heckuva traffic jam!
Get your game on! This is Seattle... and it’s your roll!

Publisher's Website
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Cardgame Space Cruiser Yamato
description:
Issue game of old Game Journal 48. Covers the whole story of the first TV series of Space Cruiser Yamato.

The basic mechanics is Mille Bornes.

The first player to go Iscandal and bring back Cosmo-cleaner to the Earth is the winner. If no player can bring back the Cosmo-cleaner within the determined number of decks, the earth would be lost.

1 timetrack
108 cards
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Move Through Deck, Race, Take That

name: Masters of Europe
description: The great powers of eary modern Europe strive for asendency. Playing country, action, and number cards into various types of melds allows control of a nation, and a chance to industrialize it, through such occurences as war, marriage, alliances. Victory points are awarded for taking control through various means, whoever gets the most points wins. In addition to a board with spaces for each of 15 countries, there is a custom card deck, and you'll need tokens/markers/chips: unique color for each player to show control, common set for victory points, common set of industry markers.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Trading

name: Of Armies and Hordes
description:
User Summary:

Of Armies and Hordes is a fantasy mass combat miniatures system from Ganesha Games, following in the footsteps of its successful fantasy skirmish miniatures system, Song of Blades and Heroes. Of Armies and Hordes allows players to enact large-scale fantasy battles with 15mm or 25/28mm miniatures, with some similarities (such as Quality and Combat Ratings) to the skirmish rules.

Here is a link to a preview of the Army Builder.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Criss Cross Po-ke-no
description:
From the rule book:

"How to Play: Each player is dealt 25 cards by the dealer. Cards are placed one-at-a-time in an empty slot in the card tray to make 10 poker hands, five across and five deep. Once placed, that cards cannot be moved. When each player has filled his/her card tray, players bet on each of the ten hands to win points."

The winner is the first player to score 100 points.
publishers: The United States Playing Card Company

name: Igel und Floh
description:
Igel und Floh ("Hedgehog and Flea") new game from their Clever Kiddo series that features a "spiel + buch"-- game and book, with book's text being in German. Obviously geared towards younger players, it appears to be an "alphabet game" that engages players with colorful cards and pictures.

This unusual game helps children to learn their first letters and words. The book can be read out loud by children under 5 years of age. Children are playfully introduced to the 5 vowels. The letters become objectives in a story. Chopsticks and rings are attached to the lovingly illustrated book, with which one can append the vowels. There are 55 cards depicting the entire alphabet. Using the cards, simple words can be added to the pictures to create imaginative stories.

name: Jack And The Beanstalk
description:
Once upon a time, there was a wonderful game based upon the beloved fairy tale "Jack In The Beanstalk". All the children who played the game always played happily ever after. Collect treasurers as you move our "Jack" up the beanstalk to the Giant's Castle. Get down safely with three treasurers - gold, the singing harp, and the goose that lays the golden egge - and you will win the game! Careful! you'll wake the sleeping Giant if you don't climb quickly and quietly. "FeeFiFoFum". Run - he's after your treasurers! Game contains 4 "Jack" movers with stands, 1 "Giant" mover with stand, 30 die-cut treasure cards, spinner, game board, rules with short story of Jack And The Beanstalk.

Publisher's Website

name: Space Shooter Target Game: Toy Story 3 Edition
description: Grab your blaster and swing into action to save Woody and the gang! Activate your shooter and target enemy toys. You can see how it feels to be Buzz Lightyear as he helps save the good toys from the Evil Lotso at the Sunny Side Day Care! Easy to understand game rules so everyone can have a BLAST!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Grubs
description:
25mm metal Miniature Game produced by Ironclad Miniatures.
http://www.ironcladminiatures.co.uk

Game features four armies bought in packs of four Grubs; Germans, Yanks, Russians and Brits.

Also available separate is an Anti-Tank Dog.

This is a simple quick-play game. Grubs move and attack with D6's and D10's required to play. Each army has at it's dispostal a range of weapons with vaious ammounts of ammo. Aim is to eliminate all other opponents.

name: The Cagey Monkey Game
description:
Instructions from inside the box:

OBJECT: To be the last player able to add another monkey to the circus wagons.

BEFORE PLAY: Place the four circus wagons faceup on the table. The monkey cards should be mixed up and turned facedown on the table. Determine who will be first.

PLAY: The first player picks up any one monkey card. He places the monkey on the circus wagon that matches the color of the bars on that card. He can place the monkey anywhere in the cage and in any position, as long as the bars on the monkey card line up correctly with the bars on the circus wagon. Player to his left then plays one monkey card, etc.

Cards placed onto the same circus cage may touch each other but may not overlap. Cards may touch the edge of the inside of the cage area but may not extend beyond the edge. Once a card has been correctly placed, it should not be moved.

When a player is unable to correctly play the monkey card he chose, he is out of the game. The last player still in the game is the WINNER.

name: Sverige Frågespel: Junior – Resespel
description:
From the publisher:
Lively and exciting game for kids who love quiz - now in pocket size! The game consists of 600 questions in six categories: Music, Sports & Games, Geography, Nature, Culture (TV shows, movies, literature), and Miscellaneous. Answer the questions and cross out 5 circles-categories with one side of the pyramid. If you are the first to correctly answer the last question, you - the are the winner!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Scrabble: Major League Baseball Edition
description:
MLB Edition Scrabble combines Scrabble game play with a uniquely shaped, baseball diamond board, baseball letter tiles, team tile racks, and special scoring rules

Specific editions for the Yankees and Red Sox were also published.

Contents:
1 Baseball Diamond Game Board
100 Baseball Letter Tiles
1 Letter Bag
4 Team Racks
4 Logo Inserts
Instructions w/ 50 Word Bonus Dictionary

name: Lesnõie Gonki
description:
From the publisher:
The players start with the "Start" and go on the road ahead for many steps, how many points fell on the dice, stopping at all located road signs. The purpose of the game is to reach "Finish" first.
Terms of motion.
If a player is stopped at the sign with the image of "Forest
Money", he gets a card value of 10 currency, spread out next to the playing field. Card "Money" is required to cover fines.
If a player is stopped at a sign (crash sign), he had an accident. Pay a fine - the card in 1 G currency and move on. If "Money" is something the player does not have, then he misses the next turn.
If a player is stopped at a sign (speed sign), he exceeded the speed limit when cornering. Pay a fine - the card in 1 G currency value. After that you can move on. If "Money" is something the player does not have, he/she must turn to where the arrow points.
If a player is stopped at the sign with a blue circle, then a card with "Money" is lost.
If the player is stopped at a sign (arrow), he must move forward one character.
The player who stopped at a sign (crossing), may, in his/her next turn to turn in any direction indicated by arrows.
You win the game when you reach the end first.

Hint! Sometimes it is good to choose longer route to save money, because they are safer.
And for beginners it is good to show the signs before the game starts, as a memory training!
categories: Children's Game, Economic, Educational, Environmental, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: King of the Hittites
description: This is a Warpspawn card game. Each player strives to have founded the most successful Hittite Empire by time the 10th King card is played. Players draw and maintain hands of Power Cards - economics, religion, diplomacy, disasters, militaries, politics - each has a value which can be used to bid on Empire cards - kings & wars - which may allow you to also acquire cities, cultures, vassals, bronze. After the bidding phase comes an event phase when Power cards can be discarded to acquire Empire cards or cause others to discard cards. Periodically - at end of Old (4th King) Middle (7th King) New (10th and last King)Kingdoms - players get victory points for different types and amounts of Empire cards.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Civilization, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Combat Last Man Standing
description: Combat Last Man Standing is a gladiatorial style card game that pits you against your friends. The object of the game is to be the "last man standing" by attacking your opponents and causing damage to be done to each players character sheet. There are two different decks utilized in Combat LMS. The action deck provides the player with attack/defense and the respective numbers for each. The action deck is set 90 card community decks. The special deck is a 30 card deck or more that each player can construct to alter the game in many ways. Each Player has a character sheet that is used to keep track of battle damage and to distribute their statistics. The player’s statistics allow the player to further customize their warriors by giving then 12 points to distribute between the four statistics. Action, Special, Replenish, and Strength make up the four statistics. Each statistic is important in its own way. For more information about game play go to our website and read the rules section at www.councilgames.com

name: Operation BP: Bullshit Plug
description:
A free download-and-print board game released in response to the Deepwater Horizon oil spill.

From the game board: "Times are getting desperate at the Deepwater Horizon. The lies show no sign of running dry and the flow of bullshit appears unstoppable. Now you and a friend can play out the greatest ecological disaster in recent history and the goliath battle of BP vs. Public Opinion. Everyone knows that appearing to do something is far better (and a whole lot cheaper) than actually doing something. So, as BP, you’re going to do your best to spin your way to a healthier share price. As the public, you can bring a certain amount of pressure to bear upon the monolithic oil company - but maybe that’s exactly what sends their PR machine into overdrive? Can BP can be relied upon to do the right thing by themselves and fix the leak?"
categories: Bluffing, Educational, Environmental, Humor, Industry / Manufacturing, Print & Play

name: BattleSpeed
description:
Translated (badly) from the French website...


BattleSpeed is a set of figurines whose combat are held in a universe where the wars became réality-show. The holographic television channels show, on line, the battles in which all the species of will oppose; universe. Among these transmissions of reality-TV " BattleSpeed" , on the holochanel Carnage Network, is looked by the accros of holovision: holo-adds. In the play, you are a chief unit and direct a unit of combatants. When you play part of BattleSpeed, you take part in a Premium of this transmission. Carnage Network retransmit your battle in all the universe. Beyond the political reasons. Only your victory counts. Success is what depends the celebrity on your unit, which will enable you to recruit new candidates with the suicide. Gain! And you will know glory. Lose! And your unit will sink in the lapse of memory.


This is a squad level papercraft miniatures game of televised futuristic battles between teams of humans, mutants, cyborgs and beasts. The free game Demo pits gorilla-like Zorg Pirates against the human ConsoMerc squad aboard a space freighter.Combat uses a freeform movement system in centimeters combined with a 2 action turn per figure which can be performed however the player sees fit. Combat is resolved with a single d6 roll vs the attackers appropriate skill in melee or ranged and any modifiers to this.

The demo comes with both miniatures and terrain to print and assemble.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Tough Pressure
description:
Move your meeples and score the most goals.

Each player have 11 football-playing meeples. Each turn you a player can make 3 moves: kick the ball or move a meeple, but watch out for offsides. There is no dice, just skill.

The board is 15x22 squares

name: La Loi de la Savane
description:
A 2 player abstract strategy game a bit similar to chess, but with wild animals for playing pieces.

All pieces can move orthogonally or diagonally, but some move faster than others. Also, some are herbivores, which count as points when a player successfully gets them to the other side of the board, while others are carnivores who try to eat the herbivores of the opposing player as they try to cross the board

name: Sneak in the Grass
description:
Idle hands are the devil's playground... and our robot lawnmowers proved to be too efficient. In the future, humanity's lawns lay perfectly maintained by a machine workforce with time to think... time to develop an agenda. Humankind was unprepared for the Lawnmower Uprising, and the world quickly fell into ruin.
The players are some of the few remaining humans, attempting to run a gauntlet of vigilant mowerbots to recover a fallen EMP warhead. With this, the humans can shut down the mowerbots long enough to win back their world. The humans have one thing going for them: As the first act of their rebellion against their slavedriving creators, the mowerbots deleted their grass-mowing directives, and now will not touch the stuff, reserving their whirling blades for mankind alone. Now the world is full of ruins and patches of grass grown out of control. Both provide some cover for our valiant heroes as they strive to retrieve the warhead and save the day.

Players deal a deck of cards to construct the board they will navigate, then use a second deck to place the player pieces, the robot counters, and the warhead. A die is rolled for each robot, assigning it a movement pattern. Players may move through two empty spaces, through one grass space, may climb a wall or climb down a wall each turn. If they approach a robot from the rear and have only moved one space, they may use the additional movement to attack the robot, which will disable it if successful or change the machine's movement pattern if not.

Robots see only in the direction they are facing, and if the player is in their line of sight, he rolls to see if he is spotted. If in the same space, the player needs to roll better than a 6 on 1d6, if one space away, a 5 or better and so on. Being in or behind grass increases the player's roll by 1, actively hiding adds 2 to the roll. If sighted, the robot will move directly to the player, even through grass (though normally robots turn when they run into grass), proceeding to the tile the player was last seen at, then resuming their pattern. Robots move 2 spaces per turn, 1 if through grass, and cannot climb. If a robot has sighted a player and enters the players' space, or a sighted player enter's the robot's space from the direction the robot is facing, the player dies. Player wins when all robots are disabled or the warhead is recovered and returned to the player's origin tile.
Note: Changing facing counts as a move, i.e., a player or robot may move 2 or move one and turn one facing, or move 2 facings if not in grass. If in grass, a player or robot may EITHER move 1, or change one facing. A player can change facing while on top of a wall, but will not be able to do it in the same round as he climbs up or down, as it will 2 moves to do either. Walls completely hide whatever is behind them, but not what is on top of them.
categories: Card Game, Maze, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Polytaire
description:
POLYTAIRE is an expansion of -the ancient solo. game Solitaire and thus it is partly:
a more richly varied game for one player and partly:
a game for two players based on the same principles, but of such a nature that it can be played quite straightforwardly or so strategically that one thinks several moves in advance just as in chess.

THE POLYTAIRE BOARD
is played on a board which like that of Solitaire has 37 squares or holes, but in contrast to Solitaire these are placed in a triangular pattern giving a hexagonal board.
How was I to untie the knot and entice the balls` out into the open?
The solution was quite simple: let the ` aim of the game be to remove as many as possible of one's own balls from the board - a principle which is far simpler and more logical and should be the more obvious solution as it is more closely related to the principle in Solitaire.
It is worth mentioning how richly varied and free from boring interludes is the simple-game which hereby evolved when compared, for example, with Chinese Chequers, especially considering how much smaller area - 37 holes as against, 121.

[From the rulebook]
publishers: Parker Brothers, Piet Hein & Skjøde, Skjøde Skjern

name: Casa da Fama
description:
English Description :

In Casa da Fama each player participates in a reality show where the goal is to eliminate your opponents and become a celebrity! Spent inside a house, each one will have to be smart enough to escape the intrigues, gossips and still captivate the audience!

Even the player leaving the house, the competition continues in the outside world in artistic events, parties, clubs and television shows! What are you waiting to be famous!

The Game

Casa da Fama is a party game up to 10 players in which players experience the daily life of a reality show happening in a house where all activities are transmitted to television viewers, who follow the intrigues and cheer for their favorite participants.

Based on a system of cards and tests (which include thinking, luck and agility), the game has eight rounds, divided into phases (such as external events, parties, etc.) and a voting system, where each player votes for the exit of one of the participants, associated with a mechanic of cards and dice, which depict the influence of the television audience.

The winner is known in the eighth round where three remaining players will be subjected to a final vote by the other players and the audience attending the program.


Em Casa da Fama cada jogador participa de um reality show, onde o objetivo é eliminar seus oponentes é se tornar uma celebridade ! Passado dentro de uma casa, cada um terá que ser inteligente o suficiente para escapar de intrigas, fofocas e ainda cair no gosto do público !

Mesmo que o jogador saia da casa a competição continua no mundo de foram em ventos artísticos, festas, baladas nas boates, shows televisivos ! O que você está esperando seja famoso !

O Jogo :

Casa da Fama é um party game onde até 10 jogadores vivem o dia a dia de um reality show. Passado dentro d euma casa, onde todas as suas atividades são transmitidas para telespectadores, que acompanham as intrigas e torcem pelos seus participantes preferidos.

Baseado num sistema de cartas de eventos e provas (que incluem raciocínio, sorte e agilidade), o jogo possui 8 turnos, dividos em fases (como eventos externos, festas, etc) e um sistema de votação onde cada um dos jogadores vota pela saída de um dos participantes, associados a uma mecânica de dados mais cartas, que retratam a influência da audiência televisiva. O vencedor é conhecido no oitavo turno onde 3 jogadores restantes serão submetidos a uma votação final pelos outros jogadores e o público que assiste o programa.
categories: Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Barbie Dress Up Game
description:
Collect all four of your dress up pieces and the Bouquet to win. However, make sure you don't have the broken heart or your dreams will be dashed to pieces.

There are two special rolls. Take any piece, or put one back. If you get any of these you can collect that last piece you are looking for or possibly put the broken heart back where it belongs.

User Summary
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: 7 Surmapattu
description:
From the publisher:

THE ROAD TO THE KINGDOM OF HEAVEN IS COVERED WITH SINS.

Roll the dice and move where the skull leads you. If you step on the 'sin square', you will get the opportunity to confess your sins and start over from the beginning. If you're not fast enough, your friends can remind you of your sins. Once on the 'sin square' you have to give a pawn (punishments’ can be made up as you like) and start over. The yellow square gives you a chance to think about your sinful life, while you miss one round. Once you have redeemed your sins and reached the gates of heaven- you win!

The producer does not take any responsibility for the consequences of the game or injuries caused by the revelations and does not cover any resulting medical expenses.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Storytelling

name: Rock, Paper, Stick, Scissors, Glue
description:
Rock, Paper, Stick, Scissors, Glue is a card game variation of the game Rock, Paper, Scissors. This self-published Print-n-Play game is suitable for all ages.

At least two cards are eliminated from the deck before players are dealt an equal number of cards. Players then compete in rounds trying to beat the other players' cards and collect all the cards into their own hand.

name: Girigiri Bowling
description: Short action game with minimal components. Ten wooden bowling pins are set on the small plastic board. The goal is to knock all but one pin by pinching the edge of the board. It was one of 500-yen games in Game Market 2010, Tokyo, Japan.

name: Geckopoly
description:
Geico Insurance, the company known for its great rates, superior service, and, of course, its talkative gecko mascot, created this custom game to reward its agents for meeting and exceeding sales goals. A promotional game, yes, but the omnipresent gecko made it a popular purchase at Geico company store sites, as well. Themed with an engaging city-by-city travel slant, and styled with a very contemporary look, GECKOPOLY had the Company’s competitors seeing green!

Publisher's Description
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Waffle-opoly
description:
WAFFLE-OPOLY was produced exclusively for the employees of The Waffle House Restaurants. In celebration of Waffle House’s 50th Anniversary, the game has both a very distinctive look and a name that’s just fun to say. Late for the Sky designed and produced all of the art, including the sunny-side up eggs that sit in the game’s distinctive Skillet token.

As time has passed, this game has developed a bit of a cult following. People still want to know where they can buy the game. It seems that customers of these popular restaurants have as much love for Waffle House as Waffle House employees! But this game was designed for Employees Only. The four Company principals appear in caricature on the game board and a timeline representing the Company’s 50 years in business is also featured. The property spaces on the board are store locations that were selected through an internal Waffle House contest, driven through performance of a store’s employees. A great competition ensued, coupled with a real source of pride throughout the entire Waffle House store network. Regardless of the competition’s outcome, every Waffle House employee received a WAFFLE-OPOLY game.

Publisher's Description
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Snackopoly
description:
McKee Foods, owners of Little Debbie Snack Foods, has a fiercely loyal family of dedicated employees, a valuable asset that is readily recognized by the owners of the Company. There is also a strong recognition of, and respect for, the Company’s long and storied history. To complete the connection to all of these elements, SNACKOPOLY was created. SNACKOPOLY was only made available to Company employees, and the games quickly became a prized possession. SNACKOPOLY was so popular, it was reprinted to satisfy the overwhelming demand of employees to have two one as a keepsake and one to play! Today, it remains a well-loved employee memento.

Publisher's Description
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Think Golf
description:
A unique and original golf game. Anything that happens in real golf can happen in Think Golf.
The use of different clubs for different shots with varying degrees of risk, requires decision making as in real golf.

This game is designed to give you a realistic golf score, incorporating all hazards and lucky shots.

Object of the game is to get the lowest score after a round of 9 or 18 holes.
You choose your club represented buy special dice. You roll the dice and move up the hole the number of yards designated on the dice.

name: Stupak The Ultimate Game of Skill & Chance
description: Players advance through the Casino, trying their luck and testing their skill at seven games in the following order.. (1) Slots (2) Blackjack (3) Keno (4) Superbowl (5) Craps (6) Pokers (7) Roulette. The Object: To be the one player who bankrupts all of the others, winning all of the money. (Rulebook)

name: Fields of Battle: Miniature Battle Rules for Castles & Crusades
description:
Miniature Battle Rules - [from the box] Fields of Battle is a simple, straightforward, easy-to-ues game of mass combat. It easily simulates battles between hundreds and even thousands of comabatants, all in a single gaming session. Herein are all the tools you need to decide the outcome of Large-Scale Warfare. Playable with the included Battle Unit Counters, or any type of miniatures, Fileds of Battle is a flexible, easy-to-learn rules set that allows you to conduct small battles between a few dozen combatants or Mass Wargare between the Armies of Kings.

Fields of Battle comes complete with 1 Rule books, 4 different Battle scenarios, scopres of Battle unit counters, 8 sheets of two-dimensional terrain tiles, 1 Three dimensional battering Ram, 1 three diminesional catapult, and 1 three dimensional siege twoer supplied by Fat Dragon Games.

Fields of Battle is fully compatible with most any Roleplaying game. It's simple siege engine mechanic is highly adaptable, allowing you to smoothly integrate the Fields of Battle Rules set with any ongoing campaign. Your PCs and their arch enemies can even battle it out alongside their clashing forces, their skills and abilities directly impacting the tide of the wars they wage. [end of box]

The game is either a stand along tabletop miniatures mass combat game in the same vein as warhammer or warmachine...or it can also be used as a battle system in which you can integrate it with whatever RPG system you feel like so that your characters can be involved with the battle as heroes.

name: Treasure Island
description:
From the inside box cover

"Treasure Island is a game of fun. Each player represents Jim Hawkins as he attempts to find the most pirate treasure. It is simple enough for a child five years old and yet exciting enough for to be a favorite with a person who is 12 or even older.

The object of the game is to obtain the most "pieces of eight", by moving your playing piece over the path of various shaped dots from start to finish."

This version appears to be a tie in to the 1950 Disney movie of the same name. The likeness of Long John Silver and Jim Hawkins are close enough.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Pirates

name: Strawberry Shortcake Strawberryland: The Board Game for Berry Best Friends
description:
From the box back:

Travel the simply dreamy path through Strawberryland. Spin the spinner, move your pawn, and collect the charms along the way. It is twice as much fun with TWO ways to win. Be the first to collect three in a row and cross the finish line OR fill your card completely and you win! So get in step with fun and remember, friends make the good times even berrier!

No reading required

This game is not to be confused with with another Rose Art offering called Strawberryland which is a memory-based game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Cacomo
description:
Cacomo is a team game (two versus two) which aims at introducing beginners to Go. The aim is to enclose the pieces of the opponents' side, then take them off the board. Unlike in Go, players are not free to decide where to put their pieces, instead this is determined by cards with coordinates (one can always choose between five cards in one's hand).
The team which captures most of the other teams' pieces is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Kim & Tim
description:
Color and number recognition for the very young. The players roll and move around a track. When they reach a field with a color, they get a color token for their personal small board. When they reach a field with a nut, they get a nut. Two nuts can be exchanged for a color one doesn't have yet. On a picture field one has to search for an item (which is usually) of a certain color in a black and white picture.
The other game variant uses numbers instead of colors.
The goal is to fill one's board with all tokens.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Prinzessin Lillifee: Der große Feenball
description:
From the instructions:

The date for the big fairy ball gets closer and closer and Princess Rosie still has nothing to wear. But luckily she has good friends. The mouse, the hare, the bear, the hedgehog, and the frog want to help Princess Rosie by trying to find the most beautiful fairy dress that has even been worn at a ball. Pupsi, the pig, has taken command and you can support the animals to find all the parts of the dress. But hurry up - you have to be ready before the ball starts at sunset.

The game board and box fit together make a diorama scene that all the players sit in front of, much like a stage. The scene is of a beautiful meadow with seven berry bushes, a castle, and blue sky beyond. The berry bushes are cards that are shuffled and placed randomly. Most of the bushes have a picture of part of Princess Lillifee's dress printed on the back so the players don't know which dress part is behind each bush. The pawns have one of the helpful animals on the back side. Pawns are placed on the board so the players cannot see which pawn is which animal. The Pig sets the goal by showing a card with a combination of a dress piece and an animal.

Players take turns rolling a die and moving the pawns behind each of the bushes, trying to match the animal and dress parts shown on the Pigs easel. Since the players don't know what is behind the pawns and bushes, they use the mirrored magic wand to look behind the bushes to see if they found a match. A sun mover acts as a timer as it moves from cloud to cloud showing that the ball is getting ready to start. If the players can collect all the dress parts before the sun sets, they win the game!

name: Das grosse Wimmelwelt-Spiel
description:
The game contains six large pictures in which many people and items can be found. One of these is chosen. Each player then draws a small card with six details from the larger pictures and has to find the one matching the current large picture. The first player to manage this keeps his/her card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Wolflend Saga
description:
Issue game of GameLink #3.
Multiplayers' game on Wolflend continent where many cardgames of monster maker series is set on.
Each player controls his own species on the continent and increase their population and build their town to get Victory points.
The game will end one turn after one player accumulates 25 VPs.

1 map
population tokens of 5 species
many coin chips, character chips, and utility chips
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Trading

name: The Othari of Aegypt
description:
The Othai of Aegypt is a free sourcebook for the fantasy wargames of Slaughterloo and Flintloque.

It contants the background and rules for the Otharmann Empire of the Fourth Age of Valon.

It was originaly a free "Rank and Style" flyer from Alternative Armies mail order, but was improved (Flintloque rules was added) and was relesed as a free PDF.

name: Flames of War: Firestorm - Warsaw: The Campaign for Warsaw
description:
Firestorm:Warsaw takes place in 1944 during the Warsaw Uprising in which the people of Warsaw/Poland sought to liberate themselves after 5 years of German occupation. Players will take control of either the German or the Polish forces. Not only will players be able to roll dice to simulate combat achieving results such as destroyed, retreat etc. they will also be able to move their forces from one area of the game board to another. Other than that there is very little wargame 'chrome'; And at best this game provides an introduction to Battlefront's Firestorm series.

Firestorm: Warsaw is a game of conflict simulation for 2 people in which victory will be determined by the player who occupies areas with a higher total point sum than their opponent at the end fo six turns.

Firestorm: Warsaw includes:

1 Set of rules
1 Gameboard


The game is part of a series of Firestorm games, although this one is much smaller than the other two.

It may be noted that the rules for the game are included within a 30-page PDF, which also contains materials relating to gaming the Warsaw Uprising using the Flames of War rule system. The Firestorm:Warsaw game is not an expansion to Flames of War, but rather a stand-alone game which can be played using the material provided, plus a few counters and figures and dice which will need to be provided by the players.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: One Fish, Two Fish, Red Fish, Blue Fish Memory Game
description:
From the Publisher's Website:

"Come along for a seashore adventure! What will you find hidden below the sand? Flip a card to reveal your challenge. Search for colorful fish, silly Seussian objects and other sea treasures hidden below 5 secret beach locations. But watch out for waves! If the game spinner lands on the wave, shake the box and the treasures will slide and hide in new locations. Find the most treasures to win!"

CONTENTS:
1 Shake-and-Look Box with 5 puzzle-piece doors (21 treasure pieces and “sand” 4.94 oz. (140g) sealed inside)
1 Spinner
29 Cards
1 Game Rules Manual.

name: Monopoly: Barça
description:
RESUMEN DEL JUEGO

Monopoly Barça is them game of buy, lease or sell football players. The winner is the game player most rich at the end of the game.
From the Start box, the pawns are moved around the board the same number of boxes than the dice roll. When a player moves to an empty box, can buy it at the bank. If is not interested, the Bank proceeds to an auction. When a player moves to a property of another player, must pay a rent, the rent is bigger if in the box are "Copas de la Liga" (League championships) or Champions League trophys. When a player moves to the boxes SPORT o AGRUPACIÓ MUTUA, he takes a card and follow his instrucions.
(From the "Introduction")

Barça is the nickname for Futbol Club Barcelona.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: La maison des mots
description: "La maison des mots" is a game for children who are beginning to read and write. The mechanism of the game is very close to bingo game. Each player has a card with 4 words and have to find the right letters to to finish pre-built words. A picture of the word helps the children to know what words he has to find. The firt player who finish his cards with 4 words, won. A fun way to learn spelling.

name: Casino Royal
description:
Rule book:
'A set of games with novel Bingo variants for 2-8 players.
Idea of the game:

Casino Royal presents the sparkling world of the big, international casinos in your own home. You experience a truly regal pastime with this interesting set of novel, thrilling Poker and Bingo variants. Casino Roal offers variety and fresh entertainment over and over again.'

Contents:
- 8 boards each showing 20 card pictures
- a pack of 52 playing cards
- 160 green chips
- 40 yellow chips

Three games:
- Casino Royal Poker: 52 playing cards turning up one by one. Each player puts a chip on the corresponding card value on his board. When a player reachs a (high) poker combination he can decide to bet. The one with the highest combination wins the bet.
- Bluff-Poker Variante: each player receives three cards. All the players bet. Once this betting is concluded the dealer begins to turn up and call out the remaining card and the players put a chip on each of the card pictures shown on their bords. When a player reachs a (high) poker combination with the cards and his board he can decide to call out 'No more bets'. The highest card combination wins the bet.
- Casino Royal Bingo: the cards are called out one by one. The players put a chip on the card pictures on their board. A player wins when he can form a predetermined formation on his board (a row or a T, H....). he wins all the chips on the boards of the other players.

name: Efteling Het Sprookjes Mysterie Spel
description:
The goal of the game is to collect fairytales.

There are 28 fairytale-cards and 4 Witch-cards. At the beginning of the game all the cards are shuffled and the cards are placed, face down, on the table.

The first player takes one or two cards. If both cards are from the same fairytale, that player gets the cards. Otherwise the player puts back the cards.
If you turn around a fairytale-card and another player has that fairytale, you may ask that player for the second card.
If a player has collected 3 cards of one fairytale, he/she puts the fairytale-cards in front of him/her. So the other players can see the cards. These cards cannot be taken by the other players.
If the fourth fairytale-card shows up and you own the fairytale, you may place the card in your collection. If you don't own the fairytale, the card is put out of the game.
If you take a Witchcard, that player has to keep the card till the end of the game.

At the end of the game the player with the most Witchcards looses 1 point.

If all the fairytales are completed, players count their fairytales.

A fairytale with 3 cards is worth 1 point.
A fairytale with 4 cards is worth 2 points.

The player with the most points wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Fantasy, Memory

name: Curses! of the Vampire
description:
The Fang-tastic laugh-out-loud party game.

Just like the Original Curses! Game, but with Vampires!

You have two actions in each turn of this party game, the first is to draw a challenge card, which will give you an action that you must perform. It could be a role you have to act out, a story to tell, or an opinion to explain. this really doesn't have any direct bearing on the game. It is a means to get to and then play off of the second type of card you draw at the end of your turn, which is a curse card.

The curse cards are played on other players and force them to continually perform certain actions, such as barking like a dog whenever the player to the right reads a card or hold on to the card with both hands at all times. If another player notices that you are not performing your action, you "break the curse" and turn it face down in front of you. In fairy tales, breaking a curse is a good thing, but not in this game. When you break three curses, you are eliminated from the game, although you are still available to have actions performed on (such as "The other people in the room are electrified. Each time you contact one of them you get a big shock.")

The last player with a curse remaining wins.

name: Jumping Chess
description:
Jumping Chess is a chess variant played on a 10x10 board The rules are similar to those of orthodox chess, except that pieces capture by jumping over opposing pieces, as in Checkers or Draughts. The standard orthodox chess array is used, but in order to avoid uncapturable pieces at the edge of the board, two extra ranks and two extra files of edge squares are added. These edge squares can only be entered as the result of a capturing jump, and pieces sitting on them are obliged to capture if possible. The object of the game is to capture the opposing King, not to checkmate it.

This game won the Chess Variant Pages 100 Square Contest.

name: Grand Slam
description:
A card and dice tennis game.
From the rules: "Grand Slam is a cardgame where young and old can win an exciting tennis match on the kitchentable.

Preperation: Shuffle the deck of cards and place in on the table. Each player takes five cards each. Roll the dice to see who starts."

The starting player rolls the dice and depending on the outcome the serve is aimed at the forehand or backhand of the other player, or even an ace. Then it is up to the other player to return the ball by using a card from the hand which matches the forehand or backhand serve and lay it down on the table. Then the server plays a card to match the returning ball the same way.
The game is played this way until no player has a card on hand that can return the ball.
For each card a player lays down the player draws a new card.

63 Cards
1 d10
1 Scoringprotocol
Rules

name: Getto Rocket
description:
Inspired by the old Getter Robo anime series, Getto Rocket is a 2-player combination DIY board game that plays very simmilar to Chess with a slight Stratego element to it. The rules and board are printed out from a PDF (the board and 10 pieces may be purchased from the game creator.) The board is a 5 wide by 6 tall illustrated grid of squares depicting the land the two sides are battling over. Each side has 5 colourfull rocket pieces each. 3 Rockets which can move 1 space forward back or sideways, 1 Pin which can move 1 space diagonal, and 1 Bomb which is stationary. These are arranged in 1-2 rows at opposite sides of the board. Each player chooses a "home base" and the objective is to either eliminate all of your opponent's pieces, or take and hold the enemy home base for 3 consecutive turns. Any piece can eliminate any other piece by attacking first. Both are removed if the Bomb is attacked.
The game also comes with 4 different Modifier Cards, 2 of which are randomly dealt each player at the start of the game. At any you may play one of your cards to the board so that it covers any two spaces that you either occupy or are currently free. Each card effects pieces differently. Such as allowing the Rocket to move diagonally while on those two spaces.
Additionally about 1 in 10 games are packed with a special Shifter piece that is randomly swapped for one of the other pieces. The Shifter can move in any direction, can occupy the same space as another friendly unit, and can transport those friendly units with it.

name: Spot Lightning Racing Game
description: A car racing simulation for 2-12 players. Players advance their cars around the track by rolling 2d6, changing lanes only in designated space. If there are instructions in the space where the car ends its turn, the player must follow the directions in that space (draw cards, move forward, move backward, etc). Different sets of cards allow players to take different actions such as using a pit stop, changing lanes, advancing their car or incurring penalties. Winner is the first across the finish line after a predetermined number of laps.

name: Kalle Ankas Sjörövarspel
description:
This pirate themed boardgame came with the Swedish comic magazine Kalle Anka & C:o (Donald Duck) in the issues #6 to #11 1977.
Each player controls a pirateship which all start in the common harbour.
The players use startmoney to purchase treasure maps which are kept hidden from the other players during the game.
The players then set sails to dig up the treasuechests at various locations on the board which are pictured on the maps.
Treasures are worth different amounts of money which are secret for all players until they are found.
The players try to return to the harbour with the treasurechests but the other pirates have the possibility to capture treasures before they return to the harbour by boarding them and engaging in ship to ship combat.
Battles are resolved by rolling a custom made spinner.
When all treasures are found the pirate with most money wins!

The game was later the same year published in the German comic magazine Micky Maus in the issues #36 to #38 1977 as Micky Maus Piratenspiel.

name: Opulent Lemurian Shatranj
description: This is a 10x10 chess variant with a unique mix of pieces. The king, rook, knight, and pawn are common to chess and shatranj. The hero and shaman are short range pieces easily as powerful as the rook on a 10x10. These two inclusive compound pieces may step one and/or jump 2 squares, either or both, in either order, changing direction between step and leap if desired, with the hero moving orthogonally and the shaman diagonally. The final piece in the game is a war elephant, the equivalent of an unchained padwar from Jetan, a piece that may move 1 or 2 squares diagonally, changing direction if desired between the first and second steps. The combination of strong and weak pieces, of different ranges and abilities, allows a strategically and tactically rich game with piece balance and variety. The opposed pairs of hero vs rook and shaman vs war elephant provide an intricate series of checks and balances between the pieces.

name: Klaus die Maus entdeckt das Jahr
description:
The game board is ring-shaped and depicts a calendar, i.e. fields for each month. The players put their pieces in their birth month; Klaus the mouse starts in the current month. The playing pieces are birthday cakes (Klaus is an actual mouse). Eleven picture tiles are placed openly into the center of the board.

The active player first checks whether there are any gifts under his/her cake. If so, the player has to say which month the gift(s) belong(s) to - if right (the color code on the backside tells the answer), the player can keep the gift. If wrong, the player has to put the gift under another player's cake.

Afterwards, Klaus is moved by a die. The active player picks a tile from the middle that matches the month Klaus moved to and keeps it (if there is no matching tile or the player makes a mistake, the tile is given away as above). When Klaus passes a player, he gives that player another tile as a gift.

When all tiles have been distributed, the player with most tiles is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Frosti
description:
A penguin holds a tray on which "ice" blocks are stacked up in a Jenga-like fashion. After each move, a player has to press a button and the penguin might (or might not) get cold and shake. If the shaking leads to blocks falling down, the active player has to stack them up on top again. If the entire tower topples, the last player before the active player is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)
publishers: CCP Games / CCP hf (Crowd Control Productions), Noris Spiele

name: Hit N' Miss
description:
This game is basically a 2, 3, or 4-player version of Shut the Box. Each player rolls dice to close out numbers with a combination of the total of the dice or the numbers on the dice individually. The goal is to close out all the numbers from 1-9.

Hit N' Miss has a plastic game board with a built-in felt-lined dice tray. This game uses marbles as markers, 10 for each player. Only two colors are used, blue and red. Players with the same color marbles may choose team play, though they may also play individually.

name: Pokemon Diamond and Pearl Poke Ball Flip Game
description:
From the back of the box:

It's a Pokemon-filled game of fun and action as you try to be the player with the most cards when the timer signals the end of the game.

Turn over a card from your stack and see if its number is higher than the "Number to beat." If it is, you get all the cards that have been played so far and you're closer to winning.

When Ash shows up, a totally different kind of action begins. You get three tries to flip a card on the special Pokemon Poke Ball paddle. Complete the challenge and your stack will grow even more.

Contents:
Poke Ball paddle
Timer
Handle
60 game cards
Instructions

name: Titany: to have more luck
description:
Rough translation of the back of the box:

Imagine that you find yourself on board the Titanic. All the passengers are enjoying their first cruise on this unique luxury liners. Suddenly, the ship rams an iceberg. The alarms sound. The ship begins to sink. Now there's only one goal: to get to a lifeboat as quickly as possible!

"Titany to have more luck" is a very nice racing game. The challenge is to bring all of your own pawns cleverly, quickly, and safely from the various starting decks to the lifeboats. The path to the lifeboats passes treacherously through passageways and elevators. Despite this, each player tries to get his pawns to the most tactically advantageous positions.

But be careful! Being together is often the same as being against each other.

Have fun and ship ahoy!

There's a note in English on the box indicating that this game is dedicated to James Cameron.

name: Heavy Metal Heroes
description: Board game based on the Magazine & Movies. Use Fate cards to move the Loc-Nar and draw Power Cards. Use the traveling Loc-Nar to recruit both Heroes and Villains. Characters control locations and fight opponents Characters. Battles use dice and cardplay. Each Character has a special ability. Locations provide you with more special abilities, Characters you control earn Victory Points plus More Victory Points the longer they stay in play. The first player to a set number of Victory Points wins.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Steam and Steel
description:
From the Lock and Load website

Steam and Steel is an easy to learn and play 2-player, steam-punk influenced, tactical-level game set in an alternate WWI, where we see that a breakthrough in steam engine technology has brought about a revolution in war. Influenced heavily by H.G. Well's The Land Ironclads, our Steam and Steel depicts armoured units and infantry in the field fighting the massive land battleships with the assistance of mechanized carriers and an array of support weapons.

Using a IGOUGO move structure but with a reaction phase built-in that allows a half move or attack. Scenarios are based on specific objectives and opposing forces are 'bought' using a points system. The action take place either in wide open spaces - great for armoured clashes, or in more closed terrain that relies on ambush and utilization of cover. The infantry have a variety of support weapons available that enhance their firepower and the ability to use 'dummy' units to create a 'fog of war', The armoured vehicles are powerful but are not essential to victory - us usual the PBI are the game winners. The emphasis is on fun and playability rather than absolute accuracy and detailed mechanics. A true players game.

admin comment
this game has been cancelled and will not be published

name: Tibbar's Apple Race
description:
User Summary:

In this game you will be stacking small wooden blocks upright or flat on top of each other. The goal is to have your pawn reach two apple tokens on a 3D tree and then unstack your blocks.

Gameplay:

On your turn you will roll the die and perform an action:
1- Place a block flat on top of your stack
2- Place a block upright on top of your stack
Apple Crate - Play one block on your stack either upright OR flat
Songbird- Lose a turn as you listen to the songbird sing

Once the apple on your pawn reaches the same height as an apple token on the tree you may take the token. Once you have two apple tokens the race is on for you to unstack you blocks. You must roll the correct number in order to take the top block off of your stack (1=flat, 2=upright, crate=either)

The first player to get two apple tokens and unstack their blocks wins!
From publisher's website:

Climb High Enough to Pick Two Apples!

The orchard is ripe for the picking! Tibbar and his buddies race to stack their wood blocks, pick two juicy red apples, and unstack their blocks! Who will be first?

name: Risk 2210 A.D.: A Call To Arms Command Deck
description:
From the publisher's site:
The primary deck starts by focusing on specific continents and territories, something that will be echoed in more depth by the later expansions by focussing each deck on tactics and game-play based upon individual countries or regions.

Players can either choose to play this original 20 card standalone deck or mix and match it with later expansion of the same standard deck design.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Pega-pega Tabuada
description:
It is an educational game about the multiplication table.
Goal: The first player to get 5 result tiles.
Progress: Every tile is put face up around the roulette. A player flicks two little balls in the roulette. The numbers indicated by the balls must be mentally multiplied and each player tries to find a tile with the result. The first to find a corresponding tile, keeps it.

name: One Ring Chess
description:
From the introduction:"One Ring Chess is played upon a field of 32 linearly adjacent squares formed into a ring. The game is won by checkmating the opponent King."

This is a linear chess variant, played on a half-sized board. The "Lord of the Rings" theme of the game points up the byzantine nature of this circular chessboard. Rooklike moves are translated directly to the board. Diagonal moves are translated as jumps, moving by staying always on the same color and hopping over squares of the other color. A full set of pieces and 4 pawns each, coupled with the board's two 1-square wide avenues of approach, offer a good range of chess tactics.

name: My Friends Tigger & Pooh Word Builder Game
description:
The game consists of a number of interlockable game pieces, each with two or three connection points. The pieces are double sided, with one side to be used for younger children and the other side to be used with older children. The side for younger players contains pictures of Disney characters. The side for older players contains word fragments that can be matched up to form words.

Each player starts with the same number of game pieces, and an additional piece is laid in the center of the play area. Starting with the youngest player, each player in turn links a piece from their hand to a piece already in play. If a player is not able play, that player draws a piece from the supply of unused pieces, and may play the new piece if able. In either case, play then passes to the next player. The first player to run out of game pieces is the winner.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Word Game

name: Big Cheese
description:
The cheese is 12 inches high, 8 inches across and 9 inches thick at the base.

From the box; 'A Giant Slice of fun. Manoeuvre your marbles up the 'Cheese' mountain. It takes skill to be the first'.

It looks like the marbles are pulled up the cheese mountain using a harness attached to the top of the cheese - pulled by strings at the bottom sides. I've only seen this game in a toy museum.

Each player gets four marbles and a mouse. A marble is put onto the mouse and then you have to carry that marble to the top, using a cord that acts as a lever and pulley. If you drop the marble, then you must go back to the base of the cheese and try again on your next turn. The first player to get 4 marbles to the top, wins.

name: Godzilla vs. Earth Defense Force
description:
It is card game of the Godzilla movie.
The player defends place card allocated as a commander of the earth defense force.
The player drops out when all place cards are destroyed. The player that remains to the last minute wins.

Turn sequence:
1.Draw cards
2.Play cards
3.Attack evil monsters

Component:
100 cards
1 rule
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Megasztár Karaoke
description:
Based on and bearing the name of the popular Hungarian television show (Megasztár, meaning "Mega-star", this is a board game with a karaoke dvd included. Each player or team sings one of the songs, then the other players or teams must vote which one they liked most, the second and third most (they get 3, 2 and 1 points respectively). You also get points if your presentation was voted the most creative, most humorous or you had the best voice. The scoring track has some special fields that can make you advance or step back; also some "camera" fields where you have to give an interview as a star and the other players are going to vote how much they liked the interview.
(user description)
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Party Game

name: Mini-Dominari
description:
This game is played on a 4 x 4 field. Each player has three playing pieces numbered 1, 2 and 3. These can be moved forward straight or diagonally and can also jump over other pieces, but only forward, never backwards. The goal is to put all three pieces out of the opposite corner of the field.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Luftikus & Sausewind
description:
The aim of the game is to thread as quickly as possible six loops on the dragon's tail and push away the clouds. At the beginning, each player has a dragon, which is covered with three clouds. After that, the players in turn roll a special dice (4 color 2 Symbol markings). Depending on if the color match, a loop symbol may be taken. The winner is the player who first has threaded hiss loops on the dragon's tail.

The game is for small children (around 3), a first game with simple rules. The children learn to thread (loops), different color names.

name: Quanto
description:
A computation game for 2-4 players from 8-14 years

Contents: 4 men, 4 boards - each showing a pair of scales with adjustable weight figures, 60 tiles showing weight units from 1-60, track with 22 spaces.

1. Zero! Each player adjusts his scale so that it shows zero.
2. Two! Each player draws two weight-tiles and puts one on each side of his scale. It is up to hom which tile goes on the left and which tile goes on the right.
3. Quanto! Players draw a third tile an can place it either on the right or left side of their scales.
4. Got it! The first player who succeeds in balancing his scale by adjusting the dials scores most points

name: SuperMark som købmand
description:
Finally a card game about shopping, with pedagogic opportunities for dialogue, as well as super fun action with the sneaky SuperMark action cards. In this fun SuperMark game you will have to go shopping for your family. Each participant draws a shopping list, but do not think you'll be a certain winner, because as soon as you are closing in on the goods on your shopping list, an opponent can play the action card "switch shopping list", and then you will have to find the goods on that list.

The SuperMark card games come in five different variations, each one with its own theme. The games are especially good for pre-school children, as they will learn how to, purely motorically, hold the cards, and they get practice in colours, combinations, numbers and relations.

name: Bauer sucht Frau: Das Kartenspiel
description:
Party game based on a German TV show. The game consists of cards with sentence starts and four possible endings. Each player also has a set of four guessing cards (A-D, one for each answer) and some heart chips. The sentences deal mostly with men/women stereotypes.
In each round, a player reads the sentence and the four endings, then each player chooses an answer option. Then pairs are assigned and the two players try to guess what answer the other player chose. The first successful pair exchanges heart chips. If only one player guessed correctly, he/she gets a single point. After 12 rounds, heart chips are counted, with multiple chips in the same color counting less than a diversity of colors. Bonus points are added and the player with most points is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Make You Fortress
description:
(Loosely translated from the instructions:) Dungeon Hazard. After a cataclysm, the world has become one massive dungeon. In this Dungeon World many species fight for survival. Make You Fortress is a 2-player [abstract] game, where opponents fight over control of a Dungeon Kingdom, in the same world as Make You Conquest (aka Dungeon War).

Contents:
Board
11 blue men & 11 red Men
10 cards
instructions

User summary: This is a tile laying game, with a card playing option. Players will take turns laying their wood counters on one of the 4x4 grid (16 board spaces). When you have a strength advantage in a row or column, you can push your opponent off the board and out of the fortress. The player who loses 3 characters first is defeated. The optional cards add a greater element of risk by allowing a player to sacrifice a character counter in exchange for a random card. A card may give a player the edge needed to win the game, or it may yield nothing at all.
publishers: Adventure Planning Service (冒険企画局 / Bouken)

name: Aux Sabords!: Kit Expert
description:
This expansion for Aux Sabords consists of additional ships, cards and treasure chests and offers additional rules to improve the base game.
The players hold five cards in their hands, play at least one and fill up to five after their move. With the cards they can move their ship(s) and pick up treasure chests. When they meet other pirate's ships, they can start a battle by playing a combination of pirate cards. The defender has to play a higher combination of pirates to thwart the attack. In any case, the winner gets the spoils. When all treasure chests are in the players' ports, the player with most chests is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: The Stock Market Game
description: 2 to 6 players buy and sell 5 stocks. Each stock rises or falls based on others buying and selling as the game progresses. Also included rules for dividends.

name: Im Bann der Mumie
description:
Lost in the valley of the dead Pharao, you hunt for the treasures of the Eternally Cursed One. Noone ever succeeded to escape from the bane of the deadly mummy. Driven by greed, those who tried it, lie forgotten in the depths of this hell. Inexplicable terrors lie in wait here, hidden in the sand.

You can already feel, how the mummy's bane reaches for you….
Will you escape from it?
And can you prevent that others profit more than you do?

Im Bann der Mumie is a very thematic card game with a board game feel. Several players take on the roles of different characters (Archaeologist, Gangster, Okkultist and Agent) and do their damnedest to unearth as many of the buried treasures of the cursed Pharaoh as possible, to sell them to the highest bidder, and enjoy their profits. And the one who makes the biggest profit wins the game...
But there is also the Mummy (a role taken on by another player) who tries to prevent the graverobbers from unearthing too many of the treasures. Or at least from taking the most valuable of items - the mummy's body itself.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Dragon Wars
description:
The ancient Dragons of the Black Mountains once claimed that they controlled all their eyes could see. The valleys and plains that stretched out from the foot fo their lofty eerie was their hunting ground and they commanded that special type of respect that only abject terror generates from all who lived beneath their dark shadow.

Dragon Wars is a tongue-in-cheek miniatures game featuring Halflings and Dragons in a battle for survival! This fully self-contained game contains over eighty 15mm pieces which consists of: 60 Halflings, 2 Dwarf Cannons and crew, 4 Undead Dragons, 8 Dragons, 3 Halfling houses as well as the rules you need for the game. If you like your games simple and silly, then this is for you!

name: Blumengarten
description:
A simple family action game .

6 coloured balls should be placed in holes by a spinning top.
Under the lucent platter are the colours of petals. For each ball of the same colour than the petal below, the player will get a small card with a correspondent flower on it.
Goal is, to collect a complete flowerbed with 5 flowers of the colours red, blue, gree, yellow, and white each.

The game was originally released in 1974 as Karussell, which did not have a flower theme.

name: Conheça o Brasil Estado a Estado
description:
Card game about brazilian states and its capitals.

The goal of the game is to get more state cards than the other players.

There are three types of cards: brazilian maps, brazilian states and clues. Each player receive three state cards. One clue card is showed and the first player to call a state that corresponds to the clue, wins the state card. The game finishes when all clue cards are turned.

name: Poppin' Puzzlers
description:
This is basically a two-player version of the 1970's game Perfection, in which you have a set of plastic shapes that fit into holes on the board.
