The board is pushed down into a spring-loaded box with a timer. When you fit all your shapes into the right holes, you turn off the timer. If you don't turn it off in time, it pops and sends all your pieces flying.

Poppin' Puzzlers is exactly like that except each player has his own set of pieces, orange or yellow, and you play on opposite sides of the game unit. There are 20 pieces for each player. The pieces get stored in a compartment on the top of the game board.

name: Roll 'n Divide
description: In Roll 'n Divide, players work together to form division equations and then build individual triangles with double-sided chips (one color on each side for each team) to win the game. You roll a 10-sided die to determine the quotient (answer) you need to make. The you pick a chip for the dividend number and divisor number. You can place them anywhere on the board, either to be part of a triangle you are making or to block your opponent from making a triangle. If you roll 7 for example, you can take the 56 chip and the 8 chip to place on the board. You could also take the 77 chip and 11 chip to put on the board. You are able to turn over an opponent's if you are able to use the previously used number in your new equation. The game board doubles as a storage tray for the pieces.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Math, Number, Territory Building
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dr. Gardner's PICK-AND-TELL GAMES
description:
A roll-and-move game with each space indicating one of four grab-bags containing storytelling prompts (small plastic toys, face pictures, words, and descriptive actions), additional movement, or spinner use (resulting in further movement or chip award / loss). When a child lands on a "bag" space, a prompt is drawn, and varying numbers of chips are awarded for the originality and completeness of story the child tells the therapist (a beginning, middle, and end being encouraged). The therapist may then be awarded chips for a responding story to which the child may respond for more chips.

From the publisher's description found on multiple websites listing this game for sale:

A Psychotherapeutic Game for Children

In this effective and comprehensive therapeutic game, Dr. Richard A. Gardner has combined four therapeutic storytelling techniques: The Bag of Words, The Bag of Toys, The Bag of Acts, and The Bag of Faces, incorporated in all of the important elements that have made Dr. Gardner`s games a staple of childhood therapy.

The instructions detail the effective use of this storytelling technique as a diagnostic and therapeutic tool, with many case examples.

For use by therapist plus one child.
Ages 5-12

From the directions:

"The time frame of play is not fixed; rather, the duration of play is determined by the therapist's judgement...When the play time is ended, the player with the most chips is declared the winner...The players need not reach the finish point to end the game..."

"The Pick-and-Tell Games are indicated for the wide variety of children's psychotic problems. They are contraindicated for psychotic children and/or those significantly involved in fantasy. Such children's problems might be entrenched because the games encourage further fantasizing. Such children should play reality-oriented games e.g. The Talking, Feeling, and Doing Game."

"The Pick-and-Tell Games were designed to be used only by mental health professionals in their therapeutic work with children. Accordingly, every reasonable attempt is made to limit the sale and distribution of the game to such professionals."

name: Technopoly
description:
Technopoly is a promotional game produced to celebrate the 50 year anniversary of Ineel Institute. It is almost an exact copy of Monopoly with the following exceptions: There are fewer spaces, there are only Chance Cards (no Community Chest) and the Free Parking House Rule (in which players take all the money from the center of the board when landing on Free Parking) is an official rule in this version (called "The Jackpot").

As players move around the board they have the opportunity to purchase the deeds for places named after technological facilities of the Ineel Institute, such as "Fluorinel Dissolution and Fuel Storage Facility", "Stored Waste Examination Pilot Plant", "Experimental Breeder Reactor-II", and "Spent Fuel Storage Cask." The Chance cards also feature text related to Ineel including, "Pay Duty on International Waste Shipment Thru RWMC - pay $100" and "Conduct a Seminar on WFC - Collect $25 fee."

The game rules allow the game to end either at a set time or until only one player remains in the game.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: La fiesta de Dora
description:
La fiesta de Dora is a memory-luck game for kids. In the game, Dora wants to celebrate her birthday party and it should meet her friends Boots, Tico, Benny, and Isa before taking the cake. Each player throws a dice that tells in what area of the board should look for the the visitors of his color. But if Swiper appears on the dice, everyone will have to reach out and say "Swiper no swiping" to avoid he takes a pie.

La fiesta de Dora es un juego de memoria y suerte para los más pequeños. En él, Dora quiere celebrar su fiesta de cumpleaños y para ello debe reunir a sus amigos Botas, Tico, Benny e Isa antes de coger el pastel. Cada jugador lanza un dado que le indicará en qué zona del tablero debe buscar a los invitados de su color. Pero si aparece en el dado el zorro Swiper todos tendrán que extender la mano y decir "Swiper no robes" o se llevará un pastel.

name: La France en 2000 Questions
description:
From the game box:
A tour around the France, for ages 8 and above. Cities, regions, history, culture and it is all in 2000 not so hard, not so easy questions. Discover France on a beautiful game board and enjoy the high quality of the question cards in this trivia game for the whole family.
While playing, answer correct to collect amazing souvenirs (points) and bonuses to win the game. First one the collect 100 points is the winner.

name: Pajęczyna
description:
A two player board game for kids 9 years and up.
Game includes a spider-web board and 6 pawns (5 spiders and 1 fly)
Game consists of subsequent player turns where one of the players controls the fly and the another - spiders. The fly is placed in the middle of the board (indicated by the red circle) and the spiders in the blue ones on the edge of the board. One of the blue circles should remain empty. Fly moves first.
Player moves the fly to any empty adjacent circle. However he cannot return to the red circle. Spiders move to any empty adjacent circle.
The player controlling the fly wins when he/she reaches one of the blue circles on the edge of the board and loses when gets surrounded by spiders.

name: Church Windows
description:
From the box: The beautiful stained glass windows of Matthew, Mark, Luke and John need your help. Use all of your cards to rebuild the apostles and you win Church Windows!

User summary: Players "rebuild" church windows by swapping cards from their hands to mixed up windows on the table. Once a window is repaired, a new window in the opposite color (red or black) can be built next to the repaired window.

The player who gets rid of their cards first is the winner.

name: Village Run
description:
Banana village is having their annual village run. This year you entered to win the Banana Cup, but you are not the only one who hungers for the cup.

Village Run is for 2 or more player game where players roll for speed and hoping to take the first place. During the game players will get power up box to take advantage over their opponents. The game use a unique speed system, in where players will have a decision whether to stay on the same speed or try to roll their luck to speed up or getting slow. Village Run also features combat in which players will try to land on a box tile to get an advantage over the other players. The game can be played around 15 minutes and whole lots of exciting laps of Village Run.
categories: Dice, Fantasy, Party Game, Print & Play, Racing, Sports, Travel
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Uskumatud Seiklused Energiamaal
description:
From the publisher:

Incredible Adventures in Energy Land is a board game created for the employees of Eesti Energia (Estonian Energy) to gain a better insight into the values of the company. It’s a family adventure game combining strategic elements with the luck factor inherent to board games.

The game route has to be created at the beginning of every new game. Thus, the game is always fresh, surprising and visually exciting. With the help from six characters - creatures connected to a certain form of energy - the player has to complete different assignments and answer questions related to different forms of energy by getting reacquainted with the basic knowledge or by learning something new.

The visual language is bright, colorful and playfully modified from different Nordic mythologies. The characters and the Energy Land itself are inspired by all the different energy forms known to man.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: NotChess
description:
NotChess is a game on an 8X* board that is a checker-like game, using pieces called Alternators. Any piece is able to be captured by an opponent whose piece moves onto the square of the piece being captured. (By replacement)

The objective is to become the only player remaining on the board.
An Alternator moves as a chess knight when moving from a white square but it moves as a short range chess rook when moving from a black square. A player starts with six pieces on the rank closest to them.

name: The DragonSlayer
description:
The DragonSlayer is a free print and play game in which the player must enter seven lairs and slay each the beast that lives there. Each time a beast dies, the player can collect the weapon that the beast had in it's lair. The weapons are humorous and include such things as a double barreled bazooka, a rocket sword, and a tank.

The combat system is very simple. Both the player and the beast have a starting health which is decreased by modified die roll. Depending on your weapon and the beast's strength the damage may be a die roll + 2, a combination of four dice rolled together, or similar modifiers. Each lair and weapon has it's own modifier. Assuming that you survive combat, you're health is automatically reset for the next cave.

Each beast is more difficult to kill than the last (culminating with the dragon in the 7th lair), but each new weapon is more powerful so the player's combat ability increases with the game's difficulty. The game is won by slaying the dragon.

name: Barclay City Life Game
description:
The board displays the map of a city.

Players roll and move along the paths of the city. Their object is to collect 8 different catergory cards.When a player has collected his/her 8 cards, that player has to go home.
During the game players can use 'Task' cards. These cards can be used to block the way for other players

The first player that arrives at home wins the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Take That

name: Bitwa pod Beresteczkiem z Samuelem Twardowskim
description: The game is a simplified simulation of Battle of Beresteczko. The event took place on 28-30 June 1651. After a few lost battles Polish-Lithuanian Republic managed to consolidate its forces - in number of about 60 thousand - and stopped about 80 thousand army of Cossacks led by Bohdan Chmielnicki and 30 thousand Tatars. Game mechanics try to reflect the way the battle was carried out but is not a typical battle simulation. Units can reatreat using a bridge on river Styr or across swamps. Players' aim is to eliminate each other's pieces.

name: Towers
description:
Towers is a game with elements of chess and checkers, played on an 8X8 board

Players start with 15 Towers and one Castellans, with both moving like the chess Rook, and may leap orthogonally over an adjacent piece, landing on the next empty cell.

Castellans may additionally step a single cell diagonally, but not to the goal cell, the corner to a player's left, without capturing.

A player may not enter their own goal cell.


CAPTURE - There are two ways of capture:
Custodian, sandwiching an opponent's piece orthgonally between two of your own pieces, or by Intervention; where a piece steps between two orthogonally placed enemy pieces, it captures them both.

It is possible to move so as to capture in more than one direction at a time.

name: Souls of the Brave: the Epic of the Alamo
description:
Solitaire wargame, a print and play product, that mixes cards and dice to reproduce the most famous desperate battle of all time: the Alamo.
The player, as the Texans, must try to avoid that the far superior mexican force reaches the walls of the Alamo. The game uses a system reminescent of Butterfield's Raf, using cards for random activation of the Mexican force, while a combat system mutuated by Zulu Wars resolve each different combat situation that may arise during the game.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Acerte o Acento
description:
Educational game where kids must use correct accentuation and backtick.

At the start of the game, each player receives a pawn and four cards. Each player must roll the dice and move the pawn. There are four kinds of spaces: opponent color, all colors, your color and take a card. If the pawn falls in one of the first two, the player must try to answer correctly a word in one of the opponents cards. The player with most point after 3 rounds is the winner.

name: The Zoo Break Game
description:
From the front cover: The animals are escaping. Capture the most to win and become head zoo keeper.

User summary: A roll-and-move game where the players are zookeepers trying to catch all of the animals that have escaped from the zoo. Based on the roll of a die in the game's unique elephant dice tower, a player will either move his pawn the indicated number of spaces, attempting to land on and capture an animal, or follow the instructions on an event card. When all of the animals have been captured, the player with the most animals wins.

name: Raliul OLTCIT
description:
From the original rules:
"OLTCIT Rally (Raliul OLCIT) is an attractive competition game created in order to learn the road signs along with their meaning, racing elements and specific terminology."

The game board is made from 65 modular plastic tiles, 43 having numbers on them.

After choosing the favorite color of your car, when your turn comes, you role one die and move on the board with a number of spaces equal with the number depicted on it. After this, you search the space number in the game rules to see what you have to do:pay taxes,receive points, low speed, high speed, going forward, going backwards, or do nothing (if the tile you are sitting on is blank).

In this way you can earn or lose points. The player with the highest score wins.

name: Sicic
description:
Sicic is a game for two. Each player guides a group of Astronomers, aiming at copying the opponent’s Constellation. Sicic is played on two 8 × 8 squared boards, named the Earth and the Sky. Each player has 4 pieces that move on the Earth (the Astronomers) and 4 pieces to be placed in the Sky (the Stars). The Stars are the player’s Constellation. There are three phases: the Afternoon, the Evening and the Night. One of the player will be the first to move in every phase of the game.

In the Afternoon, players alternate placing one Astronomer at a time on the Earth, on an empty square. In the Evening, players alternate placing one Star at a time in the Sky, on an empty square. In the Night, each player must move one of his Astronomer every turn. The Astronomer can move in a direct line in every direction, any number of unoccupied squares. He must land in an unoccupied square. The Astronomer may choose not to move, in order to “pinch” one of the opponent’s Astronomers set in a neighbouring square. The result of a pinch is that the pinched Astronomer must move in the next turn. Moreover, it is forbidden to the opponent, in the second next turn, to pinch an Astronomer that occupies the abandoned square.

The winner is the first player who manages to place his Astronomers in the same way as the opponent’s Stars. Translations, reflections and rotations are allowed. Also, a player can win by pinching an Astronomer that is not able to move.

Sicic is latin for “stellae inerrantes caeli imitatio consequi”.

Online Play: Super Duper Games

name: Fruity Bugs
description:
User Description:

Fruity Bugs is a game from the Tesco Junior range for 2 to 4 players aged 4 and up. The game includes one clockwork, strawberry board, 4 worm cards (1 blue, 1 green, 1 red and 1 yellow) and 20 green worms with coloured tail ends, 5 worms in each of the 4 colours.

You set the game up by randomly placing the worms in the holes in the strawberry and then each player selects a colour. The aim of the game is to be the first player to get all 5 worms in your colour. There is a lever at the top of the board, pull it and release to make the worms start wiggling (you'll have to repeat this frequently throughout the game as it only lasts for 10 seconds or so).

Once started players take it in turns, beginning with the youngest player, to grab a worm from the strawberry. If it matches their card they keep it, if not they put it back and then the next player goes. You keep going around until one player gets all of their 5 worms.

This is a very simple kids memory game with a dexterity element as you try and grab the wiggling worms as they move up and down in the board.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Memory

name: Dealing With Murder: Dead & Breakfast
description:
From the back of the box:
"Deal up murder and mayhem with the simple murder mystery game that's played with cards. 'Dealing with Murder' requires no fancy parties or petit'fours, just round up your favorite rival detectives and deal them into a baffling murder mystery which unfolds as the cards are dealt.

Who will be the first detective to identify the killer? Will you cooperate with your fellow sleuths...or withhold some evidence...to give yourself an edge in solving the crime?

A singular murder mystery experience for 2 to 6 amateur detectives aged 12 to adult.

Contents include a unique 55 card deck of clues, tips and evidence; crime scene photos and suspect profiles; game instructions and a sealed crime solution.

Object of the Game:
To be the first detective to solve the crime by correctly stating 1)Who the murderer is 2) The motive, and 3) How it was accomplished.

Similar to/same series as:
Dealing With Murder: Fatal Error

name: Tchin Tchin: Barmaid
description:
Extra character card that was sold in Essen '06

Bartender used as a card "character" to play up to 9 additional players!
However, it does toast with those who drink Alcohol is often used in preparing So delicious cocktails it is in fact part as appetizers with champagne, tequila or vodka (hence the three glasses represented the illustration)!
Apart from this, it is like everyone else so it must make the gesture to drink and pronounce the word related to the nationality of each drinker's drink which she participates.

But be careful because if general tour paid by the bartender or in-between the direct involvement (see rule of the game), then we should pretend to shake a shaker saying "Cocktail" to win!

name: Fish-a-Ree
description:
Time to fish, but you're rewarded only when you catch the right pair of fish so pay attention to who's swimming where - and stay away from the boot!

To set up Fish-a-Ree, players must first open the game board, then set it on top of the game cannister. Then insert the ten fish tiles and two boot tiles into the dozen slots on the game board.

On a turn, a player reveals one of the 24 number cards, then pulls out two tiles – one at a time – by pulling on the ring at the top of the tile. The player then lays out the tiles against the ruler included in the game. If the sum of the lengths of these fish equal the number card, then the player keeps the card. If not – or if a player draws a boot – then he scores nothing. In either case, the player must return the tiles to the locations where they were originally located.

The first player to collect five cards wins.

name: Un pour Tous
description:
From the designer:

CONTEXT:
Paris, 1626.
The king´s musketeers, who are carrying a very important message, arrive hasty to Palais Royal.
Hooded silhouettes appear in their way.
Are they Cardinal´s guards, Milady de Winter´s minions or swordsmen ?

The message has to arrive save.
Are they going to face each other, protect each other, stab each other, demonstrate their nobility, or their baseness in order to get this message.

Wear your plume and Fight for your faction !

MECHANIC:
You have to assign your dice between your hands. Players are going to simultaneously make a "posture", using their arms to threat a player or protect themselves, and revealing dice in each hand.

Combats are resolved with simple dice rolls using a "press-your-luck" system with different options (secret moves, counter-attacks, protection of an ally, event cards...).

One pair makes for a hit (touche), that can be parried.

A combination of 3 dice becomes a "secret move", unique and unstoppable for each character.

A "plume" die allows to control luck and take advantage over your opponents.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Card Wars
description:
Played with a standard deck of playing cards.

2-player rules:
One player takes all the red cards; the other black cards.
Jokers or the card box are laid to form the central tile of a 5x5 grid. Players each lay a card orthogonally adjacent to this central tile.

Then players take turns either:
- laying any card in an empty space orthogonally adjacent to an existing friendly card.
- laying any card on top of a friendly card (to increase defence).
- laying a card on top of an enemy card. This can only be done if the enemy card is orthogonally adjacent to a friendly card AND the card being laid is higher in rank than the existing card.

The winner is the one to occupy more spaces.

3 player game:
Players 1 and 2 take a suit each. Player 3 takes 2 suits, giving them stronger card to make up for being wedged in the middle.

4 player game:
Each player uses one suit.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Enclosure, Hand Management, Tile Placement

name: Le Monde à Vol d'Oiseau
description:
The game itself is remarkably simple. As many as six people can play and learn at the same time. Players select a part of the world represented on one of six printed boards: Europe, North and Central America, South America, Asia, Africa and Oceania, which represents Australia, New Zealand and New Guinea.

Each player then attempts to collect all 20 playing cards related to his or her respective corner of the world by correctly answering questions about various towns, mountains and rivers.

Oceania’s 20 chromolithographic cards, for example, include questions and illustrations about cities such as Brisbane, Melbourne and Sydney, as well as various individuals and fauna such as Captain James Cook, kangaroos, echidnas, cassowaries and the Aborigines of Papua, New Guinea.

Cards from other continents include illustrations such as a herring fishery off the coast of Norway, the Suez Canal, the construction of the 1893 Chicago World’s Fair exhibition and a portrait of Christopher Columbus.

The game cards, boards and instructions are written in French, allowing Francophiles the opportunity to test their language skills.

From: USC Special Collections (University of Southern California)

http://uscnews.usc.edu/university/fun_and_learning_games.htm...

name: Kuett
description:
A self published card game similar to UNO. In the deck there are only special cards. +/- shows the next player how many cards to draw (- is only for mathematical if there is already a positive number) if you can not play.
There is also a skip card. Terpentin cards are wild and stop the drawing of cards.

name: Sally
description: A memory game with 4 different ways to play. There are 48 different cards in 6 different colors and different numbers. In one variant you have to find a card in the color roll with a colored die, in another you have to build a sum rolled with a d10.

name: Fill in the "Bleep"
description: Fill in the Bleep is the single answer card game that creates a thousand laughs. Players are dealt BLEEP cards and are presented a sentence with a missing word. Players then fill in the blank with their best BLEEP card based on the die roll, (Funniest, Quirkiest, Choice). The dealer will then Fill in the BLEEP with the best submission. But beware of action cards that can change the game in an instant. Be the first to get rid of all of your BLEEP cards and you WIN! Fill in the Bleep will bring brow raising, crazy, zany far out fun.

name: Zombiekrieg 848
description:
Set in March 1945, as the Second World War draws to a close, Zombiekrieg 848 allows players to replay the battles fought between Allied troops and an enemy that history does not record.
It is a simple set of tabletop miniature wargame rules that can be played solo if desired. All players take the side of Allied troops, with the hoard Abteilung 848 zombies being controlled by a reaction table.
categories: Horror, Wargame, World War II, Zombies

name: Indicação
description:
Goal: to discover the secret word from every other player based on images and verbal clues.

How to play: Every player draws a card and spins a wheel to define wich side of the card must be used. Then each player spins a wheel and asks the player on his left something based on the result of the wheel:
- 1 vowel
- 2 consonants
- First letter
- Letter before
- How many letter?
- Last letter
- Clue
- How many consonants
- How many vowels

The first player to guess everyone´s word wins the round and get the cards of all other players. After 5 rounds, the player with the most cards wins the game.

name: Knerten kortspill
description:
Like a reversed "old Maid" you get rid of cards by getting pairs. You draw a card from your opponent, and if you got a pair you put it away. When you are out of cards you leave the game. The player who has the "knerten" card at the end of the game is the winner.

The game is based on the movie "knerten", a movie based on a book by Anne-Cath Vestly. The story is about a boy who finds a friend in a wooden stick, who lives when the adults doesn’t look. (I guess the thought is that kids find joy in simple things. The irony is that now you can buy plastic “knerten” in the toy shops In Norway.

All illustrations are shots from the film.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Sword & Shield: 54 Card Combat
description:
Sword & Shield is a tactical game of fantasy combat for 2 or more players. Using playing cards, figures, and a chess or checkers board you can fight out gritty fantasy battles.

The heart of the system lies in using a standard deck of 54 cards. These govern your ability to move and fight. Your ability to play the cards to your advantage will determine victory more so than simple luck of the draw.

Sword & Shield combines card drawing, tactical card play, and fantasy miniatures maneuvering into a simple 2 pages of rules!

This first release contains: Humans, Elves, Dwarves, Orcs Goblins, Giant Spiders, Skeletons, Zombies, Lizardmen and the dreaded Cthull all await your presence in the arena!

Pick up your copy of Sword & Shield, and let the battle begin!
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Print & Play

name: Le Défi d'Arsène Lupin
description:
Try to find Arsène Lupin and try to stop him before he finds the blue diamond.

Each player tries to find his 5 objects before accusing Arsène Lupin. The player who plays Arsène Lupin tries to find 4 objects, the blue diamond and escape before it happen.

At the beginning, rôle between Arsène Lupin and clients is drawn and stays hidden until the end.
60 hidden objects are place in the hôtel.

The mechanism is very simple, a player throws a dice on each turn and moves in the Hôtel. If his move ends on an object, he look if he belongs, and then take it back in his bedroom. When a player recovers 5 objects, he can accuse Arsène Lupin, if this player is Arsène Lupin, he leaves the hôtel.

name: Rainbow Reflection
description:
Fast-paced stacking game building coloured rainbows out of discs to match cards

The cards are shuffled and placed face-down in a pile in the centre of the table, and the coloured discs are spread out evenly around the table. Each player starts with a game base on which to build his rainbow (tower). The top card is turned over and all players have to build a rainbow following the sequence of colours and symbols on the cards. The first player to build their rainbow puts the pot of gold on top to win the round. The player who wins the most rounds is the winner.

name: Crazy Bee
description:
Have the whole family buzzing with laughter.

Each player puts on a crazy bee headband. Pick up the corresponding coloured balls with your bee by moving your head. Be the first to collect all 10 balls of your colour to win the game.


Extended game play may cause dizziness.

name: Froggy Comes Home
description: This game reminds a simplified version of Downfall. Each player in his turn should move a wooden gear in order to guide a small colored ball (the little frog) to to find its home.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Children's Game

name: Hulo!
description:
From publisher's webste:

"Here in Hawaii, olelo Hawaii is alive and spreading! But we all could use a little kokua in learning new Hawaiian huaolelo or brushing up on our vocab. Hulo! is a fast, fun, and easy way to practice your Hawaiian vocabulary. Whether you know five Hawaiian words or five hundred, you can enjoy learning with friends and family as you race to complete your Hawaiian crossword.


Hulo! is themed after the old Hawaiian nupepa, or newspapers, which didn’t have diacritics. So you can play without worrying about okina and kahako markings.
Wondering if you can use people or place names? Hiki no! Go right ahead. So even if you don’t know many Hawaiian words, you probably know a lot of names of people, streets, cities, and other places.
Two-letter huaolelo are okay.
You can use the same word twice.
Going over the pronunciation and definitions at the end is one of the funnest parts of the game. See how many new huaolelo you can learn from the other players.
Instructions are included inside the box.


You'll find a few pieces that aren't letters.

Watch out for the Ewalu piece! If someone draws it and plays it on you, aue! Aloha no! That means your crossword has to have at least one eight-letter huaolelo. Laki maikai!

Need some different letters to spell a huaolelo? If you draw an Akau piece, you can force all players to pass two pieces of their choosing to the akau, right.

If you draw a Hema piece, you can force all players to pass two pieces of their choosing to the hema, left.

The Ku! piece is like a wildcard, so you can use it as any letter of your choosing. Or, if someone is winning and you want to stop their momentum, yell out "Ku!" to stop gameplay. You can then take one of their letters, replace it with the Ku! piece, and designate the Ku! piece as a different letter. Ho ke kolohe! What this means for your opponent is probably a lot of crossword rearranging! Minamina no hoi!

The Ea piece is the one everybody wants to have. It means you have ea, or sovereignty, so nobody can mess with your crossword. In other words, you're free to make your own huaolelo without being affected by special pieces like Ewalu, Akau, Hema, and Ku. You are kuokoa--independent!"

name: Alien Zombie Tentacle Apocalypse
description:
Alien Zombie Tentacle Apocalypse. You don't have to outrun the monsters, you just have to outrun the other players. Everyone takes on the role of two or more B-movie archetypes, trying (futilely) to escape the apocalypse. Using their native abilities, gear and event cards, no one wants to be at the back of the pack when the “Die Horribly” phase arrives. Yeah, they are (were) your friends, but we're talking alien probing here. Not to mention brain-eating zombies and while you have never seen it yourself (yeah, right), you've heard what the tentacles do to you. Come to think of it, you never much liked those people anyway....

A game of AZTA takes between half an hour and an hour, depending on how cutthroat you are, and while you can play with two, maximum deviousness and treachery requires three to six players. You need to help your friends if you are going to survive. You just don't want to help them too much...

AZTA requires cardstock or business card sheets (11 of them), and preferably a color printer. The rules are one page long, so you can just dive in and play. The cards, rules and components all fit into a standard deck box for easy carrying.

name: Herding Cats
description:
Your next door neighbour, old Mrs Jones (the cat lady), just left for vacation, but she forgot to let all her cats out of her house. You and your friends agree to help Mrs Jones, by searching her house, finding her cats the putting them outside, before they cause havoc.

The first player to successfully eject 3 cats from the house is the winner.

On each turn, you explore the modular house, trying to find those pesky cats, but catching them will require a dose strategy and plenty of luck. Although, there are objects to help you; the cats' toys, food and paraphernalia, which will help you catch those cats.

Herding Cats is a hilarious game for 2-4 players that plays in around 30 minutes.
mechanics: Action Points, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Alphabet Soup
description:
A word game for 1 or more players - includes a 30-sided die and a pad of scorecards.

Build words, one letter at a time, by choosing either to throw the 30-sided Letter Die or use up one of the designated letters A-Z on the scoresheet. The longer the words, the higher your score.

Each time you throw the die (or choose a letter), enter the letter that comes up on one of the available spaces on your scorepad (there are 81 spaces - nine words with up to nine letters each). If "vowel" comes up you may place any vowel you want, wherever you want. Similarly with "wild", except that you can use any letter.

The game ends when one player has completed their ninth word.

name: Salamandaar Lite
description:
Salmandaar Lite is a semi-coop game for 1-6 players wherein the players spawn armies from castles located at the points of a hexagonal island and try to withstand the invasion of Fire Salamanders pouring forth from the volcano in the center of the island. The island and counters are all contained in the PDF that will be submitted to the file section, as will the instructions.

Player units represent workers, resources and military, and can be spent in attack, to build roads, or to support the generation of more units by providing infrastructure at the player's home castle. Players are expected to generally cooperate in repelling the Fire Salamander invasion, but player combat is possible and might be necessary to defend your castle from players fleeing Salamander overruns of their own lands. Combat with both the invaders and other players is by mutual removal, representing the consumption of both forces and materials and wealth, or will dice rolls, which might result in removal of the enemy without loss of the player unit, or might result in defeat and removal of the attacking unit. Both players and the invading Salamanders will start spawning from any captured castles.

Paper unit markers are provided, and are color-blindness friendly, but wooden cubes of assorted colors would be a great substitute.

At the end of every round (after the last player takes a turn), advance a marker on the turn track. Game ends after ten rounds, or if all players are eliminated. Winner is the player with the most castles and armies afield at game end.

This is a PnP version of a game still in development, Salamandaar (sans Lite,) for the One Sheet PnP contest. The PnP version is a fixed map, though I will provide additional maps. The final non-lite version of the game will feature a fixed intro map over which random map tiles may be placed, or placed according to scenario. The non-lite version will feature a larger map as well, and some more robust player abilities, some more ways to spend units.

Variant: Add a seventh player, who runs the Salamanders, ignoring the target priority rules and moving as he/she wishes.
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Mord im Orientexpress
description: Card game with one murderer. The murderer gets a weapon and a neutral card, all other players get 2 neutral cards. In three rounds each player trades one card with one other player. A player with the weapon in his hand is killed. All others can accuse others as murderer. You can pick one other player. If you are right you get points, if not you loose points. Played several rounds.

name: Rat and Cat
description:
A two player strategy game about a mutant rat and a cat inventor. As the rat you are trying to escape down your hole. As the cat your goal is to catch the rat.
The rat's super powers allow him to Dash down passageways at lighting speed and mentally shift physical objects. The cat however is the owner and operator of a force field generator and a transpacial warp generator.
The board is a grid made from 30 square tiles. The cat using his transpacial warp generator is able to jump across the map in one move and with his force field generator block any passageway. The rat, however, is able to move rows of passageways, enabling him to trap the cat and form a safe path to his hole.

name: Kampen om Falun
description:
From the publisher:
Kampen om Falunis a game about the Swedish city of Falun. The mechanics is, roughly, a mix of Monopoly and Trivial Pursuit where most of the questions are about the city and its history. Players move around a track on the board and acquire properties and answer trivia questions about the featured city.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Kampen om Sundsvall
description:
From the publisher:
Kampen om Sundsvallis a game about the Swedish city of Sundsvall. The mechanics is, roughly, a mix of Monopoly and Trivial Pursuit where most of the questions are about the city and its history. Players move around a track on the board and acquire properties and answer trivia questions about the featured city.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Lokalspelet, Kampen om stan: Piteå
description:
This is a Monopoly clone. The publisher Lokalspelet i Skandinavien AB did a lot of these games as promotions for different cities in the 1980s.

In the middle of the board is a photo of the Piteå and around that is a lot of the stores in the city. You can buy stock in them, and you can get cards that ask you questions about the city.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Routes de France
description:
The goal is to better understand the cities of France and their specialties. The winner will be the first that will link 10 cities.

The plateau represents France with its major cities, roads and highways.
Each player receives 10 cards at the start "step-Specialty" and a map of "Help". Each examines his cards and decides the best course to perform and then announces each departure city and arrival city. In turn, players roll a dice marked 1 to 6 (for roads) or a spinning top marked from 1 to 10 (for highways) and move their vehicles to as many boxes as points obtained. Obtaining a duplicate card entitles "Help".

Each time a player reaches a milestone, it exposes the corresponding card and draws a token "tourist" (the latter will lose 1 turn an opponent coming into the city's token).
Fields marked with an asterisk qualify for a card "Bon Voyage", the boxes marked with a danger sign forced to draw a card "Danger" (which may be offset by a relief map).

Each step relates the items on the map "step", the first arriving at its destination town gains 200 points, the second 150 points, 100 points the third and fourth 50 points. A penalty of 30 points is imposed for each stage missed.
The winner is the one who scores the highest score.

name: 100 einzigartige Orte
description: "100 einzigartige Orte, die schon bald verschwinden könnten" is a trivia game dealing with places and regions which are under threat. The players roll and move around a world map. After each roll, they have to answer a question about the continent they are currently on; if they answer correctly, they get the card and can move forward. The goal is to collect two cards from each continent and reach start again.

name: Ipo
description:
Translation of the back of the box:
Game by simple rules, where necessary strategy and intelligence, you are faced with exciting challenges.

Tag line - Only players of a certain type are compared with hypo

Card game the team who has the lowest score at the end of the match wins.

In each card, there are two values: the points value of the card is in the center and the IPO value (the score a team gets for taking the round) is in an inset circle.

The value of the IPO for the round is determined by the card led in the round. The team wins the round gets the IPO score, which will tally throughout the game.

Example with 4 players: Player A1 play 5 (with an odd IPO of 25), player B1 plays 4, A2 player plays 6, B2 player plays 5. The total round is 20 (even) the first card played is 5 (odd). Team A failed to comply with the total odd then won the B team in the IPO will be 25.
Wins points less than its IPO.

name: BYU-opoly
description: Just one more themed version of Monopoly. This time the properties are all iconic places and things associated with Brigham Young University and its locale. Rules appear to be standard.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Mastermind couleurs et formes
description:
This is a variant to Grand Mastermind.

The player must discover a code of five elements of different colors and shapes. There are four different colors and six different shapes. You have 12 chances to discover the code.

The code-maker has three different pegs: white (correct color and correct shape), black (completely correct) and red (correct shape and correct position).
publishers: Capiépa Éditeur: Jeux Éducatifs, Cayro, The Games

name: Jakten på guldmynten
description:
Jakten på guldmynten (The hunt for the goldcoins) is a dice game with characters from Disney, like Scrooge McDuck. You want to be the first player to achieve 10.000 points.

You roll 10 dices, and attempt to get dice with "pairs", like Donald, Daisy and Gladstone Gander (they have the same colour, red), you get a bonus, and also you can now roll the "coin-dice" trying to get a coin worth 1000 points. But without getting three dices with the faces of Beagle Boys. Dice with a star is a joker.

The game is similar to Monopoly Express.

name: Cacophony
description:
Manufacturer's Description:
The hilarious game of noisy Charades. Can you identify the noise of a car while rocking on your heels or the sound of a piano while blindfold and standing on one leg?

Players must try to get one member of the group to identify as many noises as possible before the timer runs out. It's not as easy as it sounds when each player has to adopt a silly position like standing on one leg, for example.

name: Starts with...
description:
Starts With is a fantastic "what do words begin with" game.
The object of the game is to complete your category list as quickly as possible. Your category list might contain such categories as boys names, musicians or countries and you spin the spinner to select a letter. The aim is then to find a word in that category that starts with that letter...boys names begining with S (not too hard) or musicians beginning with E (a bit harder).

name: Chihuahua-opoly
description:
From LateForTheSky.com:

SMALL, INTELLIGENT, SASSY
MEET THE CHIHUAHUA!

The smallest breed of dog, the Chihuahua, is named after the state of Chihuahua in Mexico. Their history is shrouded in mystery but some believe they originated from the Fennec Fox, a very small animal with big eyes and ears, which could explain the tiny frame, colossal eyes and ample ears of today’s breed. Graceful and alert with a saucy expression; Chihuahuas are highly intelligent, courageous, extremely lively, proud and adventurous. The Chihuahua is a wonderful little dog but don’t underestimate them based on size!

CHIHUAHUA-OPOLY IS A GAME FULL OF TAIL-WAGGING FUN!
COLLECT YOUR FAVORITE CHIHUAHUAS AND PLAY HARD!

Increase your rent by buying Toys for your dogs and upgrading them to Big Bones. Sounds easy enough until you get fleas, have an accident on the carpet, or worse yet, get sent to the kennel!

GRAB YOUR TOKEN AND ADVANCE TO GO CHIHUAHUAS!

Who knows! You may soon be Best in Show... or hanging out with a Chihuahua dressed as Elvis!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Yorkie-opoly
description:
From LateForTheSky.com:

LOYAL, BRAVE, CLEVER, ENERGETIC
MEET THE YORKSHIRE TERRIER!

The Yorkshire Terrier offers a big dog in a small package! Affectionately known as "Yorkies", these energetic pooches are one of the most popular dog breeds in the world. They are truly unique in both their diminutive stature and their big personalities. But don’t let their small size fool you; they are terrific watchdogs and have the attitude of a full sized dog when it comes to protecting their homes and families.

YORKIE-OPOLY IS A GAME OF TAIL-WAGGING FUN!
COLLECT YOUR FAVORITE YORKIES AND PLAY HARD!

Increase your rent by buying Toys for your dogs and upgrading them to Big Bones. Sounds easy enough until you get fleas, have an accident on the carpet, or worse yet get sent to the kennel!

GRAB YOUR TOKEN AND ADVANCE TO GO YORKIES!

Who knows! You may soon be Best in Show... or hanging out with a Yorkie with a Mohawk!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Monopoly: Manchester City FC Edition
description:
Manchester City Football Club version of Monopoly. In place of the traditional properties there are current and previous players, as well as football-themed playing pieces.

From the publisher:
Throughout Manchester City’s proud history, the club has built a deep, lasting kinship with their fans - following City can be a rollercoaster of dizzying highs and emotional lows, and this special edition of Monopoly commemorates those who have contributed to the club’s glorious heritage.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Parker Brothers, Winning Moves UK Ltd.

name: The Dot Game
description: A version of the pencil-and-paper game Boxes, modified to allow (1) play by 2 to 4 players, and (2) a spinner that can dictate the number of segments the player must play or even their orientation (horizontal or vertical). Once the fourth segment of a square is played, the player claims that square by placing a dot of his or her color in its center and then plays again; the winner is the player who has claimed the most squares by the end of the game.

name: Texas Tech-opoly
description:
From LateForTheSky.com:

Located in Lubbock, Texas Tech University® is a major comprehensive research institution rich in tradition, athletics, and heart. Raiderland is a place where students explore their interests, discover their passions and realize their potential. Ask students or alumni, there’s nothing quite like the Red Raider spirit!


Looking for a fun way to experience
TEXAS TECH UNIVERSITY®? Here it is!
All the fun... none of the studying!

Choose your token and advance to GO RED RAIDERS! Collect credit hours and
trade them in for diplomas. You may soon be marching in the Goin’ Band of Raiderland... or bumming quarters to do your laundry!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: The IN Game
description: The IN Game or Initials Game is a game in which you make your way around a board and as you go, you are challenged to figure out famous athletes, politicians, entertainers, and other influential historical figures. You are given their initials, one clue, and 30 seconds. For example: GW and "The father of our country." The answer is George Washington. WS and 'He bought Alaska." The answer is William Seward. Land on a BETS space, and opponents can place bets (double or nothing) on whether or not you can answer a clue in a tough category. The IN Game includes 1,200 different clues. This game can be played with 2-6 individual players or in teams.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Sci-Fi Trivia
description:
Sci-Fi Trivia is a game for any number of players. Players take turns rolling a die to select one of six science fiction trivia categories and then attempt to answer a question on that subject. If they answer correctly, the player scores one point and rolls for another category. If the answer is incorrect, play passes passed to the next player who rolls to select a new category. If a player gets six consecutive questions correct, they score a bonus two points. The game ends when a player has scored points for every category and the player with the highest score wins.

From the box:
Sci-Fi Trivia - a game for sci-fi buffs aged teen and up - complete on its own or a great add-on to other trivia games.

2,400 questions and answers on popular sci-fi subjects including: The Golden Age, Multi Media, New Wave, Cult Movies, Cult T.V. and The Classics.

Ideal for home and compact enough for travel, a complete trivia game on its own or a great add-on to other trivia games. Sci-Fi trivia will entertain, stimulate and challenge your mental faculties.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Trivia

name: Seelow 1945
description:
This small wargame simulates in 14 turns the last German resistance before Berlin.

Each turn represents 8 hours. Soviet units are Corps, German units are divisions. Each hexagon is 5 Km across.

Components: just one sheet of paper. On one side are the rules, on the other side the map (which includes the turn record chart and the terrain types) and the counters, that have to be cut out and mounted separately.

name: Happy Aua
description:
Each turn, a card is flipped open. The card contains a sign, a newspaper ad etc. with some weird misspelling or other mistake. Each player now notes down a comment mocking the mistake. The comment voted to be the funniest receives a point. The player with most points at the end of the game is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Murder Mystery Party: Murder at the Grand
description:
WHO MURDERED PROFESSOR EIN STEIN?

The time is 6th May 1944. The place is The Hotel Grand where a top secret conference has been arranged to reveal Professor Ein Stein's startling new invention- a deadly weapon. Professor Ein stein will not be attending the conference, he was found murdered in his room, apparently killed by his own invention. All of those attending the conference had high risk security clearance and could be trusted; But could they?

Join us in solving the Murder at The Grand.

The game box includes all the materials needed for the evening: menu and costume suggestions, the characters' booklets, party invites, name tags, etc.

name: The Bible Says... TIS SO
description:
From the box: Tis Tru - The Game of Bible Truths. A fun way to learn proverbs by matching scriptures.

The game consists of a spinner, 60 "Bible truths" (3 sections each), 9 blank sections, 6 "Book of life" sections and a list of "Bible truths".
Each "Bible truth" is broken up into a beginning, center and ending section. Players take turns spinning the spinner and collecting a number of face down sections from the center pile (Playing Pool) in an attempt to complete matching sets. Sections that you can use go in front of you face up and the ones you can't use right away go to a face up "Waiting Pool" that can be drawn from by all players.
When a player completes a "Bible truth" he gains the points listed on it.
The winner is the player that has the most points when all sections are drawn from both pools.

name: I SPY Spectacular
description:
20 years ago, Jean Marzollo and Walter Wick created the first title in their bestselling I Spy series, I Spy: A Book of Picture Riddles. What's a 20th anniversary without a "wow" kind of game? Introducing I Spy Spectacular, a one-of-a-kind game with a 3-tiered spinner that will send you over the edge looking for picture matches. To celebrate the 20th anniversary of the I Spy series, new riddles from Jean Marzollo are paired with 13 of Walter Wick's photographs from the classic I Spy vault to create a spectacular search-and-find game.

I Spy Spectacular Game is a matching game that centers around a 3-level spinner with cards to match the items on the spinner complete with I Spy's trademark riddles. This game contains one three-level spinner, which when spun locks into place one level at a time for hundreds of possible combinations of items on the spinner. The 36 double sided cards have a different combination of items on each one. Every spin will have a card to match one of the combinations it produces. Kids scramble to be the first to find a match and score 1 of the 50 score chips. The rules cotain more than one game play depending on the age group playing.

And don't forget the riddles that become a fun and creative activity at the end of the round.

name: Das große Spiel
description: This game is a nice variant of the game Memory. When you reveal two same cards you can either continue like in the normal game of memory or you can risk your points on a scoring track with fields like ×1 (times one), ×2 (times two) or 0 (zero). The roll of a die shows how many steps you go and the field you move to shows the points you then get.

name: Tyrolean Roulette
description:
"Tyrolean Roulette" is a game that consists in a spinning top that hits balls randomly and hopefully the right ones hit big points and wrong ones stay out or go in small numbers.

It has small pockets with small numbers and 8 big pockets with big numbers.

Green Balls count - 2X
Natural color - 1X
Red Ball - minus points

If you can insert all 13 balls in a turn, you can play again.

Game ends when one player reach the agreed score (Ex:500points)

name: Rock, Paper, Poker
description:
Scissors slashes paper, rock crushes scissors and paper smothers rock, but add a little poker in the mix and all bets are off! This quick-draw card game plays just like a traditional game of poker without the betting and adds the charm of your favorite childhood game. Players decide whether they are IN or OUT based on the best hands they can make with their cards. Packaged in a travel size card box, Rock, Paper, Poker is the two-in-one game that’s fun for everyone, everywhere!

Whenever the player has three of a kind in their hands but different combinations (one player has scissors and other player has rock) then the typical Rock,Paper,Scissors hierarchy is played and winner collects his opponent's cards and all cards from jackpot pile.
If two or more players have the same winning combination they place their cards in their personal piles. Losers place their cards in jackpot pile. If all players have same combination they place their cards to jackpot pile.
When all card are used or there are too few of them the game ends and players count the cards in their own personal piles.
Winner is the players with the most cards.
publishers: Discovery Bay Games, Main Street Publishing

name: The Archers
description:
The Archers is a board game by Chad Valley from the 1960s based in the world of the BBC radio series 'The Archers' and set in the fictional town of Borchester. The game includes animal tokens, paper banknotes, a linen bag and an auctioneer's gavel. There are six farm cards representing Allards Farm, Brookfield Farm, Heydon Farm, Coombe Farm, Barratts Farm and Manor Farm, and six player tokens representing the owner of each farm. The rules allow for a seventh player to act as banker/auctioneer.

Each player starts with £200, a farm card and a farmer token. Players roll dice to make their way around the game board, following any instructions on the spaces they land on. When players reach the central market area, an auction is held to purchase animal tokens drawn from the linen bag. Once three animals have been auctioned, players move around the Market Square spaces before the market closes. Players then return home and play restarts from the starting square.

Each player places any animals they obtain onto their personal farm board. A tractor must also be bought during the game. The winner is the first player to have a complete farm.
categories: Animals, Farming, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Chit-Pull System, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Math-A-Kazam!
description:
In fantasy literature, wizards cast spells, control weather and call forth otherworldly creatures. In the real world, however, the "wizards" are actually mathematicians, who use their magic powers of multiplication, subtraction and other operations to transform numbers into a different form.

In Math-A-Kazam! players try their hand at this math wizardry, using a magnetic wand to pull magnetic number chips from a bowl and creating equations as they do so. The game includes sixty regular number chips (six each 0-9) and ten "gold-rimmed Magic Jewel" number chips (0-9).

On a turn, a player has 30 seconds in which to create an equation. Players must pull chips from the cauldron one at a time and state the equation as they draw each chip, although they can change the equation in mid-play if they can't find the number they need or come across better chips. Equations are created strictly from left to right, ending with the sum or product of the equation with the operators mentally added by the active player. (A variant for math fiends suggests following the order of operations instead of reading the equation from left to right.)

If a player drops a chip while drawing it from the bowl or fails to create an equation before time runs out, then the player returns all chips to the bowl and ends his turn. Otherwise, he keeps all chips used in his equation.

Math-A-Kazam! ends once all the chips have been claimed or no more equations can be created. Each normal chips is worth one point; each Magic Jewel chip worth two. The player with the most points wins.

name: 4Up!
description:
4Up! Silly Animals Card Game - deal 4 cards to each player and lay 4 cards out on the table. Take turns matching cards from your hand with cards on the table. Add math and you’ve got a challenge game perfect for kids 5 and up. Deal 4 cards to each player and lay 4 down. Match 1 card in your hand with 1 or more cards on the table that add up to the number of the card in your hand. For example, if you have a 9 in your hand you can pick up a 9 from the table or you can pick up a 7 and a 2 or a 5 and a 4 or any combination that adds up to the number of the card in your hand. The player with the most cards wins!

Components:

48 cards
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Math

name: Hive Mind
description:
The Hive Mind has invaded! Two to five Humans must do battle with this alien invader to save themselves and the world. But be careful! The Hive Mind could Infect you, and force you to fight against your former friends!

The Hive Mind is a semi-cooperative card game for three to six players. One player uses the Hive Mind deck to fight the other players, who start the game as Humans with Human decks. Human decks are split down the middle to have a Human side and an Infected side.

The Hive Mind will try to attack the Humans' mental and physical health. Once a Human's mental health is zero and his or her physical health is three, he or she becomes Infected. An Infected character uses the Infected half of his or her cards to battle the remaining Humans and spread the infection!

Humans win if they locate the Hive and manage to kill the Hive Mind. The Hive and Infected players win if all Human players have been Infected.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fighting, Horror, Science Fiction
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Boo
description:
The goal is to reach the exit before Sweet Little BOO gets upstairs. Who will succeed? Laura, Elliot, Albert, Rose, Alec, or Fixela? Together or by themselves, all your family members can engage in this exciting race!

In this Chutes and Ladders style game, with each roll of the dice, some players will move faster, some will have to step back, others will discover secret passages, but everyone will have fun, and your only wish will be to play again!

name: The Army Game
description:
The Army Game is based on the British TV comedy show of the same name.

Up to four players take the roles of the Boys of Hut 29 who are conscripts attempting to abscond from an army camp and get into places of entertainment in nearby Itchwick, located around the edge of the board. A fifth player takes the role of Sergeant Major Snudge who tries to catch the Boys. Any Boy who is caught must go to the detention centre (The Glasshouse) in the centre of the board. If all of the Boys get into places of entertainment at the same time, they win. Sergeant Major Snudge wins if all of the Boys are in The Glasshouse at the same time.

The game is played via roll-and-move, and there are chance cards for each building, as well as for the Boys and Snudge.

name: Freddy vs. Jason Forest of Fear Game
description:
Theme:
Freddy vs. Jason Forest of Fear Game is a collector's edition game with high-quality 3D miniatures! Play as 3 frightening incarnations of the two most horrifying movie villains of all time! Includes everything you need to play!

Gameplay:
Challenge friends to slay the most victims over multiple rounds of play in an easy-to-learn but difficult-to-master game of strategic movement!

Goal:
The goal of the game is to kill the most victims.

Contents:
Comes with everything you need to play, including: 6x Collectible 3D Miniatures 12x Game Tiles 12x Victim Tokens 1x Folding Game Board Note: Not compatible with HeroClix games.

name: Das kleine Feinschmeckerquiz
description: A small trivia game about fine food and gourmets; with 100 questions and answers. The game itself is like a notebook (with spiral binding). Each page contains 2 questions and 4 nswers, the back side contains the correct answers with additional information.

name: Peur sur Irka
description:
The planet Irka has been devastated by a worldwide war. Only 5 cities remain, each protected by a force field powered by a nuclear reactor. Each player must destroy the opposing cities' generators while protecting her own.

The game uses a standard card deck. Each turn, players move their forces on the board, then attack enemy territory. Combat strength is computed by adding the number of fighting pieces, the point value of a random card and another card from the the player's hand; highest combat strength wins and can occupy the defender's position, the defender withdraws to an adjacent position, or is eliminated if retreat is impossible. If a player has a pair in her hand, she can play it to gain additional advantages (for example a pair of threes allow a player to take control of an opponent piece for this combat).

The game was published in Casus Belli magazine, issue #24: Casus Belli (Issue 24 - Feb 1985)

name: The Touch:  Farm Animals Expansion Pack
description:
Expansion for The Touch

In The Touch, plastic playing pieces (landmarks such as the Eiffel tower, objects such as a roller skate or a hamburger) are placed inside a plastic dome while cards containing sets of these figures (i.e. "Paris Landmarks") are placed around the dome. In turn, players will place their hand in the dome and attempt to locate (by feel only) pieces matching those pictured on the card that was overturned. Points are awarded for pieces drawn and sets collected with victory going to the player earning the most points.

The Farm Animal Expansion adds a new themed set of 12 pieces (cow, horse, goat...) and 6 cards to add variety to the base game. The base game is required in order to use this expansion.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Supermundial
description:
Soccer simulation published on the 5th of July, 1982 by the Italian weekly newsmagazine Panorama. Counters cover all the teams taking part in the World Cup in these same days.
The game is a classical simulation with hex-grid map, counters with attack and movement scores, charts for the results of confrontations and actions. The attack points have been awarded by a pool of famed Italian sport journalists.

name: Conducteur
description:
Translation from back of the box:

The board game CONDUCTEUR aims to familiarize the players with the road safety code and the laws that govern it. The situations presented correspond to the reality that drivers and future drivers will face.

The goal of each player is: get the least possible offense due to his negligence or imprudence for they result in the accumulation of demerit points and expensive fines . The player thus becomes well aware of the benefits of driving with vigilance and attention.

Eight (8) players can take part in the game. They receive initially a driver's license with 0 demerit points. The player who accumulates 15 demerit points will have his license revoked and will be removed from the game. Whoever ends the game with the best record will win.

From the outset, all drivers are insured under a policy of "basic liability insurance" covering damage to their vehicle when they are the victims of an accident for which they are not responsible for, covering the damage to others.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Crisloid 5 Game Set
description:
Crisloid Plastics 5 Game Set is a collection of dice and two dice cups for 5 different dice games.

Has a total of 25 d6 dice for the following games:
- 10 Pin Bowling (10 dice with a bowling pin on 1 face, 5 sides blank)
- Poker (5 dice with 10, 10, J, Q, K, Spade)
- Jack-Pot (3 dice with Bell, Lemon, Orange, Bar, Lime, Cherry)
- 5 regularly numbered dice (has rules for Craps)
- Put & Take (2 dice with A, 1, 2, 3, 3, 4 on 1 and T, T, T, P, P, P on the other).

Put and Take is a betting game where each player puts in equal amount into the pot. You then roll the dice and you put or take the number rolled. If you roll a T and an A, you take all from the pot and win.

Jack-Pot has a payout table in the rules that pays for certain rolls. For example 3 bars pays out 20 to 1, while bar-lemon-cherry equals a free roll.

name: LaserGrenadiers
description:
subtitled: "wargaming rules for 28mm science fiction miniatures" this is one of several rules-sets introduced by small/independent companies to allow gamers to play miniatures games in a more realistic "science fiction" setting, rather than the "science fantasy" setting that a leading miniatures gaming company adopted.

B&W ringbound rulebook

name: Rack Your Brains
description:
Rack Your Brains is an amusing and educational quiz game with questions at three skill levels for all ages from 7 years to adult.

It can be played by 2 - 6 people individually or in teams of two or more in any age combination.

Players must answer questions correctly throughout the game, collect six Heads of Knowledge, and win be being the first to journey to the Centre of The Brain.

This game is very similar to Trivial persuit. Players answer questions to move,collect "heads" (wooden playing pieces) and then travel to the centre of the board to win when enough "Heads" have been collected (Six).

name: Party de famille
description:
Music, dance, laughter. What a mood! What a party! Here's your goal: gather as many guests as possible to your family party. Try to create that party atmosphere that only key guests can create, like Gerard and his guitar, or by combining the trainer and his animals. It would not be so difficult if it wasn't for your opponents who will do everything in their power to break your party. Party de famille is a card game with 4 players, played in teams of 2. Overall, try your luck, start your invitations for the best family party ... and let the fun begin!

This is a trick-taking card game. You must bet on how many trick-taking you can make in a round to make points. If you and your partner get it right, you get to count ambiance points, which consist of card combinations, as well as trick-taking points. If you got it wrong, your opponents get the ambiance points.

The game end when a team reaches 200 points.

name: De Pre Historie Quiz
description:
De Pre Historie Quiz is a Trivia game played with a cd containing a huge amount of music fragments en about 200 questions about music hits. The first one to complete his compact disc playboard is winner.

Every player has his own compact disc made of 8 pieces, like slices of a pie. There are 8 categories of questions and you have to get one question correct in every category to complete your compact disc and win the game.
The 8 categories are:
Music Title -> where the player must name the title of a song
Music Artist -> where the player must name the artist of a song
Music Country -> where the player must name the country of origin of the artist
Music Title + Artist -> where the player must name both title and artist of the song
Trivia Time -> where the player must know the year a certain event happened
Trivia Name -> where the player must name the main person in a certain event
Trivia Country -> where the player must name the place where a certain event happened
Trivia Name and Country -> where the player must name both the main person as the place of a certain event

There are two dice: One with the options Music or Trivia. And another one with the 4 subcategories. The dice decide what fragment/song is played and what question to answer.

name: Aircraft Recognition Cards
description:
A very unusual offering from Pepys. They were commisioned by the Observer Corps as an aid to help sevicemen to recognise different aircraft. There were two sets printed, one with 52 cards and a joker with silhouettes of aircraft and the cards marked with R, O, B, G (to stand for Red, Orange, Blue and Green suits). The second set was still 52 cards plus a joker but this used photographs of aircraft.
Pepys saw a marketing advantage and printed rules to use the cards as a game.
The games suggested were: Pelmanism, Snap, Banker, Happy Families, Rummy, and Clock Patience.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Children's Game, World War II

name: 108th Kentucky Derby
description:
A simulation of re-racing the 108th Kentucky Derby. Cards for all 32 horses that were eligible are included. Unusually, this seems to have been published before the real race was run, so the designer suggests that you could run the race more accurately after the horses are entered in real life.

Movement is by rolling dice and then looking at a chart on the back of each horse's card. On the back of the card, each horse has a set of target numbers for each quarter of the track. Dice are rolled and if you roll one of those numbers, the horse advances. If you don't, the horse doesn't move. Eight(8) horses are in each race, the players divide up the 8 horses.

As 32 horses are provided and only 8 run, you can play a series of 4 races, to use every horse once.

name: Scrabble Pocket Puzzle
description: Two 4 x 7 sliding-tile games, with a letter and point value on each tile. The goal is to achieve a high score by forming interlocking words both horizontally and vertically. Two boards allows for both solo and competitive play.

name: Ask Pickles
description:
A double-box with two games. Happy Families was one but the other was a quiz card game, associated with Wilfred Pickles (1900-1978). Pickles was a noted radio performer for 30 years, starting in the 40's. He is pictured on the box.
The game has 29 cards. Each card has questions on them, and a score that can be earned if you answer correctly; 5 points (yellow), 10 points (red) or 20 points (blue).
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: La guerra de los signos
description:
In this game, two spacecraft armies fight each other as they try to reach the earth first and conquer it.

Each army is composed by 6 combat modules, each one representing one of the signs of the zodiac, and a mothership. The motherships are able to shoot "disc missiles" but only only can move laterally along the gameboard's central circle, while the combat modules can move forward and feature an spring-based system that makes them "explode" in case one disc missile hits it's front.

At the start of the game, each combat module is placed over it's correspondent sign in the circle, and the motherships are placed in each side of the gameboard. The starting player moves one of his modules one square forward and then shoots his mothership. If he hits and destroys one of the other player's modules, he can advance one of his again, until he fails, ending his turn. The first to move one of his modules over the central square (The earth) wins the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Miniatures, Mythology, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame

name: Newmarket
description:
A card game that is similar to the traditional playing card game of Racing Demon. One player is the Bookmaker and offers odds on each of the horses in any one race.
For the race, cards are turned over and the horse named advances along the 'course'. And there are wild cards that affect the race; Jockey Falls, Little Brown Dog, Whip, and Spur.
There is no skill at all apart from betting wisely or, if you are the Bookmaker, offering the right odds so that you can make a profit

name: Große Sprünge: kleine Sprünge
description:
Goal: Be third on target to win

1. Each player chooses 2 (plastic) frogs (same colour)
2. Try to reach as quick as possible (rolling the dice by turns) the marked (dead) zone
3. Try to optimize (by dice) your position(s) for the final leap
4. Cross the target on third position
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: All About Albany
description:
The object of this game is for the players, using dice and playing pieces, to travel on the gameboard from a Residence Square to the shopping locations shown on their shopping lists. The first player to return to his residence with travel cards for all locations on his shopping list wins the game!

Game board is map of Albany, NY depicting roads, highways, places of interest, businesses and billboards. Businesses used this game as an advertisement. Came with coupons for businesses advertised.
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: All About Town, Inc., Windsor Publications

name: plus3
description:
Goal: Be the first who concentrates your meeples with a majority of 3 on one of the big yellow circuits

1. Each player places one of his/her coloured meeple on each big yellow circuit (16)
2. Move your meeples by turn along the small yellow circuits - jumping is not allowed; capacity on a small circuit: max 1 meeple; - on a big circuit: max 7 meeples
3. You win if the achieved majority is 3:0, 4:1 or 5:2

name: Buggy
description: Simple race game with the objective of being first to win the Rally.The pieces are nice, small cars (the Buggies in the title).

name: Read My Lips, Kid!
description:
Read My Lips! version for younger people where they have 20 seconds to "lip" words and sayings for everyone else to guess. Words are from 6 categories: Person, Place, TV/movie, Thing, Music, Saying. Sometimes easy, sometimes not so easy.

Be the first player to correctly guess two words/sayings in all six categories.

name: The Boater's Knot Tying Kit
description:
A game which efforts to educate and improve knot tying skills which are specific to boating.

The opponents attempt to tie the knot on the card drawn quicker than one another, without errors, using a painted wooden dowel and a length of rope. Whoever does so claims the points on the card.

A vast array of multiple-use knots for boating are illustrated on the cards: the anchor hitch; stevedore's knot; and mooring knots for bollards are a few examples...

It's primarily for educational purposes and is just as handy to keep in one's boat for a reference as it is as part of a game collection.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Educational, Nautical, Real-time

name: Squasp
description:
An action dexterity game. Each player has a plastic fly-swat. The wasps are scattered in the room and it is a race to see who can 'Squasp' the most wasps. The wasps are made in such a way that they will stick to the fly-swat easily.
Sold with the line;
"Just squash the wasp by his sting - swat the lot 'n' you'll be king"

name: irre genug: 120 verdrehte Begriffe und Quizfragen
description:
2 - 5 players (groups) struggle for finding correct terms first
Developed for educational purposes - but can be inspiring for gamers to short pauses in between game sessions;
'irre genug' is a card game issued by the Bundeszentrale für politische Bildung of Germany. The game has 60 cards, each one depicting two different terms, describing either institutions, items, professions, geographic areas or society. On each card you see skewed hints which may trigger some unused brain areas to find the correct solution
Goal: Collect 10 points - finishing first. (score 2/1 point(s) per proper answer)

1 Moderator draws one card and asks the question
2 Anyone may answer within 30 s - correct: 2 points
3 Moderator gives hint(s) - more detailed
4 Anyone may answer within 30 s - correct: 1 point
5 Moderator scores 2 points
6 Moderator changes

There are different variations for scoring players may choose in the beginning
Disadvantage: Due to number of drawing cards (60) limited suitability

name: Global Mega Brand
description:
GLOBAL MEGA BRAND is a game about investing and auctioning. Players must choose how much to invest and use their remaining money to bid on GLOBAL MEGA BRAND shops.

The object of the game isn't to make money, but to accrue the lion's share of market power by buying the right combination of shops. The highest number of points is awarded to a player who able to buy all shops of a particular brand.

name: Sexton Blake
description:
Modestly described as The Latest and Greatest of All Card Games. The pack of 60 cards, split into 4 'suits' of criminal gangs and a further suit representing the law. There are 12 cards in each suit. Each suit's cards are ranked in order, 10, 20, etc. with 120 being the highest. Sexton Blake, and his faithful sidekick Tinker, are the two most valuable law cards, as you would expect.
