The object is to collect sets of cards by winning tricks. Tricks are won absolutely normally (you must follow suit, if you can't then you may discard or play a trump (the law are the trumps).
After all the tricks have been won, each player separates the cards worth 80 or more from his tricks won, and the rest of the cards are put to one side except that, if you do not have as many cards as the player who has the most, you draw enough cards from those set aside, making all the hands equal in the number of cards to play.
In the second stage of the game, you continue trick-taking as before but the number of cards won is unimportant. What is important is that you are aiming to collect groups of 3, 4 or 5 cards of the same value.
Points are scored by having such sets, with each group scoring the value of the cards in the group. The winner is the one with the highest score after three rounds have been played.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Secrets and Symbols
description:
Is it possible that President Obama is not a natural-born American? Could someone you know be the next victim of organized organ theft? Should we be preparing? The Mayan calendar predicts the end of the world in 2012! You'll find all the theories, secrets, and legends revealed and explained in this exciting new game!
By rolling the die, players move around the continuous board answering questions on Secrets, Legends, Symbols, or Theories. Correct answers are rewarded with a card to keep and each of those cards has part of a symbol on the back. Collect all four parts to complete any of the symbols and you win the game.

There's bonus hidden treasure to collect from those that can't answer correctly. If you are lucky you get to deal witih, or steal from the other players! It's fast, it's fun, and just a little bit mysterious.

Contents:

300 cards in four categories
game board
6 playing pieces
1 die
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Home Toys and Games Inc., Imagination Games

name: Mercenary Commander (fan expansion for Risk 2210 A.D.)
description:
From the publisher's site:

Trickery and cunning are the main characteristics of this Commander. He always attacks with an 8-sided dice and can acquire new much needed MODs for your army. That is why he can be an excellent aid to your cause.

The card deck that becomes available to you after hiring this Commander consists of the following 20 cards:

Colony Influence x 4
Colony Influence x 3
Defensive Measures x 2
Dirty Death Trap x 2
Last Stand x3
Minefield x 2
Paratroopers x 1
Changing Allegiance x 3

The Mercenary Commander is great and cheap way for gathering new MODs for offense and defense. Also he has a few special tricks that can completely catch the opponent off his guard. He is best used in combination with the Diplomat and Nuclear Commadners.

This Command Deck makes a great addition to Risk 2210 A.D. and provides more hours of fun.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Coodju Lite
description:
Coodju Lite is an elegant adaptation of Coodju, reduced in complexity to appeal to the age-impaired, but not reduced in play value.

Spelling With A Twist game designed especially for kids. Using the Coodju Lite Spinner, children will spin their way through fun and zany Spelling Twists like Forwards, Vowels, Consonants and the all-new First & Last Letter. Coodju Lite has 2 different spelling levels, colorful play variations and other surprises make it spell "f-u-n" for everyone!

You and your friends split into teams and battle each other for points by spelling words you use all the time in some bizarre and crazy ways.
The first team to collect all 5 of their Twist Cards wins the game!
categories: Children's Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: Lenny the Lion's Treasure Hunt
description:
Players must collect 1 treasure from each 'cave'. Each cave has 4 cards but only the top one is revealed. When a player collects his treasure, he may take the revealed card or the face-down card beneath it. Once you have a Treasure, you must get to 'Home', where it safe. On your journey home, you can be landed on by another player, who then gets you Treasure from you.
Movement is by a die or you can choose to move 2 spaces without a die roll.
The first player to collect 1 Treasure from each cave wins.

name: Colomino Card Game
description:
52 cards, each card having a number of squares within it. The object is to win sets, by obscuring your opponent's colour and leave as many cards visible as you can, featuring your colour.
The game is for two players but can be played with 4 or 6 players as a team game.
Four games are explained - Sideways, Fourways, Threeways and Domino.

name: Stak-A-Stik
description:
A dexterity game where you add sticks to the base without spilling any (the opposite to Jenga type games). The rules say that this game has become a craze in America especially amongst medical staff!
The number of stiks you get depends on how much you paid for the game. This ranged from 1 shilling to 10 shillings and sixpence.
A number of game rules are provided. The titles of these games are:
Patience
More and More
Twos
The Time Limit
Pairs
Foursome
Quickfire
Stak-Em
Overlap
Cullars

name: The Physog Family
description:
After Waddy had success with their first Physogs game, they decided to make this children's version. The face features are now interchangeable rather than sectioned horizentally in the adult version of the game.
Players must collect features and build-up a face. Much humour that the children will appreciate. In effect, they are collecting sets in a traditional game like Happy Families but this is far more entertaining for a bright child.

name: Tránsitos
description:
Can you imagine how it would be managing the traffic in the city of Valencia?
In this game your goal is to generate traffic and keep the traffic flowing during the day and guaranteeing the rest of the neighbors during the night.

The goal is to keep traffic in the owned districts in the first round and to avoid it in the second round, because each traffic cube in your district in the first phase adds 1 point to your score, but in the second phase it makes you lose one point.

The game has two phases, each one divided in 4 rounds, when the first phase is completed first scoring occurs. In each round each player drafts 4 district cards, and
assigns each district card to an action. These actions determine how the traffic is moved through the city. After second phase, the final scoring occurs.

Awards

2011 Accesit. V Concurs Ciutat de Granollers de Creació de Jocs


___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Juego de gestión de tráfico de la ciudad de Valencia donde lo más importante es mantener el tráfico en tus distritos por el día y por la noche conseguir el descanso de los vecinos.

El juego consta de dos fases, cada una de ellas tiene 4 rondas donde cada jugador roba 4 cartas de distrito asociando cada carta de distrito a una acción, esto determinará como el tráfico es movido por los distritos.

Durante la primera fase suman puntos todo el tráfico en tus distritos pero en la segunda fase el tráfico se volverá en tu contra y te restará puntos.

Premios

2011 Áccesit. V Concurs Ciutat de Granollers de Creació de Jocs
mechanics: Area Movement, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Organized Chaos
description:
Organized Chaos is a fast, fun, and exciting game that pits you against your opponents with one simple objective: Don’t run out of all your cards. However, don’t be fooled by the simple objective! You will be tested in many ways, and perhaps if you make smart moves and think strategically then you will emerge victorious. Accomplishing the objective will be much harder than it seems, especially since you are racing against opponents that have every reason to prevent you from reaching your objective so that he or she may win the game. Think you are winning big time? Seconds later you are losing horribly. Got a strategy you think works every time? Not so much. Prepare for excitement and disappointment, structure and disarray, this is Organized Chaos!

Everyone starts the game with one card in their hand. A token marks each players draw pile because it is very likely that one or more may end up face up at some point in the game. During a turn a player draws one card, giving them two in their hand. Each card has two sides, each with a different ability. The player may choose which card to play and which side of the card to invoke. Most cards have a side that is offensive and one that is defensive. For example, the most common type of card has Burn on one side and Refresh on the other. Burn allows you to choose an opponent and they must "Burn" or place the top X cards from their draw pile directly in their discard pile. Whereas, Refresh let's you take the top X cards from your discard pile on the bottom of your draw pile in any order.

There are also special cards that let you do things like flip yours or an opponents draw pile face up so everyone sees what their next card will be, another that lets you switch your entire deck with one of your opponents. There are several other cards that do similarly things to turn the game upside down. Use them all to your advantage to force your opponents' to lose all their cards and you will be the last one standing!

See our website for official rules updates or to purchase this and other Van Ryder Games.

name: Hurry-Up Misfitz
description:
A set collection game with some of the finest card illustrations. 72 cards making 24 pictures cut into three parts.
Each player is given 12 counters. Everyone now puts 5 counters into the 'Pool' and receives cards, leaving half the pack as a 'reserve'.
The player sitting left of the dealer starts and must play the first card of any set, if he has one. The next player plays a second card to the set started by the player to his right, if he has such a card. And so on, until a full set of three cards is revealed. The player playing the third part of the set (actually, called a trick in the rules), and must now start a new set if he can. There are penalties for a player not playing a card when he should or if the wrong picture is completed and so on. If you genuinely cannot play a card, you draw a card from the reserve.
Interestingly, for a game of this age, you can score bonus points for certain tricks or negative bonuses for some tricks.
For example, completing the Baby set takes 5 counters from the pool and one counter from every other player, or completing the Horse Omnibus set pays three counters into the pool, and so on.
The player taking the most tricks when all 24 sets have been completed takes the remaining counters in the pool and the player now with the most counters, wins the game.

name: Top Club Soccer
description:
A Monopoly type game (roll the dice, move round the board, but this game is set in the world of football.
Contents - the box says 'This box contains one playing board and approximately 450 components'.
Each player has the objective to take his team from the 3rd Division to the 1st Division and then to win the title. There are numerous cards such as, Press Report, Disciplinary Hearing, Result, that sort of thing.
The idea is to buy players who are good in the Division you are currently in, and improve the team's performance. The track on board is octagonal and six sides relate to week-days and two sides relate to Saturday morning and afternoon. On that afternoon you collect gate receipts when you pass the square designated for that purpose. This improves as you rise up the divisions. Also in this section, you can choose to earn 1 point for your match (the game was a draw) or you can purchase a Result card and take your chances.
The designers were two British footballers, quite well-known.
publishers: David Nish and Roger Davies Productions

name: Short Stack
description:
Short Stack is a traditional stacking style game, where players move, assemble, and disassemble stacks in the game, adopted to an 8x4 game board. In Short Stack, a player's most powerful stack is always at risk of being eliminated every turn.

This game is one in the Games on Half a Checkerboard Series, which are a series of games created by Richard Hutnik.

name: Words of the Wise
description:
Do your ABC's like you've never done before! Turn your ABC's into a hilarious and challenging game. Pick up a category card from the deck and think fast to find the words to match--alphabetically!

A, B, C might be easy,- see if you can get to X, Y, Z!
There are multiple ways to play. Try it on your own, go head to head, or compete in teams. Pick the one that best suits your group.

Object is to be the first player or team to reach the targeted point value.

Players pick up a card from the top of the deck. Each player in clockwise succession gives a word in alphabetic order (A to Z) relating to the category.
If a player gets stumped they are eliminated from this round. Last player standing wins the points posted on the card. If all players get stuck on one letter, the topic
is discarded and another topic is chosen.

Contents:

101 Category Cards
24 Wise Alec Cards

name: Crossword Dominoes
description:
Not a domino game despite the title.
49 cards, each with a syllable on. The idea is to make the syllables link together to form as many words as you can crossword-fashion.
Each player gets an equal number of cards and a set time to make their personal crossword.
There is also a 1 player diversion where you must make a complete crossword using all 49 cards. The answer is provided.

I have left the original description untouched as presumably the author is talking about the US version and one of the three games they have using the pieces. My version is the Wellingtons Limited version which is just the one game. The pictures show the dominoes as I have them - 96 with either one or two letters on. The way they are played is domino like though you can play multiple dominoes in a single placement if it makes a word and links to the grid. The visual effect is crossword like as the domino ends without letters are matt black.

There is no time limit and each player plays on the same "crossword" as per dominoes.

name: Massive Multiplayer Rock, Paper, Scissors
description:
This game is rock, paper, scissors adjusted so it would work with a crowd of players. This game is playable in a minute or less. Familiarity with normal 2 player rock, paper, scissors is expected to understand these rules. Here are the rules:

How to play:
1. All players simultaneously select rock, paper, scissors and reveal.
2. For each other player a player beat, they score a point (rock beats scissors, scissors beats paper, paper beats rock), they score a point.
3. After all players be scored, then determine which player has the high score. If there is one player with the highest score, then that player is the winner. If there are two player tied for high score, they play regular two player Rock, Paper, Scissors.
4. If there are more than two players tied for high score, then eliminate all players who are not tied, reset scores, and repeat these steps until there is either two or less players left.

Ending the game:
Game ends when there are two or less players left. If down to two players, then these two players play normal rock, paper, scissors.

name: In the Chips: San Francisco
description: Welcome to San Francisco, the "City By The Bay'! You'll soon be traveling on the streets of San Francisco, earning an income, buying a car, buying a home, and making investment decisions. You'll also have the choice of getting an advanced degree (as well as salary increases) by getting an education Naturally, you can succeed or fail; just like reality, some of the decisions are up to you! The object of the game is to negotiate your way through the city and make your wealth through proper management of your income in home purchases and business investments. The game ends when every player completes the trip and all cash and investments are totaled. The player with the most money is the winner. - 2 to 6 Players - Ages 10 to Adult - First published in 1980.

name: Magicus
description:
Every child plays as a magician who must make a lot of rabbits to disappear.
Each player has a small pile of wooden blocks in different colors (with a printed rabbit in every block). The difference between the player's piles are the order of the colors (the piles are made according tho a initial distribution that is different for each player).
A lot of magician's hats as placed in center of the table. Each hat has a color in his base that can be see only if you lift the hat.
The goal is to find the hat that matches the color of your top most rabbit tile, what means you can take this tile from your pile and try to find the next corresponding hat to the next rabbit and so on, until a player vanishes all his rabbits.

name: Rock N' Broc
description:
As rock n' roll fans players are collectors of rock items.

Rock N' Brock is an auction card game with a fun cooperative mechanic.

each round, players bid for a set of 3 items (posters, clothes, musical instruments, ect..), trying to collect several items of the same kind to earn the most victory points at the end.

the board is made of 3 row of 2 "slots" (cards) and each player at his turn make an offer and place his bid on a slot of one of the 3 rows.
Players can (sometimes are forced to) bid with another player in a cooperative auction in the same row.
once players have placed their bids on one slot they can't move to another row but they can increase their bids until everybody stop.
then the row with the highest bid win the 3 items and some gold.

If the auction was cooperative, the winners share themselves the goods (see rules).

The game ends when the deck is empty.

name: Nursery Rhymes
description:
52 cards being 13 sets of four cards. The cards depict a character from a nursery rhyme (consisting of three cards, the feet, the head and the middle). The 4th card in a set is the rhyme itself. Further the cards have regular playing card symbols so you could look for all four like cards (for example, Ride a Cock Horse cards are all 4's) and, as an alternative, you could use the deck as a normal deck of cards.

Play is a mixture of Happy Families and Rummy. In his turn, a player may lay down a set of 4, or he may take the face-up card from the discard pile, or he can draw a face-down card from the deck, or he can ask for a card he believes another player has. Whatever he does, he must maintain a hand of seven cards after his turn has ended.

name: Spin and Old Maid
description:
49 cards. There are six races (suits) - British, Turkish, Indian, Choctaw, Negro, Japanese. Each race has 8 ranked cards, starting with The Baby and ending with The King. The cards are also numbered from 1 to 8.
Each player gets 6 counters. Take out the Old Maid card as it is not used in the main game. Then the cards are dealt out to each player but an extra hand should also be dealt. This extra hand should remain face down and kept out of the game. Therefore, a few cards are not in play so will cause 'Stops' as the game proceeds.
The first player plays a card and announces its number and race. The next player must play the next card in rank for that race if he has it. If he doesn't then he says "I pass". There will probably come a point when the next highest card is not in play because all players will pass. In this case the player who played the last card, plays to the next round of play.
The Japanese Baby is a special card that allows the player to play it after he has just added a legal card, crying "Spin" as he does so. This means that the card he last played becomes a stop.
The game stops when one player has run out of cards. There are various rewards and forfeits and the player with the most counters wins.
Rules are included for the main game and two variants, Pool Spin and Old Maid (the publisher having added an Old Maid card for this version).

name: LagunaOpoly
description:
A Custom Monopoly Board Game for Laguna Beach, California.
The object of LagunaOpoly game is to become the wealthiest resident of Laguna Beach by buying, operating, and selling local businesses. The game ends when all but one Enterpriser has gone broke. This remaining player is the WINNER of the game.

Contents:

1 Game board
28 Business ownership deeds
16 Risk cards
16 Laguna treasure cards
16 Plastic hotels
28 Plastic houses
1 Set of money
4 Bowling pin pawns
2 Standard 6-sided dice
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Sicher ans Ziel
description:
Pass safely through the traffic! Policeman Paul help players: There are many different picture cards to for close examination. Whoever assesses the traffic situation correctly will move ahead. Traffic lights, zebra crossings, footpaths and road game - this game teaches children how to behave in traffic and gain independence.

---

German Box Back
Sicher durch den Verkehr! Polizist Paul hilft spielerisch dabei: Viele verschiedene Bildkarten regen zum genauen Hinsehen an. Wer die Verkehrs-Situationen richtig einschätzt, kommt gut voran. Ampel, Zebrastreifen, Fußweg und Spielstraße - mit diesem Spiel lernen Kinder das richtige Verhalten im Verkehr und gewinnen an Selbstständigkeit

name: F.I.L.O
description:
This is game #6 in the Games on Half a Checkerboard Series.

F.I.L.O is a sowing game like those in the Mancala family. Unlike games normally found in the Mancala family, F.I.L.O uses a first in, last out (FILO) mechanism for sowing pieces on the board, which is the basis of its name. This mechanism, combined with the attributes of the 8x4 board, takes F.I.L.O in directions not normally seen with games in the Mancala family.

name: Knight Barricades
description:
This is game #10 in the Games on Half a Checkerboard Series

This game is in the family of games that includes Amazons, and Slimetrail where the object is to cause one's opponent to not be able to move due to the number of spaces available on the board gets reduced as players play the game. Each player has a piece that has a move like a Chess Knight and also put down barricades to restrict movement. From these two elements comes the name of the game.

name: "Oosehe"?
description:
A card game featuring lovely images of animals.Each player chooses a different animal, from the 8 listed on the Key Card.
Cards are dealt out and kept by each player in a face-down stack. In his turn, a player must turn over the top card. If it matches any other face-up card, both players with the now matching cards must call "Oosehe"?, and name the animal now revealed. The first to do so, claims the matching cards plus all the cards beneath it.
The rules are a little strange in that you are asked to call the name as listed on the Key Card but as this name is also on the cards, players could just read the card itself. Maybe Victorian children found these animals exotic and not instantly recognisable.
The name of the game is pronounced "Oose he?", as rhyming with the phrase "Whose He?"

name: Sefite
description:
A rare card game for the late Victorian era. For once, it is not a Snap, Happy Families or Old Maid variant.
The cards have a fair amount of text on them (see images), not just the naval illustration. I am assuming that cards are revealed and interaction takes place between the different kinds of vessels now on view. The Battleship can protect 'Simple cards' drawn against a Destroyer. The Cruiser is a 'Simple card' itself and needs the protection of the Battleship. And other ships have their 'rules', the Destroyer, the Merchantman and the Torpedo Boat. A Victorian boy must have been thrilled with this game, with its military links.
By the way, the odd title is intended to be pronounced 'Sea-Fight'.

name: Gonna get Yer
description:
This is a simple roll and move game. Up to four players try to get their three pieces all the way around the board, avoiding the monster on the way.

The monster travels a track around the middle of the board. He doesn't move until the first six is rolled, after which he will move every time the dice is rolled BEFORE the player who rolled the dice moves the same number of spaces.

Players can choose to travel the shorter dangerous path, or take safer longer routes, so there is a small amount of risk management involved.

The game makes use of a "popper" built into the centre of the board that is depressed to roll the dice.

From the back of the box:

A fun and tense family game for 2 to 4 players. Can you get round the board without getting eaten by the monster? One false move and the monster's gonna get yer!

CONTENTS:
Playing board with centre dice-popper.
12 playing pieces (three each in four colours).
Monster.
Instructions leaflet.

name: Early Words
description:
A simple word game in which you make words of four letters or more using 112 letter cards.

Cards are drawn from a deck, until someone can make a word. The player sets that word aside and it will count towards his or her final score. Play then continues in the same manner, but if someone can create a new word by adding newly drawn letter cards to a word someone else has already made, then that word is stolen. More complicated words are harder to make but are more difficult to steal.

The first player to make a prearranged number of words (either by making them with "free" letters from the card deck or by adding to words already in play, thereby stealing them), is the winner.

From the box:

Deriving from one of the oldest word construction games, Early Words is the fastest, the most skilful and the most cunning.

name: Capt'n Sharky: Messer werfen
description:
From the back of the box:

The blades will get stuck in the planks of the deck, but the pirates need great skill to throw their knives in an empty space. If you hit a space that is already occupied, it is the next players turn. Who is the first one to get all his knives stuck in the wooden deck?

A safe game with a magnetic knife that demands instinctive feeling.

name: Il gioco di Tangentopoli
description:
Tangentopoli is a trivia game about the history of bribes, corruption, scandal, intrigue, mafia, terrorism was born as a result of the political scandal happened in Italy in the first '90.
It consists of a competition culture to reach the Great Contract (the last box of the track).
Wins the first player exceeds the 47 boxes of the path by responding to questions from time to time for commentary, history, cinema, literature, sports and journalism.
The feature of this game is that it can move forward on the path without actually knowing the answers, just pay a bribe to an opposition player who is able to respond to your seat.
But not enough. After the finish line as winner of the race has yet to undergo the final survey which rewards the competitor who has not made use of bribes.
Contents of the box:
1 board
over 500 questions
60 fiches
1 die
6 pawns/puzzle
rules

name: Stumps
description:
Stumps is a new and exciting 20-20 cricket card and dice game.

Pick your team, choose your favourite players, friends or even family. Win the toss and decide whether to bat or bowl.

Bat and decide on when to attack and when to defend. Be aware attacking can lead to losing wickets but play too defensively and your score might not be good enough.

Read the bowler's tactics and anticipate the next delivery.

Bowl tactically to restrict runs and take wickets. Bowl a good length or bowl short, and decide wisely when to use wicket taking deliveries such as Yorkers or Slower balls.

Play one-versus-one or in a group to create the ultimate team.

[Description taken from rear of game box]

name: Campionissimi Super Goal
description:
This game simulates a football match.
Each player builds his own team by buying pieces until you reach the number of points determined at the beginning of the game.
Each piece has a different buying value. Pieces are marked on the values ​​of defense, attack, movement and power of the player that they represent.
It possible deploy its own team in the field with the classic patterns of football: 3-5-2, 4-4-2, 4-3-3 (defenders-midfielders-forwards).
A match lasts two periods of 16 rounds for a total of 32 rounds.
There is also a deck of cards to use in contrast, to determine if any foul actions.
Components of the game:
1 board;
68 pieces players divided into two teams;
72 card comparison;
2 pieces ball;
1 die;
regulation

name: The N Game
description:
The N Game pits players against each other in a race to the Nitrogen cycle finish line.

Players move their Nitrogen (N) tokens on the game board through the various “pools” (chemical forms) of the Nitrogen Cycle and back to the starting N2 pool. When one player has moved three of his/her N tokens through the cycle and back to N2, the game is over, and total scores determine the winner.

To move Nitrogen, players draw and play cards representing soil bacteria and the resources that these bacteria need. They also draw event cards. Event cards can affect the active player, another player, or the entire game.

This game was developed at The University of Wisconsin-Madison through funding from the Engage program to teach the Nitrogen cycle to university soil science students, as well as high school students.
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Point to Point Movement

name: Troika
description:
Legend tells of a square island where ancient tribes built 9 temples to 3 gods named Tiki, Taki and Troika. Every summer solstice the neighboring island clans send their finest warriors to the island to compete in a tournament. The first warrior to control three temples in a row will receive the Crown of Three. And his people will rule all of the island clans for the following year.

In Troika (aka Tiki, Taki, Troika) warriors secretly choose Temple cards and Challenge cards in an attempt to control temples on the legendary square island. Temple cards are simultaneously revealed and if there is a conflict at that location, Challenge cards are revealed and resolved. Since Challenge cards do not move back to a warrior's hand until all four have been played, it would be wise to remember what the other warriors have played in previous rounds.

Troika includes three versions of the game.
Tiki - A simple and fast version of the game where the winner is the first player to get three in a row.
Taki - Introduces Bonus Row cards that are randomly chosen at the beginning of the game. Plus the game continues until all nine temples are controlled.
Troika - Introduces Temple Bonus cards. During the game players have the opportunity to take Temple Bonus cards that can increase, or possibly decrease their score at the end of the game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Pattern Building, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Wort für Wort
description:
From the box:
How is "pirate" written? Put the correct letter with the appropriate word to your picture. How many characters you may place, will show you the cheeky parrot on the turntable. Whether you've written the word correctly or not, you can check the image back to control yourself. Thus, children acquire reading skills in a fun way.

Clear 5 pictures to win. Can be any number, that is predetermined.

Each turn players turn the parrot spinner to see what symbol cards and how many they can place.
Then they have to choose a litter cards from their hand to complete the word (picture) in front of them. You have to look pictures and symbols. Sometimes spinner shows you another picture, then you add another picture card next to the one you already have. First player to complete 5 pictures is the winner.

name: Pokémon: Les Champions de Hoenn
description:
From the back of the box (translated from the original French):

"Catch all your favorite Pokémon and become the best Pokémon Trainer! The box of Pokémon: Les Champions de Hoenn contains four different card games to discover with your parents or your friends. You will be able to catch the most famous Pokémon of the Hoenn region, (but also Pokémon from other regions) and finally initiate your parents to the secrets of Pokémon!

"Four games for the best trainers to play with your family or friends!

Les Champions de Hoenn box contains a deck of 60 cards and a reference poster. There 7 cards of each of 7 colors (Pokémon types), plus 18 gray Pokémon cards.

The four games you can play with these cards are:

Le jeu des familles (the family game). A variation of Go Fish for 3 to 5 players where your goal is to gather all the Pokémon of one color, asking for Pokémon by name.

Le memory-la chasse aux Pokémon (Memory-the hunt of Pokémon). A variation on the memory game for 2 to 4 players, where you try to uncover the 2 or 3 cards that represent a Pokémon and its evolutions.

La bataille-l'arene Pokémon (The battle-the Pokémon arena). A variation of War for 2 players.

Le jeu du Pokédex (The Pokédex game). An original game for 2 to 6 players where you have to decide what cards to play in order to draw more cards, and which cards to keep for scoring at the end of the game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Video Game Theme

name: Wer weiß es?
description:
Wer weiß es? - Das große Schul-Wissen-Spiel is a German language educational game for children pre-school and during elementary school.

The game map shows a school with several class rooms. The players use dice to walk to the class rooms to get question cards from the different areas (Reading, Writing, Language, Calculating, Geography, Nature, Traffic and School Court, for Level 3-4 also available English and History). If they answer a question correctly, they get point cards and a school certificate card.

In the basic version, the first player who has collected all school certificates has won. In the advanced version, players can collect additional points for helping others to answer questions and get additional markers for this.

The game map has two sides, one for elementary school level 1-2, the other for level 3-4. Four sets of questions corresponding to the school levels are available. In the advanced version (Lvl 3-4) they can additionally collect “happy” and “unhappy” teacher cards.

Game content:
Game map
44 point cards
40 school certificate cards
8 happy/unhappy teacher marker
4 “Schlaumeier” marker
4 wooden meeples
1 dice
Each Question sets must be bought extra. Four question sets are available (Level 1-4)

name: Knock Knock
description: Card Game. The cards are dealt out and the children playing are requested to use their cards to spell who might have gone "Knock! Knock!" on the door. Points are awarded for correct spelling.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Word Game

name: Take the Bait
description:
Welcome to Lake Wanapulachit!

Take the Bait is a light, Euro-style tile collection game featuring teams of four whimsical fishermen competing to bring in the biggest catch. Do you rely on sheer fishing talent, or do you break out the Banjooki 2000 Platinum-plated Turbo Reel to haul in the monster fish? The choice is yours!

Take the Bait plays up to four players, and features a game board laid out like a lake with the game sections arranged around the lake in a semi-circle. The players take on the roles of four fishing teams at a tournament, lead by some whimsical characters with special abilities from which the players can choose.

The game is divided into three days (rounds), with three turns each round. Players begin the first, third and sixth turns at camp, in tents. They visit the campground canteen and, depending on certain circumstances, choose a coffee for the day, which will determine their turn order. Of course, the coffee that gives the biggest kick allows a player to go first but it also costs the most. Then it's onto the tackle shop to buy some equipment - some items are mundane, but cheap, while others are a bit more special but may require players to spend more cash, which isn't easy to come by.

Next, it's time for fishing. According to certain character powers, equipment mixes, etc. the players take turns drawing fish (tiles) out of three areas of the lake. The area closest to shore is the easiest to fish in, but it's where all the smaller fish dwell. The middle body of the lake has some bigger fish but requires a pier license to reach. The third is the deepest and most costly in which to fish, but it's where the big daddies live, including one monster catfish that has never been caught and has fueled tall tales for years at the lake. Mixed into the tiles in each of the sections are also various bits of detritus such as old boots, lost bikinis and such that always seem to latch onto hooks during any fishing trip. They'll hurt your score at the end of the tournament, but some may very well be of use to someone if they, or an opponent, have a matching item...

Then there's the market, where fish can be sold for money to buy bigger equipment, or held until the end of the current day (round). The market prices fluctuate from day to day and there's a catch of the day that brings a bonus, so players will have to decide whether that fish is best kept for score or sold for cash.

The final station for each turn is the lodge where teams can hire a guide - an extra hand that will help them fish for the day. The guides get cheaper as the tournament draws to an end, so players will need to decide whether they pay a premium for that extra help in the beginning or save their money for one last push at the end. Teams can also check the weather for the next day while at the lodge, giving them a little insight at the weather patterns that could influence fish migration.

The next turns continue until the end of the day when there is a weigh in, which scores points for players. The player who has the most points at the end of three days wins!

Teams can also freely trade among themselves. This trading keeps the game lively and social, as players tempt each other to "take the bait."

name: Hui Buh: Die verflixte Gespensterjagd
description:
In Hui Buh: Die verflixte Gespensterjagd, Count Morticor has imprisoned the royal family and while the ghost Hui Buh has been covered with chains, you still have a chance to direct the ghost to help the family escape.

To set up the game the first time, players need to take the string included in the box and form a loop on one end while tying the other end to a plastic key. Before the game begins, the players shuffle the twelve dungeon tiles – seven of which are blank on both sides while five hide a member of the royal family – then place the tiles in the plastic grid in the box bottom.

On a player's turn, she tries to use the rope to maneuver the key into the slot on one of the dungeon tiles and pick it up, after which she can then look at the tile. If the tile is blank, she can return it to any empty spot in the grid and try to "fish" for a new dungeon tile. If she finds a member of the royal family, she keeps the tile and her turn ends. Meanwhile, the other players are rolling a die that bears the face of Count Morticor among many blank sides. Each time the Count appears, disturbed by the rattling chains persumably, the players grab one of seven ghost chips. If they grab all seven before the active player rescues a member of the royal family, that player's turn ends immediately.

Whoever rescues the most members of the royal family wins the game.

name: All About Greater White Plains
description:
In this "chamber of commerce" game players travel around White Plains, New York to the locations shown on their shopping lists. The first player to get home with a complete set of cards for all of the locations on their shopping list wins the game!

The board is six large jigsaw puzzle pieces. It features local businesses and tourist attractions. Players move along actual streets and highways in the area.

Includes the huge puzzle-board, 6 tokens, play money, cards, shopping lists, dice, and the rules.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Math'd Potatoes
description:
A math game filled with lots of family fun! Roll your dice trying to hit the required value so you can move ahead. If you fall behind, don't worry. There are several ways to "ketchup"! A great introduction to various math operations.

Players turn over a Math Challenge Card on their turn, and then roll dice to try to get a result that meets the requirements on the card. The Challenges have varied requirements; some require an exact number, and some allow an answer from within a range of numbers, while still others demand an answer that is even or odd.

On their turn, the player rolls dice, some with numbers and some with math operators (+ or -). Players must use all the dice in any order, so long as the number dice are separated by operator dice. If no solution is found, they may reroll some or all of their dice.

On numbered spaces, the Challenge must be solved in a number of attempts less than or equal to the number shown on the space. Some spaces picture a potato and are a "Hot Potato" zone, where any player may win. All players compete at the same time to see who can solve the Challenge first.

When someone wins a Challenge they roll a Number Die, move that many spaces, then take another turn. This continues as long as they are able to solve the Challenge, and passes clockwise when they can't.

When a player passes the Ketchup Packet marker, anyone who is behind gets to slide forward to the closest "Catch Up" space. The first player to reach the final space on the board is the "Sweet Potato" and wins the game.

WHAT THEY'LL LEARN: Problem Solving, Quick Thinking, Less Than, Greater Than, Addition & Subtraction

name: The London Post
description: Victorian card game. Set collecting using similar rules to the same company's Counties games. Each card relates to a London postal district. The sets are made up of different numbers of cards.

name: TV Play-along Wheel of Fortune
description:
The first handheld electronic device made to play Wheel. No puzzles are stored in the device's memory. Players could use the device during syndicated episodes from August 31, 1988 through "at least" September 1, 1990 to read puzzles directly from the television screen.

The device can be used to play using either of the two VHS tapes available. Point the device at the television set while the VHS tape is playing and the device will be programmed with a puzzle. Puzzles can also be programmed manually using the keyboard.

Up to three players can play the standard game that is based on the television series. There is also a "Jackpot" version for an unlimited number of players where the puzzle solver gets a jackpot that starts at $1,000 but is reduced $100 for every letter guessed. In either version, the winner is the person who has the most money after a predetermined number of puzzles.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game

name: Was ist Was: Junior – Feuerwehr
description: In Was ist Was - Junior: Feuerwehr, players are confronted with fire-fighting situations and asked which tool would be best. What's most important at a fire: a crane, a pump, or a cutter? What about when attending an automobile accident? The answers are on back of the challenge cards, and the game includes an information booklet about fire departments.

name: Il gioco della Melevisione
description:
A game about an Italian TV-series, the Melevisione. The main characters have lost their favourite objects and the players must help them to find back three, randomly chosen at the start of the game. The children roll and move on the board and visit some locations, each hiding 2 items (face-down tokens). When coming to a location, they may secretly look at those object tokens.
Some tiles have special powers, such as swapping places to tokens, getting free moves and so on.
Whenever a player thinks they know where each object is, they walk back to the starting place and show the locations of the three items. If they are right, they win. If not, they are out of the game.
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Ar Seizh Bigoudenn
description: Ar Seizh Bigoudenn (The Seven Bigoudens) is a card game where you have to be quick. It's a game about cooking "crepes" and "galettes" (large traditional pancakes from Brittany), with plenty of different things inside. Using appropriate tool cards (fork, knife, spoon...), you have to catch appropriate cards in the middle of the table to fill your galette. Tool cards are placed at the center of the game area when used, so that any player can catch it. But you can only have one card per hand... make your choices, but be quick !
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Collectible Components

name: Spartacus
description:
Spartacus is a wargame for 1 or 2 players simulating the Servile War of 73-71 BC. One of the players leads the forces of the escaped gladiator Spartacus, the other controls the Roman forces. The game also includes rules for solitaire play (in which case the game system controls the Roman side).

The game is played on a point-to-point map of Italy. Each point of the map has a set of numbers describing how many troops Spartacus can recruit there, how many equipment points are available (for arming and training recruits), how much food is available and if a granary is present in the region. Each game turn consists of moving Spartacus' army, collecting recruits, arming and training slaves, and checking whether or not there are enough supplies available in the occupied regions (if not, casualties occur and one or more regions is devastated). The Roman player then take her turn, moving legions and checking for reinforcements.

Combat is resolved by a diceless Combat Result Table which take into account the training level and quality of the troops, the terrain and the strategic value of the leaders.

Spartacus wins by either successfully besieging Rome, flee through the Alps or escape by the sea. The Roman player wins by preventing a Slave victory.

name: Ice Breaker
description:
Ice Breaker is a party game designed to allow people to get to know one another by answering simple personal questions (i.e. 'How many times did you have to take your driver's test?' or 'Have you traveled outside the USA?'). The game comes equipped with four mugs, each with a different color handle, a game board, and four matching color pawns. The mug handles each have a spinner built into them, dictating which question square on the game board your pawn moves to. First pawn to reach the center of the board wins. The game board doubles as a serving tray for the mugs.

From the box art:
Break the ice and liven up the party. "Ice Breaker," the fun game that opens the way to knowing everyone better. Spin the pointer and move the color matched pawns to the revealing questions on the game tray. Drink a toast to the winner and new-found friends.

Set Includes:

4-18 oz. Game mugs with Spinner Handles
1 Serving/Game Tray
4 Pawns

name: Ask Me Another
description:
The game is a spin-off from a TV show of the same name.
The chequered board has over 100 squares (in pretty lurid colours!) and each square has a letter D on it or a letter E. You throw the dice and move right to left and the square you land on dictates the question you will receive; E = Easy question, D = Difficult question. In the bottom right corner of every square there is a number. If you get your question right, you move forward that number of spaces. If you reach the end of any row on the board, you move down to the next row and continue moving along that row.
The game has a booklet with the rules and 1,000 questions and answers.

name: MiniMonFa: Baby Cthulhu Promo
description:
A truly fearsome foe has risen from the depths!

The Baby Cthulhu Promo for MiniMonFa is a new monster you can add to any existing Dungeon Deck.

It has the following stats:

Rooms: 2
Attack: 0
Defend: 0
Abilitites: 1
Sudden Death: All the Heroes entering the room die instantly, Cthulhu disappears and is discarded after having killed the heroes.

name: Von früh bis spät
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Seven o'clock, the alarm rings! Get up, little sleepyheads, or you'll miss the most exciting things.

In Von früh bis spät, the children will live through an entire day, from waking up to going to sleep – but only those who pay attention and remember the patterns they see will win the game! At the same time, the young players will get acquainted with the clock. This game collection contains multiple games of varying difficulties.

name: Familiengeflüster
description:
Familiengeflüster, which is aimed at families with small children, is about the wishes of the different family members. The game starts with family members writing down their wishes by finishing a sentence on a randomly selected card, such as "You will ... together with me." Then, they select a family member who should fulfull their wish.

In the next round, they try to communicate their wish by drawing it on the back of another player. If they can communicate their wish correctly, they gain a happiness card; otherwise, they gain an out-of-luck card.

Finally, all players vote on which wish is the best, to determine a "family wish" that should be carried out before the next game of Familiengeflüster.

name: Vector Chess
description:
VECTOR CHESS is a war game that was developed from a combination of the term “vector”, which is a quantity used to represent magnitude and direction, and “chess”, one of the world’s oldest war games. Each piece in this game has a rank that determines the distance it may move, and a directional characteristic which indicates the direction that it may be moved. In this way, each piece represents a vector, having characteristics of both magnitude and direction.

PLAYING SURFACE: Vector Chess is played on a square playing area divided into either 49 or 64 smaller squares of equal size. The squares may be alternately light and dark colored, but it is not necessary. A game played on the board having 49 squares will usually make for a shorter game when compared to a game on the 64 square board.

THE PIECES: Depending upon the type of board used, enough pieces must be used to fill the first two rows of squares on each side of the board, with each piece set facing the opposite side of the board. Only two types of pieces are used in this game: the MAJOR pieces, and the MINOR pieces. The major pieces, which are line up along the first row of the board, have the highest rank and may be moved from one to four spaces along a straight line in the direction that they are pointing. The minor pieces are lined up on the second row of the board, and are identical to the major pieces except that they are shorter and may be moved only one or two spaces in the direction that they are pointing. Each piece in this game maneuvers like a soldier on a battlefield – it may turn and move to a new position, provided no other piece blocks its path, and it may attack any enemy piece that is directly in its path and within range. The range of movement is the number of spaces that the piece move can move as was previously described.

OBJECT OF THE GAME: The object of the game is to “check mate” the opposing player by maneuvering pieces into his first row squares until the defending pieces in that row are outnumbered. If the first row squares are empty, only one attacking pieces is required to put the opposing player “in check”. The defending player must break the check during his next turn as described below, or he will be considered “check mated”.

COMPONENTS: This game includes 32 round wooden playing pieces in 2 colors that are similar looking to a rook in chess but have a directional arrow in the top. For each player there are 8 'tall' pieces and 8 'short' pieces that otherwise look identical. The board included has a 7x7 grid on a rolled up vinyl board (although the game can also be played on an 8x8 grid - presumably a standard chess board would be suitable)

name: Race-Play
description:
Australian action game.
You get eight plastic horses, a good size, to which is attached a length of string (around 1 metre). The strings are unwound to their full length and will stretch from the control box to the start line . At the start everyone frantically rewinds their string. The first horse to reach the control box, wins.
The horses are named after celebrated Australian thoroughbreds (including Phar Lap).
There is no clear winner although I think it will be the richest player after a number of pre-set races. There is no recommendation who should be the Bookie. A non-player would be favourite for that task.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Party Game, Racing, Sports
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Kolonix
description:
KOLONIX a board game in which colonize the-deal-free squares on the board by placing them in our leading disc (figure).
Figure consists of two basic discs.
Movement of the disc leading to 2-1 (two to one in the front side) is the same as chess horse. After each made ​​free movement in our field is marked with color and not taking no further part in the game giving us a point-to-colonization.
The game objective is to take as many free fields by colonization, and acquisition or breaking the puck leading opponent, this is possible when the opponent can within our movement.
You can win with the difference or completely occupied the field to "0" if you take over the puck leading opponent.


KOLONIX to gra planszowa w której kolonizujemy-zajmujemy wolne pola na planszy poprzez umieszczenie na nich naszego krążka prowadzącego (figury).
Figura składa się z dwóch krążków podstawowych.
Ruch krążka prowadzącego to 2-1 (dwa do przodu jedno w bok) jest identyczny jak konika szachowego. Po każdym wykonanym ruchu wolne pole zostaje oznaczone naszym kolorem i nie bierze już dalszego udziału w grze dając nam 1 punkt-kolonizacji.
Celem gry jest zajęcie jak największej liczby wolnych pól przez kolonizację oraz przejęcie czyli zbicie krążka prowadzącego przeciwnika, jest to możliwe gdy przeciwnik stanie w zasięgu naszego ruchu.
Wygrać można dzięki różnicy zajętych pól lub zupełnie do „0” jeśli przejmiemy krążek prowadzący przeciwnika.

name: Archipel
description:
You are tourists racing to be the first one to visit all seven of the islands that comprise the Îles-de-la-Madeleine.

To do so you collect cards in hand that match one of the three possible current destinations. When you have the correct number of cards in hand to visit one of the available islands, you collect a token representing your visit there. In the end game, you also have the option of stealing tokens from other players.

The first player to have one of each token wins.

name: Tile Twist
description:
The board is made up of 81 tiles placed differently each time you play. The configurations and fun are nearly limitless. With such a dynamic board, you may only be able to move a few tiles on one turn, while on another turn you might be able to cross the entire board!

Win by collecting points scattered around the board and getting the highest score before making your way back to home base. Each roll of the die creates strategic opportunities to make a path to victory or impede your opponents. For example, you may be able to rotate one or two tiles and open a path to more points or break up the path of your opponent, add a blocking piece anywhere on the board to prevent your opponent from reaching his destination, or trade places with another player to get out of a bind and race to your goal.

Tile Twist: it's a strategic game for family and friends...with a twist!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Veilig verkeer!
description:
A game where children learn the basis rules of the movement law. It starts with recognising the traffic signs and later on the meaning. Afterwards the child learns what it must do when the traffic is controlled by a traffic light or a police officer.

Each player is represented in the game with a bicycle. During the game a player has to visit several destinations. On his way the player has to recognise traffic signs or react to different traffic situations: stop when the light is red, ... The first player who has reached 5 destinations is the winner.

name: Tensor
description:
The Tensor card game pits two players against each other in a race to move pieces from the center of the board to the edge.

Each player has the same set of cards at the start of a round. On each turn three cards are played, face down. If you can reason out what your opponent will do, you can gain the advantage.

name: 4x4 Dice
description:
A fun little time-waster with a hint of strategy. You just need a piece of paper, a pen, a die, and your wits.

Draw a grid, then fill it up with die values as they are rolled. Your score increases based on your positioning of the values and where the pips end up. Add a bonus "house rules" score... and highest score wins.

(please see the files list below for the rules in PDF form)

name: Rugby sur Table
description:
This is a recreation of a rugby match using strategy, dexterity and a bit of luck.
The game board is made of green felt and represents a rugby field.

Each team is composed of 5 player tokens.
These are flat plastic tokens, circa 5 cm long. Players alternate moving around their tokens by throwing a die and moving them one, two or three lengths.

It is possible to pass the ball to another token before throwing the die.
A defending token can tackle an attacking token or even steal the ball by touching it or passing through it.

When a player wishes to kick the ball, either to gain some ground or to send the ball between the goal posts, he plays "tiddly-wink" with a small plastic ball.

A game lasts for two 20mn halftimes.

name: New Scotland Yard: Crime Scene
description:
Game description from the publisher:

In New Scotland Yard: Crime Scene, there has been a murder in the heart of London and New Scotland Yard's team of Crime Scene Examiners are investigating the case. There are six pieces of evidence to find, and the race is on to locate each one before the crime scenes are contaminated and the evidence is lost forever.

First, you must collect the forensic test equipment you will need for the investigation. Then, racing around London, you must find where each piece of evidence is located. Visit the scenes, study the clues and perform forensic tests using the tools included in the game. This may sound easy, but speed, a keen eye and attention to detail are essential to success. There is multiple evidence in each location and you will need to use your forensic test equipment with skill and accuracy to ensure you get the correct results.

Once you have successfully determined the location of all six pieces of evidence, return quickly to Scotland Yard and present your findings to the Detective Superintendent ... but be quick, the police are counting on you.
publishers: Crown & Andrews Ltd., Winning Moves Germany

name: Henry VIII Chess
description: Henry VIII Chess is a variant of chess, played on a board 8 wide and 7 deep. Each player has one King, 7 queens and 8 pawns. Pawns are restricted to moving one space forward (as opposed to 2) and capture as normal. Queens move like they do in chess. The game provides a set of opposing objectives where the object is to either capture the enemy King, or to be the first player to lose all 7 of their Queens. These opposing objectives provides for much tension.

name: Discon
description:
Discon is an abstract game for 2-4 players.

A 10x10 grid is covered with stackable discs in four different colours, save for the corners, which are numbered and act as the players' starting positions.

Each player has 6 "roof" discs which enter the board in their corner. Roofs move in an L-shape, like a knight in chess, and collect the discs in the squares they move to.

The game ends when all discs are collected, at which point towers are scored according to height and colour composition.

name: Agami
description:
Players have two counters which move clockwise round a board by the throw of two d6 and both start on their particular colour starting spaces. Each player starts with two counters, 10 chips, 3 strategy cards and a small number of Colour Space cards.
You gain one chip each time one of your counters passes your home base. If a player's counter lands on another player's base they must pay them 2 chips. If you land on a trade space you may buy another strategy card for 5 chips. There are a number of special squares round the board, which if you land on them and hold the right strategy cards, you may attack other player's counters if they are on vulnerable squares. In successful attacks you may win counters, Colour Space cards or chips, depending on the sort of attack. Colour Space cards that are won are placed on the board and may augment your earnings.
The winner is the player who ends up with most counters but the game end condition is not specified.

name: Jane Austen's Pride and Prejudice Trivia Game
description:
A must have for any Jane Austen fan. Based on the novel Pride and Prejudice by Jane Austen, the game contains 300 trivia cards and 8 bonus Jane Austen trivia questions.

Each player/team on his turn rolls a die and is then asked the trivia question from one of the cards. If he answers correctly, he earns points equal to the number rolled on the die and then rolls again and continues his turn until he answers incorrectly, at which point it is the other players/teams turn.

The first player/team to earn 25 points wins.

name: The Grinch Christmas Bingo Game
description:
From the manufacturer:

Get five gifts in a row to win – but watch out for the Grinch!

Ring in the holiday with a whole new take on the Dr. Seuss Christmas classic. Take a gift token from under the tree and see if you can find a match. But watch out – if you draw a Grinch tile, it’s anyone’s guess what will happen next! Drop the “Grinchy” coin down the chimney. The Grinch may steal your presents, or bring heart-warming holiday cheer. A whimsical Seussian twist on an all-time favorite game that’s fun for all ages!

name: Job hunting
description:
User summary

A set collecting card game with special effects. The card deck consists of cards of varying colour and titles. Players start with a small hand of cards and some cards laid face up on the table. On a player's turn, he may either use one card from hand to grab one of the face up cards, or if he can't, play a card into the open area. Some cards have a special effect when gained.

The goal of the game is to get a set of same coloured, but differently titled cards, representing a deep knowledge in a specific area important for job-searching.

Translated box back
This is a simple game in which the players collect skill cards in order to get a job offer. Three skill cards of the same colour earns you one job offer! But beware, because among the skill cards, there are some that force you to draw an event card, and who knows what may happen then. The first player to get a set number of job offers wins!

name: Build For The Title
description:
A free Print and Play game ruthlessly taking the deck building mechanism from Dominion, Ascension, Resident Evil etc. However instead of a bleak and bleary fantasy world, players take the roles of football (soccer) team managers and build their club up to challenge for league glory!

Buy in squad players, build stadium improvements, get yourself a feeder team, hire physios, coaches and an assistant manager as you develop your squad to become the best it can be and take on the best teams in the league!

Managers start with a small deck of cards consisting of a few average players and some money. On their turn a manager can use the money to buy new items from a selection available and they can turn to their players to play games against a dozen different teams, some stronger than others. Over the course of the game, the manager's club (their hand of cards) will grow bigger and stronger, allowing them to compete against and beat the stronger opposition teams in the game. Build For The Title is all about building a strong and streamlined club that is capable of beating everyone in their way.

name: StrikerZ Dice Game
description:
StrikerZ is a light and fast soccer game, with the bottom of the box serving as the playing arena.

Each player has a "team" of five dice bearing the traditional numbers from 2 to 11, with one #14 substitute. (The #1 keeper is on the shooting die.) During a turn, both players roll their dice in the arena, with the player who rolls the higher sum getting the chance to shoot for a goal by rolling the green die – which will result in a goal, stop or corner kick.

If your dice total is much less than the opponent, you receive a yellow card. Rolling a manager icon lets you change the result of another die; the dice also have whistle and substitution icons.

The first player to score five goals wins.

name: Map Exploring
description:
User summary:
A tile-laying game for 2–4 players. Players have their starting point in one of the corners of a thought 7x7 tile map, with the goal in the middle. Taking turns of laying down tiles with straight corridors, bends, T-crossings and so on, some of which are one-way, the player who first connects his starting point with the goal wins the game. Among the special tiles are tiles that allow you to turn, move or remove an already laid tile.

name: Postman Pat: A Very Special Delivery Board Game
description:
A simple roll and move game for the very young.

Another busy day for Postman Pat as he dashes around collecting Special Delivery parcels for the residents of Greendale. Be the first to find and collect the most matching parcels. Players spin the spinner to move around the board, depending on the number of parcels pictured on the square they landed on they get to turn over the same number of tiles in the middle of the board, if they get a matching pair they get to keep them. If they land on one of the character squares they get to jumble some of the tiles.

The publisher says this is a memory game with a jumble shuffle twist (whatever that is)!
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: 'Jimmy'
description:
Another failed attempt by Waddingtons, to get into the electronic board game market.

The pitch has several holes in it at strategic points. If the ball rolls into one of your holes, you press a button behind the goal and the ball is 'pinged' out of the hole and into another hole. You hope to keep possession and eventually shoot into the opponent's goal.

It had sound effects and an electronic score board but, as a game, it is almost entirely devoid of skill. You just press buttons.

name: Dance Mania
description:
It's time to break out and hit the dance floor! You can boogie to one of the three beats on the electronic dance unit or play your own slammin' tunes to groove to. The more you play, the better you'll get...that's when you start improvising! The dancer that scores the most points, by collecting cards while dancing, become the Bratz Disco Queen.

Contents:

electronic dance unit- pink & white speaker,
gameboard,
pack of 36 double- sided dance cards,
instructions
publishers: Hasbro, MB Jeux, MB Spellen, Milton Bradley

name: Das kleine Automobilquiz
description: A small trivia game about cars; with 100 questions and answers. The game itself is like a notebook (with spiral binding). Each page contains 2 questions and 4 possible answers, the back side contains the correct answers with additional information.

name: VEX: Cross The Red Line
description: An expansion for Vex with 50 new cards containing new challanges

name: Twenty-nine
description:
Twenty-nine is a simple adding game played with traditional playing cards.

Are cards are dealt equally to all players, setting aside any remainder. Each player lays a card in turn, adding its face value to a communal total. (Aces and royals count as '1'.) The total cannot exceed twenty-nine; a player who has no legal play must pass. The player who brings the total to twenty-nine gets a point, and the total is reset to zero for the next player. When every player passes, the game is over. The player or partnership with the most points wins.

name: Spy Against Spy
description: Spy Against Spy is a free two player print and play deduction game. Each player is a secret agent trying to uncover their opponent’s secret identity and eliminated them from the game before they themselves are eliminated. A game of Spy Against Spy is the best of three assignments, with the first player to win two assignments winning the game.

name: Sink the Ship
description:
Shooting game. 6 targets, made of card. The targets are 'stood up' in wooden supports. A nice cannon is used to shoot at the targets. A player must knock over a ship to count as a 'success' and earn a point. You can decide before you start the winning conditions, first to score 5 successes wins, that sort of thing.
Box - "A battling good game".
I'm guessing the date but it looks to me like a WWII vintage game, when children, particularly boys, were very interested in all things military.

name: Find the Mistakes
description:
Party game. There are 15 sheets, with three pictures on each sheet. Guests are given a sheet each and, during the evening, must study the pictures and make a list of all the things wrong with each picture. For instance, a man might be holding an unopened umbrella but he is holding the umbrelly upside down.
The guest with the most correct observations, wins.

name: Acchiappa il Fantasma!
description: Casper the ghost is the star of this game where two teams must to hide their 10 ghosts. Each turn the players will choose an object of the other team hoping to find a ghost. The winner will be the team who will find all the ghosts of the opponent.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Yes & No
description:
A game for larger group of players, in two teams, featuring words and definitions. At first glance the game offers a well-known standard mechanism, you must describe something to the members of your team, avoiding given taboo words, the team must guess the item or term. A new feature introduced in Yes & No is that you also have a list of compulsory words that you must use. And this results in a completely different game.

Contents:

game board
Yes & No. 110 card
1 timer (30 sec)
1 dice
2 characters
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: Lauras Versteckspiel
description: On the cards are motives from Lauras world, five cards are laid out face up, each player also receives 5 cards. The active player looks at the cards and tries to remember them, then he closes his eyes and one card is turned down. Now the player has 20 seconds to name the card correctly. If he is right he can place one of his cards face up on the table, if he is wrong a card from the draw pile is added. The player to discard his last card wins the game.

name: Miniature Golf
description:
British golf game that can be played on a carpet.
Metal 'rings' are provided, each with a hole in the centre and a number. Place these rings around the carpet and then you putt the ball into the hole of Number one ring. When that hole is completed, putt towards Hole 2, and so on. The player who takes the least shots after all the holes have been played, wins.

name: Singularity
description:
Played on the The Game of Y board.

12 stones of their own color for each player, arranged alternating around the perimeter of the board.

From the website "Taking turns, players move any one of their stones by 1, 2 or 3 unit spaces along an unobstructed line, in any direction. A stone may move in only a single direction on a turn. There are no jumps and no captures of opponent pieces. When a player's stone lands immediately next to a stone of its own color, in any direction, on or within the 15 nodes of the central triangular region of the board the moving stone captures the resting stone, which is removed from the board...

To be the first player to have only one stone remaining on the board, occupying one of the 3 central nodes."

name: Khagan
description:
Khagan is a game of 13th Century Mongol conquest. In this game, players each assume the role of a mighty Mongol warlord. With his powerful army, each warlord expands across Eurasia conquering and pillaging the native peoples. The warlord who ships the richest plunder back to Mongolia will certainly be named the next Great Khagan (and win the game).

At the start of each turn, the active player draws from his pool of available tumens (Mongolian army unit of 10,000 men). The drawn tumen tokens function as the player's army for the given turn. Players move their tumens to conquer new territories, receiving both resources and intimidation tokens, the latter of which can be strategically used to acquire even more territories.

In the spirit of nomadic warfare, at the end of each turn, the active player must select one of his clans to encamp. All tumens of a differing clan are removed from play. Tumens of the chosen clan remain on the board, functioning as a springboard for future conquests on the player's next turn.
mechanics: Area Movement, Chit-Pull System, Worker Placement

name: Sailor Buoy!
description:
Your eyes do not deceive you on the box. Yes, it is a hair-dryer in the player's hand.
A race game played on the tabletop, between yachts. The method of propulsion is the afore-mentioned hair-dryer. The yachts are on wheels and you can make the course as easy or as hard as you choose. Getting round corners and not in eachother's way is a little tricky to say the least. First yacht over the designated finish line, wins.

name: Pocket Quiz: Architektur und Baustilkunde
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The title translates to "Architecture and Styles" and the questions center around these topics.

name: Pocket Quiz: Die DDR
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

All questions are about the now defunct GDR (German Democratic Republic).

name: Pocket Quiz: Hunde
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The title translates to "Dogs" and the questions are about that topic.

name: Pocket Quiz: Goethe
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

All questions are about the German writer, pictorial artist, biologist, theoretical physicist, and polymath Johann Wolfgang von Goethe.

name: Pocket Quiz: Judentum
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The title translates to "Judaism" and the questions are about that topic.

name: Pocket Quiz: Klassische Musik
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The title translates to "Classical Music" and the questions are about that topic.

name: Pocket Quiz: Knigge
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice answers. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The questions are all about etiquette; the title "Knigge" refers to Adolph Freiherr Knigge who wrote a book about that topic in 1788.

name: Pocket Quiz: Köln
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The questions are all about the German city of Cologne.

name: Pocket Quiz: Klassiker der Weltliteratur
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The title translates to "Classics of World Literature" and the questions are about that topic.

name: Pocket Quiz: Politik & Geschichte
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The title translates to "Politics & History" and the questions are all about these topics.

name: Pocket Quiz: Sylt
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The questions are all about the German island of Sylt.

name: Pocket Quiz: Weltreligionen
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The title translates to "Religions of the World" and all questions are about that topic.

name: Smurfs Hold On Clumsy
description: Don't let Clumsy fall! Clumsy Smurfs sits on top of a wall of bricks. Take turns using Gargamel’s wand to push out the bricks one at time, but it's only a matter of time before Clumsy tumbles down. Don’t let it be YOU!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Die kleinen Wassernixen
description: The little mermaids playing in the moonlight ride with beads on fishing, diving for treasure or maintain her long hair. Animals and Plants of the water are their best friends and in three different games, children can dive into the world of mermaids. In the picture game players form an underwater picture with the cards, in the collecting game, each child must find 5 cards of their color, and in the memory game, there are 40 pairs from the world of mermaids.

name: Augen auf!
description:
