Objective: be the first to move your three meeples (cars) back home. Simple 'roll and move' game, combined with educational touch (learning road signs). Your meeples (Wartburg 311) can't be thrown out, but you should try to block your opponents.

Second (better known) edition 1965/68 by 'Spika'

name: Fast Play Rules for the Pike & Shot Period (1550 - 1720 AD)
description: Tabletop miniature wargame rules for the period 1550-1720AD. The rules are designed as an introductory ruleset to the pike and shot era and are basically a simplified version of the ruleset Constantinople to Vienna, also by Newbury Rules. The rules are designed with 15mm miniatures in mind but can be adapted to any scale.

name: More Brutes
description: An even greater peril awaits with More Brutes! Expand the Brutes Fantasy Microgame with this add-on that includes 12 new Disposable Heroes Paper Miniatures and a total of 15 new character, weapon, and armor gimmicks/traits.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures

name: Le Docte rat:  Série 03
description: Expansion 03: additional questions (1000+) to be played with "Le Docte Rat".

name: Pocket Quiz: Filmzitate
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The title translates to "Movie Quotes" and the questions are about that topic.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Well You Bowled!
description:
A board game of Flat Green Bowls

Well You Bowled is a board game based on the sport of flat green bowls. The object of the game, as in real bowls, is to get as many of your woods as possible nearre the Jack than your opponent's nearest wood. The game is designed to be played by two teams of up to four players, but may be played in on an individual basis if required. The game is played over a series of "ends".

Each end the jack is set, then each player places a wood along the baseline and declares the intended length, then draws a card from the top of the deck to determine the position of that wood on the rink in relation to the position nominated. If the wood hits another, then the "wick" cards give directions for the two playing pieces. Players may instead of drawing a card to elect to fire. Instead they draw from the fire deck and follow the instructions. Once all players have played their woods, then end is finished, and the end is scored, and another one started. A game is either played to an agreed number of ends or an agreed number of shots (points).

name: Das Geister-Spiel
description: Players start at the castle door and try to reach the tower, they have to pass 29 spaces and overcome ghosts. Good dice rolls and clever use of the results will help a player to be there first and win. In his turn a player rolls all 3 dice: To enter a spot a dice in the roll must show the number of the space or it must be possible to form the number from the numbers rolled. When the dice have fallen accordingly, one can enter several spots in sequence. If helmet and armour are rolled at the same time, one can move to the next armour chip. All players not in first place may re-roll one die per turn.

name: Ost !
description:
Ost ! is a medieval skirmish miniature wargame, originally published in Vae Victis magazine issue #32.

The game uses a simple chit-pull system (using common playing cards) to alternate minis activation between players. Each activated figure has 2 actions, which can be used to move, fight, fire, reload a weapon or perform a special action (such as climbing on horseback). Combat is resolved by an opposed d10 roll with modifiers (for fighters skill, armor, weapons...), ranged combat by a die roll on a table.

The game includes rules for ranged weapons, cover, armor, horse riding, morale, civilians and a scenario ("Les routiers sont sympas").

Scale: 1 mini = 1 man, 1 cm = 1 m, a turn = a few seconds

name: Das lustige Enten-Rennen
description: The ducklings race around the pond, but to make it more difficult each must find three items before moving. In his turn a player rolls the die and may move the number of spots rolled when he can find two more tiles showing the same item as the tile under the marker stone. He may turn over up to three tiles, if he finds two correct tiles he moves his duck, if not, can only move the marker to another tile. Je first player round the pond and back at the duck house wins the game.
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Das Mozart-Quiz
description: Honouring the Mozart Year 2006 Noris offers a quiz game with 1320 questions and answers on the subject of Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart. Players move their tokens over a historic map of Europe, following in the steps of Mozart. Each player at the beginning of the game receives several cities visited by Mozart during his travels and have now to visit those cities, too. To continue travelling a player must correctly answer a question. The first player to arrive back in Salzburg has won the game.

name: Wo und Was?
description:
Players are dealt 12, 10 or 8 cards depending on the number of players. The cards are three types - Land cards, Goods cards and Choice cards (which act as jokers).
The game plays a little like Rummy as players have to collect sets which are laid in front of them. You can add to your sets and you can add to opponents' sets.
The sets within the card types consist of a Question and related answers so a little trivia knowledge helps you not to overlook cards you need.
Winner is the one who plays all their cards first.

name: Keep Calm! Stai calmo!
description:
The object of the game is to have all your pawns arrive to the home squares of the same colour, located at the end of the course, before to the other players.

At start of the game, each player place 1 pawn at START box and 3 pawns on the boxes of his colour.

Each player rolls a dice and move only one pawn according to the result. In case of 6, player could move and re-roll, moving another pawn, or free one pawn placing it on START box.

If one pawn finish its moving on a box occupied by another pawn, this pawn will return on START box.

name: Iddy Umpty
description:
The New Wireless Card Game - Quickly teaches you to read Morse.

This is an older person's Snap variant. During the game you need to alike images and you need to know the Morse Code name for the letter (if that letter has a name identity). I think it probably dates from the 20's.

The winner is the one who ends up with all the cards.

The name was not made up by the publisher. It sounds as if it comes from a children's nursery rhyme, but it is the "conventional verbal representation of the dots and dashes of the Morse code" according to the OED. Troops were apparently taught to recognise whether a dot or a dash was being transmitted by the sound of the machine. A dot made an 'iddy' sound and a dash sounded like 'umpty'.

name: Evas Welt
description:
In Evas World there are buildings, a car, a tractor & trailer, a swimming pool, trees, a pasture and much, much more. All those things are pictured on 48 discovery cards, items are presented as seen from all possible directions. On the game board with 12 inner squares all those things are pictured when being looked on from above, as you would do from an airplane.

In your turn you roll and move your marker around the 12 central squares on the board. Then you look at the squares adjacent to the square with your marker and try to imagine how the situation would look if you were standing in the road instead of looking down. Then you take the corresponding pictures from the display of discovery cards. Your left neighbour controls your choice, he can turn over the cards, the correct solution is given on the back. When all discovery cards have been given out, the player with most cards wins.

name: Filly Unicorn: Das große Regenbogenfest
description: Rainbow island and tower are set up, the crystal meadows laid out and the crystals stacked. In your turn you roll the dice and can jump your filly over a crystal stack showing a crystal of a color rolled, and again for the 2nd die. You can jump from the island on all meadows and from one meadow to the next one or back to the island. If you cannot jump or do not want to take the colors, must discard a crystal. For a set of one crystal in each color you receive a rainbow chip, and you can swap crystals 2:1 with other Fillies. You win with three rainbow chips.

name: Hattu Möhrchen?
description: 33 slits in the board carry carrots, one slit is empty. In his move a player pulls out a carrot - if it is good and without worm the player puts in into his rabbit den. A bad carrot with worm goes back into the field in any place chosen by the player. The first player to collect 5 good carrots wins the game. In a variant the board can be turned 90 degrees after each move.

name: Qubic
description:
In a article titled Three Dimensional Chess: Reflections and Speculations by Benjamin Grosbayne on page 74 in British Chess Magazine, Volume 85 (1964) there is one terse paragraph describing a 3D tic-tac-toe game.

"The simplest beginning for the whole 3D concept in the field of board games can be seen in QUBIC, the 3D tic-tac-toe (tick-tack-too) made by George M. Fox of Shelbourne Falls, Mass., U.S.A. This elementary game has three boards superimposed, each of five squares. The rules are as in the 2D game played by children except that the players move in three directions. The levels are held together by thin poles and the whole may be assembled or taken apart and then packed into a very small space. It should serve as a good introduction for young children and beginners in some of the following 3D games."

The only arrangement for the boards that would make sense for 5 spaces an "X" pattern.

Shelbourne Falls is evidently a misspelling since there is no such town in Massachusetts. It should be Shelburne Falls.

It is really odd that the 4x4x4 version of Qubic would later be published by "Qubic Games" in Shelburne Falls, Massachusetts.

Fox had been an employee of Milton Bradley. He evidently got the McLoughlin Brothers copies of a lot of children's books when MB bought McLoughlin. He later donated his children's book collection to the San Fransisco library.

Similar to:

3D Tic Tac Toe - Which is played on 27 spaces in a 3x3x3 grid.
Qubic - Which is played on 64 spaces in a 4x4x4 grid

name: Fußball Poker
description:
Players build a football team one player at a time in Fußball Poker, but they're never assured of getting the player they want since all of the other team owners are bidding at the same time as you.

Each player starts the game with €100 million; someone shuffles the 48 player cards, then places them in a face-down pile. On a turn, the active player draws and reveals four cards, then places a bid face-down on the table; while the bid itself is secret, other players can see how many money cards you included in the bid. Each player in turn places a secret bid, then they reveal these bids. Whoever offers the most money takes the footballer of his choice and places it in an empty position in his team line-up on the game board, then the second-highest bidder does the same, and so on. If a player has no money, he takes the last card on offer. The active player position rotates to the left, then players each bid on and draft another card.

In addition to acquiring high-valued footballers, players are trying to fill their team with a proper line-up of players – midfielders in the midfield, three defenders and a keeper in the back, and so on – as they score bonus points when those sections have the properly positioned players in them. When a player drafts an "ersatz" (substitute) footballer, it can replace any footballer already in play and it counts as being in the proper position; the drawback is that an ersatz player is worth no points on its own.

After twelve rounds of drafting, each player will have a full line-up and one player on the sidelines; this player can be substituted for any other footballer already on the team, even if the substitute is not labeled "ersatz".

Players then tally their player points and any bonus points for completing a section with the proper footballers. The player with the highest score wins, with ties being broken by the money still in hand.

name: Snake Bite
description:
Players play as snakes competing to collect eggs scattered across the board. Every time you eat an egg, your snake grows longer. Watch out, though; snakes can eat each other's tails, so a long snake is a tempting target!

Points are awarded for eating eggs and other snake's tails. A balance of both is usually needed to win.

name: The Grape Game
description:
As the manager of your vineyard, you will try to carry out all the operations making up a year in viticulture, from winter pruning until grape harvesting.

Each task you perform will be represented either by expenses in personnel for manual tasks (pink tokens), or in equipment for mechanical tasks (grey tokens). Each operation will enable you to earn either grape cards or maturity cards, and you’ll have to collect these cards in pairs in order to harvest ripe grapes.
The more pairs you gather, the more points you’ll score!

Be careful! The weather, vine diseases, accidents and even hiring strategies between players may complicate your harvesting plans.
It’s all a matter of risk management... your passion will transform you into a winegrower!
...and the accompanying booklet (Lexicon and winegrowing notes) will instruct you to become – who knows ? A real winegrower!

As the players choose and separate into the two styles of cultivating their vines, they will enjoy playing the “Traditional” style against the “Conventional” way – and throughout the game, they will learn the details of the job of winegrowing.

It’s not a matter of performing each operation in just one trip around the board : this is not a game of ‘snakes and ladders’ ! The secret is to make as many trips as required in order to utilize all of your talents and resources.

A management game requiring luck and strategy, THE GRAPE GAME enables anyone with or without prior knowledge of winemaking to discover the true nature of this profession and to enjoy the process.

name: Emmi
description:
Counting to six, either from the caterpillar`s head or tail, and recognition of colours is the focus of the game. The player who has the most points in his or her own colour on emmi`s back at the end will win the game.

Promotes first counting, colour recognition

Contents:
• 1 big caterpillar "Emmi" (480 x Ø 35 mm) with rotary articulars
• 2 dice
• 5 wooden cards

name: WW III
description: World War Three. A simulation of the Third World War as it might have happened back in 1985. Card and Token Game for 2 players. One player is NATO, the other is the Warsaw Pact. The Pregame depicts events leading to the outbreak of hostitilities and gives players a chance to gain advantages before tensions become too much. The main game follows the conflict on land, sea, and air. Rules for nuclear exchange can result in limited Nuclear War or all-out Armageddon.

name: The Gee-Wiz Jig-Saw Race Game
description:
Contents
4 Boxes of Puzzle Pieces.
Central Pool Puzzle Pieces.
1 Set of Rules.

"A game of skill and chance that combines the fascination of Jig-Saw construction with the thrill of a race game." says the box and going on to say "Not just an ordinary Jig-Saw, but an entirely new idea that leaves the result of the race a speculation to the last piece."

Each player has one of the colour coded boxes of pieces.
There is also a central pool of pieces for the water jump.
Players begin their puzzles - This forms part of their race track. Once their piece's are used up,the water jump is made, using pieces from the centre pool. The winner is the first one to complete their track the fastest (including the water jump).

The rules suggest that counters may be used For side stakes if required.

name: Drängelei
description: The jetty is rather narrow and the bear and his friends jostle each other while trying to catch a fish. The player in position 1 is the one to begin to fish, he rolls the die and if the die shows a 1 or 2 he has caught the corresponding number of fish. He may go on rolling the die. If a blue 1 appears he falls into the pond and has to line up again in last place. All others move forward one spot and the number 1 now starts fishing. If the die shows a red 2, the player in position 2 falls into the pond and has to line up in the back. Who is the first to catch 12 or 18 fish, depending on the number of players, wins the game.

name: Panamaland
description: There are many things to find from Panamaland to the little hut beside the river, and players must be lucky three times to move and win the game. Players start with their tiger at the hut, the bear stands on any Panama card. The active player rolls the die. Now he needs to find two more cards identical to the one the bear stands on. If he is lucky, the are already there face up, otherwise the player may turn over up to three cards to find the necessary motives. If he has found them, he may move his tiger as many spots as he has rolled, otherwise the tiger stays in place. The player to be the first to get back to the hut beside the river wins the game.

name: Iron & Steam
description:
Iron & Steam is a rules system for playing out ironclad naval combat in the era of the American Civil War. Game play is relatively streamlined, while rules include a good amount of specific technical information to satisfy those wanting a greater degree of granularity and detail. As such, the rules contain pre-generated game statistics for historical vessels, but also provide guidelines for converting any vessel to in-game play statistics. Similarly, for simplicity identical gun ranges are suggested for any gun of a given type (e.g. smoothbore cannon), while for those players wishing to add more detail and realism an appendix is included with expanded gun statistics to differentiate historical guns of various manufacture.

The rules are designed to use a scale of 1:2400

Also included is a bibliography of suggested reading.
categories: American Civil War, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation

name: Bayrisches Sammelsurium Das Spiel
description:
Humorous quiz game about Bavaria.
Goa of the game is to reach Munich first. You can advance through luck of the dice, correct answers, real wealth, misleading other players and ignorance of the other players.
Players roll the dice and if arrow is rolled he moves up the ladder. If "K", "S" or "W" is rolled player takes a creative, estimate or knowledge card from the deck and asks a question. There is a short game and a team option.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Der störrische Esel
description: The donkey carries fruits in a basket towards the market, but a bridge is causing problems. The players have their fruit color, depending on the number of players and different numbers of cards, on the remainder pile. With the card, a player can put a fruit in the basket, repair a broken bridge's step or remove the fruit from another player's basket. With the wild card You have free choice among actions. If the donkey cross the bridge, the player with the most fruits in his basket is the winner.

name: Automobility
description:
Objective: be the first collecting 5 knowledge cards out of 5 different (coloured) theme areas:
versions & technology
milestones
sports
design
innovation & environment

- moving by turn -
During player's turn die is rolled, may move into any direction, but not vice versa; occupied spaces may be crossed.
Appropriate card is drawn, pick up question - if the answer is correct keep the card.
Board, 5 x 50 cards with more than 1000 questions
24 action cards, 6 meeples, 1 die, rule sheet
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE: RenFaire Reanimation
description:
From the publisher:

Description:
ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE

RenFaire Reanimation!

Expansion Deck

The Zombie Apocalypse is getting medieval on your ass. The undead are converging on the local Renaissance Festival and it’s not looking good. So grab a flagon of mead and a sword, you’re finally going to get the chance to really use that thing.

Welcome to the Zombie Apocalypse!

You need the Zombie Apocalypse basic deck to use this expansion.

Components:
RenFaire Reanimation! Deck (1 deck of 14 cards) Tuck Box, Clear, 52 Cards
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE: Within The Woods
description:
From the publisher:

Description:

Expansion Deck

You thought it would be safer in the woods.But the forest is a dark, ancient, place. Full of things long dead that would use zombies for their own ends. Now you don’t just have to worry about being eaten, but losing your very soul as well! That and mosquitoes, those things are a bitch.

You need the Zombie Apocalypse basic deck to use this expansion.

Components:
Within The Woods Deck (1 deck of 14 cards) Tuck Box, Clear, 52 Cards
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE: Dead Medicine
description:
From the publisher:

Description:
Expansion Deck

The Zombie Apocalypse is too much for some people. Their mind goes long before a Zombie can get to it. You used to be able to go to a Doctor when you had problems like this, but what do you do when the Doctor has become the craziest one of all?

Welcome to the Zombie Apocalypse!

You need the Zombie Apocalypse basic deck to use this expansion.

Components:
Dead Medicine Deck (1 deck of 14 cards) Tuck Box, Clear, 52 Cards
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE: Punk Ass Zombies!
description:
From the publisher:

Description:
Expansion Deck

If you’re into Punk, this deck has it all. Punks, Punk Zombies, Punk Love. If you don’t care for Punk, that’s fine too. They’ll
probably all get eaten anyway. They say Punk is Dead, but it’s really only Undead.

Welcome to the Zombie Apocalypse!

You Need the Zombie Apocalypse basic deck to use this expansion.

Components:
ZA Expansions Deck (1 deck of 14 cards) Tuck Box, Clear, 52 Cards
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE: Zombie Supplement
description:
From the publisher:

Description:

Expansion Deck

This deck is basically more of what you got with the original deck. It can be used as a side deck, but works best if just shuffled into the main deck to increase its size. This can give you a longer and more pleasing game, while also making multiplayer games more exciting. Just think of it as Extenze for the Zombie Apocalypse!

You need the Zombie Apocalypse basic deck to use this expansion.

Components:
Zombie Supplement Deck (1 deck of 14 cards) Tuck Box, Clear, 52 Cards
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE: The Crawling Dead
description:
From the publisher:
Description:
ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE

The Crawling Dead!

Expansion Deck

You’ve seen Running Zombies, Walking Zombies, Shambling Zombies, even Lurching Zombies. Now you’ve got Crawling Zombies. It took them a while to get here, but what did you expect, they were crawling. So you had better watch your ankles, or anything else you’ve got hanging low.

Welcome to the Zombie Apocalypse!

You need the Zombie Apocalypse basic deck to use this expansion.

Components:
The Crawling Dead Deck (1 deck of 14 cards) Tuck Box, Clear, 52 Cards
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE: The Infected
description:
From the publisher:
Description:

Expansion Deck

A new breed of Zombie has emerged in the Zombie Apocalypse. The Infected are not your typical undead Zombie, but a Human infected with a virus that makes them an unthinking killer that will attack anything else that moves, Human OR Zombie. They taste just the same to a regular Zombie though, just a little spicier!

Welcome to the Zombie Apocalypse!

You need the Zombie Apocalypse basic deck to use this expansion.

Components:
The Infected Deck (1 deck of 14 cards) Tuck Box, Clear, 52 Cards
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE: Un-Death Metal Mayhem
description:
From the publisher:

Description:
Expansion Deck

The Zombie Apocalypse gets Metal with this theme deck. Metalheads beware! Some Zombies think you’re a treat. All that headbanging shakes your brain up like a nice, tasty, smoothie. MMmmm!! The Zombies have to take you down first, though. So all they may end up eating is a fistful of metal.

Welcome to the Zombie Apocalypse!

You need the Zombie Apocalypse basic deck to use this expansion.

Components:
Un-Death Metal Mayhem Deck (1 deck of 14 cards) Tuck Box, Clear, 52 Cards
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE: Til Un-Death Do Us Part
description:
From the publisher:

Description:
Expansion Deck

In the worst case of Wedding Crashing ever, the hordes of the undead have come to ruin some couple’s very special day. Unlucky for the Zombies, though, this couple’s armed to the teeth. What’s that saying again? Oh yeah,“Something old, something dead, something chewed on, something red.”

Welcome to the Zombie Apocalypse!

You need the Zombie Apocalypse basic deck to use this expansion.

Components:
Til Un-Death Do Us Part Deck (1 deck of 14 cards) Tuck Box, Clear, 52 Cards
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE: Better Red Than Undead
description:
From the publisher:

Description:
Expansion Deck

Some members of the Redneck nation have decided to venture into the ruined cities to search for supplies (beer). Did they make a wrong turn, or will it be the undead shambling for the hills? I think I just heard “Duelling Banjos” start playing.

Welcome to the Zombie Apocalypse!

You need the Zombie Apocalypse basic deck to use this expansion.

Components:
Better Red Than Undead Deck (1 deck of 14 cards) Tuck Box, Clear, 52 Cards
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE: Demon Zombie Hunters
description:

It adds 14 new cards to the game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

It adds 14 new cards to the game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

description:

It adds 14 new cards to the game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE: Death-Con One
description:

It adds 14 new cards to the game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE: Night of the Thinking Dead
description:
This new expansion can only be acquired by getting the Z-Day bundle with all 15 expansions!

It adds 14 new cards to the game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Das große Quiz zur Bibel
description:
Objective: be the first to pass the finish line
- acting by turn -

using a die, picking up cards and finding the correct answer let your meeple move along
2 different editions: 1994 and 1997
content: 1000 questions out of Old and New Testament

name: En busca de Eldorado
description:
"In Search of Eldorado" (In search of Eldorado) is a strategy game involving 2 teams (expeditionaries and indigenous) that can be composed of 1, 2 or 3 players each

The expeditionaries mission is a sea voyage aboard their galleons, from its port to the land of the Indians.

There are 3 pyramids spread over the territory of these.

Below one of the 3 pyramids is Eldorado. It'll be known by the brand that bears on the base. The only ones who know which of the pyramids is marked are the Indians.

The aim of the expedition will be to find and seize the pyramid that contains Eldorado and take it to the port where the expedition departed.

The Indians will be guarding the 3 pyramids, thus hindering the expeditionaries discovering which of them is Eldorado.

His other mission will be hunt down and eliminating the expeditionaries as soon as they land.

If any of the expeditionaries manages to find and grab the pyramid of Eldorado, the Indians will use all means at its disposal by land and sea to recover and return the pyramid of Eldorado to their place of origin.

The members of each team will decide among them wich piece they move each turn.
categories: Adventure, American Indian Wars, Exploration, Nautical
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Secret Unit Deployment

name: African Animal Hunt
description:
Rules for game: First, place the animals (Elephant, Alligator, Camel, Zebra, Lion and Goat) on the board using set up rules , then 1st player rolls dice and then can do any of 3 things.

1) Place hunter on the board and then move him the total of both dice

or

2) place hunter on board move him total of 1 die then place second hunter on board and move him total of 2nd die

or

3) start hunter move him total of 1 die then place peg on board horizontally or vertically the distance away from hunter equal to the 2nd die.

Object of the game is to continue to make those die rolls and try and to surround the animals. Game ends when all animals have been caught. Scoring is as follows: Elephant, Alligator and Camel= 4 points. Zebra and Lion = 3 points and Goat = 2 points.

name: Eine Reihe Tiere
description:
A beautifully-made variant of n in a row.
Each player gets on the train five animal tiles and try as many of animals place in a row, but in correct environment - the fish in the pond, the bird in the tree, the butterfly on the flower and the hare in the meadow. Star fields are wild areas where each animal may be placed. Who gets rid of the most animals is the winner.

name: Flocki such' das Socki!
description: Flocki and his doggy friends play at retrieving socks. Each player chooses a dog disc, the sock tiles are briefly displayed openly and then turned over. The active player rolls the die, this is the sock the dogs should retrieve. All players now look for this sock and place their dog disc as fast as the can onto the tile they think is the correct one. More than one disc is allowed on a tile, they are stacked. When all have placed their dog the tiles are turned over: If you did find the correct sock, you score chip points: 3 if you were the fastest, 2 if you were second and all others score 1 point. If you selected a wrong sock, you lose points. Then you switch 2 sock tiles. When all chips have been given out, you win with most points from your chips.

name: Der Eismann   Ötzis Reise durch die Zeit
description:
Objective: become the wealthiest stone age man
- acting/moving by turn -

Phase 1:
Collect as many property cards as possible ==>

don't marry too often - you must feed them all
avoid wolves and bears
make reasonable deals on stone age markets
find correct answers for drawn questions cards
try to get copper - the most precious good
make well elaborated moves


if you think that you prepared yourself well ==>
Phase 2

be the first crossing the glacier (surviving!)
getting a big bonus - all property is going to be calculated ==>


Resulting in winning the game
categories: Card Game, Dice, Prehistoric, Racing, Trivia

name: Toni Tausendfüssler
description:
objective: be the first to put on Toni's shoes
- moving/acting by turn -
each player places his meeples at one side of Toni's coloured segments
each player gets 13 shoes
roll the coloured die - step to the next coloured segment an put a wooden shoe on
continue - if the segment you stepped on is already equipped - bad luck
if the die shows white - free choice
winner is who puts on Toni's last shoe
variant: the one who puts on Toni's very last shoe (out of general supply) wins

name: Choker
description:
A combination of chess and poker that uses standard playing cards for special effects. The chess pieces move as they would in an ordinary game of chess, with certain exceptions. Players draw cards from a standard poker deck on every turn. Different cards correspond to different playing pieces. The red cards correspond to the white pieces and the black cards correspond to the black pieces. Being able to form and play different Poker hands allows the players to do such things as teleport a piece or move multiple times in a row. For the white player, red poker hands effect the player's own pieces and black poker hands effect the opponent.

The effects of the various poker hands are potent, thus, the game is a much more tactical chess that is quicker, more severe, and with added dimensions to consider. Playing in the traditional sense generally does not work as the playing of the various poker hands change the traditional rules.

name: Jack and Jill
description:
A card game that utilises the board that came with it but the host must provide other equipment.

It is a two player game (or 4 or 6, in which case the games is played as a partnership game).

The object is to fill your bucket or, at least, finish the game with the most water in your bucket.

Cards are laid from your hand, domino fashion i.e. as long as you match one of the numbers on the end dominoes, you can play that card. Most cards will say something like 5 Red Black 2. In this case, if you were Red, you would move your playing piece 5 spaces around the board. The spaces on the board let you add water to your bucket or cause your bucket to start leaking.

The game ends as soon as one player fills their bucket or it ends after both players have made two circuits of the board and then the winner is the one with the most water remaining in their bucket.

name: Cinglés des jeux
description:
Each player chooses a figurine and puts it on the start line.

In his turn, the active player rolls a die and moves his figurine as many spaces indicated by the dice.
According to the space he lands, he plays a card from categories "Game", "Sport" or "Game Chrono".
He chooses question from the card and opponent who must answer that. If opponent answer correctly, he moves as many spaces indicated on the card. If not the current player moves.

Player who reach around the stage first receive the World Cup and is the winner of the game!

name: Planken Ud Knud!
description:
User summary:

Party game for grown ups. Each player get one of Morten Ingemanns 20 cartoony characters, and the goal is to stay on the board. Players have to answer questions, sing songs, tell jokes, drink drinks or do other tasks, or suffer the consequenses.
mechanics: Acting, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Singing

name: Sport 3000
description:
Similar game with Trivial Pursuit themed on Austrian sports. The categories are general sports, sports on wheels and skis, Summer Olympic sports, team sports and Winter sports.
Who is the first player to get the score card for each color wins the game

name: ASL Comp: Afrikakorps – Reluctant Offensive
description:
El Guettar, Tunisia, 23 March 1943: As soon as the movements of the enemy 10th Panzer Division were recognized as a major counter-attack Lieutenant Colonel Maxwell A. Tinscher's 899th Tank Destroyer Battalion, equipped with the new M10s, was ordered to support the hard-pressed 601st. Leaving behind A' Company in reserve, the 899th moved out at 0845 hours in a full-throttle dash to meet the Germans. Captain Kirk Adam's B' Company was in the lead and reached El Guettar just as Stukas worked over the area. Following a meeting between Colonel Tinscher, his S-3 Captain Joseph Morrison and the CO of the 601st T.D. Battalion, B' Company was ordered into the pass immediately, without waiting for C' Company. At 0955 B' Company sped into the valley floor between hills, immediately drawing fire. One destroyer was disabled on a minefield. The rest reorganized, moved off the road, and amid heavy fire from artillery, anti-tank and small arms, focused on enemy armor. Their 3-inch guns proved deadly, destroying ten Mark IVs, two anti-tank guns, and damaging two other Panzers in exchange for three M-10s burned and two disabled. For his action, Lieutenant Coady was awarded the Silver Star...

ASLComp AFRIKAKORPS: RELUCTANT OFFENSIVE is a detailed new ASLComp VARIANT that tells the story of the War in North Africa. It's about time the desert warfare goodness that was spawned by Hal Hock's seminal work TOBRUK back in 1975... was brought to the gaming tables of ASLers. And now it is, in a big way.

The ninth portion of the set-piece is ASLComp AFRIKAKORPS: Reluctant Offensive and takes the action into early 1941 and the first offensive to capture a city that would become a watchword later in the war: "Tobruk". The action culminates with the Battle of Beda Fomm on a map that recreates the battlefield as well as the long out of print historical map, using the overlay set. This set of 8 scenarios also bring the FORT OVERLAY, depicting Fort Mechili into play. Can you get the Italian garrison in the fort to surrender? We'll leave that to you, your dice and your tactics.

You receive a set of 8 scenarios, all depicting actions from the exciting offensive, rife with combined-arms actions. And yes, these are aimed at playability. Slap them down, bang them out, do it again. And again. Please do a little hooting and hollering while you're at it... at least when you roll 'snakeyes' (or the other guy rolls 'boxcars').

ASLComp AFRIKAKORPS—RELUCTANT OFFENSIVE contains:

8 action-packed scenarios depicting actions from Rommel's drive into Cyrenaica
Color cover sheet
Descriptive back sheet
Ziploc style storage bag
All the interest in the War in North Africa that you have been waiting for someone to show you


WEST OF ALAMEIN and BEYOND VALOR REQUIRED FOR USE + ASLComp AFRIKAKORPS CORE PACKS 1-2 ALSO NEEDED FOR PLAY
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Bank Attack
description:
Object of the game is to be the richest player at the end of the game robbing the banks.

Every round the convoy brings to bank 500 dollars. Players take turns to play the villians with value 1-5. Your goal is to successfully collect the most points with a single bandit. To do this you have the right to exchange your cards once. After the second round, who has the strongest villian wins this phase.

Winner takes the 5 dice and try to roll the 3-digits code of the conwoy to get all the money.

name: ASEAN-Chess
description:
New invention of chess game form traditional chess of South East Asian Countries. The game adapts from Makruk (Thai Chess), Ouk Chatrang (Cambodian Chess) and Sittuyin (Burmese Chess). Those have very similar chess style and have some minor difference.

The game is declared on March 14th 2011 at ASEAN-Chess council, Bangkok, Thailand.

The game applies some Chess's rules to those tradition chess variants in ASEAN (such as Ouk Chatrang, Makruk, Sittuyin) for easier to settle the tournaments and record the results.

Some different rules between Chess and ASEAN-chess such as
- Bishop is called as Elephant
- Pawns start at the 3rd row and can be promoted to be Queen (and only Queen) at the 8th row
- Queen can move only 1 diagonal space
- Bishop (Elephant) can move 1 space diagonally or 1 space forward
- No Castling
- Use counting rules when neither side has any pawns and both players agree to use counting rules

Note: ASEAN stand for "Association of South East Asia Nations"

name: Conni am Strand
description:
Objective:
be the first gaining a complete set (4) of cards with the same
image
- acting by turn -
its like Memory but with following varieties:
- you are collecting only one set of 4 cards
- currently you are on the beach ==> due to wind and waves
slides becoming mixed again by time

remarks:
belongs to a series of so called 'Mitbringspielen' (small present games)

name: Das Ü-50 Quiz
description:
Objective:
be the first climbing up victory points list to the top
- moving/acting by turn -

each player throws the die, moving round the board, drafting cards (some multiple choice), finding questions for answers out the 60's - 80's, gaining victory points if ..

remarks
target group: see title, but can be played with modification by children, too
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Brunete: La Primera Gran Batalla de la Guerra Civil Espanola
description:
Brunete: La Primera Gran Batalla de la Guerra Civil Espanola is a tactical wargame about the Battle of Brunete, in the nearby of Madrid who took place in july 1937 during the Spanish Civil War. The game scale is battalion.

This game represents the first big battle of the Spanish Civil War.

The Republican player tries to occupy the village of Brunete, and the Nationalist player has to avoid it.

Players move their units (battalions) using the movement factor printed in the counters and solve combats with the die and the results chart.

name: Let's Play Basketball
description:
Sports card game designed to simulate one quarter of a basketball game.

The cards are divided into three piles by color. The "Play pile is red, "Free Throws" are white, and "Jump balls" are blue. The first player turns over a "Jump Ball" to determine who starts drawing from the "Play" pile. Players alternate turning over cards until the "Play" pile is exhausted. Points are scored as determined by the cards drawn. This sequence is repeated for four quarters. The player with the highest point total after four quarters is declared the winner.

name: Activity Die siebziger Jahre! Zusatzkarten
description: Expansion for the Activity. 110 new cards for the base game with theme The Seventies!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Line Drawing, Team-Based Game

name: Kleiner Eisbär komm doch mit!
description:
Objective: be the first saving your (3) ice bears by bringing them back to the arctic pole
- moving by turn/'Roll & Move' game -
Each player throws a 6-sided-die ('6' is replaced by a balloon)
and moves one of his/her (3) ice bears into the direction of the balloon according the rolled number; if number and distance are matching, step into the balloon - if not (too far) take another bear or miss one turn;
if the die shows the balloon move it 1 step ahead.
If the balloon reaches the pole before one of the players has saved his/her 3 bears all players loose the game
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing
publishers: Schmidt Spiele, Selecta Spel en Hobby

name: Marvel Slingers
description:
Marvel Slingers combines collectibles with toys in this dexterity game. The Marvel Universe provides the setting as heroes and villains (such as Hades, Loki and Athena) battle each other for supremacy at your hands.

The basic game consists of several elements. You have a battle map, a set of battle medallions, power boost medallions, and the central element - your Slinger. The Slinger is a ball-shaped yo-yo-like creation with a magnet on the under-belly; each Slinger has its own personality in terms of power and stamina, making different ones suitable for different levels of expertise.

You use the Slinger to attack your opponents' battle medallions on the battle map, wielding the Slinger like a yo-yo. Your aim is to make contact with your chosen target and defeat it. The built-in power meter measures power, and a winner is determined. Each round is played as a 5-on-5 battle.

The collectible aspect comes in the form of different Slingers and different medallions (both battle and power boost) – all in various levels of rarity.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip

name: Bon Voyage
description: The object of the game is to be the first player to travel around the world! To do this you must journey through eight colour-coded areas of the world and collect at least one Bon Voyage card from each area. The first player to accumulate at least 40,000 kilometres on Bon Voyage cards, from all 8 areas, returns home to win the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Upidee
description:
Horse racing game. Looks lovely but it is just a roll and moove game.

The board is unusual, consisting of cards which, if laid out in the correct order, form a track.

Each player is given a supply of counters (not included in the game). 5 counters per player are placed into the Pool. This will be the prize if you reach the end first. When you move, if you land on a picture space, then you must obey the instructions. Some are the usual Miss a Turn variety but some make you add more counters to the Pool or, maybe, take some counters out of the Pool. The winner of the race i.e. reaches the last space on the board first, collects the Pool and the real winner is the player that has the most counters.

name: Piet Piraat: Naar de haaien
description:
In this children's game, the players attempt to steal their opponents treasure by rolling a cannon ball (a marble) off a slope. At the bottom of the slope, their are several treasure chest space. If the marble lands in a treasure chest space containing an opponent's treasure, they get to steal it.

However, the players get to protect their treasures by placing obstacles (sharks) on the slope, which may deflect the cannon ball.

name: On an Adventure with Geronimo Stilton: The Game
description:
Have you never dreamed of travelling in the Kingdom of Fantasy? Together with Geronimo Stilton and Trinket Scribbler on the back of the Rainbow Dragon and fly back to Fantasia, the world full of imagination. Geronimo Stilton finds a lovely music box in the attic with a very important message in Fantastic Script. “Help Florina the fairy queen, she is in great danger!” That is where Geronimo Stilton's adventure starts. Travel together with him through the 6 fantastic realms of Fantasia, where you will have to carry out an instruction in each one of them. Trinket Scribbler will help you in this. In this way, you will collect the 6 coloured Emeralds, which ultimately give you access to Florissant, the fairy kingdom. And above all, don't forget the music box…

In this game, Geronimo Stilton travels though the realms of Fantasia. On their turn, players move the Geronimo pawn and will answer questions and carry out assignments. The first player to complete an assignment in each realm wins the game.

name: Entdecke die Natur
description:
"Discover the nature" in English
Trivia game with questions about a nature.
You must answer correctly to advance on the game board and collect all the profit from the first part. A question is read aloud along with three possible answers, the players put in their opinion, the correct prediction chip face down on the table. Who has been right moves on the board in front of a field may turn around the chip and win the corresponding part. For higher income parts players have to move higher by answering further questions, but falls back on the base part with a wrong answer. Who first had all the pieces turned on the colored side wins.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Trivia

name: Das Kindergarten-Wörterspiel: Tiere
description:
Das Kindergarten-Wörterspiel: Tiere

is a cooparative game for the languange training with childs from 3 to 6 years (with the help of one adult).

Together with zookeeper Tim you having a nice day at the zoo.
While you going to through the zoo you have to achieve some challenges. The field on which Tim stands shows you which kind of challenge you get. If you were succesfull you gain one card. It is the goal to get 9 cards before the zoo closes.

The Challenges are around story-telling, Memory and roleplay.

(user summary)
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Memory, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Travel Scavenger Hunt for Kids
description:
From the game's website:

Travel Scavenger Hunt is a great new kids road trip game. To play, each player takes 5 cards and tries to locate various roadside objects. Players may have to find a stop sign, a pickup truck, a license plate with the letter Z, and many others. In addition, several funny "Hear It", "Smell It", and "Feel It" cards encouarge kids to use all their travel senses by listening for sounds, feeling for bumps, and sniffing for scents.

Travel Scavenger Hunt is the ultimate boredom beater and the perfect passenger for your next family roadtrip adventure.

name: Grunt: The Modern Death-dealing Card Game
description:
Grunt is a warfare card game using a board to depict 6 combat areas where Grunts (infantry) engage in combat.

The 6 combat areas depicted on the board (Town, Woods, Ruins, Hills, Swamp, and Fields) affect combat potential dependng on equipment and attack types used. Players take turn drawing and playing cards. Types of cards are: Black (Action) cards, Red (Explosives) cards, Green (Strike) cards, Orange (Equipment) cards, and Blue (Special Defense) cards.

Black Action or Green Strike cards are played hidden and take effect only on the next turn. This is done to simulate the time it takes to perform combat manoeuvres. Orange Equipment and Red Explosives cards must be played immediately when drawn. Blue Special Defense cards can be played at any time.

Play proceeds until resources (the main deck of cards) have been exhausted. The player with the most victory points is the winner.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Sternenschweif: Flug durch die Nacht
description:
The unicorns from all over the world organize a competition flight.
Player with his unicorn has 2 options: move forward 1 space on the game board or risk and roll 6 dice with combination of courage, foresight and luck. If he lucky he may move more than 1 space or sometimes needs to reset his character this turn. Who plays and sent at the end arrives first, wins.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Fantasy, Novel-based, Racing

name: Wirbel auf der Weide
description:
Objective: collect as many bonus points as possible (finding fodder on your way back to the shed & getting oat)
- moving by turn -
each player has to move his/her 3 horses back from the pasture to the shed
throw (better: flip) the die inside the cover, that it touches the edge: bouncing back you may move/act with your horse according the space(colour) the die ends up;
make up your mind: choosing a short route you will get less valuable fodder but you are safe (more or less) getting a dry space with oat ==> which is necessary that all the stuff you picked up along your way home does count
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Dice, Racing

name: Baccalite
description:
This is a Roulette related game from around the 1930's by Chad Valley. The game is set inside the box with a metal spinner. All the players except the bank can bet any amount of counters they wish, on any colour they wish. Then you place the ball into the device, and give it a spin, and see where the ball falls out. This lights one of the circles at the side and who ever has bet on that colour wins.

The colours offer the odds as follows:
Green 2 - 1
Yellow 3 - 1
Blue 5 - 1
Pink 7 - 1
Red 15 - 1

You can bet with counters, or real money if everyone agrees. The Bank should be a different person each 'race'.

name: I Romanacci
description:
I Romanacci is a trivia game for kids to adults. Discover the people, culture, and curiosities of Rome, the eternal city. To advance on the board, players have to answer questions and carefully manage the travel budget. The player who reaches the end first is the winner.

Question Categories:

Geography & Nature
Art & Culture
History
Food & Wine
Paris Yesterday & Today
Famous People

name: L'Italia & gli Italiani
description:
L'Italia & Gli Italiani (aka, "Italy and the Italians") is a trivia game for kids to adults. It provides an entertaining journey to discover the characters, culture and curiosities of Italy. To advance on the board, players have to answer questions and carefully manage the travel budget. The player who reaches the end first is the winner.

Question Categories:

Geography & Nature
Art & Culture
History
Food & Wine
Film & Music
Famous People

name: Genegrafter: Mini-Expansion
description: "Genegrafter: Mini-Expansion" is a small 15 card expansion featuring a new card type and some additional characters.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Quiz
description:
300 questions for the whole family
The first player reads out a question and who first identifies the correct answer gets the card and places it in front of him.
Game ends after predetermined amount of questions or if there are no questions left in game. Player with the most cards wins the game.

name: Present Drop!
description:
Present Drop was the winning entry in the BoardGameCamp 2010 game jam, for a game that fitted entirely on a sheet of A4. The prize was it being printed on the back of every Cadbury selection box the following year.

It's a Christmas tile-placing game for 2-4 players in which presents fall down chimneys into hearths. However, the path of falling presents does not always run smoothly and players may divert presents into their own hearths by altering the course of the chimneys.

Chimney tiles are positioned each turn by players hoping to funnel presents into their hearths or away from other players'. The chimneys may split, curve or even multiply the number of presents that fall through them. Some chimney tiles have presents on them that signal a drop. Before those tiles are placed, presents fall down each column and into the hearths. Each present is worth a point. At the end of the game there is a final present drop and the players total up their points.

name: Quitz
description:
Similar game to Quixo played in 6x6 grid.
Player push the row so that the last game-piece fall over the edge. Object of the game is to get 5 of Your game-pieces in row.

name: Wer trägt das Risiko
description:
Each turn a player takes the role of entrepreneur, the other players become insurers.
The entrepreneur must negotiate insurance contracts with other players to protect themselves from harm.
5 categories of events, fire, theft, illness, accident, water damage.

Players have cards in their hands that will be part of contract negotiations.

Once all players have toured as a businessman, the richest wins.

name: Rocks
description: An abstract roll and move game for two players. Each player has eight pawns, divided between two start areas. The goal is to be the first to get one pawn to the center of the board, following the pathways. This is complicated by the twelve polished rocks that start on designated spaces. pawns cannot pass rocks, but by landing a pawn on a rock exactly, a player can relocate the rock to hinder the other players pawns.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Black Hole
description:
Abstract strategy game. Each player has a Simulator (in effect, a private board for each player). On this secret board a player may place his Black Holes (land on an enemy Black Hole and your spaceship is out of the game). Then players set out their spaceships.

Movement is plotted on your private screens and there is no combat system that requires a die roll. In that regard it would be like playing Chess with invisible pieces.

The object is to get across the main board, to the safety zone at the opposite side. On the way, enemy ships can take your ships, especially if you do not have defensive shields.

Contents
1 Playing Board.
2 Simulators.
44 Playing Pieces in Two Colours.
8 Black Hole Pieces.
2 Sets of Instructions.

name: Wissens-Quiz
description: At 240 cards, there are more than 4500 questions and answer choices from the fields of knowledge of history, geography, Politic & Science, Arts & Culture, Sports & Leisure, and geography. On each card there are 4 questions found with each of four possible answers. In his turn the player's neighbor asks a question. The color of the category is rolled with die. If the answer is correct he gets the card. The first player who has a card from each category wins the game.

name: Gehirn-Jogging
description:
The object of the game is to collect action cards solving the problems. The cards are stacked separately by type, there are colors, shapes, word and number cards. In his turn, the player rotate around the any top action card and try to solve the task. If the hourglass run out, the problem is called or the solution must be done. If the problem is solved correctly, you get the card. The solutions to the question cards can be found in the rule.
Player who first solve predetermined number of tasks (5,10 or 15) wins the game,
categories: Mature / Adult, Number, Puzzle, Word Game

name: Spawn
description: Shibumi Set Game. Abstract two player. Players take turns placing 3 balls of different colors and then removing a ball without ever getting 3 balls of the same color to directly touch each other.

name: Startup Fever: BGG Expansion
description:
4 card extension for Startup Fever available on Board Game Geek. The following 4 cards are included: BOOM, CRASH, HOUSE RULES and BOARD GAME GEEK. Multiple BGG extensions can be added to Startup Fever.

The centerpiece, the BOARD GAME GEEK card is exclusively available as part of this set on Board Game Geek and gives the owner of the game in game benefits of one money - because (s)he supported

BOOM/CRASH change the rules of the game for the duration of one year

HOUSE RULES allows the owner of the game to write up their own event card.

name: bim bom
description:
The game contains four player boards with images of different environments (concert hall, countryside, kindergarten, street), 32 tiles with images of things making sounds and compact disc.

When player hears the sound corresponding to his environment he must find the tile presenting the source of the sound. Sounds are played in random order until one player will gather eight tiles.
In the second variant players listen to the sounds and catch the tiles no matter which environment they are related to. Game ends when all tiles are taken. Player with most of tiles wins.

name: Die Schatzkammer von El Mirador
description:
A children's game that uses the Toystick (http://www.toystick.de/), an electronic device that has to be acquired separately and can be used with a variety of books and games. When used with a compatible book or game, the stick reads texts or plays music.

"Die Schatzkammer von El Mirador" is the first game for the Toystick. The players are adventurers searching for treasures in the legendary cave of El Mirador. They have to avoid hidden traps, and whoever collects the most treasures wins the game.

The Toystick functions as a random movement generator that tells the players how many spaces they can move on the board. It also tells them when they have hit one of the hidden traps, which ends the current player's turn. The board has special spaces for treasure markers. If a player reaches a treasure space with a suitable treasure (as marked on one of the treasure maps), they earn that treasure. Another element in the game is the guardian, which the players move to one of the guardian spaces when they've collected a treasure. All player tokens in that segment of the board are returned to the pyramid in the center of the board. Equipment chits can be used to escape from traps or the guardian, to exchange the position of treasures etc.

The game ends when one player has collected the required number of treasures (6 or 8).

name: Kookiz
description:
Time to play Cookie Monster! In Kookiz, players want to grab as many different types of cookies as possible, preferably big stacks of cookies to keep them out of the hands of other players.

The deck in Kookiz consists of 80 cards, with eight cards of ten types of cookies. Before starting the game, shuffle the cards, deal each player a hand of four cookies, place four(if there are 2 or 4 players) or five(if there are 3 or 5 players) cookies in the center of the table, then deal out the other cards evenly to form face-down draw stacks for each player. This is a real-time game, there are no player turns. Everyone plays simultaneously at the same time (as fast as they can :D ), and performs one of the following actions:


You can place two or more cookies of the SAME type in a face-up stack in front of you.
You can play a single cookie from your hand on top of a card in the center of the table, then place that stack before you. You can only take this action if you are holding ONE copy of the card.
You can play a single cookie from your hand on top of another player's stack to claim that stack and place it before you. You can only take this action if you are holding ONE copy of the card.


After any action, refill your hand to four cookies, drawing from your own face-down stack. The round ends when a player has played all of her cards; this player scores three bonus points for ending the round. Everyone else scores one point for each type of cookie they have before them.

The player with the highest score after five rounds wins.

name: Gods of Olympus
description:
Gods of Olympus is a Board Game for players aged 12 to adult. The game can be played in 2-6 individual players or teams and it includes a variety of challenges. There are 7 categories of challenges- 5 power challenges -Knowledge, Performance, Visual, Physical, Logical- plus General challenges and Battle challenges. Each category has at least 10 different types of tasks of different difficulty levels and styles.

The game is staged in Ancient Greece when Gods were ruling over the earth and influenced the lives of men. The players enter the Labyrinth and go towards the center to beat the Minotaur and become Heroes. On their way, players gather Powers, by completing challenges. Once they are heroes, they need to go back and get out of the Labyrinth. Only a true God can escape the mythical Maze alive. On their way back they need stronger powers that they gather by completing Hero challenges. The first to escape the Labyrinth is the winner – a God of Olympus.

The story: The Gods of Olympus decided to welcome one human among them as one of their peers. But it cannot be any human. He/she has to be worthy of becoming a God, the best they can find, one who is a true hero and of special character. Each city of Ancient Greece selected their best representative and sent them to participate to the Gods of Olympus Challenge. Each city selected the bravest, the strongest, the smartest and the most talented citizen to represent them in the Gods Challenge and gain protection of the Gods for their city and the people living in it.

You are the representative of one of the cities of Ancient Greece. As your city representative you will have to enter the Labyrinth, face multiple challenges that require skill, strength, knowledge, reach the Centre of the Labyrinth and face the Minotaur. To reach the centre of the labyrinth you need the 5 magic powers you gain on your way, but you also need luck and a good strategy. You have to act smart, solve the challenges and move fast inside the labyrinth and out. On your way, you'll have to avoid dangerous creatures like the Gorgons that can turn you into stone. You may also have to fight your opponents in fair battle, especially if they attack you. Only the first getting out of the labyrinth can become a God of Olympus and anyone can still win the game no matter how advanced the other players are, provided they play smart.

name: Heinz Monopoly Game
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

Another in the very long line of MONOPOLY Games.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Josef und seine Brüder
description:
Objective: learn as much as possible about the story of 'Josef', written in the Old Testament;
improve your knowledge, communication, memory...
- acting by turn -
During your turn draw a card and follow instructions ==> you have to tell a story either by drawings, pantomimic,... explaining terms like 'wine', 'christening', 'Adam' in a way that all others can guess successfully what you've tried to describe.
successful - next players turn
otherwise draw a new card
remarks:
often an adult/game master reads a story prior to the start or at least supervises the activity
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Religious

name: Dead Things
description:
Here's a chance to play a zombie game that works like it does in the movies. The system is fast and deadly. Comes with map as well as character cards. An innovative turn order keeps you guessing and zombies are likely to surround you at any time.

The goal is for all the characters to get out of the parking lot alive.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Variable Phase Order

name: Jungle Jinks
description:
"Consisting of forty eight pictorial cards illustrative of the Adventures and Games of the Boys of Dr. Lion's Jungle School from Constance Stannard Chapman's Original Designs."

Each numbered cards of the sets are similar, for example number 2 of each set shows an animal with a musical instrument. There are 48 cards arranged in 3 sets of 16, each lettered A, B or C and numbered 1 to 16; all the illustrations are different and have an appropriate title.

A set number of cards are dealt, probably 5, to each player. The object of the game is to complete a set of three cards, one from each letter, for example a set would be cards A1, B1 and C1, not 1 to 16 of A. The player to the dealer's left begins the play by asking his next neighbor on his left side for A, B or C of any set to complete the three cards of the set. When a player has succeeded in completing a set, he must show the completed set, and may then draw a card from the pool but no card must be drawn from the pool except upon the completion of a set, and only one card drawn.

The winner of the game is the one who completes the most sets.

This game is copyright Thomas De La Rue on the box, but the rules say that H P Gibson are the copyright holders. As far as I know, there has never been a reissue of the game so I assume H P Gibson still hold the copyright. However, I am crediting them both with this game. Almost certainly, De La Rue printed it and H P Gibson distributed it.
publishers: De La Rue, H. P. Gibson & Sons

name: Hookipa
description:
Original board game
The aim is to complete the Olympic Triangle Course by rounding all the bouys in the correct, predetermined sequence.

Surf Slalom
The aim is to be the first player to complete the course of 6 bouys. This must be done in the right way and in the right order and ending up back at the start.

Each player has a miniature sailboard and a points card. Dice are thrown to determine the boardspeed (1 or 2 boardspeed drops 1, 3 or 4 boardspeed remains the same, 5 or 6 boardspeed increases 1). Cards are used to help or hinder progress.

name: Addi Cat's
description:
Addi Cat's is a mathematical card game of memory, concentration and speed.
translated into several languages ​​(English, German, Spanish and Italian): the main rule, the challenges of the additions, the memory and the battle.
You can see the animation to quickly learn to play the main rule.

Players take turns turning their cards over and compare their results. If 2 players have the same result (for instance 7 + 5 and 12), they must hit the mouse card placed in the center of the table (purple card) as fast as possible. The quickest gives his cards to his opponent. SOme bonus cards also included.
The first player to get rid of all his cards wins.

Contents:

100 Addition cards,
19 Sum cards,
19 Action cards
19 "Correction" cards.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Educational, Math

name: Anagram
description:
The object of the game is to make words with the highest value.

Each player takes 12 letters at random. They try to form words with the anagrams. In the case where the player can call such a word, he can put it anywhere on the board in order to score maximum points, trying to put the letter of a given color on a square with the same color
The game ends when one player has made five anagrams. The winner is then the one who scored the most points.

name: Crickard
description:
A cricket card game, probably from the fifties because Trever Bailey is pictured on the box. He was a England Test Match player in that era.

Take two of the four 'Out' cards out of the deck and shuffle the rest. The cards dealt into four piles, all face down. Take one of these piles out of play and use the other three shuffled together. To decide the outcome of each delivery, turn over the top card and follow its instructions. Most of the time it will be a number of runs scored but it could say 'Out' or other options. If four wickets have fallen, add another 'Out' card into the remaining cards and shuffle them again. If 6 wickets fall, add the other 'Out' card. These rules both indicate that later batsmen are easier to get out by the bowler.

Two innings are played and the one with the best score, wins.

name: We're gonna hang out the Washing on the Siegfried Line
description:
Patriotic game that drew its inspiration from the popular song during the Second World War.

Rules inside the lid as follows;

1. The game may be played by any number.
2. The object of the game is to get all the washing hung on the line (i.e., set out on the table in front of each player).
3. Shuffle the small Washing Cards, and deal to each an equal number. Put any cards left over back in the box.
4. Shuffle the large cards and place them face down in the centre of the table in one pile.
5. Each player chooses any three Washing Cards from his own hand, and passes them on to the player on his left.
6. Everyone takes it in turn to pick a card from the central pile, and places it face up alongside. He may hang an article on the line as soon as he picks a card with the correct washing cost. A player picking a hazard card takes back into his hand any of his washing on the table that is specified, or otherwise obeys the instructions on the card. All hazard cards count as a turn. Each time the central pack has been gone through, re-shuffle and carry on.
7. When one player succeeds in hanging up all his washing, the other players add up the money-value of the washing not hung out, and this is counted against them. Then proceed with the next round.
Any number of rounds may be played, the winner being with the least money-value at the end of play. Alternatively a price-limit of, say, five shillings or seven shillings and six pence may be fixed. Any player reaching this limit drops out, and play continues until only the winner is left.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Music, World War II

name: 3.6 international
description:
3.6 International is a game of thirty-six cards plus three jokers. Each card has a color, tens digit and units digit. The goal is to reconstruct six families of maps showing the same characteristics.

To do this, you ask a card from opponent. But it is allowed to lie. If You are in doubt, You may ask to see the hand of the target. There will be a penalty of three cards for the liar or for you if he didn't lie.

name: Spring Heel Jack
description:
Action board game. The board has 16 holes in it. The player loads a spring device and places it on the table, as far back as he wishes, and catapults a ball onto the board. If it settles into one of the holes, a score of 2 to 10 points will be scored. The one with the most points when the game ends, wins.

The spring device will cause the player to experiment. Two factors are involved - how far back to reach the board and how much to hold the device down before releasing it. It must be easy to over-shoot or under-shoot the board.

name: A Weekend in London
description:
The game board shows a map of London. Players roll a die and move through the city, trying to reach the famous sites (especially those two whose cards they drew at the beginning and which are marked). Additionally, taxis, buses and the tube can be used to get around more quickly, but they have to be paid for in travel chips. When a player reaches a site, s/he is asked a question. If answering correctly, the site card can be discarded and a new travel chip is drawn. When reaching an unmarked site, they can earn a new site card (if that belongs to someone else, it can be "stolen").
When a player can reach both sites they drew at the beginning and gain two more site cards and return to their starting location, s/he wins the game.

Questions come in two difficulty levels, as the game is designed for language learning. So the difficulty does not refer to the knowledge needed to answer the question, but to the English speaking ability.

name: Into the Fray
description:
Into the Fray is a print and play skirmish level fantasy war-game from Moss Games.

Into the Fray allows each player to take control of one of the factions of the Hundred Worlds. Each group attempting to uncover the secrets of the lost world of Gateway and crushing anyone who stands in their way.

Designed so that each player will field between 15 and 20 figures in a standard battle, a game of Into the Fray (ITF) will last about 2 hours with experienced players. The game includes rules for the standard fare like movement, combat and morale, and also includes a system for magic and special abilities that will keep things interesting, even for veteran players.

Available only in an electronic format, ITF is a print and play game. It keeps the initial cost down and allows you to make as many or as few miniatures as you need to form your army. With a few supplies (cardstock and glue sticks) and a few hobby tools (a hobby knife and a straightedge), you can build all of the cards, miniatures, counters and templates you need. Add in a handful of six siders and a tape measure and you will be ready to get Into the Fray!!

name: Monopoly Movers
description: A collectable version of the classic game Monopoly. This edition comes in the form of a die-cast semi-tractor trailer truck. The trailer opens to reveal a miniature version of the standard game.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Sjørøver-skatten
description:
vintage roll dice and move game from 1941;
Players start at the coast of South America and "sails" west.
The target is being the first to Sail to the Tonga Isles in one piece and find the great Pirate treasure, all the while avoiding bad weather, pirates, coral reefs and other dangers along the way.

There is only one rather swirly route that takes you across the pacific oceans over towards Australia and The target Tonga Isles (passing Islands and groups like Tahiti, Baker Island, Gilbert Isle, St Cruz & Fidji) and if you hit certain spots/numbers along the travel, actions are taken according to rulesheet.

name: 24 Game Primer Add/Subtract
description: Each card contains two wheels and a target number. Player must pick the wheel that can make the target number. You can add and subtract only. Use all the numbers on each wheel, but use each number only once. Only one wheel works on each card. Each card is worth 1 to 3 points depending on difficulty. The first player to make the target number wins the card. Player with the most cards wins.

name: Les 1000 Bornes Olympiques
description:
A Mille Bornes variant in which players must score maximum points by just replacing the miles by sports, by the lights of the pitfalls and "Long live the Olympics!"

Draw a card to your hand, play or discard.

The game ends when one player has placed a series of six cards and he managed to shoot down six cards in his hand. The game also ends if no cards remaining in the deck is playable.
Each series reported scores up to 40 points, 10 bonus points triggering endgame, foul play by 10 points.
The winner is the first totaling 500 points after several parties.

name: Mon quotidien
description:
Players are journalists and write a newspaper

By answering questions correctly, player draws a cards in the pocket to fill the place on his newspaper. The first player to have completed his newspaper is the winner.

Using the plate divided into several zones, you spin the arrow, and you pull the card corresponding to the area where the arrow is stopped.

There are several type of cards:
- INTERVIEW is a collective issue, the first to answer draws a card from the pouch.
- INTERVIEW PHOTO is a collective issue, but the question is about the photo visible to all players. The first to answer draws a card from the pouch.
- EXPERT is an individual matter. The player whose turn is must answer and draws a card in the pouch for good responders.
- OPPORTUNITY allows to draw a card from the pocket, without having to answer a question.
- BAD LUCK forced the player to deliver one of his cards in the pocket.
- SCOOP is to get a card in an opponent's cards.
- INTERNET cards are optional, as they require an internet connection, to monitor response. If used, they are incorporated in the stack of cards interview.

name: As'Truc
description:
Object of the game is to build his own house by answering the questions for rooms.

Playing the game
Using the dice, each player goes through the corridors of the house.
In choosing his route, he stops at:
- A room: In answering the corresponding question, he wins the card with the room to place it on his house.
- A box 'Forum': He asks the room of their choice to other players and hope they do not know the answer!
- A box 'Mission': He draws a card and runs Mission
- A box 'Bingo': He went into the room of his choice. If he answers the question, he won three-piece card, otherwise he loses 2!
- A secret passage. It uses this shortcut to quickly move from one floor to another house.

Who builds up his house first wins the game.
